text: smell is pure oranges and very faint hops but the smell is amazing . taste did n't lead up to the smell kind of a big build up and then aahh .  on tap at rogue in portland , or . appearance : black , opaque , thin cover of dark tan leaves heavy lace in the heavy rogue goblet .  the only thing slightly disappointing about this beer for me was the mouthfeel seemed a bit watery .

smell is awesome -- the smoked pork hits you first , followed by hints of raw sugar , honey , apples or pears , and black licorice . first few sips have an element of 'burnt'-ness to them , but once you get used to it , it 's quite pleasant . there 's almost a saltiness to it , with some background flavours of coffee , chocolate , and strong malts .  pours black with virtually no light around the edges . towering cap of light brown foam that grew on the pour like one of those ash-growing snake things from a fireworks stand . retention is great , as is the lacing .  it had a light feel on the palate with mild carbonation .

wonderful nose on this beast . but it is n't very rich . its kind of one dimensional . has big hop character , big malt character , roasty , chocolate , caramel , but that 's about it .  huge head , somewhat lasting , good lacing , smallish bubbles .  thin mouthfeel , this is the achilles heel of the beer .

the head is fluffy , off-white , and responsible , in part , for the best characteristic of this brew : the nose . the nose is a wonderful mix of allspice , nutmeg , and a bit of cinnamon , laid over a warm , inviting sweetness . it 's like sniffing a particularly delicious cookie . this brew goes down quite smoothly , and does not seem as high in alcohol as i thought it would .  a - very very dark . very fluffy head and lots of lacing .  mouthfeel is ok. fairly light body , more than i 'd think it should be at this abv .

smells amazing . the pine and citra form a wave of hoppy goodness .  a : the perfect clear orange color . great retention .  a- blackness with a espresso colored head s- coffee beans ground soaked in licorice coffee and dark chocolate really bold t- straight up coffee and espresso with bitter chocolate and a slight tang finish m- medium carbonation and a bit watery for the style d- i drink 3 cup of coffee a day who am i to judge ?

wow . thick bourbon and aforementioned flavors , mostly caramel . lovely beer , quite exceptional .  a- the pour yields an opaque black body with a small khaki colored head composed of tightly knit bubbles . the head is long lasting and leaves complete rings on the sides of my glass .  this is almost as good a stout as they come . i like guinness extra stout better because it has more bitterness . but this stout is smooth and easy to drink with a nice bitterness . if you are looking for a stout to bring to a party this is a good one because it is not too bitter . almost everyone i have served this to has liked it .

smell is simply awesome - like a buttery biscuit drizzled in honey , sitting in the middle of a pine forest . amazingly drinkable for the abv , and this is how the beer becomes dangerous .  pours a clear amber , nice thick white head forms , as it drops leaves some pretty epic lacing , settles to a nice layer , great retention . looks great , smells good , but the alcohol takes too much of it .  tastefully good as well.with the same taste of chocolate milk with a hint of hops and lots of malt.i could have this one for breakfast lunch , and dinner.what ya mean i 'm a raging alcholic.i beg your pardon.this is one tasty beverage , one that will put a smile on your face all day long .

a : pours a yellowish orange color , like apple juice with a little fizz ; head is huge and rocky , foamy and thick , like something out of a bubble machine ; yeast sediments sink to the glass bottom upon pour and settling s : everything you 'd expect from a belgian strong ale ( dark or light ) , with complex , sweet dark candied and dark fruit aromas ; however , there is a hint of dry , hoppy citrus and bitterness just underneath the heavy sweetness ; definite booze smell as the beer warms t : the first flavor is alcohol , but not in a sharp , unpleasant way ; it 's there , but tempered with the great and significant sweetness only found in belgian strongs ; great maltiness ; sweetness ranges from tropical fruit flavors to bits of caramel , vanilla , cloves and banana ; m : smooth and heavy up front ; warm , tingly on the tongue ; finishes with a surprising and welcomed touch of dryness that finishes in a refreshing and crisp way ; amazing ! maybe i 'm just an american , but this one 's damn good .  spectacular retention and thick , chunky lace .  smell is of old corn/rice and skunk . pew . taste was horrendous . a skunky malt liquor flavor mixed with sweet rice/corn adjunct . maybe it went bad on it 's journey from the carib-bean ? looks like i should have gone for the sam light that was also in the fridge ...

very promising . and then : the taste is a bit disappointing after that great smell . good , but not exceptional .  pours a two finger white head that fades slowly , leaving a good lace . nice crystal clear amber color .  the mouthfeel is just average . also , carbonation is lacking enough to make this feel sticky .

it is deep , dark and mysterious -- perhaps much like the ellusive rasputin himself . it mixes roasted coffee aromas , with the sweeter remnants of chocolate , caramel and toffee . there is also a nice , bold noticeable tinge of hops to the overall inhalation . in the mouth , this beer is amazingly bold and full . there is also a nice biting aftertaste , allowing its overall substance to be reckoned with .  bottle says bottled on 4/16/09 a - pours cloudy orange with huge 3 fingers of pillowy foam that takes forever to die down - lacing is all over the glass . this is one fine looking beer s - very hoppy with a strong grassy aroma - there are so many other aromas also - reminds me of a wine t - bitterness is subdued , bready yeast flavor is present , solid malt backbone m - great creamy mouthfeel - but i wish there was a little more lingering bitterness to this brew d - this is a very sneaky 9 % abv - deceptively drinkable .  the rye is evident , as is a tangy almost sour note along with the bread . a little over-carbonated ... i found it slightly distracting and that it may have affected my enjoyment of the beer 's complexity . light-bodied and very refreshing . while i have little to no experience with beers of this style , i enjoyed this one and i believe that its a great refresher during the summer months .

one of the best smelling beers i 've ever tried . good amount of pumpkin . clean and delicious . lighter side of medium in body . not sure if this is a drastic improvement from regular pumking , but this is surely tasty .  golden yellow with a full white head that melts to a quarter inch covering of sticky lacing .  m : slick mouthfeel with a medium amount of carbonation that can be prickly at times . body is medium and has a bit of resiny stickiness to it .

aroma of spruce and tiger lillies . supremely floral . this is not the aroma of your average triple . this beer could be marketed as liquid potpourri , and i 'd be proud to buy a lame plug-in air freshener that smelled like this . certainly , all the qualities are there .  tasted june 22nd 2011 ( from notes ) poured into a la chouffe tulip a - a clear blood red , one finger tan head and some lacing s - alcohol , wine barrels , sweet dried fruits , earth , oak , french vanilla and more sweet and alcohol t - alcohol , lots of sugar , sweet malts , tons of sweet dried fruit , black cherries , wine barrels , raisins , charred oak , molasses , carmelised brown sugar and vanilla .  mouthfeel is perhaps a bit thin for the style but not bad .

when i first opened the bottle i could smell the cherrys right away . it was a very sweet smell which suprised me that the beer was not as sweet as the smell . very nice appearance .  it has the perfect color for a lager , dark but not to dark .  m : the feel is slightly creamy but on the lighter side of medium bodied . could be a bit thicker here ... d : if you like coffee beers i could see someone drinking good amount of these .

a velvety mouth feel , really enjoyable .  excellent head duration to boot , with the dollop of foam in the middle arranged like a hurricane taking shape ; stellar looking beer .  this is a great beer . the aromas are sweet and malty , with hints of caramel and vanilla . this beer has a nice , smoky flavor with hints of toffee and vanilla . this will definitely be going on my `` favorite beers '' list .

) aromas are in the background and define it with a rugged , backcountry character .  pours a very nice looking dark ruby with a thick tan head which remains forever and leaves sticky lacing in my delirium glass . a beautiful beer , i wish they all looked like this .  light carbonation and light-medium bodied . flavor is a hospital antiseptic . said to be an ipa , i understand pigs fly too . looks bad , smells bad , tastes worse , higher abv is hidden . waaay overpriced at $ 10.45 for a 330ml bottle from colonial spirits acton , ma .

aroma is a sweet malt-candy smell , bready , with a note of ginger and sourness . this beer tastes almost as good as it smells .  gorgeous . big , beautiful , creamy head over a glowing murky golden body .  carbonation a little higher than i expect in the style but still manages to be exceptionally drinkable .

s : great smelling beer . c-hops and american malts . potent nose . d : great beer , absolutely delicious , with the delicate touch of a masterful brewer .  appearance : extremely voluptuous head , almost overflowing , with lots of carbonation and bubbles . color is pitch black , no nuances there .  drinkability : mouthfeel is a little thin , but this is a very solidly crafted stout , up there with the tops in style .

earthy , weedy , hoppy , piney ! a real west coast ipa . love it ! not for the faint of heart hop haters , but awesome for hop lovers ! definitely interesting with tropical fruit hints in this one . mouthfeel : deliciously crisp and oily .  drank on-tap at atwood 's tavern , cambridge , ma served in a stemmed glass gorgeous appearance . thick , lasting rings of lacing coated the glass .  not too complicated , but a pleasant experience overall . goes down quite easily ( in part because of the low carbonation ) .

devastatingly attractive . dried herb in color . brilliant nose . obviously aged and incredibly smooth on the palate but the cellaring destroyed the hop presense .  pours a luscious peach/dark gold color with a substantial , fluffy , two-finger head that exhibits excellent retention and lacing .  the mouthfeel is less crisp then i had hoped .

look : it poured a transparent orange-brown colour with a thin tannish head that did not disappear smell : exceptional . it smells delicious . a little sour with some sweetness in there .  the beer arrived at the table black with a tan head .  medium bodied , highly carbonated .

a - clear honey colored with very little head . s - smells of ripe cherries , raspberries , honey , alcohol , mango , citrus , brandy , apple juice , flowers , and apricots . t - tastes of cherry , alcohol , brandy , citrus , candied sugar , sherry , and honey .  a - classic dark bronze doppelbock color .  m-medium bodied with slightly more carbonation than i prefer in a porter .

s - mmm , what a good smelling beer . delicious smell , and a lot of it .  best by date of 5/3/11 a : standard pour yields a billowy 2.5 finger light creamsicle colored head with very good retention . lacing is patchy and spotty with nice cling .  medium bodied , it seems a little flat at the beginning , but there 's sharp carbonation at the finish , which is a little watery and silty .

the smell is perfect , like cranberries , very tart and almost bitter . you can really smell this all the way up your nose .  poured into my big family guy mug and was greeted with one of the best looking heads i 've ever seen in that mug . perfect ruddy brown with a hint of mbver red , just like a bock should . nice and opaque too , hard to see any bubbles in there .  slightly sour , a bit thin , highly carbonated . quite drinkable .

the mystery beer in my joe 's garage variety pack , poured a deep brown with dark near crimson hue when held up to the light with a large 2 finger mocha colored head.perfect 5 for me aroma wise its american big on the fruity , piney hop mixed with chocolate and earth just fantastic love the big hop profile.the same goes for the flavors big piney drier hop profile intertwined with bitter chocolate with a earthy raw nut lingering finish.a little prickly on the mouth but nothing to take away from the great flavors of the beer , damn i wish there more porters like this it is the most hoppedup version i think i have had to date .  caged and corked 75cl bottle ; poured with an immense head of tight foam and a beautiful tornadic swirl of yeast-inspired carbonation .  m -- light carbonation . good body with a lightly soft mouthfeel .

smell : smell is impressive to say the least . huge oaky brandy smells , with rasberry , chocolate and an imposing roasted malt presence . taste : everything good about the smell is in the taste , although unfortunately it still has a bit of a raw bite to it .  incredible looking esb . pours with the cascading effect and settles to a bright amber color .  it seems to light and over carbonated for a stout .

the smell was amazing -- probably the highlight of the beer . it got better as the temp increased . overall , it 's a pretty solid novelty beer .  two fingers of light tan head forms and recedes slowly . the color of this beer is truly gorgeous ... smell is sweet and sugary upfront .  thin on mouthfeel medium orangish-amber with a 1 finger offwhite head that leaves a respectable amount of lacing . taste : broad caramel maltiness with a warming alcohol changes over to a restrained english hop bitterness . notes : a nice esb , although the abv is much higher than say , honker 's ale . drinkability ranks fairly high but the alcohol content is above that of a session beer .

s : nice big belgian yeast nose . one of the best smelling beers i have ever encountered . t : starts off sweet with some raisins . the worst part of this beer and it was still way above average . d : very drinkable .  glassware - imperial pint appearance - dark amber/red in color , which makes sense . nice two finger white head that leaves a lot of really great lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel was slightly thin with a very tasty caramel taste on the tongue . the finish was semi-sweet , slightly dry , very nice for the style .

the nose is beautiful . i get the belgian yeastiness , and something akin to peaches served with a dash of allspice . so far it 's awesome .  beautiful amber color . medium just-barely-off-white head that is nice and dense . very lasting lace .  a little thin , flavors do n't linger or expand much .

s : chocolate covered cherries , vanilla , mocha , amazing ! t : huge vanilla ( a little much for me ) , oak , bakers chocolate , mocha .  light-sucking black with a monumental 2.5 finger head of a nice deep tan . great retention and lacing . ca n't ask for a better appearance than this .  light bodied though , almost watery . in a way this is an ipa-light - some similar desirable flavors and aromas , but less bitterness , less alcohol , and lighter bodied .

smells amazing ! t - not too much smoke , bet definitely present .  very attractive beer . massive sticky foamy eggshell colored head rises to 2 fingers and holds there forever .  mouf & gt ; meh . okay . average .

750ml bottle with cork , like their local series . smells of the local 1 , champagne , cork , lemon meringue or orange marmalade , some tropical fruits or pina colada , wet vegetation . surprisingly , i taste the hop in the flavor more than the aroma . a unique hop . corky . kudos for making a dry and hoppy saison , and getting it to texas ! worth trying .  2011 batch 1 - 750ml bottle poured into a cbs snifter a : black as night . gorgeous finger-and-a-half dark brown head that leaves a nice full cap throughout consumption .  mouthfeel is light and carbonation fades to almost flat .

the nose here is at first reminiscent of a barleywine ( raisiny , sweet ) , then an imperial stout ( chocolatey , roasty ) , and ultimately an outstanding cabernet ( earthy and leathery notes on top of dark fruits and floral perfumes ) . i find this to be an ideal complexity - notable not for its blunt force but for the way it continues to surprise . cigar box certainly comes to mind . barleywine-type sweetness is much more prevalent in this dimension , although it interacts in interesting ways with a darker , roasted quality . the finish is warm in a pleasing way . outstanding beer for slow sipping and contemplation .  bottle from the lcbo the 2008 vintage has held its own agaist the 2007. black with a lovely tan head .  body was very light and thin .

the nose on this one is very strong . some pineapple , orange zest , and grapefruit along with some floral and piney notes . if this tastes as good as it smells , i 'm in for a sweet , citrusy treat . the taste is , unfortunately , not as juicy as the nose might suggest .  great retention , light lace . gorgeous .  i found the body to be a bit thin carbonation medium to low .

beautiful beer at 6.8 % abv certainly packs a punch , a - perfect for the style , a big fluffy head fell away at moderate pace , lacing well , pours a hazy orange s - a highlight for me , big amarillo hop aroma , citrus , fruity no negatives in the aroma dept . t - a little bit less than a std dipa bitterness but still kicked liked a wild goat , beautiful flavours , crystal or other malts coming through m - well controlled and certainly right for me .  pours a bright , clear , light orange color with a nice looking head .  it 's light on body , and not especially interesting - but as fruit beers go , this was excellent .

it 's wonderful . t- initial malts , some yeast , bread and biscuity notes , and strong warming alcohol .  makes an impressive appearance , a nice red amber color with a large foamy pale head that lingers in the chalice with some sticking .  the body was medium to medium light .

smell : strong citrus aroma boasting orange , pineapple and sappy resin . they really knocked it out of the park in the smell , what an inviting and pleasing scent . has west coast written all over it . overall : a pretty impressive brew from cisco brewers .  lighter and brighter looking than i expected , nelson poured without any `` redness '' i typically , and erroneously , associate with rye beers . a clear hay golden hue , with a beautiful cream white head ; excellent retention and lacing .  the mouthfeel was the only thing that detracted from the beer in my opinion , as i found it to be a little to watery for my personal preference .

aromatic and hoppy from the different types of hops used - there is some fruit and alot of pine . this is pure heaven in a glass from the aroma to the taste and finish everything is enjoyable . the abv is not to high but you can still a get decent buzz but drinking a few .  a -- beautiful dark amber color with two fingers of head using a standard pour . very dark for an ipa . great lacing as well .  m - a little watery for the style , but not objectionable .

lively grapefruit , bright citrus notes abound . what a lovely burst of pineapple and fruit aromas . so very inviting . taste - resin and oily entry , coating the tongue with the expected presence of hops to the max .  pours very dark , almost black with dense head that does not dissipate till the end of pint , leaving thick and dense lacing . amazing .  the only thing i felt was it could use a little more carbonation to balance the tart flavor and make it more perky .

this is a powerfully aromatic ale it hits you the moment you open it . there is a strong candied fruit smell here . candy dates , pineapple , cherry , and a raw tobacco scent . about the most aromatic beer i have smelled in at least a year , maybe more . pliny the younger and three floyds dreadnaught are the only two on the same level of complexity . mouthfeel is good . drinkability is ok .  great looking beer .  not too complex- makes for easy drinking , as does its texture . carbonation level seems low , though as an earlier commenter noted , it is actually just very fine .

this is delicious beer . the aroma is just like liquor soaked fruit , with a hint of cinnamon . it 's got a nice clear amber color .  appearance : black in color sporting a two finger creamy head that lasted a long time .  though this is a red ale of stormy garnet and the menu states it is `` brewed with 20 % honey malts for a touch of sourness '' ( honey = sourness ? it is not merely that this red ale tastes bad ; it is absolutely offensive . of the lowest evolutionary order . the entire beer is corrupted by spoilage and should n't be served publicly .

the second surly can i got from my man joe aka ineedabeerhere . the aroma is quite hoppy , even with all this time in the can . pineapple , grape , carrots ? you can also smell a bit of alcohol in the furious , but only after sniffing the juice . the taste continues with the depth of the aroma , and i 'm loving it . it could use a bit more sweetness to accentuate the fruity hops .  this brew pours a very large head of creamy fine light brown bubbles and opaque black brown body .  this beer was skunky ... skunky like a becks . and i couldnt find any other component of this beer redeeming enough to get over that skunkyness . my encounter with this beer started out ok ... it has a pale yellow appearance with a medium amount of head . taste exhibited becks ( or maybe even becks light ) levels of skunkitude , again with a bit of clove chasing after it to apologize . definitely not recommended .

aroma is great . i really get a spicy sage aroma on this one . a sweetness from the herbal notes really plays perfect with this one . really a perfect nose . taste is spot on too .  poured from a liter swingtop bottle into a snifter a= pours a thick black color with a nice one finger brown head that lasts suprisingly long with amazing lacing . s= huge hop notes which is amazing as well as a prominent coffee smell .  m : medium to light body with medium to low carbonation . would have preferred a bigger body by far .

absolutely wonderful ! t : unfortunately , does n't quite live up to the aroma .  into a tulip . pours the closest to motor oil i 've ever seen in a beer , dark crimson/brown head , dense retention and heavy legs .  average feel for the genre i 'd say . it 's pleasant in sips and gulps and a few of em would be just as enjoyable as one .

this is very easily the best smelling beer i 've ever whiffed . taste is very disappointing . the smell is this brews strongest point , but it is also the source of the beer 's greatest flaw .  poured into a pint glass , this radiant beer had a crisp , clear orange body and a thick white head .  m - the mouthfeel is a little light , with little carbonation .

aroma smells a lot like centennial and amarillo hops - a touch of tangerine and bubble gum mixed in with the grapefruit and pine . i love it . flavor is fairly sweet up front , with good piney notes , and a strong grapefruit bitterness in the finish . as it is , it 's still really good .  exquisite in appearance !  m- thin and smooth with almost not carbonation feel . kind of has the texture of a flat soda .

s : coffee ice cream cones ? like a joy ice cream cone , and a mild coffee . only beer yet to give me that . m : creamy , creamy and creamy . imperial anyone ? t : i 'll start with a heavy dark chocolate to start .  thick dense white head with great retention .  m - a little on the thin side .

it has a great smell of having trouble explaining other than sweet . this is a very drinkable beer but there are many more much better .  tasted in mid-may 2009. nearly opaque , black/brown , with reddish brown on the edges under the light . great lacing , forming curtains in the latter half of the glass .  m- light in body and light to medium in carbonation .

amazingly strong - smells of syrupy semi-sweet chocolate and very deep roasty and toasty malts ; smells like very fresh brewed espresso ... actually , the `` freshness '' of the smell is really quite intense . taste : very burnt and roasty malt characteristics that are reminiscent of fresh brewed espresso and grounds ; faint flavors of semi-sweet baking chocolate ; i have to admit , this would be an amazing morning drink .  cloudy pale copper color and of hazy reddish tone nearer to the top which is adorned by a rich creamy head of froth about an inch high and colored of dark ivory . head retains its thick body to settle a bit with a lumpy top and lots of lace in big blotches , looks scrumptious !  medium bodied and a bit sticky in the mouth .

s - awesome on my nose well hopped .  this is a stunning looking ale : dark-brown with a ruby glaze , bubbles dancing toward the top like a light snowfall in reverse , crowned with a creamy mocha head .  mouthfeel : thin body and medium carbonation overall : a nice geuze , a bit too watery for my liking though .

amazing smell ; right in line with what i expect from stone .  brown to copper towards the edges with a huge off white head that falls slow and never completely goes away while clinging to the glass . as the edges fall away , thick ringed sheets of foam . this is one damn good lookin ' beer .  mouthfeel is a bit light , to me , for the style , though it seems appropriate for the flavors that this beer brings to the palate .

fantastic . i 'm a big fan of floral ipas , and not so into the bitterness . delicious . reminds me a lot of abrasive in this respect ( the floral/citrus vs. bitter balance ) , though not quite on that level .  a - pours with one finger of white foam on top of a perfectly clear , copper colored body . the head settles slowly and leaves nice , thick lace .  mouthfeel : medium bodied .

s- smell is awesome . tons of tropical fruits pineapple , apricot , and grapefruit a bit of sweetness coming through from the malts . t- follows the nose really well . a very nice hop forward beer .  this beer sure looks good , but it sure aint of me . stone ris pours an oily thick pitch black witha huge brown head . as the head disapates , it leave so great lacing .  thin bodied , and just sufficient carbonation , but i suspect the growler is at fault much more than the beer .

aroma of a quad / stout mix with the figs , plums and spices plus a hint of grape hi-c infused vanilla . full bodied , viscous without being cloying , chewy . the alcohol is amazingly restrained , not even the inherent warmth you 'd expect at this abv level .  pours a chocolate brown color with a massive invincible head that lasts to the bitter end and gobs and gobs of lace .  m honestly its way too light of a mouthfeel .

aroma is overwhelming with citrusy peach essence of hop . so sweet and spicy , very cali . i usually sniff for 15-20 seconds but this beer merits much more nasal enjoyment .  has a lovely appearance . produces about two and a have fingers thick of light tan head that has perfect retention . the body of the brew is cleanly filtered and is dark copper/ruby red in color .  a little too thick on the tongue , but nice .

fantastic stuff .  deep golden to light amber colored with a big head that settles into a nice thin layer of foam with moderate lacing as you get through the pint .  the mouthfeel has average carbonation and ismedium bodied yet feels a bit thin at the same time , as it falls off the toungue quite quickly .

very unique . i could tell from smelling it that it was going to be sour , but had no idea the extent of sourness .  quite surprising ... not because it 's a great beer from dogfish head ( that 's certainly not surprising ) , but because i have never actually enjoyed a pumpkin ale . seriously ever . appearance & gt ; what a beauty . colour reads from dark honey to a pumpkin orange glow . extremely lively .  mouthfeel is sticky-sweet and dense .

very sessionable , but only an adequate porter with the exception of the nose which is amazing .  great looking beer .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied with likely carbonation . that , and the over carbonated pour make this beer a something i would not recommend .

i love the smell of this beer ... i smell molasses with hints of toffee ... nice maltiness . mouthfeel is very good . great esb !  poured into a large wine glass , very dark , giant creamy brown head ( very enticing ) .  a fairly light bodied beer with near champagne carbonation ... a bit too much for me , although i know many like this in their wild ales .

m : moderate to heavy mouthfeel d : smells was awesome , taste was too much for me .  this brew produces mounds of bright white head , which peaks easily over the top of my stein . it has a very nice golden and hazy body .  mouthfeel is pretty average , as is the smell ... i ca n't think of anything distinctive about these characteristics .

big roasty coffee with cocoa aroma is readily evident upon , without lifting the glass .  poured with some mild carbonation that settled into a thick yellowish head . absolute best porter i have ever seen .  lighter body than i thought it would be with with very low carbonation..the weakest point of the brew . easy drinker for the abv and ignoring the mouth feel , a nice brew .

has a solid malt flavor with a huge hop aroma . i could use a tad more bitterness but that is just a personal preference .  the beer itself pulls a pitch black into the glass and lets no light through . darkness is right . head retention is decent , leaves a perfect lacing behind .  the body is thin and slightly anemic . a little more carbonation and body would carry this really unique beer into the stratosphere .

smells absolutely wonderful ... pungent aroma of hops all the way ... piney , citrusy hops and i 'm loving it ... i want to smell this all night ... terrific blend of piney/grapefuit hops and sweet malts.. thought this was going to be a hop bomb all the way which would have been fine but i 'm surprised at the balance on this one .  put it under bright light and it looks magnificent in my flute !  a bit thin , but a very good stout flavor develops in the mouth . i 'd have preferred a bit fuller body .

very nice . the taste is quite good , mostly dominated by malts .  pours with a beautiful amber body topped by a thick lasting head with a good amount of lace left on the glass .  the mouthfeel was thin with a slightly dry aftertaste .

aroma is very inviting with apple , pear , and an awesome yeastiness . the taste is n't as fruity and glorious as the incredible aroma but it is nice and earthy . there is a great toastiness to it and great caramel , bread and diacetyl butter flavor .  a : this pours pitch black . a large tan head ( over two fingers forms ) with great retention .  body is a little thin .

very nice start of a semi-grainy and fully malted pilsner barley . delicious .  nice retention and very good lacing . clear amber color makes this an all around great looking brew .  mouthfeel : pretty thick and a little syrupy . i 'd actually like a little more carbonation .

i prefered the tap version as the apricots were so intense in the aroma as the bottle had more funk and barnyard . apricot , lemon and peach flavors . moderate acidity for a cantillon . the palate could be drier and the carbonation more lively but this a stellar offering by cantillon once again .  a : clear copper , fluffy white head , good retention and lace .  the taste is fantastic , but the beer is a little thin and a bit hot ; not a good session beer , but great type of brew to have after a long day .

s- great pumpkin smell up front with a nutmeg spice on the back end . smells like a fresh baked pumpkin pie at thanksgiving .  this beer looks absolutely perfect .  this beer was purchased at cyclone liquors , in ames , iowa . the beer was very dark in color and tasted very well . i drank the beer warm and i think it was a good beer . i would try this beer again if it was presented to me . it had a very nice sweet taste for a german dunkel , which i am not a huge fan of .

pumpkin pie spice is felt throughout and makes it absolutely wonderful . absolutely amazing . going into this , i knew that southern tier made some great beers . i had no idea this would be one of their best !  a perfect pour into an oversized wine glass with rich deep amber body a tightly formed thick white head , i could not find any reason to not give a perfect score.tropical fruity hops in the nose with a little boozy and caramel sweetness , overripe mango and pineapple on the palate with again some sweetish booze , the malt base is quite dry underneath the hops and sweet booze.a nice dipa , one of the best pours for me ... ever .  mouthfeel is rather thin and average .

i thought the smell was magnificent ! ! the taste , too , was sweet and fruity , but nearly as sweet as the smell , which is good , seeing that that would probably have been overpowering . i do not really have another barleywine with which to compare this one , but as simply `` a beer '' this is a fantastic brew ...  beautiful looking beer .  too carbonated , the mouthful of liquid seems to almost crumble right away .

the closest thing to bourbon county stout ive ever smelled . a wonderful nose of raisins , oak , vanilla , bourbon , chewy chocolate , cocoa , rum , and god knows what else . it seems there are citrus hops that are mixing without dropping a beer with the malt and creating this rather sweet fruity start . finishing with bourbon and a touch of alcohol bite . overall im pretty happy with this beer . huge thanks to crushedvol for this extra .  pours almost black , with tan 2 finger head .  m : i feel that this could have used a little more body and less carbonation , but overall ... not bad .

smells great . big , overripe tropical fruit and citrus with a little bit of grass underneath . i actually coughed and spilled some while pouring and thought , `` man , that smells awesome ! '' while cleaning it up . still good , just a letdown after the nose .  great retention and lacing !  mouthfeel - a bit too carbonated which overrides the wonderful taste at first .

probably the sweetest ipa i 've run across . aroma of candy and berries . nicely hopped with clear strawberry and other berry notes .  a - golden and slightly hazed with coppery highlights and a foamy , cushiony head that jets to the surface and clings to the glass like glue as it subsides . head retention is fantastic , and would be even without the aid of the etching at the bottom of the glass . fantastic .  mouthfeel is grainy and oily , body is medium to thin , carbonation is sharp .

the beer is certainly lighter than i expected with an almost straw color . the nose on this brew is phenomenal ! i 'm immediately transported to magical grapefruit land as the beer screams citrus into my nostrils . there is a piney base note to this smell to that compliments the soaring citrus very well . not on hops of course , as the grapefruity citrus notes yielded to a piney bite on the finish , but rather the malt character . while still a world class ipa , i felt that the backbone of this brew just was n't quite as strong as i would have liked and the huge hop profile was almost overwhelming .  pours with a rich , rocky head over a cloudy orange body , with lots of lacing . one of the best presentations i 've seen .  m light body for the style , but not unpleasant .

smell : the aroma of the beer is full of hoppy promises . oily pine tar resins combine with a citrus and tropical fruits explosions of grapefruit , lemon , mango and pineapple bombard my nose .  a- pretty beautiful . a reddish amber color , just glowing .  being from the adirondacks i quickly likened this to adirondack brewery 's bear naked ale , yet a lager version , and a bit more wheat-filled . the mouth-feel is nice , but nothing special ( not flat , not too bubbly ) . in short , its a dandy brew- we all enjoyed it and thought it was pretty cool to have something that is only currently available in growlers from the brewery ( spring seasonal ) , drink up !
this is , to date , the finest smelling pilsner i 've had .  this beer looks perfect . theres not as much smell to this one as others like it .  this one was surprisingly thin in body .

the sweet malts balance this very nicely . m & d : medium body beer , nice level of carbonation , makes for a semi-creamy mouthfeel . just an outstanding ipa .  the best looking beer in the world , & one of the tastiest .  the mouthfeel was medium with a syrupy sweetness on the palate .

it smells fantastic . sweet floral hops , with citrus present . t - very good , but its a little more bitter and less citrusy than the aroma led me to expect .  poured from 12oz bottle into trusty milwaukee brewers pint glass a- deep lushous brown with nice 1/2 '' head that sticks around a while to keep me company s- some faint malts , all in all not much going on in the smell department t- a lot of different but very faint flavors . it looks amazing and feels great but the taste is kind of lame and i detect little to no smell .  the mouthfeel i found oddly watery ... but still fairly full bodied at the same time . carbonation was fairly mild - maybe that lended to the `` watery '' sensation .

nose is very full and really inviting . aromas jump out of the glass a buttery toffee . a big abv sipper with a great nose . sorry jay-bone , just did n't cut it for me .  great lacing that lined the entire glass . cloudy .  m : full bodied and creamy , the slightest touch of carbonation and a smooth , somewhat watery finish .

smell is very strong , like a clove-orange christmas pomander . really spicey and orange-peely , with coriander , grass and soap . if this thing tastes as good as it smells , i 'm gon na love it . the taste is dominated by the clove , soap and cookie-dough malt . it tastes good , but not as good or as complex as it smells . alcohol is notable from the warm burn in the aftertaste . all around , a very interesting beer .  simply beautiful cascading action that lasts for over a minute ! superb tan head retention that is not going away at all !  good carbonation , which i appreciate . minimal complexity to this beer .

the nose is deep , thick , prodigious coffee and some raisiny dark chocolate notes , and roasted dark sweet grains .  reddish copper in color , impressive head with incredible retention and massive lacing down the sides of my pub glass .  m. thin to medium body with a somewhat biting carbonation . ends fairly dry .

s -- the deepest , richest coffee smell i 've gotten from any beer . lots of other coffee stouts have this `` stong '' of a smell , but none that i can remember have such a deep roasty smell , its hard to describe since i am not a coffee drinker .  served cold , poured into a pint glass , it has a great amber red color with excellent clarity . the creamy head sticks around a good long time but slowly settles leaving a sheet of lacing on the glass .  hate to say it , but the bottle/case i have is absolutely awful . other than a hint of coriander spice all i got was an overwelming sourness that made this one of the few i had to pour down the drain . they obviously put wayyy too much orange peel in their mix . if you can get past the sourness it is par for a wit bier course . i 'm hoping this was a bad/expired batch because ... .as far as mill street goes imo , stick to the coffee porter ...

as soon as i opened the bottle , i was smacked with a heavy hoppy smell , easily reminded me it 's an ipa i 'm dealing with . s : an amazing combination of hops , pine , citrus , maybe some grape . t : interesting , with the token ipa hoppiness being the most notable aspect of it all . d : daunting at first , especially for me , not a huge fan of ipas , but i have to respect this beer . the dynamic flavor-smell combinations are remarkable , and though it 's not my favorite , the never-departing flavor may be the reminder that it is something to be reckoned with .  a toasted head has great retention and lace .  it was pretty smooth for stout and for for the alcohol content . i tried it with a few other beers .

d - spectacular aroma displayed on a solid background of malt . the aroma is still so full and excellent that it makes up for any weakness in the flavor profile .  the body of hop head poured an absolutly beautiful copper-orange color , with a sizable custard head . retention and lacing were both excellent , thanks to a constant supply of carbonation from below .  mouthfeel : medium-bodied with thankfully a burst of carbonation near the end , making it a little less watery than it initially presents itself to be .

this had a wonderful nose of tropical fruits , sugars , and malts , with a little herbal hop bitterness thrown into the mix as well . the taste was more of the same , fruity , sweet and delicious . this did have a medicinal , somewhat metallic , after taste though that kind of reminded me of orval .  pours a mouthwatering dark , rusty , brown color . head is substantial in size and settles to about 1cm thick . light tan in color with a dense foam consistency .  the mouthfeel is thinner when compared with other stouts , merely decent .

smell is fantastic ! nothing but chocolate covered toffee in the nose , the lightest bit of roastiness , and a hint of nuttiness . i love it .  beautiful dark color , with good mapping down the sides .  low carbonation . a bit coating , but not to syrupy/thick .

lovely aroma of figs , coffee , licorice , lavender , pinesap , chocolate & mint . the dark roasted malts smell so very fresh , almost as if they were right there damp in the palm of your hands .  a : pale straw , great carbonation , crystal clear , and a lovely full head .  mouth feel is sharp and crisp , with a high carbonation level .

aroma is full of floral notes and hoppy sweetness . gummy ... lavender ... spicy ... oh so nice ... smooth on the palate ... a smallish touch of burn on the way down the throat . more balanced than i was expecting ... a nice sweetness up front and a good bitter back-end .  poured from a 750ml bottle into my troubadour tulip glass . a dense and enormous mattress of foam tops the ale almost like a merengue . a sudsy lattice-work of lace remains in the glass even after it is empty .  perhaps a bit thin for the style , which i suppose makes it a good pale ale for summertime quaffing .

amazing nose of peach with a high , frothy , long lasting head with an almost soapy mouthfeel .  pours very dark brown color with a 2.5 finger dense tan head with incredible retention , with some very nice lacing on the glass .  slinky and a little thin , but ok .

great smell good apperance .  a : pours a wonderfully bright golden/orange color .  it pains me to trash a beer , but this brewery needs a swift kick in the pants . i ordered this to give the brewery a second chance , since the white cloud ale i had the day before was patently awful . after a couple sips , i took it back to the bar and told the bartender , saying i wanted to try the local beer , but could n't drink it . no lager is intended to be a sour beer . he added that it 's sort of an acquired taste , but happily replaced it with a real beer . i could n't finish either of these sour beers ( and not like it 's brewed intentionally with brett ) . whoever the new guy is , he needs to clean up the brewery and get back to basics with brewing .

huge hop aroma , a nice scottish style malt presnece behind the agresive hop bitterenes .  poured - beautiful dark color .  mouthfeel : i 've always thought this was a little off ... not quite enough spine to offset the sweetness .

i smell a fruity and floral characteristic along with a strong citrusy hop overtone . this is a classic ipa and the brewers knew what they were doing with this batch .  a - amazing grey color s - yeast , very slight citrus , wheat t - plain in a good way , kinda thick and sweet bready coriander turns to a dry slightly bitter finish .  i could drink this one all night long . just the right amount of sweetness with a little more than expected carbonation . pale yellow in color , lemony aroma.very clean with little aftertaste . easy to drink and very enjoyable . will definately drink again .

aroma vomits forth ripe , rich fruits . raisin paste and juicy plum notes jump out of the glass from a distance . the slightest hint of raw cocoa beans top off this exotic nasal medley . still , tastewise , there are better dubbels . it 's no 12 , but it 's a solid beer wrapped in an exquisite package . worth a try , glad i did .  poured into a tulip a nice dark brown color , nice carbonation , awesome fuckn ' head , never seen a head like this from a bw , two-finger creamy tannish head , tons of sticky lacing and islands through out the drink .  m & # 8211 ; thin , refreshing , light , plentiful , smooth carbonation .

not faux-bacos as many low-end rauschbiers often are ... but honest to god bacon . once you get through the scent , there is a wonderfully salty and sweet beer underneath , that makes you want to keep drinking .  i absolutely loved this bottle .  the beer feels just a bit thin on the tongue .

smell is unbelievable . tons of chocolate , dark fruit , and malted milk balls .  it lasts forever and settles to a nice pillow . usually old ales have no head at all . i 'm amazed this looks so good .  mouthfeel : a little slick , thinner on the palate than i expected drinkability : a fine porter , would definitely drink again .

just plainly delicious as hell . goddamn , what a insanely alluring nose . on the palate , the dark grains come to the fore , with a rich roasted character , leavening to a light burnt cacao husk note .  anyways , into the erdinger glass ... a - really impressed with this head .  body is on the thin side of medium and the finish is both mildly astringent and slightly bitter .

really smells nice . the taste mimicks the nose ... .nice balance between the cloves and banana notes ... also some subtle but enjoyable caramel maltiness .  biggish , crusty , light tan head leaves lots of hard , sticky lacing . very pretty .  mouthfeel is a little thin and alcoholic with low carbonation . overall this beer has a nice balance of flavours but i feel the barrel presence is a little bit too subtle and the mouthfeel a bit too thin to prevent a higher score .

: ) s. an incredible aroma on this one . absolutely fantastic . t. awesome , just like the nose . incredible smell and taste , unfortunately difficult to obtain in my area ( even for those in mi ) .  a : pours a light golden with a couple fingers of dense white head that reduced very slowly into a thick frothy head . beautiful rings/sheets of lacing left with every sip .  mf : the carbonation is n't quite as spritzy as i would hope to go along with the huge sourness , the body is light d : this is a great lambic .

awesomely complex . taste : chocolate , chocolate malt , coffee , chocolate syrup .  a - pours a beautiful golden/amber with a puffy head which quickly dissolves with lots of lacing s - wow .  m- low carbonation , medium-body .

smells wonderful . cloves , banana , caramel , fruitiness . nice comfortable warmth from the alcohol . not something i could see drinking a ton of at a sitting , but delightful as a one off .  light amber beer was topped by a thick head that left some of the thickest lacing i have seen in my career .  the beer is somewhat oxidized , but still highly drinkable very light bodied bitter , true to the the style . this is a prime candidate for a session beer . at 3.8 % abv , it 's alcohol content makes this a clear choice for something that could literally be consumed all day long , starting with your pancakes !

smell has a strong piney grapefruit aroma , the grapefruit really shines through as the star , the aroma kind of reminds me of the 1260 triple ipa .  pours garnet with 4 fingers of off white/sand colored head . insane lacing & healthy head retention s : sour , vinergary notes up front that dissipates to not much of anything & then comes back t : sweetness & sourness do battle up front , along with serious dryness .  mouthfeel - this seems a bit watery for my liking , and a bit light too , it does n't take away from the beer too much though luckily , still great . the carbonation seems pretty good , maybe a bit overcarbonated .

s : the glass was a foot and a half away from my face and i could immediately smell a warm pumpkin pie coming out of the oven with a nice floral hops on the back . t : the spicy pumpkin flavor swirls with a strong caramel malt flavor .  poured into a fluted pilsner glass , this czech pils showed an exceptional ability to form a stiff , meringue-like , rocky head of foam . retention was great , lasting for the duration of the glass , leaving irregular clumps of foam on the way down .  m - not as thick as i 'd like it to taste considering how rich the smell is . d - very drinkable , with the lighter mouthfeel it 's easier to forget how much you 've had .

vanilla , oak , maple leaf , faint rum aroma , and most of all ooey gooey caramel - sort of like a caramello bar . t : bittersweet chocolate layered with oaky and vanilla flavors , a caramel filling , and a coffee finish . i would even go as far to say this was luxurious or elegant .  12 oz bottle poured into a dfh tulip . a- literally my favorite color of beer- deep reddish-copper . solid 1+ inch head that laces well .  m- seems a little thin , but nicely carbonated .

very enjoyable beer . highly quaffable and deliciously decadent .  poured into my duvel tulip a - pours a dark reddish-brown color with a huge pillowy tan head . this is absolutely beautiful , and took a good 3 minutes to recede enough for me to drink it !  the carbonation is unfortunately at a distracting level , but the feel is strong enough otherwise to not hurt too much overall .

smells amazing . chocolate and some buttery , boozy notes emerge with warming .  the beer looks really good with a thick brown creamy head , tons of lacing , and a very nice head that lasts and lasts .  pretty average mouthfeel overall .

nose has a surprising sweetness with tropical fruit esters of subtle pineapple and mango : both were of the dried and sweetened kind of fruit rather than fresh . citrus , earthy , grassy hops balanced with biscuit sweet and bitter malts .  this beer pours exceptionally well for a three finger thick cranium in a light tan color .  mouthfeel : the carbonation is light , as is the body .

the smell is exactly like a cafe mocha -- dark chocolate , buttery , and quality roasted coffee . the taste is very intense on the chocolate but the roasted coffee malts come through nicely too .  on tap tonight at fountainhead in chicago ... poured into a tulip ... pours dark brown with nice dark ruby red highlights , good clarity . capped with three fingers of cool whip-esque white head that leaves a bit of lacing ... sweet and sour cherries dominate the nose with bits of oak and vanilla .  very light bodied , but carbonation seems too low to me .

the nose of this beer was amazing - grapefruit , orange , mango , and pineapple and pine . the taste is just about as good . wow . mouthfeel was medium and mildly carbonated .  appearance/pour : nice dark amber with a surprising stream of carbonation rising from the glass bottom etch . head which dissapates to a nice ring with small foamy clusters . thick lacing and a dense sound while pouring- sounds thick .  the carbonation is moderate high . i think it is a bit high for the style but the carbonation does not take anything away from the beer .

exceptional smell of toffee , caramel , nutty . wanted to eat something that smelled like this . slightly bitter note on the nose . sweet with a more bitter nutty taste .  bottle provided by mike , drank into my hill farmstead glass ... looks great , a dark clear peach with a big bright white head . looks awesome ! ! ! ... boring aroma of light toffee and hops , generic .  in my opinion , flying dog brewery has created a great seasonal , smooth-tasting beer with very little bite or after taste . i would definitely recommend it to any self-respecting beer drinker who might be having an end-of-summer party this or any october .

smell is super fruity sweetness , excellent complexities including wood , vanilla and a bit of alcohol . taste is an explosion of goodness . i love that barleywines come in 12oz bottles** , as that 's the size that i 'd prefer to have this style of beer in .  pours a gorgeous dark caramel in the glass , with a nice thick tan head .  good carbonation and medium bodied . flavor is spicy , yeasty , hints of sweetness that gets buried by the yeast . lingering yeasty aftertaste .

smells interesting and fun . the taste is floral and spicey .  ruby and brown shades with decent clarity , a beautiful 1/2 inch head of white foam sits atop with solid retention .  m : flat , slick , and that 's it . not quite watery , but pretty close .

smells great ! ! !  look : bright golden color , white head of creamy foam with 2 fingers thick , very good lacing , has a sticker that say it was the best beer in the world in 2002 , let see if it 's true ; smell : biscuity malts and fruit essences ; taste : pine and spicy hops , molasses , some biscuity malts , alcohol and sugars at the finish ; mouthfeel : dry and very bitter , bittersweet and spicy finish , the body is creamy and thick ; drinkability : the first time i try the `` tripel '' style , very spicy .  it was a little thin .

wonderful citrus aroma of oranges and grapefruits . the nose is n't just there , it smacks you in the face - and this is a wonderful thing . if i could give higher than a five for aroma on this beer i would . taste - this beer is called hop dragon and consequently is all about hops . great bitter kick that almost goes unnoticed because of all the other great things about this beer .  great amber apperance with thick ass head that will not stop clinging to the glass .  3.0 m : medium body . smooth , but not creamy .

the head falls to an island of loose bubbles , a ring , and dusting that leaves spots of lacing.. mind blowing aroma . orange , mango , papaya , grapefruit , pineapple ... candied hops ! sweet and floral , it tickles my nose and begs to be tasted . i taste tropical fruits , with lots of green and white pepper , it is earthy and reminds me of kind-buds .  appearance is near perfect for this style .  mouthfeel : both the carbonation and body are on the higher end of the light range .

smells rich and sweet with a nice peaty smokiness to it . overall it 's nice .  abv 5 % pours a brilliant , perfectly clear , golden color with a fluffy three finger white head . picture perfect of a pils .  mouthfeel is quite viscous , with not a lot of texture . feels full and a bit flat . could use more carbonation to cut through the smokey flavour more .

s : the best smelling coffee oatmeal stout i 've smelled to date .  appearance : slightly hazy , ruby-amber pour with a voluminous ( and tenacious ) , light-tan whipped-cream head . recedes to floating dollops ... lace everywhere !  m : feels alright . average .

nose is fantastic ! uniquely fruity , like a cranberry-mango chutney . hops are detectable and make this a complex sniffer , probably the best smelling tripel i have ever laid nostrils upon . fruit levels take on the best from belgium , impressive . very nice brew , might be my favorite that i have had so far from the bruery .  appearance : pitch black . very dark head .  my first tripel style beer , i spit it on my counter . the flavors of fruit combined with a bitter aftertaste left one bottle down the drain , and three still sitting in their case . anyone near me is welcome to the other three . while i am confident in the quality of this product , this style is definitely not for me .

aroma is predominately belgian funk and gambrinus honey malt . flavor is pilsen , honey , and belgian aromatic malt with just enough hop to balance . yeast flavor is a very nice blend of straight belgian and brett .  got a single of this the other day , and poured it into my mug and the appearance is beautiful . hazy straw color , best looking ive seen in a hefe .  the drawback on this beer is the carbonation - it 's too heavy . sparkly but with a nice dryness in the finish .

smell has a great malty dark fig aroma . very warm smell . taste is also very malty .  one beautiful looking barleywine here . it almost glows a nice dark amber color .  the nose is caramely and very malty . a little too carbinated for a traditional barleywine but lines ones gut like the best of the bunch ! being a sucker for barleywines i have to give this beer high remarks .

nose is certainly affected with the trademark jolly pumpkin barrel aroma/flavor.. light vanilla wood without imparting too much diacetyl . finally , i 've found the beer this balances with perfectly.. the creamy whipped dreaminess of the barrel versus the stark , bright , ripe fruits of an american dubbel.. this exudes a mindblowing aroma . superb . blueberry ice cream scent with a blondie underneath . delectable . taste does n't disappoint either . jolly pumpkin seems to be a real one trick pony , but this is one of the times when that pony executes its trick perfectly .  this brew pours into the glass with a black body topped by a thick creamy , light brown head with a good amount of lacing left behind .  body is light and the carbonation is lively , a bit too much for my preferences .

wonderful . just the perfect amount of fruit mixed with the belgian wheat goodness .  slightly opaque with a chilled haze , this brew looks damn inviting .  but there are hints of dark fruits that seem to disintegrate on your tongue , slight astringent alcohol tate/smelll this is defiantly a very drinkable brew .

the nose is one of my best ipa aromas ever , with a powerful yet less aggressive hop blast , full of fruit and floral notes , and only flavored with pine , not dominated by it . extremely impressive stuff from these salt lake city brewers .  dark chocolate brown with a nice , thick , creamy , khaki head atop .  while the champagne-like extreme dryness may put off some , i think it makes the beer truly unique and tasty as opposed to unblanced .

the grapes come through again from the aroma but the flavour depth is n't as good as the nose . a decent ipa with lots of great aroma but lacking a bit of flavour . a really nice showcase of the nelson sauvin hop and a great idea from mikkeller .  a : yellow , straw hues , slightly hazy , enormous whipped meringue head , long lasting retention , nice lacing .  and this is a surprisingly warming , earthy-tasting beverage for a `` summer ale '' -- i would n't mind opening up one of these in midwinter either , except in that it lacks body . it 's in the mouthfeel that the summeriness stands out .

s : as soon as i popped this one , i loved the smell of it . i was hoping after the great smell , it would have a taste i loved , but unfortunately not a taste that suits me .  a gorgeous beer , this pours a rich , hazed , honey amber with a killer head of eggshell puff that forms stiff rocky peaks and deposits thick clumps of lace .  medium bodied with carbonation that was a little too high and too coarse for my liking , but it did n't turn me off completely . my only issue was the carbonation .

smells creamy/milky with rich , almost sweet coffee , chocolate , kaluha , cocoa , and a touch of green hops . absolutely divine . the flavor is roasty with burnt/charred malts , coffee , chocolate , and a medium bitterness .  appearance - you can immediately tell from pouring that this beer has exceptional carbonation . it also has phenomenal lacing capabilities that do n't want to let go of the glass .  the mouthfeel was a little on the watery side but i did n't feel like it ruined the experience .

for the record , fresh - this might be the mightiest tasting ipa out there . smells like mango , citrus , pine needles , pineapple , melon etc . also has a nice sweet malt aroma in the background . lots of piney resin with a pineapple/mango twang . o : overall , a finely crafted ipa . among my favs all-time and easily my top 3 from out west .  poured into duvel tulip glass , half beer half very thick foamy head . very solid beer .  m - a little thin-bodied and watery and a little low on the carbonation .

the aroma is full on citrus hops . love it . the flavor is much more balanced than the nose . the citrus blast is there but the malt `` grinds '' away at it . overall another great beer from surly .  this beer poured slow , and was pitch black in color . the head was medium sized , but brown , with small bubbles . looked beautiful !  ran into the maui brewing company while killing time until our dinner reservations were ready . there was a very slight bitterness in the aftertaste but was well hidden in the passion fruit sweetness . found the beer to start like any average golden ale but the aftertaste was what i really liked about it sorta like an ice tea aftertaste .

nose is amazing ! huge assertive orange spice . the single most assertive bold orange spice nose i may ever have smelled . beautiful . mouthfeel is rich and lightly creamy with nice carbonation and a nice texture and feel . flavors are just plain weird . there is an herb quality and character to this beer , initially stange and offensive that become very appealing . i suspect that one will love or hate this one ; and , it deserves a taste ; it 's unique .  blood red color with a thick pink foamy head the color of blush wine .  the beer seems to thin a bit in the mouthfeel . very clean beer for a triple , slightly thin in the mouthfeel , but that helps give this beer a nice clean dry finish .

the smell is amazing ! ! very nice indeed . mouthfeel is medium light with a healthy amount of carbonation and a dry finish .  a : clear , pale golden color with two fingers of fluffy white foam that diminishes to a quarter-sized berg . extensive speckled lacing remains on the glass and tiny bubbles rise in many steady streams through the column .  lowish carbonation and a slightly thin mouthfeel .

the aroma was spectacular , one of the best i have ever been privy to . though the look could use a touch of tinkering , the amazing aroma and depth of flavors more than made up for it . a unique and enjoyable offering unlike any other saison i 've ever had .  but not rahr and son 's w.w. from the get go the pour was great a beautiful reddish brown with a head that stuck around for awhile . and lacing that covered the glass throughout the few minutes it took for me to gobble this one down and lots of sediment in the bottle .  toward the end of the drink , the beer felt almost flat .

insanely tart notes of lemon zest , white grape rinds , and dry oak barrels . so incredibly tart ; for me , the only comparable wild ale is batch 2 beatification ( in terms of sheer sourness ) . fantastic beer .  pours black with a long lasting brown head that leaves plenty of lacing .  smooth and to the point , bit of a sweet aftertaste in the sweet sticky beer way .

the best thing about this beer is the aroma imo . awesome , very awesome . beer is thin and falls flat on the flavors at first . its a good beer , just not my favorite .  a : poured a dark clear ( filtered ) chocolatey amber color with a rich white foamy head .  light , decently carbonated , and quenching for the desert dweller .

really complex nose . smoke , bourbon , dark cherry sour notes . the taste was excellent . really nice with the bourbon not over powering .  dark copper with a 2 finger off-white head from a 22 into a pint glass . i drink slower , so i poured the remainder almost 30 minutes later and it still formed a 2 finger head . this is much lighter in the smoke than any rauch that most people have had .  it also takes a hit because while it looks thick , it feels a bit thinner than it should be .

really great nose !  glass : chimay goblet temp : cellared @ approx 45 degrees bottling date : 04-23-08 pours an exceptional clear golden amber color . minimal head that retains a light lacing all the way down .  m : thinner and crisper .

cranberry nose with traces of brett-like peppery suede funkiness ( either from the kombucha or actual brett ) , black cherry , dried peaches , honey , and cider . it 's one of the most distinct and delicious smelling beers i 've come across in a while . it 's clever enough to inspire analysis , while still being relatively drinkable , in spite of the co2 struggles .  a- gorgeous . deep gold with hints of orange .  m - this is the weakest part of the beer . medium body with a little too much carbonation .

huge hop and malt aroma , very typical of stone .  incredible retention , eventually falling to a quarter-inch layer of froth . impressive start .  the carbonation is nice throughout . thinner than expected also .

many `` damn '' s and `` holy s*** '' s could be heard as we sniffed the mercifully small portions in our tasting glasses . tons of whiskey , vanilla , burnt caramel , butterscotch . taste features big woody vanilla along with chocolate , caramel , coffee , and big booze ( how could it not ) . lot of whiskey . some sweetness , but really nowhere near as sweet as i thought it might be . feel is thick and syrupy , but look at what you 're drinking - this is one of those beers you could probably pour over your pancakes .  pours a nice deep and shiny orange/amber , with a beautiful white , fluffy head that stays a good while . nice creamy lacing on the glass .  the overall feel is dry , like it should be , but unfortunately , it 's also a touch chaulky , which is pretty unfortunate .

the flavor is not quite as complex as the nose would suggest but it is still quite good . it starts out with some dry oakiness followed by dusty cocoa .  on tap o'brien 's pub san diego , ca black with a lot of visible carbonation and a thin brown head . regular , lined lacing down the glass . very attractive and perfect for a black ipa . roasted malts and pine aromas combine , though i would suggest that the roast is fairly dominant .  m-a bit watery for my tastes but the taste makes you forget about it being slightly thin .

the aroma is absolutely wonderful ... full of freshly crushed green , leafy and sweet hops . nice . the carbonation is mild to moderate . pleasantly surprised by this one..i thought this was going to be another average pale ale , but this very enjoyable .  a deep golden pour teams with a fluffy cream head . good head retention and great lacing . very sexy served in a tulip .  mouthfeel : the body is oddly thin , and crisp .

above average head retention & lacing s : lemony with white pepper & orange peel t : follows the nose , also some breadyness & candi sugar , apple peels & general spiceyness up front . finishes with apple peel , lemony & herbal hops & a lovely spiceyness & just a bit of grapefruit at the apex mf : medium bodied , lively carbonation , very nice balance superb drinkabilty i could stay on this all night !  this beer looks perfect . pretty gold color , with a nice big fluffy head .  nothing special here .

s : creme brulee ? the nose on this beer is amazing . loads of vanilla , caramel , cream , butterscotch and a tad bit of roasted malt .  pours a clear dark brown with superior side lacing and a copious tan head with very good retention . appearance is exceptional .  m- thin to medium in body . highly attenuated with a soft carbonation .

back to the smell - oak , but the lovely old sort . . .  pours a light , burnt orange , very clear . the beautiful amber-orange gives it an amazing radiant quality , looks delicious and refreshing . also great for the beach , on a deck or patio watching the sun set to match the color of this gorgeous beer , especially since it will go great with chips and salsa .  medium bodied and dry .

smell is incredible : pure piney , grapefruity hops with a veneer of rich malt . and that in itself is amazing ! finishes like an unsweetened soda .  appearance : i 'm a huge fan of this beer 's appearance . it is mildly dark in colour with a deep rich , ruby read colour that really glows when held up to light . it pours with a nice dense , slightly rocky head .  4.5/5 m : crisp , medium body .

i stick my nose to the glass to get a better whiff of the hoppy goodness and i sneezed 3x . this is all about the hops . as the aroma foretold , this beer is all about the hops . the beer is drinkable now , but it is a big beer and pretty green .  the carbonation gives rise to an absolutely stunning off white , creamy head with excellent retention .  carbonation seems spot on .

it pours like a big , english old ale . smell- fat and sweet , it 's a beautiful display of wood and chocolate covered cherries ... but more like the liquid that surrounds the cherries . notes of old leatherbound library books and rum soaked dark fruits abound .  1,000 review a- awesome copper red appearance , great foam and nice head when poured from a bottle .  a malty mouthful without much carbonation . resiny flavors fill the mouth but do n't obscure the big malt . this one is quite drinkable with an interesting mix of flavors that rise out of the basic malty sweetness .

do n't be turned off by the little green specks floating around as they are chucks of hops leftover from fermentation and help accentuate the huge hoppy aromas . pours a nice creamy golden color with slight greenish hue to foamy head . aromas of malts and hops give way to dried fruit .  1 pint 6 oz tall dark brown bottle with a racer checkered flag on the label with red and yellow print , pewter cap . great retention and clumpy lace .  nice floral hops and malt starchiness in the finish . it 's a drinkable beer . heavy in the stomach .

s : this smells like heaven . endless raspberries , need i say more . it 's not as good as the legendary new glarus raspberry tart , but this beer is certainly fun and tastes great .  thanks to mistakebythelake for this growl pour apperance- golden orange with a good amount of white head . a gorgeous beer !  mouthfeel was week and its not complex at all .

very well balanced . medium body . very nicely done .  growler the bruery placentia , ca a clear light golden with a big and thick foaming white head . the head sticks around for quite a while and eventually leaves thick and sticky lacing all down the glass .  mouf & gt ; nice , nothing special drinkability & gt ; sure thing

overall pretty good .  a : an outstanding looking beer . dark plum color with a pinch of tannish head and amazing coating lacing . stunning .  if you aerate the beer in your mouth , it really releases the co2 . it would do well as a beer to server with medium to strong cheese .

aroma is wow ! bacon .  it poured with a huge , frothy , clumpy , and sticky head that was the darkest brown i 've ever seen .  a little lighter and less sweet than many `` real '' belgian beers , and a little thinner in the mouthfeel department .

aroma is absolutely perfect . sweet maple and brown sugar mouth-watering goodness with fresh cannabanoid hop perfume .  i had this on tap and have to say was extremely impressed by its beautiful golden color , and fine head .  mouthfeel was fine but that doesnt make up for much .

the aroma continues to provoke the senses with a luscious , mouthwatering perfume . its flavor had a tough time catching up to its exceptional aroma , but still came through with a graceful sequence of sweet malts modestly checked with a light hop scheme .  this one pours a beautiful orange copper color with 3/4 '' off-white head .  m - crisp and bitey , high carbonation - the bottle overflowed when i opened it .

absolutely amazing grapefruit , lemon , and orange aroma . also has a touch of sweet toffee and vanilla . this was a beautiful hazy golden pour , with typical cask frothy head . very well balanced flavor , then a wonderful dry bitter finish . this is an amazing brew , and the cask only adds to it .  a - a very light straw color with great clarity and a large , thick white head . perfect . this looks tame like a corona but has loads of complexity .  parching on the tongue . almost no flavor : slight sweetness up front , trace of bitterness on finish . really .

wonderful aroma ! it 's fantastic !  the beer pours a jet black liquid ; impenetrable by light . the head is a nice coffee color , about an inch right up to the edge of my pint glass . the head retention is excellent and the lacing on the side of the glass leads down to a creamy top of the beer even when almost gone .  light bodied .

s - wow , really fresh pine aroma . pine needles are also big . the finish is bitter , yet fragrant sap . overall this is very well done .  pours an effervescent honey color with3+ fingers of cream colored head . insane lacing & head retention s : grapefruit & lemon , fades a bit as this warms t : follows the nose , plus pineyness , slight breadyness & a touch of leafy hops & dryness hiding behind a ton of grapefruit up front .  on tap this poured as a golden straw colored ale , clear and bright with less than an inch of head . there is an apparent hoppy aroma that followed with a similarly dominant slight-hoppy taste followed by the expected bitters - very tasty . i stopped with one . not to discount its drink-ability , there are just several others i wish to try .

floral pine caramel . t : at 99 ibu and 6 % i was expecting a hop bomb that was crazy unbalanced but the scottish golden grain holds up against the hops . real bitter and dry mouth with a little astringent flavor d : besides my mouth being super dry and bitter its a great session beer . one of the best ipas ive had considering the flavor of the beer .  pours hazy gold with a massive , fluffy white head . very promising appearance , but way overcarbonated if you 're shooting for anything lambic-esque .  m_on the lighter side with a bit too much carbonation . the carbonation is along the lines of a tripel which is a bit too much for the style . d_the light body while a flaw style wise make this fairly easy to drink .

s : wonderful nose . toasted notes with some malt character hiding behind it .  this is more like it ... pitch black . pours a thick brown head that quickly swells to 2 inches and then recedes to 1/4 inch .  m - a little thin , sickly-sweet finish .

took a trip down to colorado springs last week , mainly to visit this brewery . aromas of passion fruit , grapefruit and tangerine . medium bodied , and not at all bitter , with flavors of oak , booze and sweet malt .  pours into a nonic the darkest shade of brown , almost black . huge frothy tan head that leaves gobs of lacing around the glass with good head retention .  fairly thin and smooth , mild to medium bodied . breckenridge definitely delivers a vanilla porter as i would expect a vanilla flavored porter to be . i suggest toning down the roasted barley and focusing more on bittering hops .

s - smell is phenomenal . right after you uncap it you 're hit with cinnamon and nutmeg and plenty of pumpkin .  pours a very nice black color with some ruby hues and a thick white head . i love to watch this beer settle .  mouthfeel can be too fizzy if you do n't make sure to pour high for tall head . when i 'm drinking more than one beer , this is my favorite second or third , as it 's got enough hops to satisfy , is not highly alcoholic , and sells for a real good price where i live .

while really good , not as good as aroma . overall : really good . would have liked the flavor to measure up to the aroma but you still ca n't go wrong with this one .  very nice looking beer in a great setting .  m : not too bad , there was a little bit of body .

s - roasted grains , caramelized sugar , wood smoke , charcoal , fireplace and campfire aromas abound ! wonderfully smoky , earthy , outdoorsy , and roasty ! i also smell some nice cheese notes hidden behind the smoke , and some solid hops are there too .  pours a two finger cream head that fades slowly , leaving a good lace . nice deep amber color .  the only thing that could be improved on this beer is the mouthfeel . a bit light for my tastes , but like i said it has incredible drinkability without making you get too full too quick .

probably the best aroma of any ale i 've tasted all year . amazing ester profile .  a rich gold hue with white one-finger head , laces astonishingly well . looks like a good beer .  actually thought it might be bad but when i drank it there was plenty of carbonation . smell : a toasted malty smell with an almost cardboard smell . taste : very strong toasted smell but more of a bitterness then a sweetness . note : no date on the bottle but wondering if this beer had gone bad . will try another attempt at it but not really looking forward to it .

nice nose ! great complexity .  got this one in trade , thanks eric ... a : perfect look . thick 1 and 1/2 inch off-white head that slowly fades leaving nice lacing around the glass .  lighter mouthfeel than expected . d - full flavor and light mouthfeel .

this smells amazing . like perfumed hop elephants . but damn ... this smells amazing . i could inhale this all day . which sounds odd .  impressive retention , plenty of lacing .  m - moderate carbonation , medium bodied .

incredibly complex aroma , a deep strong dark with dirt , sour grass , tart apple , a cornucopia of spices . perfect touch of the rustic .  a clear copper ruby when held up to the light with brilliant head retention and honeycomb lacing .  mouthfeel works just fine , but is a little watery . highly drinkable .

awesomely hoppy nose of ripe citrus and waxy tropical notes with a good dose of pine too- mango , ruby red grapefruit , papaya , peach , grassy lemon mint . very pungent . overall , very juicy and delicious , with my one complaint being that the beer finishes a little short .  a - incredible crimson-amber color with a lasting two-finger off-white head .  the huge head tipped me off and my first taste confirmed that this beer was infected . as a homebrewer , i 'm sure to sample every beer i brew before i give it to a friend . a little qc goes a long way .

s- jeepers creepers there 's some bugs in there . super sour and funky with lots of acidity in the nose . t- so sour and tart with tons of acidity . bright brilliant sour cherries , strawberries and underipe plums .  a : awesome when poured from a nitro bottle , cream to brown to almost black right before your eyes . nice caramel colored head and lacing that hung around throughout .  mouthfeel is smooth , crisp and almost watery , with medium carbonation and a medium body .

smell is incredible . a big sugar smell is predominant accompanied by nice dark malts . there is a nice thickness to it as well , that makes it incredibly smooth . drinkable beer for a strong abv .  poured from a 12 oz bottle , 2008 version a : pours a clear mahogany brown , with ruby hues , under a big slightly off white head . excellent retention and lace .  the mouthfeel was quite thin with a very fine and mild carbonation .

s- awesome char smell with chocolate and roasted coffee , and supported by a rich dark fruit sweetness . hoppy bitterness is a fantastic undertone . m- nice smooth mouthfeel .  incredible whipped retention and lacing everywhere . this is an awesome looking beer !  m - light bodied , not overly carbonated , clean finish , mild fruity aftertaste fades quickly .
