the aroma is thoroughly enticing , presenting notes of buttered wheat , bubble gum , orange peel , banana creme , vanilla , and a touch of spicy , organic hops . all in all , a satisfyingly complex and tasty wheatwine from the talented terrapin brewers .  this beer had a beautiful pour into a tulip glass . very dark and rich , with a dark roasted tan head that was very thick and continually rebuilt itself every time i swirled the glass .  nice chewy mouthfeel , but significantly under-carbonated . the only thing it lacks is carbonation and a decent head .

wonderful mixed aroma with qualities of malt behind the wonderful saaz hops . this is a really nice beer .  ( bottle into pint glass - sampled 4/5/10 ) picture perfect pour with a dark brown color and creamy off white head .  m : standard mouthfeel for a low alcohol ale .

aroma : it has that rare smell that is as full and alluring as you 'd hope it would taste : banana bread , roasted chestnuts , cloves , hints of chocolate , estery and phenolic notes . the finish is very clean , with lingering bits of pepper and chalky dark chocolate . mouthfeel : it has a very smooth feel even though the carbonation is quite prickly . the dark malts give it a fuller and more flavorful character than most saisons , although incorporating them also reduces the peppiness and refreshment of a traditional saison . would i get it again ? : yes . it 's a solid beer , and though not the pinacle of its style , a welcome alternative to traditional saisons . bottled : february 25 , 2011 served : may 6 , 2011 price = $ 8.99 at whole foods ( nyc ) additional notes : - international bitterness units : 30 - malt : pilsner , rye , crystal rye , black malt - hops : pilgrim , saaz  thanks for the opportunity ... poured into an imperial pint glass , formed a 1/4 '' dark brown ( almost purply black ) head above the opaque black brew . head hangs on , with average lace , which actually is pretty good for the style .  mouthfeel : medium and semi-smooth . bottom line : this is one of the most bland beers i 've ever had .

amazingly complex aroma of hand-made chocolates . very mild and easy drinking . definately nothing double powered on the flavor . surprisingly clean . very light body . very drinkable .  330ml bottle poured into tulip dec9 2010 a super hazy golden orange with tiny suspended particles being move around by a shitload of bubbles . a gentle pour leaves a massive 3 finger head that forms a dome over the top of the glass and just sits there for a while ever so slowly falling to a thick film with a island in the middle that looks like a little brain s a little yeast and pineapple with some other fruits i ca n't quite place and some booze t what i smell but with a little more booze , some cereals and a nice little blast of hops .  it states `` the deep coffee flavors are created naturally during the brewing process by dark roasted malts . '' then later it notes `` stout brewed with coffee . anyway , i 'll refer to this as a steady drinking stout because of its thinness , otherwise it 's pretty enjoyable . not particulary complex but enjoyable taste of roasted malt with coffee . abv seems pretty low as i had two with no noticable effects .

this is good , but it 's a little overrated here . it 's tasty and it smells fantastic . i know real porters have sour ale , but usually that sour ale adds creaminess , here it almost has a coors light sourness ( acrid-overdrive ) to it thats off-putting .  hazy light golden with a nice , moussy white head ; excellent head retention , and great lacing . perfect looks . no contest here .  the mouthfeel was medium bodied with adequate carbonation .

man this was incredible . citrusy herbal if i had to put some words on it .  a : amazing head on top of a dark yellow body launches up to the top of the glass and hangs out forever , ending its long life in a spiderweb of beauty . glass is soapy all the way down . this beer could not look any more inviting .  it is light bodied and enjoyable . it has a light hops aroma and a light bodied feel to it .

this reminds me a bit of pte with that ridiculously great aroma and bitterness but not quite having the citric hop flavor that i would normally want in a dipa . this beer is incredibly bitter on the back end and the hot alcohol make this beer difficult to session .  pours a clear golden color with a thick , fluffy , off-white head .  a watery texture and lighter body than i expected from the nose , with a moderate amount of carbonation .

that 's a good thing in my book . overall a fantastic aipa .  pours a cloudy yellow/gold color , with a huge thick fluffy white head . a good deal of carbonation helped this head hold for what seemed like an eternity .  this is about my only complaint of this beer-too much carbonation ! carbonation gives a foamy/frothy mouthfeel .

s-what comes through first is a perfect balance of sweet caramel malt and a blast of citrus hops . d- this brew is pretty awesome . brews that emphasize the citrus/spicy hop combo are hard to come by and this one does an excellent job with it .  stamp directly on top of the white , generic cap announces : bottl 2008* a dark caramel body with a significant amount of sediment floating around that were actually dark in appearance . topping all of that is a nice , creamy white head that sticks around for several minutes . very cool look .  overall , i quite enjoyed this beer . it 's got a fresh and interesting taste that makes it a decent drinking beer . deliciously fruity hops , nice malt sweetness , comes across as quite fresh . noticeable taste of apricots which i quite like makes this distinctive and something i look forward to drinking . disappointing finish however . lots of interesting things happening up front and then nada . nothing really lingers which is a darn shame , 'cause overall this beer is well worth a try . still tasty after each bottle . mmmm .

smell is a beautiful bouquet of tangy/citrus hops .  had a gorgeous impenetrable chestnut coloration , massive amounts of creeping carbonation , and a thick , creamy off-white head that displayed amazing retention .  mouthfeel is just a tad watery .

three floyds beers have a unique aroma . the hops come across , thick and flowery . ive heard they use amarillo and columbus hops for aroma . many brewers could learn from these folks . milk chocolate , coffee , a little toasted malt with just a mild flowery hop flavor on the finish . slick , smooth and rich mouth feel , very nice , very drinkable .  a - two fingers of off-white head slowly fade on top of a gorgeous translucent amber beer with bubbles rising steadily through it s - smell is a juicy blend of citrus and apricot , grapefruit is most prominent but plenty of orange zest comes through , apricot is muted and there 's a little bit of mint and pine in there too , do n't get too much aroma from the malts , a touch of toffee maybe t - flavor is far too muted considering that the beer is so appealing to the eyes and the nose , a touch of sweetness , a lot of hop bitterness , some grapefruit and orange , some apricot , but so subdued m - nice tongue coating from the hops but the carbonation is a little prickly , not as smooth as it could be o - not a bad ipa , not a great ipa .  long , super bitter piney bitterness , aftertaste almost of pine-sol but i love the hop attack . problem is that it 's too sweet and slightly syrupy , especially evident in the middle . a little harsh and unbalanced overall , big beer and it shows .

the smell dances on the nose , full of floral and hops .  a : fantastic clarity , golden , and a relentless head , a 3 millimeter head is still visible after 20 minutes , leaving rings of lace in its wake .  m - medium body , with moderate to high carbonation . a bit too carbonated for my liking . slightly thin , would like a bigger body from a stout . the mouthfeel is lacking , and sweet flavors of vanilla and chocolate make it too much like a dessert beer , one is all you need .

s - impressive ! i 've smelled hoppy beers from a few feet away , but this has a spicy malt boozy smell that almost fills a room when the the bottle is uncapped .  the beer poured a nice black with a tan lacing .  mouthfeel : body is light to medium and slightly watery .

the aroma is intoxicating , deep and bold arabica coffee notes upfront that is fruity and intense . high quality cacao , molasses , pepper , cherry wood and a wallop of alcohol ... really outstanding . the flavor is a letdown from the aroma , with a broad sweetness that kind of smothers the coffee and roasted notes , some cherry and plum notes in the background and an alcohol bite finishes things off . an incredible aroma almost makes up for the cloying sweetness .  this brew pours with a deep amber body topped by a medium thick head with lots of lacing .  the mouthfeel is just a little light and watery .

the smell is exceptional . tons of different scents .  a-amber with sediment and good frothy head . the color an intense head gives this one high scores .  the mouthfeel is a bit weird ; kind of a harshness on the tongue .

s- nice nutty aromas , butterscotch , caramel , high end rum notes . this makes me smile . t- starts out a nice light dry chocolate , some nutty notes , light caramel , and some light dry hoppiness on the clean finish .  pour revelaed an extremely thick and long lasting creamy white head.as it reduced it left rings of lace in the glass.the color presented was orange and somewhat cloudy.mouthfeel wasnt very crisp and seemed a bit watery.the finish left a sharp sweet or tart twist that dissapeared real quick.a bit bitter in the back of the throat with a wheaty grain taste.a spicy aroma thats not too strong but is there.tastes of oranges , lemon , cloves , corriander , and honey are noted.overall good with a medium body .  the mouthfeel is a little on the thin and watery side though .

the nose is fantastic , being all floral spicy hop . the flavour is terrific too , delivering a spicy , sappy , resiny , sticky malt and hop elixir .  a big fluffy ice cream scoop of a head , eventually smooths out to about a quarter inch . for a lager this is a very good looking beer .  even with the earthy malt flavor , the overall feel stays on the thin side .

wow ... the nose on this is excellent ! tons of roasted malts , coffee beans and dark chocolate . very nice ... the taste is n't quite as profound as the nose , but it holds up well . i am really glad i had the chance to try it ... after all , it has been on my wants list for some time .  a : damn near perfect in my book . nicely hazy , radiant golden orange color . it 's got a big , soapy head that settles into a cap and leaves big sheets of lacing . so far so good .  5/5 m : medium body and smooth . the lighter body makes it sit not-too-heavy , and it would be easy to partake of a few of these on a cold night .

nose was rich with fudgy chocolate , smoke and charcoal .  1-fingered extremely light tan head with very impressive retention , leaves rings of lace all the way down the glass .  m : crisp and a very smooth , medium body , medium carbonation , finish is slightly sticky . tad too thin for my liking , but not too bad .

s - the first thing that hits you is a bourbon alcohol smell , which is quite potent . the aromas are incredibly complex , i 've never smelt anything like it . it is incredibly sweet , it makes your teeth ache just at the thought of it ; maybe this will lessen with cellaring .  pours an opaque thick looking black , with a fat beige head . very attractive .  lightly bodied , perhaps overly so , with a passably dextrinous mouthfeel .

5.0 s : wow ! this is n't the strongest smelling dipa i 've had ( it 's up there ) , but it is the most harmonious mixture of citrus i 've ever experienced . pineapple and mango are the most intense , followed by orange , tangerine , and grapefruit . 3.5 t : the taste is a bit disappointing after the nose . 3.0 m : lighter medium body , but it strangely lays heavy on the tongue . 3.5 d : pretty good , but one of the reason i really like dipas are for the awesome creamy mouthfeels .  a : pours a beautiful bronze with ruby highlights . this beer looks fantastic . s : smell is of juicy citrusy hops , with an abundant dose of pale and caramel malt .  m : hmmm . it may be a tad too aggressive with the carbonation .

the aroma is possibly the best feature of this brew . very sweet and flowery , almost of lemon , chamomile , and honey with very strong hop overtones . a nice light amber color , slightly darker than the 60 minute .  appearance : pours with a massive amount of head , ca n't even pour the bottle in one try . awesome lacing . the beer itself is black as black can be , without even a hint of any other color around the edges . drinkability : this beer is a beautiful thing to behold , with amazing lacing .  m : medium-bodied , creamy , resiny , thin finish .

the smell is aggressive , and with high standard , quite classic . a vanilla character from the oak treatment adds nicely to the vibrant sweet malty caramel butterscotch toffee brown sugar molasses notes . really nice ! ! the flavor is quite nice as it reflects the nose yet has a surprisingly black licorice thing going on , especially in the really enjoyable aftertaste .  pours out almost pitch black but some light shines through around the edges . a nice fluffy , off-white two finger head has nice retention and leaves heavy lace behind . a huge pillow stays on top of the beer .  m- the mouthfeel is a little lighter than expected , almost watered down .

s- huge floral hop aroma escapes from the glass . t- extremely flavorful , very hoppy with a hoppy grapefruit finish . d- exceptionally drinkable .  poured from a 11.6oz brown bottle with a white cap marked `` bottl 2006* 12 % '' into a tulip glass . easily one of the longest lasting , largest frothy heads of foam i have ever seen on any beer . appearance is a rusty yellowish orange color , cloudy and semi-translucent .  solid mouthfeel , nothing noteworthy , but nothing wrong with it .

complex , unique , and very intriguing . lots of vanilla , caramel , and pumpkin with cinnamon , nutmeg , and allspice . big and flavorful , intriguing , and easy to drink in a non-session beer kind of way .  in the original struise glass it looks really great .  m- just average .
s - oh my , one of the most delicious aromas i 've ever experienced . d - fantastic stout .  pours up a beautiful grapefruit color with a very thin white head .  m : smooth on the palate .

the aroma of this beer is amazing ! hops hops and more hops ! very deep and complex . citrus , spice , pine ... but not much of the barley makes it through . wow this is hoppy !  the beer poured a hazy golden color with a massive white head .  mouthfeel is a bit lacking . this is not a full-bodied beer , as i would prefer , but the carbonation level is to my liking for a barley wine drinkability is very good for a big beer .

a harmonious aroma of raisins and rosemary , dominating . dates and caramel , intoxicating sugars . wow , taste is right there too . it 's just alluring .  a - caramel-butterscotch gold with a thick off-white head , very nice looking .  body is very thin for a dipa , medium carbonation .

does n't quite live up to the smell , but still very pleasant and highly sessionable .  brett poured a beautiful slightly hazed golden-orange color producing a massive white head of assorted bubble sizes which was a bit hard to tame .  m : surprisingly on the more carbonated side with a slight fizzy mouthfeel .

whatever , it sounds good . it pours a very deep brown color , just a hint of blood red at the bottom , with a small , short-lived beige head .  chocolate head over a pitch black pit , some sweet lacing ... some mild anise and roasted malts tingle the nose , also a hint of acetone in there .  i first had this beer a year ago and fell in love . so i was excited to see it appear once again this fall . i find it a very easy beer to drink even for the inexperienced beer drinker . flavorful and rich with malts , a slight hint of hops towards the end . the aroma is sweet but not overpowering , you can definitely smell the sweet malt that went into this brew . i highly recommend this beer . unfortunately its not around year round but it definitely will give you something to look forward to come fall .

the smell is the best part of this beer . it ' sweet and refreshing , almost like woodchips or taking a walk in the woods on a brisk fall afternoon . upon first drink , the extreme hops and alcohol content are apparent . the alcohol is not yet well incorporated into the beer and combined with the hops makes this very difficult to drink .  pours with a fluffy , light tan head that sticks over a deep , hazy , amber brown body . great lace .  m : decent mouthfell , it has to have this considering how light it is .

aroma- has a super strong pumpkin aroma with tons of sweetness , spice , and ingredient within ! rivals schlafly 's pumpkin aroma already ! appearance- pours a 1.5 finger head that has terrific retention . mouthfeel- medium-full bodied , medium-high carbonation , smooth , and leaves awesome amount of pumpkin/spice on the palate . overall impression- now this one breaks into my top 5 list !  summit horizon red : a : appearance is exceptional , great amber-red color to it with exceptional clarity ! nice 1 '' head that develops yet depletes half-way through .  quite watery for the big flavor this one tastes and smells different from the main stream craft ipas , which is a pretty new category i 'll give it that .

the smell of tangerine jumps right out at you the moment you free this beer from the bottle . tangerine just fills the room . this is a unique ipa . fruit fresh from the tropics start this beer off . mango maybe ? the flavor actually kind of mutes itself in the middle and the hops kick in during the finish and stay . the hops are very citrus in nature and somewhat floral . i do n't detect the piney nature of a lot of ipa 's .  still a bit of haze but not anything like a hefe . the beer looks great in this glass !  a light- to moderate mouthfeel , hints of sour flavor linger at the back of the tongue after the swallow . i do n't pick up much of a hint of carbonation in the mouthfeel .

s - the nose on this one is as good as it gets . t - just wonderful - almost as perfect as the nose . this outstanding beer 's only downfall . d - great . tons of booze and heat on this one , but the outstanding vanilla and coconut flavors allow me to drink as much of this as is available !  pours a cloudy golden/orange color with a two finger frothy head that has really good retention and leaves lots of sticky lacing .  m : light body , watery touch , smooth with low carbonated in the mouth .

330ml bottle served into an snifter glass.enjoyed on sep11.pours intense orangish copper in color , chill haze appearance.crowned by a creamy light yellowish off-white thick layer froth.brief retention leaving some spotty lacing.yeast & intense caramel malt aromas . buttery bread , toffee hints & slightly fruity -apricot & peach- notes to the nose.spicy , orange zest & subtle coriander flavors.gentle warming alcohol.sweet bitterness in the middle.medium but intense body.soft carbonation.dry bitter finish.smooth fruity aftertaste.a beer for a long & paused drink.a nice warming beer .  it poured black as a tuxedo in a dark closet . it came topped with a dense , dark-brown head that had a lot of staying power .  the mouthfeel is just a touch too syrupy , though it does n't detract much at all from the enjoyment of the beer .

incredibly fresh hop aroma . absolutely unbelievable . must try these galaxy hops for my homebrew soon .  probably the prettiest lacing you will ever see on a glass . effing beautiful .  first sip reveals a much thinner body than i expected and average carbonation .

super sweet aroma with lots of yeast an plenty of sweet , dark fruit . some toffee aroma as well . sweet flavor , though there 's a little sharpness there as well that reminds me , again , a little of port .  appearance : gorgeous beer with strong lacing throughout the entire glass . it looked sooo good , but there is almost no aroma .  m : the honey seems to add a little body to this , but other than that , just average .

the smell is really quite wonderful ; nearly perfect . the roast and sweetness are the perfect marriage of complimentary elements .  two fingers of thick billowing collapse into a thin cap that left sticky lacing on my glass .  this beer pours with a very pale yellow body topped by a medium thick head with some lacing left behind . not much flavor or aroma but more than you get from most light beers . the aroma was sour and bitter and the flavor was malty with a hint of bitter hoppiness .

refreshing , quite complex , and just the right temperate on the citrus .  this keller bier produces vast amounts of bright white head and has a hazy orangish and silver color .  mouthfeel : a bit thin and watery .

s : citra hops up front . smells of pineapple and other tropical fruits . i 'm in love with the aroma . t : slightly sweet malts .  a - black , inch and half of tawny head . leaves amazing lacing that should be in a museum as art .  mouthfeel - smooth , yet a litle effervescent .

it smelled of the mediterranean sea and beautiful , long-legged , not to be fucked with , italian women with sensuous lips . a very sweet , lemony ipa that is excellent for what it is , and enjoyable , for a time .  head retention was excellent , melting down to a slightly less huge frothy , rocky head . lacing was thick and plentiful ... .a beautiful looking beer .  not too much that i can to the other reviews here . this beer was nothing but dissapointing . the label does say ipa right ? where are the hops ? i know that it does n't have to be a hop bomb but the flavor just is n't very good at all . i 've got 5 bottles left from this 6-pack . now i have to decide if i struggle though them or i just pour them out .

perfect . not as great as the nose but still excellent . m : prickly hops , of course , some mild warmth from the alcohol , and some light carbonation .  my bottle looks different than the picture ; guess they changed the label . appearance : clear light amber with a big frothy head of light tan .  my only complaint with this beer is that it is a little thin .

it smells distinctly like pineapple cake . i mean you get the sweet pineapple and a really bready smell underneath . probably my favorite smell in a beer ever , different than the norm for an apa . definitely does n't live up to the smell but i enjoy it . the carbonation level is good and there is n't really a harsh aftertaste . there certainly is n't anything off-putting , and i would recommend it to anyone , at least for the sake of smelling it .  appearance - gold honeyed color in a belgian glass . extremely high effervescence yields 3 fingers of foam instantly . the soft bubbled head recedes unevenly to a thin solid cover .  start is lightly sweet , the top skeletal in feel , the finish lightly carbonated , hops shy in their spiciness , a bit medicinal , dry aftertaste , quite drinkable but a touch different than my normal american over the top beers , and frankly scarlet i dont give a damn , im ready for a change .

i 'll tell you that the smell is freaking awesome . have n't tasted the beer yet , but smells of good things to come ... here we go . s - freaking awesome . especially since i considered this some bland , flavored light beer t - nice .  this is the only barley wine i have every tried , and chances are it will be the last . some people love this stuff , not me , not my taste buds .  it has a medium body and a fair amount of carbonation , but again feels a bit weak .

smell is amazing ! you can pick out both beers , which is the goal of black and tans . prism hits the nail on the head , because in the beer , you can pick out the lemony hops of the pale ale and it goes very well with the licorice aroma of the porter . carbonation is right on , not too much , and at a very natural level . it brings something else to the table , and yet it works for the style .  the color of this beer i find just amazing . it 's so dark as it sits in a guinness glass , with it 's beautiful smooth head . are there bubbles finer than these ? in contrast to how heavy it looks , it 's goes down incredibly smooth and fast .  smoky , malty and mildy coffee-like . deep black with a thumb thick mocha head . fore is hoppy bitter then roasted barley malt follows . very much in the fullers vein as opposed to the more roasty and coffee/chocolate flavored american porters . very nice brew .

the smell was bourbon and caramel . sometimes these things can taste like beer with a shot of liquor - not so with this one . all in all , quite excellent .  this pours out the same deep orange color as the last one with the same solid fluffy head , lacing , etc . as appearance goes , there is nothing left to improve upon .  t - great pilsner , very slight hops , clean finish m - light body d - very smooth and very drinkable .

aroma is a delight . clean , bright and complex , yeasty sweet spicy goodness . taste is equally complex . figs , green grapes , caramel , leather and a brief dry twang .  a- pitch black with a nice tan head s- roasted malt hits the nose right away , some undertones of black coffee and dark chocolate t- the nose gave the preview roasted malts , coffee and dark chocolate , very nice m- balanced , but i do like my stouts a bit thicker d- an easy dinking stout that i could have often .  a bit thin , for i think i like them a bit more bodiful , but smooth and flavorful i do think this one , yes .

this is one of the nicest smelling beers i 've had .  bottle : poured a deep pitch-black stout with a motor oil consistency and a small foamy head with good retention and some lacing .  m - the bitterness and acidic notes can be a bit of a turnoff , and its a bit prickly going down , thus not the smoothest dubbel i 've had . o - a tasty dubbel , but not my favourite .

sweetish and beautiful . t : unfortunately , the alcohol flavor jumps to the front , and while it 's not quite overwhelming , it 's a large part of the flavor , which i do n't find pleasant .  pours a dark brown with nice ruby highlights and a very frothy cappuccino head that lasts and leaves abundant lacing .  my first new pumpkin beer of the year . i love october ( because of pumpkin flavored beers ) . this is definitely not the best pumpkin beer i 've tried , but it 's still a very good beer . if you like shock top 's wheat , you want to try this . i ca n't promise i 'll buy another 6 pack , mostly due to price and wanting to try new things .

however , the smell is unbelievable . this is definitely a dessert beer .  appearance there 's pretty much no flaw to how this beer looks . its a deep , thick black , capped with a super rich , creamy tan head . great retention and solid lacing .  a bit too foamy actually . last swigs : overall enjoyable . that 's cheap !

looks less viscous then i had expected smell is bourbon all the way . probably the most bourbon i have ever smelled in a ba beer . the smell prepares you for a very chewy brew but the mouthfeel isnt so .  330 ml bottle poured into a tulip glass . appearance - the beer pours a hazy golden orange with three fingers of pillowy off-white head .  m : medium-light in body .

n : this is a beautiful , mouthwatering nose . smells very close to liquid pumpkin pie .  this beer pours a hazy honey golden orange with a huge fluffy white head , that leaves some seriously sticky lacing . i could only think to myself that this is an absolutely beautiful beer .  smooth , mellow finish , and a thin watery mouthfeel .

the nose on this one is about a mile deep . i get tons of nutmeg , chai tea , cinnamon , vanilla , ginger snap best describes the aroma . i ca n't stop smelling it . most , if not all the aromatic qualities come through on the palate . very creamy and spicey . overall the drinkability is good . great aroma , great flavor and mouthfeel .  a - this beer pours black in color . this is a beautiful looking beer .  ( m ) smooth , oily , and flat . it 's a solid beer , or a solid base of a beer that could be improved only with a better mouthfeel .

oh , man ... the aroma on this is , perhaps as the name implies , heavenly . almost a perfect balance in the nose -- fruity , pine needles , grapefruit . and this one goes through three `` hoppings , '' kettle , hop back , and dry hopping ... awesome . the flavor is just about perfect . a fine balance of hop flavors , including a nice grapefruit bitterness and a light bready undertone . but , as a whole , this is a very drinkable beer ... and quite delicious .  head holds well making this an incredibly good looking beer .  mouthfeel : a little thin , medium body , low carbonation , medium flavor . underwhelming mouth .

before i can even look more i smell fresh roasted coffee . incredibly nose on this beer .  terrific retention and lots of lace . stunning .  m - this one finished a little dry , too much so for my liking , but the carbonation was nicely balanced , making it very smooth .

taste is a bit of a let down compared to the amazing aroma . a really good ipa .  the beer was poured into a champagne flute . appearance : this may be the singularly best looking beer i have ever seen in a glass . the head was very tall and proud with an off white coloration . the retention was perfect throughout the consumption of the beer . the carbonation was explosive rolling boiling bubbles .  m - pretty watery and thin .

( s ) - a ridiculously rich aroma . awesome whiffs of oaky bourbon with sweet toffee and caramel with an even more glorious smell of cocoa covered dark cherries behind it . its strong , but smells really stinking good .  pours a huge head with crazy retention that wo n't leave the glass .  m : somewhat thick , bread-y . but smooth .

aroma is simply heavenly , with strong molasses overtone and some burnt hints .  dark brown head over a black body . there were tons of good stouts opened at the tasting , but this rose to the top of the heap . lovely stuff  on my first stop on my michigan beer tour . the grand cru on tap was a very nice start to my tour . the first taste was wonderful , but , the flavor of the beer left my mouth looking for just alittle more .

this smelled like freshly ground coffee , chocolate , muffins , brownies , and finished with a roasted woodsy character . wow . i want to dip my whole face in this beer .  a : beautiful two inch creamy head . incredible creamy yellowy orange color with micro rising carbonation .  m -- slightly too watery , does n't really coat the mouth like i would hope but it washes down clean with no bad lingering tastes d -- this is it here , i think this is the beer i would use to introduce someone new to ipa 's .

s : the aroma is forceful - sweet butter nougat , hazelnut and almond liquor , amaretto , fig , sweet nuts , dark cherry , vanilla ... almost an amaretto stench . t : tangy up front , highly carbonic , muted sweetness much as in the nose , delicate but rich nuts , light molasses , vanilla , all warm soft and lightly sweet , nuanced , dynamic , but flavor light . a delicious dubbel , but with such rich aromatics , the flavor in the mouth leaves more to be desired .  it was presented in a room-temperature glass with a thin , bone-white head with moderate retention . the color was spot on - a beautiful , deep-golden yellow with ne-quality clarity .  could use both more body and carbonation .

it had a very beautiful aroma of dried fruit and alcohol . almost wine like to the nose , and was enjoyed by everyone i offered it to .  bottle slightly hazy golden orange and yellow . quickly forming , large , persistent near-white head . lots of lacing left down the glass .  the mouth is a tiny bit like flat soda which was the only off-putting part of this beer .

smell : wow . butter cream , pecan , caramel , custard . butter rum lifesaver , anyone ? awesome . taste : bready and nutty . not as complex as the aroma but still very nice . lingering alcohol finish .  hazy blond in color with a steady stream of bubbles rising from the bottom of the glass to form a huge , thick , rocky white head that lasts for the entire glass .  malts help to round it out a little , but that bitterness hangs around for quite a bit m : medium body with typical sa carbonation , slightly oily d/o : well , apparently zeus is known for that intense piney flavor , so it is highlighted well here .

s - from the first crack of this beer , the smell is great . fruits are in the forefront , with a bit of bitterness . great smell , i do n't think it gets a whole lot better than this . this is still a phenomenal tasting beer , but comparing it to the smell , it lacks a bit . m - mouthfeel is good , slightly syrupy and the bitterness fades at a good rate . overall , this beer is great . i 've had it several times and i have found that if you let it sit for a while , the bitterness dies out a bit , but the fruitiness goes with it .  poured into a standard snifter at about 55 degrees f , 1-inch head , light lacing , deep beautiful cloudy magenta .  the mouthfeel is a bit thin and the carbonation is quite sharp ; a bit fizzier than i 'd like .

stalagtites of drippy lace . fantastic barrel aroma , soaked in bourbon and sun-dried , retaining it 's oaky complexity . mouthfeel is smooth and rich , alcohol really only detracts from the taste slightly .  poured into a chimay goblet and it looks beautiful . nice size head with a nice golden clear look to it .  taste : a bit thin for a porter , almost to the point of being slightly watery .

the aroma is like a fresh hop cone very nice . from what you expect with the aroma is a slight let down but that said it is nice . the taste malty to start the taste turns to a earthy hop flavor .  pours a murky brown/dark copper with brighter highlights when held to the light . a three-finger sticky and frothy tan head crests the top of my tulip glass , but stays together . the head lasts a long time and leaves thick sheets behind .  the mouthfeel is slightly buttery but leans more towars a syrup-like feel . carbonation would be greatly appreciated and add a very unique feel for this beer .

s : wonderful fruity belgian goodness . caramel malty dubbel is a smell warms me up even on a hot evening . allagash has some of the nicest smelling belgians that come to mind .  poured into a snifter , revealing rich black body and one of the thickest and darkest heads i 've ever seen on an ris , one which bubbles down nicely into a turgid foamy mess of a surface .  i wish the mouthfeel had a bit more viscosity ... .but i say that about every stout .

smell : sweet and pungent . horseblanket nose . spicy belgian funk is reminiscent of a gueuze .  pours a beautiful dark orange/copper color with a good head retention and lacing . i love the color of this beer .  t - again , bicuit and nut . nice and malty , virtually no hop bite , but tasty none the less . d - i have had this a ton in the past , but i only just got around to getting another one for the purposes of reviewing .

smell : absolutely delicious . the hops really fused well with the cedar in this case . love it . taste : it is a very sharp flavor .  bottle into a pils glass pours a clear , deep copper orange with a one and a half inch off-white head which holds up well throughout from lots of carbonation release . it also leaves some nice looking sheets of lacing down the sides of the glass . ca n't ask for a better looking beer .  m : somewhat thin body , slightly watery ; could do with more carbonation also .

smell is one of the best ever , strong flowery , grassy smell . slight grainy smell also . you know what is about to happen .  let 's start with first impressions : this big beer makes a big impression on appearance . dark and sinister looking , the rough-textured mocha-colored head sits atop the black body like a russian fur cap . lacing is full and sticky .  smell is cocoa , touch of coffee , licorice , slight vanilla , a whiff of smoke . taste is thick creamy , dark and bakers chocolate , touch of espresso , end is dry and slightly bitter , a woody aftertaste .

for me , this was one of the most appealing scents i 'd smelled in a long time .  jet black ... amazing tan head .  from the perfume river in vietnam ( no really , that 's what the label says ) , on to the beer : poured into a mug , it 's a clear yellow color with a soda-like head . this flavors in the beer do n't meld together well for me . there 's more cooked corn , a mild astingency , and a straightforward bitterness that battle each other for supremecy . even at ice cold , it took some work for me to stomach this beer . round off the edges and we might have something more tolerable .

it has fantastic light floral hop aromas . the alcohol content is n't particularly high and their are some superior apas around .  its pale golden liquid is filled with lively bubbles cascading to the the bright long lasting white head .  m - felt a bit thin to me .

i actually smell this beer about 2 feet away when opening . very citrusy and piney , a small amount of orange juice sweetness is present . a very nice extreme beer , i may be afraid to try fresh .  dark brown pour with a solid tan head .  a - black on the pour with no head whatsoever s - big burnt malt and bittersweet chocolate aroma along with some bourbon , some oak and vanilla in there as well , slight alcohol , as the beer warms up , smells almost like straight bourbon , maybe more like a bourbon and cola t - big bourbon flavor right up front , lots of oak as well , some bittersweet chocolate in the body , finish is more bourbon and oak along with some vanilla , alcohol notes , long finish m - a bit too flat for my taste , full-bodied but totally devoid of any carbonation action in the mouth d - i 'm glad port put this in a 375ml bottle , because this is a sipper , treated this almost like fine bourbon sipping for quite awhile , but i could sip on this all night very interesting beer .

a very easy drinking doppelbock , with terrific aromas , and a surprisingly `` light '' flavor and mouthfeel .  poured into a weizen glass . beautiful colors here - shades of deep amber , gold , and a bone white head that leaves all kinds of lacing . decent amount of carbonation bubbles are present as well .  heavy bodied but also heavily carbonated . less carbonation would have been preferred as experiencing more of the beginning flavors would make for a more enjoyable tasting .

aroma is awesome . yeast .  there is something hypnotic about watching the beer cascade into a jet black liquid with a wonderful tan thick creamy head . to me , the head on this is the best of almost any beer , and has a unique look .  little fruityness . light to medium body , oily , light carbonation . could be a little more carbonated .

the nose on this thing is awesome . complex sweet fruits , sultanas and figs , some ginger , brown sugar , earth and alcohol .  frickin ' a beautiful . deep and black , medium head of nice and tight dark tan bubbles . no effort required to get it and even going vigorously on the pour it seems like there 's not a crazy amount of head . beautiful .  the carbonation is ok ; small fresh bubbles at a decent strength .

very very unique beer , the nose right off the bat informs you of it . rich aroma of the carmel malts used , very heavy scent , but goes along nicely with the character of the porter . really good on a cold day in warm house kind of beer .  it 's one of the prettiest beers i 've ever seen ! deep , dark brown with a hint of ruby when held up to strong light . a tan frothy and foamy lasts and lasts , leaving waves of sticky lace on the side of the glass ( artful ) .  medium thin body manages a bit of creaminess .

aroma : very complex . banana , clove , butter , bubblegum , and hints of alcohol .  a : ca n't really take anything away from this one , perfect tan head on top of a pitch black body .  m : finish stays around for quite a while , almost too long , really coats the mouth .

a great aroma greets the nose , with soft cherry fruits and lots of toffee sweetness . a hint of floral & piny hops lingers in the background -- -very barleywine-line , which i enjoy . the flavor has the typical wee heavy malt profile boosted by a vinous barrel note . overall , a great special release from real ale , and probably one of their best beers i 've had to date .  poured a beautifully clear , clean amber golden color , with a huge 3 finger , frothy , white head . lacing was incredible on this one , totally covered from the top to the bottom of the glass when finished .  the mouthfeel is light bodied with a high level of biting carbonation ( the carbonation is the only part of this beer that i 'm not too fond of ) . quite dry due to the high level of carbonation .

a wonderful sweet , almost fruity smell after opening the bottle .  pours a very clear copper color with a fluffy white head . leaves lots of lacing on the glass as it slowly recedes .  this brew is 5.2 % abv and my bottle looks exactly the same apart from the two silver australian international beer awards one from 2007 & the other from 2008 in the top left of the label anyways it pours a dark cola hue with a fast vanishing two finger head and sporadic lacing , the aroma is fresh chocolate icecream and vanilla expresso , it has an average mouthfeel with tastes of fresh chocolate icecream , vanilla expresso , macadamia and it finishes with a light bitter mouthfeel , overall a nice brew that is just lacking that full mouthfeel of a stout in my mind but in saying that its very sessionable and ill definately buy this again .

syrupy but not in an over the top fashion . s. phenomenal , tons of coffee , vanilla caramel and sweet chocolate , with a sense of dryness . there is a lot of complexity in the nose , i like it . t. sweet bourbon , oak dryness , all smells mentioned above , bitter coffee all the way through al little rough on the mix of flavors but still great . creamy and crunchy . i would categorize this along with bell 's expedition stout as being a bad boy of the style . its not a smooth and user friendly drink .  it basically looks very impressive ... fantastic .  had this during o'briens wet hop festival . pours clear orange with a white ring of bubbles . lots of caramel with some tropical hops in the nose . kind of like a fruitcake . earthy , yet citrusy in the taste . bit sweeter than your normal ipa . grapefruit and blood orange . good stuff .

i loved the spicy taste when i first tried it , reminded me of christmas in the summer , and the smell was very delightful . i would definatly get this beer again if i was out with some buddies , and being that it is a summer beer it was perfect for a summer night in georgia .  poured out a beautiful and dark midnight black color with a cascading and creamy rich head of tan foam .  mouth feel is reasonably rich .

nose is superb -- very much pumpkin pie . delicious and a new pumpkin ale favorite !  poured from a 750ml bottle into a champagne flute : appearance : pours a beautiful strawberry red/ lavander purple color . huge pink head that has great retention .  the body is sufficient to carry the 10 percent alcohol which is impressive by itself . some spicy notes and an effervescent type of feel to it .

s : a great big whiff of piney , citrus , and florally goodness hits the olfactory receptors . i 'm expecting a decent malt backbone here . o : this was only my fourth offering from 3 floyds ( alpha king , apocalypse cow , arctic panzer wolf ) and i 've been impressed with most .  appearance - black with murky auburn brown edges . nice semi tan head with great retention and lacing . super sticky on the sides , just beautiful .  t - tastes like a combination of pine-sol and a basic light lager m - who cares ?

a big , beautiful whack of tropical fruits on the nose - pineapple , passionfruit . superb . the tropical fruits are still there on the palate but perhaps a little more resinous than i was expecting .  a beautiful looking beer with at least a two-finger head that lasts for a while before fading to a nice cap that remains to the end .  first pull provided a mouthfeel that was a little more smooth than i would have expected , just short of creamy .

the first thing that hit me and my friend was the fantastic smell -- heavy with alcohol and woody wine overtones .  pours nicely for a two finger thick tan head , and has a copper colored well filtered body .  carbonation is n't bad , with fairly good activity after each drink . mouth-feel is a bit dry .

the smell is probably the best part of this beer . sweet and herbal with a touch of honey , hazelnut , citrus of some kind . the finish is very dry . pretty cool beer .  lovely looking beer , and very similar in appearance to the classic guinness look , with a large creamy tan head on top of a dark body .  it has a medium-light body and it 's pretty smooth .

beautiful aromas of freshly baked banana bread , vanilla coke , toasted candied coconut . definitely will be cracking some more of these open in the future , alcohol is well hidden and i tend to consider rr a bit too hyped but this is a very nice beer .  first of all this is an amazing looking beer . a nice pale orange , hazy , with a huge rocky white head . great retention and that belgian lace that i love .  m - this is where the beer ranks fairly average for me . under carbonated and a little bit flat , would have liked it to be heavier , stickier , and have more of a bite .

the smell was excellent . i happen to love maple ( though i confess it is n't something i usually have in my beer ) , and the rich malty aroma of nutty maple notes was divine . ah , well this is a toughie for me because i 'm sure that this is the perfect beer for my girlfriends who are n't so crazy about things that resemble hops , barley , malt ... or hmmm.. beer .  black boss porter , poland the bottle is very bold and to the point , solid block cap , impressive . poured into pint glass : this beer is rich black color with a creamy brownish head , the head is small but retains well and long . the nicest red/mahogany color come thought when hit by light .  it has little to no head on it with a soft pour . this beer has a good balance of spices that is not overpowering . the aftertaste is mellow . this is one of the darker ales that i have drank but all in all i would give it another try . especially on a snowy winter day .

the aroma , however , is a-one , outstanding , and really well captured in the wineglass : nice , fresh pumpkin accompanied by strong notes of cinnamon , nutmeg , clove , maybe some ginger ... wow , this is the smell i look for in my pumpkin ales - imo they nailed it . that said , i feel the flavor takes a step back ; maybe the nose raised expectations too high ... still very nice , with the pumpkin and spices pulling through , but perhaps not as robustly as the nose had led me to believe ; there 's also a not entirely pleasant though subtle bitterness to it , as well as a bit a boozy bite to the finish .  this ipa is perfect specimen as far as appearance . it is a cloudy gold in color with a nice foamy long lasting head that sticks perfectly to the glass .  m - a little water , but it goes down smoothly d - this is a really good beer .

quite delicious , but not quite as good as the nose led me to believe . m. thin with a good level of carbonation d. i was a bit disappointed with the taste after the incredible smell , but the mouthfeel is really what let me down here .  appearance : hazy golden orange . effervescent body with a thick pillowy , white head that just wo n't quite .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied with low yet sharp carbonation .

awesome smell , couldnt wait to drink it !  on initial pour this is one of the finest looking brews i 've ever laid eyes on .  m good medium body , with a lot of carbonation , either takes away from this beer .
a fantastic aroma if you ask me ! great stuff !  a : excellent dark red color . very bright and enticing .  mouthfeel : it 's a bit heavy for the style .

nice . d - i 'm coming to the conclusion that i 'm not a huge fan of hoppy beers . but this is nice . while i ca n't say i 'd like this all the time , i 'd definitely like to revisit it .  this was poured from the bottle into a consendonk tulip glass . a - clear light golden straw color with a thick foamy , ice cream-like head that is very well retained s - sweet malt and fruity yeast aroma with a slight hop spiciness t - like aroma , sweet malt up front with fruit-like notes and a very slight amount of hops on the finish m - medium body with high carbonation d - this is a decent , well-made beer .  muted roastiness and chocolate malt notes . deep black body with a decently firm and lasting thumb thick head . roasted coffee beans int he fore followed by toasted and burnt bread and some mild chocolate notes int he finish . finish is dry and coffee tinged great classic porter .

s - smelled like delicious spiced pumpkin pie with clove and spiced apple undertones . this is an excellent beer .  pours a beautiful golden color with thick , frothy guinness-like white head .  always looking for a great session beer and this one fits the bill for me . great bitter citrus aromas with just enough malt balance on the taste to keep the acidity in check . great piney hop character with a nice citrusy finish . my only complaint on this one is the price , for $ 11.99 a six i would prefer stone keep the etched bottles and give me a 4 % abv beer at a more reasonable price .
t- very very nice . lots of chocolate & lots of coffee .  pours a oil dark black with a big brown head .  mouthfeel - rather bubbly , fairly thin .

excellent . sweet and sour fruits cominate the taste , but caramel malts creep slowly in , along with alcohol , honey , and even some wood . the feel ends up pleasantly sweet and smooth .  pours a three fingered cream head that slowly fades to a thin layer , leaving a good lace .  thanks to ncvbc for this great extra best by 12/31/08 bottle poured into my sniffer produced a good fingers worth of tan head that turns into a ring of lace around the glass on top of a jet black body aromas of toasted malts , coffee and chocolate with a slight funk ( i 'm glad i am not the only one to pick it up i though my nose was going ) earthiness , sweat malts , light chocolate , molasses good balance of flavors the only real complaint is it is a little thin for a stout good drinkability i could drink a few of these a night easy .

s- very wonderful aroma here . very nice hop smells come from this .  this brew pours out a deep , hazy red amber color crested with a massive head that retains very well and leaves huge , sticky lacing .  mouthfeel- medium body with very little carbonation .

this is a light caramel colored beer . the smell of this bear makes me eager to drink it . it 's a combination of peach , apricot , and orange . this is a nice light ( in color and mouthfeel ) beer that will be great going into spring .  very nice 3 finger head that was creamy with a great deal of structure . deep orange/amber in color and quite translucent . great lacing and a touch of visible carbonation . this short description is not an indication that it was n't great .  light feel with lots of carbonation .

the smell is sweet and malty . sugar cookie , icing , cotton candy , candy corn , it is predominantly sugar , but it is many different shades of sweet . it is a smell you seldom come across in beer , and it is great . the flavor is big and bold .  plenty of head that lingers all the way down the glass .  spicy and yeasty on the finish , this beer is medium-light on the palate with a high level of carbonation , much higher than i care for , really foaming up in my mouth .

an impressive nose . t : mouth puckering bitterness is the first thing i noticed . d , notes : this is very good . the type of beer that bas help move to the best of list .  appearance : as poured the beer is a nice lightly hazed golden apricot color with a 1 fluffy off white head that leaves rings , legs and small patches of lacing as it recedes .  the mouthfeel is medium but i think the beer would be better if it was properly carbonated .

the initial nose is wonderful . first comes the hops . i actually can smell parts of all 3 bastards in here , awesome . the taste is slightly disappointing relative to the nose .  a gorgeous midnight pitch-black , with luscious creamy , light-tan head , almost a finger thick . impressive sticky lacing .  a chore to swallow . lingers on the palate like a bad cigarette . overall : not something i 'll ever subject myself to again . there are way better means of getting trashed than this , and though it 's cheap , it 's not at all worth the gagging and self loathing .

it has a very sweet aroma to it and that makes it all the more appealing . smell is more prevalent the more it warms up .  a : beautiful , clear , dark ruby body under a majestic two-finger head of creamy , sticky tan foam . tons of lace . truly spectacular . s : a little underpowered - light acetic sting , some sweet fruit , and a bit of husky malt .  it looks like a pale ale should , there 's some yeast on the bottom of the bottle and the head stays for a bit . i 'd rather have a bit more malt presence , it 's just too hoppy and bitter for me . drinkability , if i had to choose between this and a macro , i 'd take this . edit on 10-3-04 i 've raised my review score , since i 've either started loving the hop , my tastes have changed or the fact that this is one of the few decent beers you can get around here on a night out and i 've become more accoustomed to it .

smell- that of very fresh raspberries . not the fake sugared and candied scent , but a kind of smell you may catch at jamba juice when you order a smoothie . taste- a tad sour and tart at first , which turns to a nice sweet flavor . not as fresh as the scent was . tasted a bit like jolly ranchers .  it poured cleanly into a glass with a large-bubbled head which stayed steady , and a very yeasty smell opened up in the room . the color , particularly , is astonishing ; a yellow-amber cloudiness that draws the eye , with the contrasting white head giving it some depth . the wildness of the yeasts gave this particular bottle a vinegary quality , though traces of an apricot flavor could be found underneath .  i can see why the word peat was used before in a review the mouthfeel was medium to light i will agree it needs some more body to it this is a good brew and with a little tweaking it could become world class .

huge tropical fruit aromas on this one -- passion fruit , mango , pineapple and bubble gum . creamy , with a good warming alcohol finish .  a - huge head , really fluffy . beautiful amber color with appealing haziness .  come and drink this corn syrup !

appearance : beautiful murky caramel color with a hint of dried apricot . smell : amazing sweet english butter toffee with candied strawberries . very very rich and delicious . mouthfull : thick and smooth exceptional beer by another great quebec brewery .  pours an intense orange/cherry with a full finger of fluffy off-white head .  mouthfeel - a little gritty , though a light body to it .

s : grapefruit and evergreen needles . you can smell the aroma of bold hops from yards away . t : simcoe , welcome aboard .  this bock pours perfectly with a tight forming bright white head that stays around for a good duration .  decent head , minimal lacing , crisp smell with just a hint of hops . the hops are more noticeable in the taste . really nice american lager . makes bud look like the crap it is . my only macro beer ( maybe amber bock , too )

wonderful aroma . warm and oaky , molasses . almost get a bbq sauce scent , very spicey like a worcester sauce . very interesting tastes in this one , unusual .  a : attractive drink on the pour , looks like a lighter , creamier guinness pint from a good tap . huge head and flowing bubbles .  i think i 'm a bit parial to this beer for 2 reasons . it 's not by any means a `` specialty '' beer , it 's your typical lager and since it 's been around since before any of us were born it 's got a nostalgic feel . excellent beer in my books , average for most .

s : i thought i died and went to heaven the first time i smelled this beer . caramel and toffee aromas dominate with some hints of berries .  a : jet black with some garnet around the edges when held to ( candle ) light ; about the most enjoyable thing about guinness is watching the bubbles work their way up the glass , creating a nice and tight , light almond head , leaving nothing but an opaque blackness below ... s : hmmm , not much here ... maybe some roasted malts , but faint .  i think if the mouthfeel was better it would have made a world of difference imo .

smell : smells absolutely wonderful . bitter hops with a hint of sweetness .  pours a two finger , cream head that slowly fades to a thin layer leaving a good lace . clear deep amber color .  mouthfeel : hoppy and rough , but a bit fuzzy .

smells like halloween ! very welcoming . it sure is an imperial . very crisp , sexy beer . spices are rounded , clove , cinnamon , vanilla bean , and most importantly , fresh pumpkin .  pours into a pint glass a translucent straw yellow with a billowing white head and and amazing lacing that last throughout the drink .  high carbonation detracts slightly .

i absolutely love the smell on this beer , but i also love peaty islay scotches . the smell reminds me of a campfire on a beach , with the peaty campfire smoke , wet wood , and leather aromas . the complex aromas are a little subdued on the palate . tons of different flavors in this beer , but none really stand out in front .  looks very impressive ... just like i expect beer to .  mouthfeel : it feels like an astringent hop bitterness , but i sure as heck ca n't taste any hops .

hazy yellow body with short white head beautiful voluptous peach aroma . very juicy . simple and juicy , no bitterness or sourness .  towards the end of the night it settles down to a thin concentric ring but a nice swirl brings you back to viewing what i consider one of the most beautiful looking barleywines i 've ever seen .  m - medium/light body with little carbonation good with spicy food .

it smells delicious . appearance : deep amber in color with a thick light cream colored head .  poured into my duvel tulip glass , poured a rich thick borwn that cant be seen through , a rich creamy five finger head rises to the top and stays awhile , the smell is rich grain and alchoal with a sweet fig overtone , the flavor is figs , hazelnuts , molasses , honney , sweet malt , a hint of folaral hops then malt for days .  the motuhfeel is moderately carbonated and slightly watery .

smell is phenomenal , sweeter , spicy , floral hops , fruity esters , just very appealing to me , lots of aroma without overpowering . perhaps if the aroma was so appealing to me , the taste would seem better , as there 's really nothing wrong with it , pretty standard witte . drinkability is pretty good , if only for the aroma .  a - translucent , super vibrant golden straw color that could illuminate a room . finger eggshell ( always wanted to work that color into a review ! ) head with a nice bubbly ring and a thin white film of bubbles remains on the surface .  the hops however tastes amazing but it needs more malt m - very light mouthfeel d - probably the most drinkable 7.2 % beer ive ever had

s- totally amazing smell . just like pumkin pie .  poured a hazy straw colored hue with a fluffy three finger head . the retention was beyond excellent as was the very stick lacing . by the time i got to the bottom of my hefe glass , there was still nearly a finger of fluffy head remaining .  medium bodied with medium carbonation . i only wish this average mouthfeel was supporting an average taste .

this beer smells so good ! sweet with almost a balsamic vinegar quality . great . tart , sour gets me in the back of the mouth .  pours dark amber with a large honeycomb coloured head and lots of lacing .  for the mouthfeel , i found this stout almost watery in consistency .

smell : super strong pine , grapefruit , and bitterness warns the tastebuds through the nose what is to come . taste : hearty caramel sweetness with a very strong and biting bitterenss .  dissipates slowly and exhibits great retention with beautiful lacing .  slight astringent twinge . d- very good `` sessionable '' strong ale .

one of the best smelling beers i have tried .  some of shakespeare 's stuff is pretty dark , but shakespeare stout a nihilistic black , with a big head the color of creamy coffee . the little black bubbles peppering the head make it look alluringly like a chocolate chip cookie .  it was also a little to carbonated for me in the mouth feel category .

it 's an awesome smelling stout !  maredsous 8 on tap in a tulip glass . black cherry color with a nice creamy head . excellent lacing , thick on the glass .  mouthfeel - very enjoyable borderline complex character .

this smelled like the kitchen while my mom bakes banana bread .  a big frothy white head that sticks around forever , and then leaves some pretty sticky lace on the glass . a very pretty beer , love head .  crisp taste - not heavy as expected ... hints of smokey , woody flavors - has the appeal of a coffee porter ... mouthfeel is average .

great smell . on the buds , the mint is first and foremost .  sediment floats about in a strange vapor-like form . just the head by itself is more complex than most beers , sits on top the whole time , slowly getting all awesome and chunky looking and leaving good lacing .  smooth , nice , a little thin maybe . not a ton of carbonation at the end which leaves it a little watery .

under all of this , i can still smell some gumball and barnyard odors . an amazing smell and likely a very unique one . t - more grapefruit pith and that same pine , but i still ca n't figure it out .  pours beautiful dark brown with red edges , almost black with a huge tan head that sticks around and leaves walls of creamy lace .  way too thin in the mouthfeel category , however .

pours with a fat thumb head , with decent stout lacing ... smell is amazing , lots of sweet bourbon and chocolate plum ... lots of bourbon upfront but it really is remarkable how enjoyable it is , despite the fact that its like sipping straight bourbon ... this beer would age soooo beautifully ! a wonderful beer that i was honored to have tried at a really fun event , but that open bar kicked my butt in the end ! !  it has a gold cloudy body with a beautiful head and just the right amount of carbonation from an aesthetic point of view . it is a simply picture perfect beer .  taste is dominating by anis with some candi sugar . body was above average and alcohol was well hidden .

one of the nicest smelling dipas ( imperial pale ? ) i 've experienced t : initially starts out with lots of bitterness from the hops .  beautiful nitro thick creamy tan head over a black body . has a lovely way of settling to a creamy solid chunk that wo n't spill out of the glass if you tilt it .  m : a touch thin .

s. tons of beautiful hop aroma - a spring day in a can .  this beer pours a semi-cloudy pale orange color . the head is an impressive two and a half inches in height , and recedes very slowly into thick , chunky lacing .  ) my only qualm was the the body seemed a little thin .

viscous notes , along with minimal head retention & lacing s : orchard fruit , grainyness , & pineapple t : peaches , pineapple , honey , boozey grain & a kiss of estery yeast & mushroom like funk .  hazy/cloudy straw yellow coloe . great lacing .  a medium to full body . possibly a little too thick ( syrupy was mentioned earlier by easyr which sums it up well ) as it took me a while to make headway down the glass ( unusual for me ) .

beer also appeared to be quite carbonated smell : hot-day-amn . the smell of this one is trump tight . the eastern spices are like aroma therapy . those clove-ish spices blend with the hops and a sweet fruit scent to create an enticing aroma . taste : from the second this one hits your lips you just know that this is an `` americanized '' tripel .  very bright , very glowing red body . cream-colored head is boisterous and rocky .  the feel is smooth , suprisingly light for a beer that seems so heavy . while i feel that this is one of north coast 's better efforts ... though none are really bad , i do wish that it had a bit more body .

amazing . taste almost supports the smell but not to the degree i 'd hoped . if this veered away from the spicy sweetness it offers in the mouth toward the cherry vagueness of the smell i could see this being an absolutely impeccable ale .  the beer looks great ! s : i get some notes of honey , grass , caramel , and light seasonal summer fruit .  thin , oily body ... definitely needs some more heft .

the yeast notes are exquisite . not very earthy , mostly ripe fruit with a bit of funky complexity .  tall , nearly white head with good retention and great lacing .  smooth , medium body with a palate almost entirely made up of bitter , herbal hops ; perhaps trace notes of biscuity malt can be detected , but they are virtually non-existent . finish is long , dry , and bitter , and leaves you wanting more , which leads to a great level of drinkability , especially for a hophead .

a : orange copper color , almost no head s : floral hops , not much else but thats ok with me . i love the way this beer smells ! t : tastes like it smells .  11.2 oz bottle poured into duvel tulip a : perfect . billowing tan head barely contained in this glass . settles to leave full layer of fine tan lacing . as you sip the soft foam coats the side of the glass in sheets not patches .  the only real flaw for me with this beer is that it 's a bit thin , but that 's a bit nit-picky and did n't detract at all for me from this wonderful beer .

my favorite part of the beer was the aroma . it had this very intense chocolaty smell that while sipping was very pleasing to the senses .  poured this puppy into a duvel tulip , which helped to bring about an ample 4 finger thick fluffy and off white head . the body is very murky and peach in color . head retention is great , as well as the lacing .  color and mouthfeel are average for the style and fine .

aroma : an amazing , complex aroma which far exceeds any other pils aroma i have smelled . lemony , peppery , summery , yeasty and malty all zipping around my nose . taste : does n't live up to the aroma but is n't bad .  pours to a very dark brown , only slightly ruby colored liquid with a massive fluffy white head that coats the entire circumference of the glass in a perfect frilly victoria 's secret crotchless panty-style lacing . she really is quite sexy looking .  so we have another german pilsner . i 'm still amazed that there are so many of these . i 'm still unable to get passed the grassy flavor of these . i just which they 'd add something else to mute that flavor down a bit . then again that would change the style and it would n't be a pils anymore . anyhow this brew is clear yellow with an earthy natural aroma and taste . the style just is n't for me .

heavy caramels , bourbon , dark fruits , a fruity sweetness and a touch of tobacco.. this is really a fantastic smelling barleywine . i 'd dare to say it is one of the best smelling barleywines that i 've had to date . kudos to a great bouquet . plenty of caramel malt to provide a creamy mouthfeel , king henry takes off with sweetness but not cloyingly so .  has my favorite froth for this style , thick and sticky , goes nowhere fast and the color looks bread .  now i understand the meaning of the word `` swill '' . i have an enormous amount of respect for european beers . avoid . trust me .

smell is flowery , and very aromatic .  like nocturnum , my favorite of the delirium family , this beer has nice white fluffy head . the beer pours orange/gold , and the head lasted through the entire glass .  m - average mouthfeel . carbonation on par , but a very thin feeling brew .

on tap at the austin ginger man . the aroma had a sweet wheat flavor along with banana , lemony citrus and a moderate clove spiciness . very flavorful and well rounded hefewiezen aroma . i get lots of clove flavor throughout the beer .  pours a jet black wth a huuge , really tight brown head that retains really well , beautiful !  a tad thin .

nose is roasty coffee , caramel , roast chocolate , herbal hop , and fruity , spicy and nutty yeast products . crazy . the first thing that hits me is fruit bouquet , then herbal hop ushers in phenols . good if you do n't think of it as stout .  the beer poured into the glass a brilliant clear gold with a thick , dense white head , te head retained well , and when it did recede it left a chunky lace on the side of the glass . a stream of champagne bubbles rise from the bottom , a testament to the carbonation of the bottle conditioned beer .  decent palate , a little thin like the others in the series , but fairly smooth .

the smell came off fruity , flowery , and hoppy . great aromas ! !  pours a motor oil black with some brown edges and two fingers of mocha tan head . threads of lacing line the tulip . however , for some reason the beer is extremely green - perhaps it 's the victim of oxidization ?  mouthfeel i kind of like the mouthfeel to this one . the carbonation isnt bad , and it goes down smoother than most .

330ml bottle bought from the vineyard , belfast ... poured a deep coppery brown / amber colour ... slightly off white head poured quite foamy and faded to light ring ... no real lacing ... aroma - toffee / caramel maltiness with very light toasted notes , brown sugar sweetness , nice rich creamy fruitiness ( figs and dates ) , biscuity notes , fruit cake , slight leathery notes , some spiciness , some rum perhaps , light hops ... taste rich toffee maltiness , spicy fruits ( dates and figs ) , nice warming alcohol notes , bready , treacle , light hops cutting through the sweetness , some light nuttiness ... feel - quite smooth , oily notes ... medium body .  this one pours a hazy yellowish orange with a white head that just will not go away . looks great overall .  feel is also a bit thin and fizzy .

it is overpoweringly fruity and has an amazing aroma . it pours a cloudy light rose pink with a huge head.you are overwhelmed by the raspberry nose .  appearance is beautiful . pours an oaky golden light brown . leaving a dense one finger head on top of the beer .  m : lightly carbed , thin , slightly oily , tannic finish .

the aroma is honeysuckle and dark fruit , complex , tropic , and soothing . mouthfeel is brighter than i would have expected , but leaves a slightly gritty film on the teeth . the taste is not nearly as complex or abundant as the smell and alcohol does not feature much part in it .  a - pretty , near black pour with quite a sold 1+ inch head that stays around for awhile .  m - medium body , not a lot of carbonation .

remains hazy as it warns , unlike the 2010 . among the best sour aromas i 've had the pleasure of experiencing . t : fruits , oak , and brett share the spotlight . great blend of the three flavors . m : body is thin and weak , yet nicely oily . d : sessionable , even at $ 40/bottle .  a -- this one pours with as much head as you want , and probably more . i must have had a little too much force behind mine because there was a fluffy white head up 3/4 of the glass . golden yellow with carbonation bubbles racing quickly to the top . tons of lacing .  mouthfeel was a bit thick , and it was not quite as carbonated as i would have liked .

exceptional aroma . very hoppy , and you get it at the first sip , then the sweetness , finishes bitter , with all the hops of an ipa but more subdued .  the way the carbonation and creamy foam mixes with the super dark body of the beer is gorgeous . through the glass , it looked like the bubbles were cascading like a waterfall , only upwards . anyway , the body is opaque and the head is super creamy and tan in apprearance . the head stuck around for a long time and left decent lacing .  hmmm . drank this because a chick bought a pitcher and the service was terrable . it 's like club soda with a twist of beer . not much color , not much flavor . not bite of hop . not really much to say about this stuff . it 's pretty popular with girls ...

the aroma was simply outstanding . i have tried a number of the best coffee beers but none even came close to the nose on this one . pure and simple . every time i smelled this , i imagined myself walking into a coffee shop . the flavor profile was not quite as coffee heavy as the nose , but it was indeed more complex . malty rich up front .  a : gentle pour creates a 3 finger powdery white head with incredible retention . a beautiful beer to behold .  m : the body is light but sugary and grainy with a moderate carbonation .

a delicious aroma of coffee , and bready malts , and a flavor which delivers with a nice hop bitterness at the finish .  it has a great thick fluffy dark mocha colored head perched upon a jet black body . the head was still present a good 5 minutes after pouring .  mouthfeel is a bit thin and resinous , this is really the only fault i can find .

stoudt 's double ipa 12 oz bottle medium pour in a mug recent brewing , ingested 12/06 poured a hazy orange amber with a rocky off white fully lasting head with excellent lacing that left layered ring of lacing upon every sip , like reading the rings of on a tree and tracing it 's age . smelt of strong sweet grapefruit and orange , tropical pineapple banana bubble gum or starbust mystery flavor , parsnip , with light barnyard and earthy yeasty flavors . overall , a great dipa that balances a malt sweetness backbone and strong hops nicely .  a - murky apple juice with and incredible pillow head ... slow to leave , chunky lace left .  mouthfeel : bubbly and light body . the mouthfeel is a little peculiar and affects my experience .

majestic sniffs . taste is equally multifacited . one of the maltier versions i 've encountered , laid out in a doughy , bready fashion . this is a very fine hefeweizen  a : pours a hazy golden with a thick bubbly white head that slowly faded into a thick film that lasted the whole beer through and left an incredible fuzzy sheet of solid lacing down the glass . beautiful .  the only fault is that its a little thin bodied but that 's what makes this brew dangerous .

2010 bottle had a ton of suspended sediment in a burnt orange body . wow , aroma is the big winner here . pumpkin pie with crust as it warms ; some clove came thru as well , and even somewhat herbal . pretty authentic pumpkin flavor - vegetable/squash quality , and good amount of spices , incl cinnamon , nutmeg , and clove - but not overpowering . decent volume of malty sweetness / richness ... touch of campfire as it warms . outstanding drinkability - this is the most aromatic and flavorful pumpkin ale you can buy at this level of abv .  12 oz bottle poured into a snifter - best before oct. 19th 2007 appearance : harsh pouring reveals a generous 2 '' head that lasts quite a long time . the head is tan with tiny bubbles that leaves a bit of lace behind .  the mouthfeel is a bit astringent .

the aroma is of peat , caramel , nuts , and chocolate . i really like the uniqueness of this aroma . the taste has more caramel than the aroma . overall , this is a really , really good scotch ale .  a - only a sliver of red around the edge . tall very tight light brown head leaving considerable lacing .  a : pours a dark brown with a two finger head ; burnt orange around the edges of the glass when held to light ; lacing is excellent s : smells of caramel and coffee ; very earthy aroma t : tastes like a bitter coffee initially , but the sweetness of caramel and honey slowly creeps in m : i think its a bit too watery and the carbonation does not seem right d : two in a sitting is nice ; i 'm generally not a porter fan , but i enjoyed this beer

really really strong nose - very sweet with notes of baking spices , vanilla , vanilla cake batter , pumpkin . there is also something about it that i 'm not sure i 've ever smelled before ... and i love it . t : lives up to the smell .  what a shame ... pours a pretty golden-amber color topped by a huge , thick , creamy white head .  mouthfeel is on the thin side for a stout .

it smells wonderfully of coffee bean and dark chocolate . the taste is just a little bit dry at the finish for me , but very rich and complex roasted flavors going on here .  honestly one of the most impressive looking ipa 's i 've encountered .  mouthfeel : medium bodied .

deliciously hoppy nose - massive sweet fruit backed with gritty , resinous hops . extremely fragrant , and powerful . palate is less robust , with a subtle , but pleasant hop character riding over the top of a smooth , buttery sweetness . this leaves it extremely drinkable - very smooth and refreshing . an excellent and tasty little ipa .  pours with a deep red-brown body topped by a medium thick lasting head with good lace .  the mouthfeel was about what i expected going in , but i thought it might a little over-carbonated . the aggressiveness of the carbonation was a little distracting .

really delicious smell t : very tannic finish ... almost too much . not as sour as the smell suggests , but very nice . lots of flavor going on !  looks perfect . mounds of off white maybe pretty much light tan head , and has a clear dark copper colored body .  the body is medium with decent carbonation .

aroma exhibited a very nice floral hop bouquet . light and sweet with a hint of spiciness . this beer smells excellent and is not overpowered by the hops .  i rarely describe a beer 's color as `` black '' , since most are actually a deep brown , but this poured like motor oil ! i got just over a finger of deep-tan head with decent retention off of my pour .  m- low carbonation and very low mouthfeel .

smell- mmmmm , nice floral and citrus scents hit you right away . not too harsh , but about what you should expect out of an ipa . very tasty . mouthfeel- nice carbonation level .  the chocolate yeti has perfect color in both the body of the beer and the frothy dark brown head .  the mouthfeel is a bit overcarbonated for the stle but not bad .

s - easily the beer 's most remarkable feature . wonderful aroma of blackberries and blueberries with a slightly sourish tint . t - although it does n't quite live up to the aroma in terms of complexity , this is still quite good . early palate some sour dark fruits are balanced out by a moderate caramel flavor .  snow-white head was thick and pillowy , and lingered through the entire drink , and reduced to excellent lacing up and down the glass .  m. a bit acidic d. overall a nice iipa .

s : pumpkin pie baby ! very nice . t : pumpkin spice , clove , nutmeg and caramel from the malts .  impressive looking beer .  pretty thin mouthfeel i guess , but overall its a great balance of flavor and drinkability , something i would definitely buy again .

aroma is whoa grapefruit ! nice brew , maybe a bit over the top , but for an anniversary brew , you do what you have to .  pours a slightly hazy , deep copper with a 3-finger thick , frothy light yellow head . lots of lacing .  carbonated but not overly so . on the lighter side of medium bodied , i 'd say .
