the pure white fluffy head looked like snow had fallen on a green-apple tree ! the smell of grannysmith apple and candied sugar . the taste was the same as the nose except at the finish , some good tart apple rhine gives a good semi-dry finish .  poured a dark mahogany with a big light brown head that left some lacing .  this is a man 's beer . none of this flowery wine swilling critique lingo . light color , smell and mouth feel , who really cares . outstanding dry & hoppy flavor without sweetness . when bought in the 30 pack , cost is about 50 cents each . the best macro being produced !

a floral citrus smell hits you hard with a smell of some sweetness to it that seems to be hiding in this hoppy beer . mouthfeel- a good amount of carbonation to it between medium to heavy in its feel , about average in my opionion drinkability-is n't the best but with conditioning you can become very use to it and then it becomes very appealing . just brilliant .  two fingers of thick , creamy baige head with great retention and tons of lacing .  this feels thin for some reason . carbonation is good and proper .

right when i opened it the first wiff was a great strong smell of piney hops . outstanding smell . the freshness was still there .  16.9oz bottle - 2006 vintage - served at 45 degrees into a large snifter appearance : charcoal black and completely opaque . vigorous pour yieds a 3 inch head that is thick and creamy . caramel colored head with great retention .  mouthfeel too prickly and astringent but medium body is appropriate for style .

s : a very rich banana/clove mix , just about perfect . no hops , no nothing .  great divide brewing rumble oak aged ipa : as you pour this beer in a glass you will notice a burnished copper color , a luxurious off-white head that laces and lasts to the end , and a subtle but complex aroma .  the only knock here is that it was a little thin . m = is it possible to be creamy and watery at the same time ?

huge amounts of fruitiness , candy , and grapefruit on the nose . sweet , light , and apricots also show up a bit . reminds me of some type of orange/apricot candy i 've had before but can not put my finger on it . very light , very fruity , yet tart but it is quite a curious taste . very easy to drink and although i do n't see myself buying a lot of lindeman 's myself i will highly recommend this to anyone trying a geuze !  pours a dark black color with no light being able to penetrate in the glass , large tan head that fades slowly to leave some patchy lacing on the glass .  feel seems to be about medium in body , but slightly watery , with a lingering semi-bitter dark unsweetened chocolate/coffee bean aftertaste .

excellent aroma . lots of fruits both sweet and citrus , doughy yeast , something unknown but floral and distant anise perhaps .  a freind brought this brew over ... a : perfect look for a belgian ale . deep dark ruby color like an iced tea .  mouthfeel is on the light end .

smell is so awesome . the belgian yeast esters mixed with the hoppyness of the ipa is out of this world . probably one of the nicest beers i have smelled . it smells better than it tastes . it 's a very good beer but i like the smell of it alot better .  out of a bomber this beer was a true , opaque black color . the retention was very good ; it soon became a fluffy cap that also left very good , consistent lacing .  tart and dry feel , but not overly so . lower carbonation detracts a little , really the only flaw in my mind .

s : the bouquet is quite vibrant , with grapefruit and pineapple jumping out of the glass .  4 finger frothy white head with great retention and lacing .  mouthfeel : this was my one issue with this beer . it loses carbonation quickly , and with not that much to start with , it is kind of a bummer . a little sticky as well but the taste makes up for a bit of this .

the aroma is great . lots of citrus and pine notes . overall a very good and strong ipa ( 9 % ) .  a very appealing looking brew .  mouthfeel : this is the one downside of this beer ; it 's just a bit thin .

nose : this thing has everything : an early combination of chocolate , caramel , and nuts presents a whole pecan pie on a silver platter . all this is followed by some dark chocolate covered cherries and fruitcake aroma . it has a sweet plastic lasting flavor that warns off any hops . has a bit of a smoky swallow which is nice , but does n't mellow the bubble gum . this one is getting thrown behind bars for 3-5 - then we 'll see if it 's more under control .  poured a nice orange/golden color with a very large bubbly head which remained for a long time and left average lacing . an excellent looking beer .  i thought the mouthfeel was a touch watery but the whole packaged seem very much an alluring strong-lawnmower , early evening session beer .

s : a very sweet and complex nose here . lots of caramel , toffee , dates , figs , raisins , and wood . t : not quite as impressive as the nose , but still damn good . lots of caramel , bourbon , oak , and apple .  a- clear dark reddish copper hue with a billowy tan head that last forever and leaves tons of sticky lacing on the glass . edit : holy shit , this beer is so hoppy it turns your tongue yellow !  tingly in the nose which is common with sour ales but this is n't sour at all t. sweet with dried fruit , malty m. has a biting quality , a bit to carbonated .

s - big aroma of cherry juice , some apple juice , molasses , malts , just a great smell . t - a nice balance of molasses , licorice , malts , some cherry .  makes a nice , thick head with staying power . deep , dark brown color with a lighter ( and nicely creamy ) brown head .  an e-mail from the brewery indicated that twins lager is not the same beer as hauenstein , just with a different label . schells tells me that the twins lager uses a different recipe and yeast than the hauenstein , but a side by side comparison leaves me wondering why they would go through the trouble . i have always liked `` cheap '' beers . the beer drinkers of olden days wanted it cold , crisp , and cheap . but for afternoon lazing back and swigging , there is certainly nothing wrong with a cold bottle of twins lager . twins lager might be `` twice as refreshing '' as the label purports , but , boy would it be a treat to drink an original recipe fitgers again !

smooth melted creamy chocolate with tart raspberry , kissed with dark fruits ; plums , prunes and blackberries .  beautiful pour . bits of sediment floating around . nice creamy tan head that remained throughout with gorgeous lacing .  boosting the carbonation would help .

lightly spicy with some typical weizen-like notes of clove and yeast . this is quite a fruity smelling brew with alcohol esters being fairly pronounced . for a beer that smells quite deep and intense with character , the flavor falls a bit short and is not nearly as complex . as the brew warms up , some chocolate grain notes become evident .  appearance - perfect ! black with brown 2 finger head tiny bubbles smell - very pleasant as one would expect..malty , chocolatey , caramel and a very slight smokeness taste - very balanced as usual from a uk brewer .  light-medium carbonation and medium bodied . flavor is sour apple cider without the expected hops from a bitter , one has to question if this bottle has gone bad but after reading other reviews apparently it has n't , even though it has n't been brewed since 2006 .

smell : loads of coriander , yeasty nuttiness and clove phenols , with a heavy dose of of bubblegum , yummy ! mouthfeel : very carbonated and full body notes : excellent . different and similar to the original at the same time .  this beer black and entirely opaque with a thick and persistant off-white head with flecks of tan in it - very nice looking beer .  m - sort of dry but hops represented well in this brew .

absolutely fantastic aroma , but let down by it 's flavours .  color is an absolutely gorgeous golden amber that promises an excellent brew .  there is little ( hardly any ) carbonation here , and the mouthfeel really does n't pack a punch at all .

the smell of this 2 year old beer is so rich and strong . it smells of sweet fruits and a little bit of alcohol .  pours a three finger cream head that fades slowly to a thin layer leaving a good lace .  m/d - mouthfeel is nothing special , the steely hop bite takes a bit away .

s : this smells amazing . raspberry and strawberry jam with bread and peanut butter . unbelievable , the aroma could n't be better . impressive . m : lower medium body with upper moderate carbonation . overall : the flavor is good , but the aroma is unreal . i could n't take my nose out of the glass .  great head , expected cascading upon serving .  shockingly light carbonation feel . i think the mouthfeel is off from what it should be .

very nice nose . sipping is quite sweet . however , this was much more than i was expecting ; very nice .  a : red-brown , fluffy off-white head , awesome retention and lace !  mouthfeel : low carbonation , light-medium body , slick texture . a bit flat all in all .

absolutely fantastic aroma . t & m : sweet chocolate , citrus hops , and toasted black malt all make their appearance .  brilliant gold with enthusiastic bubbles streaming up to meet the huge fluffy white head .  m : medium body but the finish is not as crisp nor as clean as it could be .

the first impression i got when i took a long deep breathe in the the glass was sweet malt and chocolate , oh my god , chocolate ! it seems as though i was sniffing a fresh glass of dark chocolate milk . it just smells creamy and smooth . the taste was roasted malt and grains combined with the chocolate .  pours thick and pitch black , no light can penetrate this . has a nice sized brown head that fades to medium ring that leaves an awesome lace .  mouthfeel was a little thin , that 's my only complaint .

the smell is sweet , spicy , almost vinous , and very complex . each time i think i have an aroma captured it changes into something else .  two fingers of frothy light yellow head with great retention and lacing . truly exceptional .  seems a bit thin , with very soft carbonation .

s : wow , this beer smells amazing . whiskey and bourbon dominate the nose . i could literally sit here and smell this beer for the 15 minutes and be perfectly happy .  pours a amber ale color with a super looking coffee colored head with tight tiny bubbles that also remits some great lacing .  thanks jpm30 . clearly sour taste that sweetens as you drink it . vineous and slightly rich , wood only detactable before the taste buds are overpowered.. great after salty fish . a slightly milder alternative to a cantillon , overpowering the mouth but not for the entire day .

the aroma kick is amazing , a strong citrus , fresh piney hop nose . overall , highly drinkable , in the west coast pliny type tradition .  reviewed 1/12/2010 ( bottle ) : pours a dark reddish brown color body , big fluffy head , off-white , lasting .  m : light but slightly creamy body .

s- very complex with sweet milk chocolate predominating mixed with a good amount of raisin , smells like a raisin candy bar in a good way . t- not as complex as the nose but still tasty . lots of chocolate with a finish of the whipped cream , the other flavors seem lost in the mix .  very dark ruby red colored body with tightly knit khaki colored head .  feel left me a bit disappointed , however , as it was thin -- too thin for this big of flavor .

aromas are full of the whiskey barrel , but really well balanced with a ton of tree fruit - especially apricots and apples . flavors are a rich mix of fruits , thick bread/yeast , honey - lots of honey , just a kiss of hops , vanilla icing , maybe some fruitcake ... just a lot going on here . and fairly sweet , but delicious . as it warms , it converts to creme brulee and banana pudding - but never loses the whiskey barrel .  pours a rich golden orange , excellent clarity , good carbonation , topped by a level one finger slab of snow white foam .  the mouthfeel was light but a bit chewy .

s- as only a good british beer can smell , luscious . very complex . t/m- ok , the taste lets down a bit after the luscious aroma . a good beer but disappointed that it is n't a great beer .  has a really nice fluffy one finger tan head that sticks around . lacing covers a huge portion of the glass .  this beer has a flavor i really like m- pretty thin and bubbly , almost reminds me of a bmc feel o- one of my favorite tasting pale ales .

smoked gouda cheese , which is one of my favorite cheeses , some peet smokiness , a bit of earthiness , and a little sourness .  pours a deep murky brown with a nice frothy light-tan head that lasts and leaves great lacing .  m : a bit thin , i was kind of expecting it to be a bit more viscous .

s - nice ! grapefruit aroma with some hints of pine fill my nose . very attractive flowery hops , with some bready biscuity malt hidden along the way . nice co2 .  a : pours opaque jet black with a formidable tan head -- nice retention .  nicely carbonated .

smell : best feature . raisins , a bit of anise , nougat , milk chocolate straddling dark chocolate all while riding a wave of mocha coffee . while good , it does n't live quite live up to the aroma . mouthfeel : carbonation is a bit higher than normal .  pours with a short , brown head with melted caramel edges . really nice lacing .  mouthfeel is somewhat disappointing . if we 're talking about banana bread here , then it should be thicker , like bread .

n : cherry , honey , fig , banana , candy sugar , light funk , hints of cinnamon and perhaps some clove . o : nicely balanced and easy drinking . this makes a wonderful winter treat !  11.2oz bottle poured into a chalice pours a murky , deep brown with a thick , one-finger head that has awesome staying power and leaves rings of lacing down my glass .  m/t : light to medium body , watery and a good amount of carbonation . however with the light body , low bitterness and virtually zero aftertaste , i could session this beer .

s - great smelling ! lots of nice fruit and hoppy deliciousness . overall , a fantastic beer . it 's odd that it 's an amber , as it tastes a lot like an ipa .  one and a half fingers of super creamy off-white head . excellent retention and lots of lacing . awesome !  medium bodied fairly low carbonation .

smell of dark rich chocolate , coffee and molassas , having some dark fruity earthiness to it . taste is again rich as in the above aromas with some roastiness and having alchohol present , but not overwhelming .  pours a lighty hazed burnt orange , huge cap of frothy and sticky white head , great retention and lacing .  tastes like , yeah , tart blueberries ( probably artificial blueberries ) . just sweet & weird & sweet ... really tough to finish one . much like a cheap , too-tart wine cooler .

the smell is intense and wonderful , very unique and really lends to the overall quality of this beer .  well there is no way i can fault the look of this ale..its perfect for style darkest of black with a huge frothy light brown head..beeee-u-tiful .  i did notice after a while that it has been pulled from tap that it acquires a lack of a better word , a buttery taste that really dos n't go good with anything . i do like this beer and i 'm not bashing it . the buttery taste in my opinion did not take effect until thirty or so minutes after pour . i do keep some in my fridge . i have shiner before to make burgers with , which turned out great . good beer for beer lovers .

decent lacing left behind . s - wow , great aroma here . immediately there is a lot of pineapple and coconut aroma making it clear that this has been barrel aged . lots of stuff going on here .  huge 3 to 4-finger tan/beige head , slowly recedes to thin but relatively constant layer . great webby lace .  slightly under carbonated for my taste but not really a flaw .

a good looking beer that smells perfect , but ca n't hold up in the taste realm .  the two versions are enough alike that any impression of 15th anniversary will translate to 16th ; therefore , my review of 15th anniversary follows : [ `` great divide 15th anniversary wood aged double ipa poured a beautiful copper with red hints when held to light . there was a massive creamy head and huge amounts of lace clung to the glass .  m : relatively light though not particularly carbonated .

smell is boatloads of grapefruit , orange rind , and lemon ; really fantastic in the aroma department . taste is brisk , with a light but flavorful hop attack , refreshing wheat tartness , and perfect carbonation .  it settles slowly in a dramatically lumpy fashion leaving a tremendous amount of chunky and webby lace .  drink this on tap at city beverage in durham . i like the color and mouthfeel , though a bit thin for a heavy beer aroma is slightly sweet and complex spices taste is toasted barley , spices , and slight caramel with little head . drinks easy for a heavy beer

i can smell this beer from the other side of the room ! this is one of the best smelling sours out there ! flavor is good ... but not as crazy as i expected . a good sour , but does n't stand out like i wanted it to . the obvious sour/tart funk is right on key ... and very clean and crisp . overall , a very solid sour from captain lawrence ... a must try !  great sustain and massive lacing . as good as it gets .  i think that the long trip from greece to williamsburg , va did n't treat this beer too kindly . pours and looks like the standard heine-clone . taste was rather flat .

it is good , but one at a time .  pours a very hazy orange-amber with a massive , pillowy , long-lasting head and great lacing .  not as sweet as oscura , but the mouthfeel reminded me of it . it is a little light in the feel for an imperial but ample carbonation maybe to much .

intresting , very intens smell , very nice hop aroma , tons of hops , citrus flavour , very similar to pliny the elder , i want to taste this one t : similar to the nose but not that strong , wheat , tons of hops , citrus , sweet malts , nice slightly bitter finish , this could be the little brother of pliny the elder , but this is softer , not so strong , m : very smooth , very well balanced , d : very drinkable , alcohol is well hidden , i could drink this all day long , yammy , well done struise .  on tap at strange brew in manchester , nh 2/2/11 a : light yellow , almost hay colored , hazy . 1 1/2 inch fluffy white head , leaves tons of lacing , almost completely covering the glass .  as a swallow i think the first thing i notice is that this is a tad light , but still serviceable in mouthfeel . a nicely balanced apa if not a little thin . im still pleasantly surprised !

some lacing & no head retention smell ; huge oaky & sherry notes taste : super sweet up front , followed by raisin , vanilla , treacle/honey and tangerine notes . very complex , but a little too sweet for my tastes mf : syruppy , oily , undercarbonated , & slightly out of balance .  it pours a beautiful clear coppery-brown with just a little head .  the mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with no carbonation .

s - sweet complex dark stone fruits . cinnamon apple fig . with a bit of pimento . mild oaky hickory hop smells . although not as complex as the smells it is yummy .  beautiful 3 finger head , caramel , frothy and persistent , reddish mahogany nice stream of bubbles , good lacing ; if this did n't look so inviting i would put it on a shelf and leave it there forever !  the mouthfeel is light with a decent amount of carbonation .

smell : piney hops , citrus ( grapefruit , peach and pineapple ) . overall : the aroma was out of this world . it 's very much like an ipa . just did n't seemed very well balanced .  insanely sticky , a spectacular pour .  m : the feel is creamy and medium bodied . rather light for a ris and that really detracts from the beer in my opinion . the mouthfeel is lighter than what i come to think of when i thik of a ris .

aroma is excellent . it 's full of fresh hops , citrus and pine .  appearance : pours a beautiful hazy dark amber color with a finger of foamy off white head that leaves a little bit of lacing and good retention .  m_slightly below medium bodied and very effervescent .

aroma is unusual and very pleasant : something akin to meadowland following a spring shower blended with a peatiness and cooked vine fruits .  appearance & gt ; yellow , lively . lovely .  s : candied pineapple , yeast , and hops well balanced t : a typical ipa taste with accents of pineapple ; yeasts and hops , well balanced m/d a bit thin , carbonation too small and too much , abv on the high side and quite noticeable good beer

the aromas is astonishing , this is the most coffee like of any coffee beers that i 've tasted . excellent .  a - pours a gorgeous pure orange color with a nice white dense head . it recedes slowly and it is sticky and very attractive .  m : very smooth , but seems pretty thin in terms of the body of the beer .

smells like apples , tastes like hops . very tasty . the fragrance certainly did not match the taste , which is a good thing .  as for the head , it stood about an inch in height when it first came out . the consistency is foamy and the color khaki . amazing retention and cobweb-like rings of lacing .  mouthfeel is lightly carbonated , a little thick ( like a dark lager ... blech ) , and generally mediocre .

a : pours like a typical ipa , great clarity , orange color , foamy white head , sticky lacing , and good head retention s : before opening this bottle , i was saying to myself `` please be fresh , please be fresh '' and almost immediately after cracking the top of , my nose was met by the unmistakable fresh hop profile of hop stoopid . big aromatic tropical profile with notes of mango , orange and honey . some earthy malts sit beneath the bright hop profile . the flavors do n't all see to be coming together like i would like as there is some caramel character that throws me off a little mf : medium body , high carbonation , a tad sharp d : this is a great value for a dipa that packs quite the punch in the hop department . the highlight of this beer is the aroma . the taste is great , but does n't deliver as good of balance as some of my other favorite dipas .  appearance : a massive white head sits atop a slightly hazy golden body . classic looks and perfect presentation for a tripel .  not sure what they used for malt , but very sugary at first . the hops comes in and stays with you . almost like an ipa with the first snoot full of hops . i suppose they have to keep winning people over cause of the whole inbev deal . king of beers , so i am not surprised .
it smells great . t : the taste didnt exactly match the smell but the taste was good too .  pours near black with tan head .  m - slightly thin and sweet .

s : bold and healthy hop aroma . perfect ipa smell . t : dry and hoppy .  pours hazy light brown with some orange tints . great head and great lacing .  it 's viciously acidic , but tasty . i like acidic ... i 'll drink straight malt vinegar . this is fizzy alcoholic pomegranate juice with nothing to resemble beer to my palate . i would n't hold `` not tasting like beer '' against a legitimate ale beverage , which i 'm sure this is , except that i like beer , and i do n't like this .

pours a murky borwn with some red hue with absolutely no head to speak of here but was expected , great aromas of cocoa some sugar cookie dough and orange with some noticable nuttieness.a real sipping brew here and fruity to the hilt big orange flavors along with some sour cherry and i have to say it does have this vodka and cranberry flavor to it the first i have ever experienced that in a beer , as the beer warms a real nutty presence come out as well.a nice before bed beer very enjoyable and exremely complex .  a brilliant tan head rose quickly to three-fingers and lowered very slowly leaving brilliantly thick patchy lace on the glass .  very light mouthfeel .

the smell is amazing . it gets me first on the sides of my tongue .  perfect appearance . really smooth 2 finger ashy cocobutter brown head . dark black balled body that looks beautiful in my snifter .  the mouthfeel is fairly overcarbonated and dry .

s ) pumpkin pie ... this really has it covered . this is spiced , but not over the top , which made me very happy . a very nice balance of pumpkin and beer . this is quite smooth . nice finish and aftertaste . o ) i have n't really had many pumpkin beers , but i 've heard good things about this one , so i finally gave it a shot . i 'm really glad i did .  appearance - jet black in color with a very nice one finger light tan head that lingers while drinking . perfect for keeping in the flavor and smell of the beer smell - very light on the malt smell , but somewhat heavy on the bitter hops .  mouthfeel is medium with a thick body but too much carbonation for a barleywine .

great aroma , flavor and bitterness .  the color was near black to black with light tan head . the lacing was exceptional , straight rings from the top to the bottem .  m - heavy , with little carbonation .

nice maple , nice cognac pipe tobacco aroma going on as well as some nice syrup smell . great . t- initially , some nice matliness , caramel/maple , then some dry hops .  the head fades very slowly , leaving a massive lacing .  m- thinner than i would like and overly fizzy from too much carbonation .

smell is pure hops , limes , lemons ... .lemon marange pie ! great brew . memorable !  a-pours a pitch black color with a finger and a half tan head .  m- a little light and watery , but not awful . makes for easy drinking .

on the nose , fresh fruits , cherries , peaches , green apples , pears , simply amazing . a bit twangy and just on the border of being chewy , but not quite . dry and a bit laid back ; decent yeasty body with some reserved sugar , candy cane offerings . sticky as it warms , sort of a bubble gum palate and a bit rustic .  pours out a beautiful amber color with a wonderful fluffy white head .  mouthfeel is surprisingly tingly and sharp from the tiny carbonation and i suspect a hop i ca n't discern in either the aroma or taste . mouthfeel is unfortunately a little weak and thin for style to my mind .

the nose of this beer is simply amazing . pure fresh cherries , almost like a top notch but soft lambic . some light caramel and hops could be smelled as well , but mostly fresh fresh soft cherries . light caramel tone , but just very clean and malty . the bottle is a little disapointing to be honest , but on tap this beer is simply amazing . fresh cherries and soft clean crisp malt .  pours a very dark and opaque brown , almost black , very thick brown head forms , settles to a big thick ring around the glass , lots of sticky lacing , about as perfect as a stout can look .  average body and carbonation .

upon opening the bottle you receive a pleasant aroma and on pouring the smell is obviously even more intense . the mouthfeel is actually kind of weak and bitter , surprisingly , given the pleasant look and smell of this beer .  the old version of this beer brewed at devils canyon was pretty mediocre , but this is actually very good . appearance is excellent . clear golden with a soapy-looking white head that lasts and leaves great rings of lacing .  mouth : such a light and watery mouthfeel that it becomes distracting pondering the feel when you should be appreciating the tastes . drink : the nearly too-light mouthfeel is redeemed by the drinkability of this brew .

small amount of lace around the edges s : roasted coffee and dark chocolate hit the nose first . very sweet smelling , as well as the presence of alcohol t : initially it was more bitter then i expected from the aroma .  pours pale gold with a massive crown of stiff white foam .  m - ok and average .

s : cranberries , some grapes and apples . good hop character . very complex and well done aroma . t : finish is slightly bitter but nothing overpowering , with a warm alcohol character that becomes a little cloying .  black with reddish tints if you look hard enough . looks really good . fluffy foam settles to a thick , dense mass .  this is n't the fault of the brewer so maby it had great head . the main problem with this beer was infection . i 'm sure it was an infection because when i sniffed it i thought for a second maybe i was at the movies about to dig into a 12 dollar medium popcorn . past the buttery flavor i could taste blueberry almost which i 'm sure was n't intended either . it 'd be interesting to taste one from a different batch .

this is just perfect . pine and citrus are both detectable . but ... ahhh , it smells so good !  pours a deep chestnut brown , with a layer of foamy white goodness on top . laces amazingly . the more beers i try from this brewery the more i realize they sure know how to make a beer look good .  palate : medium body and higher end carbonation .

this stuff smells great . a very unique sweet plummy/buttery smell . tastes good , too . does n't taste like 9 % at all .  a : pours a clear golden color with two fingers of creamy white head that fades slowly , leaving countless strips of lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel : this beer has adequate body , but i would like a bit more texture .

aroma : heavenly . roasted malt , chocolate , a hint of coffee , and i detected a hint of whiskey aroma that was very pleasant . taste and mouthfeel : slightly chewy but not quite creamy .  a deep , but crystal clear cherry wood red/brown with some creamy tan head . just perfect !  m= a little thin . boring mouth on it .

this beer smell awesome ! ! ! as i drink it , the problem is , what flavors match up with these aromas ? the beer has a great london/english fruity estery taste with christmas ale type flavors of nutmeg and cinimmon . i wish i had more than one of these to review beacuse its a really complex ale that i would like to clone . a very drinkable ale with a great nutty spicey fruity finish .  appearance : darkest , thickest brown head i 've seen , even a notch above rogue 's shakespeare stout . pitch black even when directly on top of a 60w lamp . tall head , intense lacing .  the mouthfeel was lowly carbonated .

the smell is amazing , strong coffee aroma , more so than any other coffee stout i 've had , easily the best aspect of this stout . the taste is a bit more reserved with the coffee as it 's hard to beat the strong aroma , but there is a good deal of coffee and roasted malt , hint of chocolate , and a decent bitterness in the end .  head leaves a serious amount of lace on the glass . really a great looking pint of beer .  definitely a little too carbonated for my taste - the mouthfeel was a little too creamy , masking the flavor .

that 's a good looking chunk of froth . huge aroma with lots of piney , grassy and citrusy hop smells . mmmmm . very spicy piney hops mostly though with some alcohol and a tad bit of malty earthy smell . this is a marvelous beer that i wish i could get my hands on again .  poured into an ommegang chalice a reddish/purplish brown color with a solid half-inch of head.. perfect for the style .  had a typical pilsner mouthfeel .

that 's what i get in the nose . fresh hot bowl of oatmeal delivered fresh to your nose with dallop of caramelized brown sugar and a heaping of fresh raspberries . a deep burgundy/purple color , it almost looks like a shiraz . i love the complexity and uniquness of this beer , but it tastes too much like a wine cooler for me to love . i just ca n't handle all of the fruit .  not sure if i need a spoon for this one . pours thick as anything i have ever seen .  m- average medium bodied beer o- great take on a saison style beer .

i 've never actually smelt a flanders with actual fruit in the nose but this is really amazing and adds a whole new experience to this brew . simply fantastic and i 'm grateful to have had a chance to try it !  appearance - crystal clear gold body with a huge white head ( took three goblets to pour this ) . gorgeous .  mouf & gt ; sudsy .

the smell is stunning . if i could bottle this and wear it , i would . just incredible . the taste is great , but does not live up tot he smell .  pours a dark brown with a healthy sandy light tan head that lingers at a fairly thick level and laces the glass heavily .  mouthfeel is a bit watery not much body to it , but on a hot day like today , i could take plenty of these guys down .

smell : a deep and delightful warm caress to the nostrils . chocolate , molasses , brandy , and oak joint together for an exquisite amalgamation . wonderfully sugary , earthy , and effervescent .  poured from the bottle into a sam adams sensory glass . a : a beautiful pillowy head sits atop a clear , deep brownish copper , with great carbonation . perfect and appetizing .  m : a light-medium feel to it and kind of syrupy .

s - huge pine aroma that is quickly and easily enjoyable . massively beautiful from the get-go , with underlying citrus notes . a perfect , varied aroma that promises wonderful delights within t - slight pine taste , bit of grapefruit , pure hops abound . d - very nice , but perhaps lacking a bit of malt balance making this a bit more difficult to enjoy .  pours a deep brown with ruby highlights into a tulip . creamy off-white/light khaki head leaves excellent lacing and retention .  m : earthy with a little grapefruit at the begining and a little pine at the finish . light carbonation .

smell is strongly vanilla , delicious bourbon vanilla .  pours a hazy amber colour with one of the most impressive head i have ever seen . a frothy rocky mountain large off white head .  i almost gag every time i take a sip of this . tastes like day-old miller high life with some bread , chocolate , and coffee mixed in . it looks like cola , and at first it smells like oh , say , a bottle of old milwaukee . if only it tasted even half as good as old milwaukee . please , for your own sake , stay away .

the smell is great . as a chocolate lover , i really like this . smells like straight up melted chocolate . but this is really good if you like chocolate . next time i will pair it with some raspberries or strawberries , or make a damn milkshake out of it .  my beer poured a dark , murky , opaque mahogany color with a gigantic , creamy tan head that took forever to fade and leaves chunky lacing down the side . my foam looks like a root beer float it is so solid and creamy looking .  mouthfeel is smooth , but almost unpleasantly so .

the smell was exceptional and exciting , with a remarkable variety of spicy tones that are too complex to describe . with great anticipation , i tried the first sip , which was heavenly . and then it happened ... a nasty aftertaste that i could n't quite place but did n't like .  say what you will about guinness ; yes , i know they 're a bunch of gimmick happy corporate whores , but one thing is undeniable ... there is no other beer on the planet , that looks , smells , or tastes , like a guinness on tap . the cascading effect is awesome . for the first third of the glass it leaves a solid wall of lace all the way around without a break in it . held to the light it 's surprisingly clear and reveals a fiery red hue .  a : solid black , modest lacing even at the beginning , but once the beer was gone so was the lacing s : malty , chicory , lingers nicely t : dominated by coffee ; bitter stout ; the oak comes through nicely ; not very complex m : casked , so it does n't really buzz in the mouth overall , a really good beer , but not as complex as i was hoping ; still , very worthwhile

very enticing . taste has quite a bit of belgian yeast and spice .  this is a great looking beer for sure . a hazy mix of orange and yellow body with a huge white head . the head is at least three fingers in size and is airy and thin so as to not steal much of my beer , but still has great retention .  m. a little too sticky , it feels syrupy , but without a sweeter taste it fells a little off .

huge pumpkin aroma with a bit of spice not unlike pumpkin pie ( which i was eating with it ! ) . my wife loves pumpkin and is not much of a beer drinker and really liked this beer .  a : poured perfectly . nice pinkish , beige head with a good retention and very good lacing for this style .  mouthfeel is full and seems overcarbonated for the style , but overall has the typical heavy/slightly syrupy mouthfeel characteristic of wheat beers .

the smell is amazing . coffee dominates , and while i 'm not a coffee drinker , i like the smell of it .  pours a deep deep dark brown with a monumental rocky khaki head ... . beautiful .  mouthfeel is fine - it 's a very light lager .

smells heavenly - a brilliant blend of maple syrup , caramel , toffee , figs , burnt sugar and bourbon . just a hint of booziness at the end . tastes a lot like it smells - however the bourbon is much more prevalent than the other flavors - you get hints of the caramel , figgy , malty deliciousness present in the nose , but they 're largely overpowered by the bourbon .  bottle and served in my expedition snifter ( along side of the 5 & 8 ) : a - very dark with some ruby highlights and the best head of the three with a good creamy lace upon the glassware .  body is ok , nothing special but not bad . very boozy finish .

just unbelievable . on the palate the beer is very good , but does n't blow my socks off . very nice beer from stone brewing .  a- deep black with a giant tan head . retention is awsome and it laces down the entire glass .  m : light bodied and well carbonated .

was picked up by my bro-in-law and quickly swept away to milly 's tavern to begin our pre-race inebriation . the pumpkin ale was a solid beer , and had a wonderful nose and flavor . the color was clear golden and the glass came lined with sugar and spice !  a nearly perfect pour . smells and tastes of the usual hefe spicy , peppery yeast , clove and banana , with a touch of citrus ( maybe lemon ) sourness .  m : the body is not as thick as i was expecting . it on the thin side as far as stouts go , but drinks very smoothly . i would have liked a thicker body , but that 's just being picky .

smell was amazing , coffee , toffee , bitter chocolate , sugar , fruit .  this brew poured a medium creamy long lasting dark brown head of small to large sized bubbles .  mouthfeel is a little thin , though .

aroma : coffee and chocolate malt meld accented by a whiff of hops and a touch of smoke . nice complexity and balance leads to a very appealing invitation . overall impression : thick and creamy with a wonderful nose . unfortunately the taste just didnt live up to the billing .  a- pours a deep black color with a huge , fluffy , brown head that leaves tons of lacing as it goes down .  the beer poured hard but the carbonation ended up being low and the mouthfeel medium .

s : smell is great . bourbon , vanilla , and coffee . t : tastes of bourbon , vanilla , and coffee with hints of toffee and roasted malts . d : this is very drinkable , especially for the abv .  pours thick and black with a big fluffy head with excellent retention . looks rich and dessert-like .  the bier finishes quickly but is not overly dry . the malt department is a little thin for me but damn well done !

a : pours a muddy muddy thick black with a little ring of head that sticks around but i was not expecting a head anyways , its just dark and inviting black as night s : smells incredibly sweet , like a sweet port , huge huge nose on this , plums and rum raisins with hints of sweet and dark chocolate . i mean there is not real reason to get more specific it smells pretty much like exactly what is listed here , very luxurious . t/mf : the carbonation is a nice touch here and allows an extremely heavy and creamy body to impart the flavor all across the tongue .  poured a hazy golden yellow with a three finger white head that remained throughout the glass and even continued to grow if left to sit for long . insane ! maintained phenomenal lacing throughout the glass . first off , the appearance on this one was ridiculous for the style .  mouthfeel the beer is slick on the tongue with strong carbonation . the body is a little lacking , medium-light .

pours a hazy amber/orange color with a small white to light yellow head , very bubbly . nose is amazing , fresh and fruity , mango , grapefruit , pine and sweet fruit juice . taste is much less fruity than the nose , but it 's still top notch , for a regular ipa it sure packs a hop punch , very bitter and palate tingling . a really nice addition to lawson 's hoppy line up !  a- pours a deep oily black with a three finger tall foamy brown head that has incredible retention ( after 5 minutes there 's still a finger worth left ) .  feels quite creamy at first , almost in a draft-stout kind of way , which struck me as odd . would rather it be crisper and a bit more carbonated , though .

full and rich , with dried fruits overtaking the nose . lots of vanilla in here , as well as some caramel and licorice . t : quite a lot going on in this brew . nothing too special here . d : so scarily drinkable . at 11.5 % , i feel that i could sip this all night .  poured from a growler into a pint glass . pours a deep , clear ruby-brown with wonderful garnet highlights when held to the light . a fat , frothy head of light tan foam shows marvelous retention , holding tight throughout and lasting to the finish , grabbing tightly to the walls of the glass , leaving behind thick , bubbly curtains of lace as the glass empties .  do not know if this was an aberation , but this caused a lower score in mouthfeel .

i smell orange , tangerine , kind buds , papaya , pine , and hints of rock candy . the aroma is lovely ! it smells like someone is peeling an orange next to me . good , but not as amazing as the nose .  poured black , with a brown head .  finishes with a sweet malt taste m- medium bodied with decent carbonation , not as full for an octoberfest as i 'd like but still good d- very drinkable and easy to use to introduce others to a seasonal beer

good lacing & head retention s : intense almost burnt caramel & malt & some alcohol t : smokey caramel & a little aclohol up front , then a hint of cherry & oak . finishes with dryness , a slight smokeyness & a praline sweetness mf : sticky rich body with excellent carbonation & balance drinks good , but 2 would be about my limit .  bear republic big bear black stout is an impenetrably black ale with a huge , chunky , foamy , light-chestnut colored head that coats the glass .  the taste is metal , sweet malt and finishes a nasty bitter . this is not a beer to be revisited unless it is on tap . i need to quite trying these imported green bottled beer . i do n't think i 've had a good one yet . on tap is a different story since kegs should n't get light damage . of course then there 's temperature . . .

smell is delicious ; porter , plus chocolate , plus raspberry . highly encouraging . so wonderful up front , so nasty in the back .  guinness is one of the worlds greatest beers , hands down . rich , tasty , creamy , heartwarming .  pretty weak mouthfeel , it 's a bit watery . i 'm enjoying the flavour and aroma quite a bit but the mouthfeel is a bit weak . but lacking in mouthfeel .

the nose was spectacular . sweet tar , coffee , chocolate , sappy wood all leap from the glass . molasses and brown sugar are buried within the beautiful , rich nose . overwhelming loads of flavors battling for attention .  the appearance is the epitimy of excellence . huge mountainous head supported by sunshine golden body , medium carbonation , tons of rocky , chunky lacing left behind only to be washed away with the high alcohol gobbles .  mouthfeel was the only thing i was n't too keen on- felt a little spritzer-ish .

smells awesome . if this tastes anywhere near as good as it smells , i will be happy . the smells are simply fantastic - if i have another bottle , i may just let it sit and inhale the fumes rather than actually drinking it .  a very nice hazy orange color with a huge off-white head that subsides slowly and leaves lots of nice lace .  the body is rather thin though .

aroma is hugely redolent of skunky , sticky bud if you ask me . hugely hoppy , very fresh , quite similar to rubbing a fresh hop cone in your hands and sniffing . not unenjoyable , but very bitter , so much that i did n't really notice much else .  bottle : poured a dark porter with a super huge medium brown foamy head with super great retention and lacing - almost to the point where i am wondering if something is wrong .  m : medium-full bodied , zero carbonation , silky . d : lacks the warming feeling that is usually related to a winter warmer .

aroma of roast , ash , chocolate , dried fruits , vanilla , bourbon , caramel malts , and alcohol . taste of dark fruit , some tropical , sticky molasses , roasted malts , vanilla , and bourbon - alcohol .  great streaks of lacing that never disappear .  m : over carbonated - fizzy .

5.0 s : lots of oatmeal is apparent . this may be the most oatmeal laden beer i 've had . awesome balance between sweet and roasted flavors . 4.0 t : the taste is just about as good as the nose , but the mouthfeel is too distracting for me to enjoy it .  a : beautiful . three fingers worth of foamy mocha colored head . lots of lacing here .  mouthfeel was a bit heavy and undercarbonated , but that may have been more of the fault of the bar i was at , and not the beer its self .

this fella was simply awesome . it smelled a lot sweeter than the normal ab , with the oak scent peaking through at the tail end of the nose .  pours a beautiful burnt sunset orange with crystal clarity , finger of foamy head has good retention .  the head vanished quickly , but the carbonation level remained high . the aroma was overwhelming sour cherries ... mouthwatering sweet aroma that shows a huge proportion of cherries used in this brew . definitely on the sugary sweeter cherry beer side .

: ( looks and smells awesome . dark chocolate color with a small tan head that does n't stick around for too long . this smelled of chocolate before i even managed to get my nose near the glass . smells like hershey 's . i really really wanted to like this beer , but it was tough to get through the bottle and i was sharing it . if only it tasted like it smelled , this would have been great .  as the beer was going down in the glass , it left an incredible , thick creamy lacing all over the glass . appearance was pretty cloudy , light copper color .  mouthful mouthful is okay . has decent carbonation , but i 've had better as far as carbonation goes .
quite impressive - i just could n't stop bringing this one to my nose .  it pours a thick , viscous black with a large dark tan hea that slowly recedes .  mouthfeel : there is a lot of bitterness .

gives a snootful of dark chocolate and sweet dark molasses from 6 inches away , truly intense aroma . flavor is gently dominated by the chocolate , leans a little toward chocolate flavor extract , but nothing definitive .  poured from a 750ml bottle bottled on november 10 , 2011 into a tulip . a : pitch black with a 1 finger foam head . exactly how a stout should look .  mouthfeel is a bit thin and watery .

there is also a nice toffee and molasses sweetness to keep the aroma balanced . there are also hints of dark berries : to me it smelled like blueberry and raspberry . it is a very enticing aroma . taste : more roasted glory , and the first sip was a shock of burnt bitterness ; the overpowering intensity , though , passed after a couple sips .  big bulky beige head 1 1/2 inches . a thin head remains throughout no matter how long it sits ( very nice ) .  taste is more of the same ... some wild floral flavors , hints of citrus ... seems like the dominant flavors have switched from the citrus to the floral characteristics . i like it , for sure , but could use some balance . i 'm not a big fan of the bitter taste left in the mouth ... but it 's still plenty drinkable . a definitely above-average ale , but not the best .

exquisite critrusy , lemony aroma ; actually smells 'juicy ' . just amazing . flavour consists of traditional hefeweizen attributes with the addition of citrusy , american style hops .  the head of foam was nothing short of exceptional . it had a 1 1/2 inch creamy head of tan colored foam that looked good enough to eat .  this is a seasonal brew , do n't know if it is offered everywhere or if it was given adequate time to chill before serving so i 'll reserve final judgment for later .

smells fantastic ! fruity , citrus , & some serious hops . one of the better smelling beers i 've had .  pours black , black black , with a big , dark , thick cloud of a head .  m : still a bit watered down , but again , it 's better .

smell is very floral and fragrant , wow , fantastic . as it warms , you get more classic nw hops , pine and citrus .  this thing pours up a crystal clear copper with big rocky white head that leaves behind some of the prettiest lace i have seen in a while . great head retention and beautiful rising bubbles in this incredibly clear beer just make this look positively stunning .  mouthfeel : typical red stickyness drinkability : i love this beer .

smell : fantastic , lots of citrus , pine and bubble gum . it is decently balanced but could use some more malt backbone .  a wonderfully thick head sits on top of an incredibly amber colored beer . my favorite look easily .  mouthfeel is thin for a stout imo , but not bad .

a - black with a huge coffee colored head s - smells delicious - very sweet , chocolate malts . the most balanced smell to a stout i have had the pleasure of knowing .  poured black with a thick brown head . the retention was great . very creamy and capuccino like looking head .  mouthfeel was my only complaint .

the smell is close to overwhelming , but exceptionally pleasant nonetheless . oak , vanilla , toffee , caramel , dark chocolate , raisins , bourbon/brandy , and maybe a touch of cinnamon all alternately ( yet congruently ) jump out at you . quite a complex and interesting beer , the drinkablility is hard to judge due to the faux-thin nature of the body .  appearance : dark black color , with big chocolate brown head , medium carb smell : chocolate , with malts , and some wood taste : bitter dark chocolate , coffee , alcohol , and roasted malt mouthfeel : dry , slightly bitter , rich full body drinkability : a drinkable imperial stout , the high abv is moderately masked .  m - lots of carbonation maybe bordering on too much .

smell : wow , mazing ! roasty , dark chocolate , very coffee forward , sweetness . taste : very good , nice and roasty . overall : very good beer , i would certainly want to have this again .  pours black with a dark brown creamy head . very nice beer to look at .  thin to medium bodied with moderate carbonation .

i absolutely love the aroma of this beer , and with more restrained alcohol its drinkability would improve .  poured into michelob celebrate glassware ; awesome head retention for several minutes . fantastic lacing .  no sediment at all when bought fresh . this really brought out flavors you could not taste beforehand . a wedge of orange or lemon is a nice touch also . best served a little warmer than most beers . goes really well with food . a beer you could drink all night especially during a good bar-b-que .

an isabelline crown persists and leaves luxurious cascades of sandy lacing - those bubbles that stick rest atop viscous legs suggesting snow dusted mountain peaks . aroma is highly potent - it hits you from the moment the seal is popped . brown sugar , high quality aged sherry , vanilla , coconut , dense brown bread , faint clove ... the list goes on . the flavor profile closely follows the aromatics , but everything is present in a lesser degree . lots of flavors come and go - abbreviated tastes of bread crusts , licorice , and dried tropical fruit . the finish is quite nutty and hints at leather as well . almost like an armagnac it is a beer well suited to contemplation . the oak notes contribute a great deal without becoming overwhelming ( brandy barrel angel 's share i 'm lookin ' at you ) . definitely worth seeking out and sticking in the cellar ...  i also love the brownish patina imparted to the deep red colour as it sits in a chalice .  mouthfeel a bit thin .

mmmmm , a smell like none other . besides aroma , this is a mighty tasty beer ; absolutely my newest favorite ipa . i could drink a couple of these at once , but like many highly flavorful beers , not my kind of session brew .  this beer is so dark that it makes the glass appear as if it 's jet black . it 's beautiful . no head , no carbonation , just black .  it 's a black colored beer with ruby edges . fairly nice nose , with a variety of dark fruits , as well as a bit of chocolate and coffee . really nice nose . flavor is fully packed , loaded with dark fruits ( blackberry , plum , cherry and currant ) , as well as some notes of dark chocolate , coffee and a light hint of alcohol . i like it .

the aroma was very fresh , like a breeze on a river , ( stunning ! ) floral hops and hints of citrus along with caramel malt ; a sweet and inviting blend . muted orange rind , grapefruit notes and a doughy malt/yeast blend were present but the bitterness that sat atop them i found unpleasant .  huge sticky head alone has a personality all its own . gorgeous golden haze pour that has no room for improvement , while in a class all its own .  a - it was still cascading when the glass arrived to the table ... settled into a deep , deep brown body with a brown head ... the head was creamy yet bubbly and it retained as one finger tall ... sheets of lacing were left s - there was a lot of chocolate in the nose with some subtler coffee notes ... dark fruits were present as well as a noticeable hop presence t - again , the chocolate presence was throughout the entire beer ... it tasted like bittersweet chocolate ... the dark fruits came out in the middle ... i would say dates were most prevalent because there was a nice , sweet caramel note throughout ... the coffee flavor showed up briefly at the end as well as the hops ... it did n't leave a bitterness on the palate though m - light bodied ... this was indifferent for me ... you would think the nitro would have added some body , but it actually came across as watered down o - the description said this was an homage to yard 's brawler ... i believe i had three of these one night ... the chocolate flavor is nice and it 's all around ... there are other players that join in the flavors ... you ca n't beat 2.6 % abv , talk about session ! ... my only complaint is the watered down mouthfeel

smells very sweet , of caramel and spice and a definite alcohol presence on the nose . i love it . one of the best smelling beers i 've put my nose to .  a : solid black body topped with three full fingers of rich , dense , medium-brown head that just barely poke above the rim of the glass ; incredibly persistent retention and a practically solid sheet of lacing .  the mouthfeel is a bit too watery and perhaps a bit chalky .

very sweet , but extremely complex . awesome . taste is intense sourness and bitterness , which tapers off to not much else .  it packs in beautiful cascading , lively carbonation , a firm & rich off-white head and amazing levels of retention . that and a bold black color make for one masterful visage .  this beer poured nicely with a creamy white head , giving off nice citrus aromas . the flavor was shocking , however , reminding me of kool-aid orange flavor , and with almost as much sweetness . i could n't distinguish any hop bitterness , though it could have used some to balance out the excessive sweetness . this beer tastes as though all the yeast were filtered out , and then orange kool-aid added post-fermentation

smell is amazing . has a spicy fruity smell .  i havent seen a head that tall in awhile.pcb 's cabot street wheat poured a thick frothy solid white head that lingered and left a lace around my whole glass.it smelled of bananas with a citrus twist.the color was a cloudy light yellow.it yielded a banana wheaty taste with a touch of sour lemon at the finish.it leaves a dry feeling in the mouth with virtually no aftertaste.a very good light beer for a hot summer day !  it was my first fruity beer . it kinda tasted like an apricot . i was expecting most of a fruit taste like wine , but no . and i liked the picture on the bottle . and since it came ithaca i just had to try it . over all the beer was worth it . it 's good . : )

not dominating like some ipa 's , there are also crisp malt notes . the blend is just about perfect . this is one inviting beer !  pours an opaque orange gold with a massive , fluffy four finger head . gorgeous , a pour and a swirl can barely keep it in the glass . lots of visible , whitish sediment swirls around under the head . tiny champagne bubbles collect on the outside under the rim , sliding shimmering down the glass into a frothy lace after a tilt .  the mouthfeel is medium , slightly watery .

this is mouthwatering and powerful . t : follows the nose . though it is not as powerful as the nose imo . m/d : a full body that is low on the carbonation end .  pours a cloudy yellow with amazing white head that stays through out the whole glass .  mouthfeel is a little too tingly for me with the carbonation .

the aroma is that of a rich red wine , high in fresh fruit and tart cherry . complex undertones reveal the earthiness of damp autumn woodland , as it warms . the alcohol is greater than anticipated , and interesting , given that it is labeled as 4 % . a ton of character , oud beersel is my opinion of a stunning example of what this style can achieve . unpretentious and impeccably crafted , this is a gastronomical work of art .  a : pours a clear golden with a massive frothy , rocky head with great sustain .  this was my first encounter with pumpkin ale . i must confess that i could not finish the bottle . i had the distinct impression that the beer was trying to taste like something and not quite getting there . fearing the latter , i tossed the bottle after about five sips .

the second the cap is popped , the aromas come rushing out and literally fill the room . it smells like i 'm chopping up fresh oranges and pineapples as i pour this beer ; remarkable ! this beer takes me longer to finish than most dipas this drinkable because i stop to sniff this beer before every sip ! it is not exceptionally bitter but a rather sweet and citrusy ipa . there is n't a lot of malt getting in the way of the hops , hops , hops . a superbly drinkable dipa .  this beer poured a black body with a thick dark tan/black head . a beautiful sight to see .  aroma of fresh fruit and a bit of must , faint barnyard . taste starts with blackcurrant , very dry , moderately sour . hints of vanilla . finishes with more fruit and some mustiness . complex . would love to see it age .

very nice presentation . aroma is forresty ( real word ? ) with grassy , herbal , piney , sprucy hop notes along with citrus notes of grapefruit and lemon rind .  poured from a bottle into a pint - exceptionally clear , copper colored with a one finger head that was almost latte colored , enough carbonation to keep plenty of lacing and a little bit of a head until the end .  nice golden color with plenty of carbonation . the head of foam was really thick and creamy , but it dropped down to a this lace in about 15 mins . at first i was n't crazy about the taste , but about 3-4 sips into the beer i changed my tune . it is not like any beer that i typically drink , so i did n't what to expect.interesting brew , i would buy this again .

aroma is amazing ... whisky , vanilla , smooth smoke , chocolate , big roasted notes and some oak . taste was a bit of a let down after the wonderful aroma . i picked up a lot of sweet chocolate , some booze , big on the bourbon flavor . this was a rare treat to enjoy i am very happy i had the chance .  the reserve special black bier was a beautiful sight resting in a dark horse souvenir pint glass . it was black as night with a dark tan head indicating the level of roast of the malts used .  m-medium carbonation with a fairly dry finish o-listed as a pale lager ?

the nose is very complex with hints of soy sauce and salty taffy .  a - giant white lumpy 3 finger head with fantastic retention ! ever-so-slightly hazy straw yellow that 's profusely effervescent .  mouthfeel : a bit thinner than expected , but not bad .

'' -- review from the growler ... .dark brown color with a small tan head ... .awesome aroma of fresh picked and mashed blueberries along with a sweet chocolate aroma ... the nose it top notch ... body is a bit light ... not horribly so but i wish it had a bit more meat to it ... taste is a bit acidic from the blueberries..the cocoa complements nicely but is definitely secondary ... .  very dark , nearly black , dark ruby edges , huge three finger head that falls slowly , becomes rocky , excellent lacing , and a cap that sticks around throughout .  in the mouth , it 's rather average , with light carbonation .

750ml bottle into duvel tulip a : golden/almost straw color with 3 '' thick , white whipped-cream like foam s : mango ! tropical fruit . smell of a very `` sticky '' and sweet fruit . once the foam dissipated , i can smell some `` yogurty '' belgian yeast . t : low-medium , maltiness with some husky ( tannin ) character upfront . noticed a very clean belgian yeast flavor after my palate got used to the beer . d : highly drinkable .  appearance- deeper colored golden pour with a full inch plus rocky head with a good 1/4 inch of staying power . great looking beer .  m - a little harsh , not as smooth as other ipas .

robust cherry smell that is fantastic . taste is almost all cherry , wheaty malt underneath .  great looking pour for a white ale .  creamy flavor does not carry over into the mouthfeel ; light bodied beer without much carbonation .

very nice aroma ! very nice beer .  into a pint glass , it poured a transparent straw/gold ; heavily carbonated , two fingers of bright white , and great head retention and lacing .  nothing to write home about when it comes to mouthfeel . kind of a club-soda feel to the beer , tingly . though there seems to be a strange `` romanian roulette '' effect where every sixth beer is kinda soapy .

the smell is extremely vibrant and spicy reminding me immediately of egg-nog . despite being very interesting and flavorful it becomes difficult to drink about halfway through .  on tap at ebenezer 's 2/13/11 a : pitch black and completely opaque . massive 2 finger mocha colored foamy and rocky head that was there to the finish . i ca n't recall many big stouts with such an impressive looking head .  dare i say it seems a bit on the thin side . the meatiness in the flavor is not backed up by the body . not bad , but just a little disappointing ... this is a fine stout .

the aroma is that of fresh american hops that have been sitting in the aging tank for a while . this beer is dry hopped every day for a month and the aroma tell the story . citrusy aromas that gram the oral senses and tell a story of freshness . it is surprisingly balanced and the hop aroma and flavor is a real treat . score : my personal taste score was a 93 / 100 .  poured dark brown with a light tan head .  i can feel it in my cheeks . it does n't have any off aromas specifically , but it definitely has the acidity for it . undrinkable , i 'm pouring it out .

the nose is creme creme creme . the taste to too strong for the brule , which takes away from the nose of the beer .  this beer pours an inky black with a dark brown head .  refreshing when ice cold , pleasantly balanced when it warms a bit .

t - not as complex as i had hoped for , but still good . starts off with bourbon vanilla flavors with some caramel malt sweetness mid palate , then big oak flavors with a bit of spice through the long finish .  bomber picked up from the brewery , opened after some months aging into goblet : a : quite nice hazy light-golden orange color with a substantial , creamy , lasting head .  the carbonation is surprisingly strong for the style .

i smell fresh cat piss , pine , grapefruit peel , fresh , fresh fresh hops ! ! ! ! still hard to live up to the smell . the mouthfeel is good and i have to say that if this beer was on tap i would stop for a pint or three every day .  ) tasted 10/02 : bronze/bright amber color with good tan lasting head .  the mouthfeel is sort of watery , but it 's alright . this drinks very well .

i can also catch a slight nose of peaty scotch if i catch it the right way . fantastic aroma here .  a - pours a very dark brown - almost black - with a two-finger , well-carbonated , beige head that slowly dissipates to a 1 cm head . very attractive drink , as well as bottle which is slightly shorter and wider than most 12 oz bottles .  this beer has a fairly heavy body , a bit too much for my tastes .

s - wow , what a blast of aromas : floral notes , pine and citrus smack you in the face . t - it tasted of spicy , piney hops with a sweet , burnt toast maltiness . it is extremely hoppy and fairly easy drinking considering the high abv .  on tap at the pub ... the body is bright dark orange , but totally clear , very cool . an off white head leaves a thin cap , with great lacing , stellar ... the aroma is really successful in that the citra hops come across as orangey and sweet but they are literally cut but the balance of the other hops which reigns it in with some nice bitter pine .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied to me . could be a little thicker on the tongue .

the smell was everything you would expect from a beer as hoppy as this . the smell of hop oil was big .  bottle into an english pint glass appearance - dark brown/red hue reminds me of high grade saddle leather . a very handsome brew , sir .  it has a pretty high carbonation .

this beer has the most incredible smell in the world . '' the big wafts of vanilla , caramel , and butterscotch fill the nose and is absolutely delectable . i could enjoy the aroma of this beer for hours . one bomber was enough for me , and i was pleasantly surprised .  opague black extremely heavy coffee colored heading . that leaves excellent lacing and keeps a nice collar all the way down to the last gulp .  the palate is somewhat thin for the style but it 's still smooth .

the aroma is fantastic ; a huge hit of lemony citrus and grass with undertones of pale malt and yeast . excellent ; the best pilsner i 've tried .  a - dark caramel brown in color with some golden hues around the edges of the glass . hue , foamy off-white head with excellent retention .  m - thin with medium low carbonation d - not a bad amber .

smell was outstanding . malts , and dried fruits , raisins , prunes , etc , very complex and really builds the base for the beer . very , very nice . no bitterness to speak of and a lingering toffee sweetness at the end . overall an excellent doppelbock , right up there in my top 3 .  absolutely beautiful orange red body with a thin white head .  m - thought it was a little flat , but not bad .

aroma was ridiculously appealing - sweet malt , caramel , maple , vanilla , oak , some dark fruit , and alcohol . wow . d - this was a sipper , but drinkability benefited from the fact that it tasted so damn good .  pours a pretty deep black with dark tan head that clings to the glass . looking quite appealing .  m : carbonation is a little weak ( especially since i poured moderately , and received an aggressive head ) leaving a mouthfeel thatis not strong enough for me to consider it cask-like . a little watery ... d : all things considered , i really enjoyed this beer .

the smell is great , roasted barley , choc , some hints of caramel , delicious . taste is fantastic .  drank on-tap at hot tomato 's , new haven , ct poured a hazy amber with a two-finger , bubbly , white head that left huge ridges of lacing all the way down the glass .  carbonation is a bit low for the style .
this is one of the best smelling beers i have ever had .  what a gorgeous beer ! incredibly dark brown head , near pitch black color , and smells just right .  i also find it a little thin .

it really reminds me of the nose i get off a really good heffeweizen ( spelling might be wrong , but there ya go ) . it 's a bright and inviting smell and makes my mouth water .  this is the first tripel i 've ever seen that does n't pour like a homebrew . it is pleasantly clear with a rock-solid white head . then , after perfectly maintaining its integrity for five minutes , i look away for two second and it completely collapses for form a nice ring-around-the-beer with some craggy lacing left behind .  ill start this by saying i am not a lager drinker by any means . the smell is very summery with hints of citrus and the taste is very malty . the taste is very rounded and balanced . nothing is too harsh or overpowering it all just sort of settles around itself . would drink again !

s- wow , loads of scents starting with a spiced apple and spiced pear followed by great light sweet malt scents and of course the belgian bready yeast ... this reminded me of my trips i used to take to julian with my parents and brothers as a child , we would always go up there for some fresh apple pie and hot cider ... t- not as much as the smell , but still great . you pick up on the apple/pear , spices , light sweet malt and loads of bready yeast with a nice crisp finish .  look : dark brown with a good solid 1 inch head with great retention and some spotty lacing smell : smoked pork comes to mind .  mouthfeel is decent , this beer seems to foam up in your mouth .

this beers saving grace is a fantastic odor .  a- a perfect golden look in the glass . looks great .  m- medium body that was slightly under-carbonated . with more carbonation , all the flavors would bite that much more .

ahh , the smell makes up for the poor visual aspect ... it is phenomenal ! nonetheless , this is an outstanding nose . barrel aging is very evident upon tasting , as is the alcohol . to me , it almost seems like a tripel and a half , as it needs a bit more body-adding malts and the alcohol is a bit rough ... but that is being a bit picky , i am very glad i brought this out for my 500th .  a- black beer into ayinger glass , huge head with infinite retention , probably 4 fingers on average . nice light mocha color and a ton of lace everywhere .  m-explosive carbonation . tough to gauge the feel over the bubbles . a bit too carbonated for me .

a- pours a pitch black hue with brown and amber highlights , small tan/brown head that is mostly sustaining , fair amount of lacing throughout s- fruity scents dominated by raisins and dark fruit ( as advertised on the label ) , i am also getting tones of apple , peach , belgian candy , sweet caramel/toffee malts , and a modest alcohol presence t- initial taste is raisins , raisins , and more raisins ( almost cloyingly sweet ) , followed by a variety of fruits and spices , yeasty/bready/sweet malts , a little bit of chocolate and belgian candy , finishes with sweet malts , a touch of bittering hops and warming alcohol presence m- medium/full bodied with good carbonation , nice slick texture that coats the tongue in sweetness d- 9 % abv is well-masked , but this definitely a sipping beer to be enjoyed over time ( much like a port or desert wine ) .  bottle : poured a deep opaque brown color ale with a huge dirty white color foamy head with good retention and some lacing .  very good light lager . hints of barley and hops , with a smooth slightly dry aftertaste . this brew had a short lived white foamy head and lower than normal carbonation . i would highly recommend this to any light beer drinker .

aroma is huge apricot honey-butter you smell from across the room . amazing . super wowowowow . an incredible rich aroma : great smelling beer . taste is an underlying sweet walnut toffee with apricot honey-butter with a huge fruity citrus hop bitterness that lasts forever .  a-black as hell , 2 1/2 '' incredible light brown cappucino froth head . this beer looks fantastic . s-roasted malt aroma is so subtle it 's barely there .  i 'd love to try this on cask , if only to taste it more directly without all the carbonation dancing across my tongue .

aromas of lots of different berries ( strawberies , blueberries , blackberries , and raspberries ) . i would get a different berry every time i sniffed . the berries were done nice ! good thing i like all the types of berries in this one .  in a snifter at falling rock in denver on 9/12/11 a - exceptional head , white and everlasting . decent lace .  in the glass , the elderberry dominates . the taste just off , sour in a nasty way , more like rotten fruit than any sort of pleasant tartness which might be expected from the berries . we gave this a decent try to see if it would get better , but in the end just could n't drink it .

it smells amazing -- a sharp alcohol bite ( it 's a 21 abv , for crying out loud ) but surrounded with sweet citrus and pine and caramel and hops .  the foam was wheat in color , bubbly , thick , smooth and left a ring around the glass til the end . the color was a dark burgandy/all most black with an orange red highlight in the light .  body is light and a bit watery , not too syruppy at all .

the nose is heavy on the rye malt- showing a more pure breadiness with fruity tones of buttery apples , white raisin , faint cinnamon , light brown sugar , plum . the parallels to rye whiskey are awesome in this . the medium bodied palate is caramelly sweet up front with a mild bitterness that ushers in the rye maltiness- drying and spicy with lots of fruity tones .  black to extremely dark brown in color of the body . huge rocky head that is coffee color .  m : crisp feel at first , mellows gradually before eventually becoming a little sticky/gummy . light-medium body .

the aroma is awesome . right away it reminds me of kuhnhenn raspberry eisbock with huge notes of sweet raspberries and chocolate .  frothy tan head .  t : bitter chocolates and cold black coffee .mmmmm m : a bit thin in the mouthfeel , slight warming in the finish which i found dry .

i 've always like tryign various fruit beers ... .and this one was certainly one of the better ones that i have tried . the raspberries are extremely prevalent to both smell and taste , but not to the point of being overwhelming .  pours a moderately clear reddish hue . massive cap of tan foam does not seem to want to go anywhere , stubbornly leaving sheets of lace on the glass .  the body is pretty light though and clean .

d : nice big i.p.a. , best smelling i have had yet , very flavorful and the malt has been kept in check and the hops can come right through .  plenty of bubbles could be observed rising through the body , in short , it looked great ! the head produced somegood laceing as the beer was consumed .  its sucks to know that in a different format this could be so much more . body and carb is okay , but by this point i 'm already at the meh stage .

lovely , bright cherry red color ... head is large at first , simmers down quickly ... aroma : mmmmm ... .complex ! quite a rich and invigorating aroma , i postpone consumption to prolong my time drinking it deep into the nose ... really nice !  a light orange marmalade cropped with a white , creamy top , it looks damn delicious !  i was not a big fan of the mouthfeel of this one . i 'm all for thick imperial stouts , but somehow this one was much more syrupy than i liked , it felt a little to sticky sweet in my mouth .

looks good , smells amazing , but the taste is very underwhelming .  served up a breathtaking deep copper amber that is crystal clear . the head is slightly off-white and looks superb with tightly packed , shiny bubbles that stick around forever and leave near perfect lace . if this beer tastes nearly as good as it looks i will be most happy .  the taste is also very floral and hoppy , but its a smooth onset of flavors , doesnt smack you like other ipas , which ca be good or bad . the flavor doesnt last as long as other beers in this catagory . overall a pretty good beer , i think most peple will enjoy this one .

s - coffee . geez .  2009 vintage a- deep violet , crimson red just a beautiful awe-inspiring color and massive towering head that seems to be independent of the beer and an entity all onto itself .  smell was sweet , with a citrus hint and strong english ale smell . initial taste was interesting , and i was n't sure about whether i would like it . by the end of the bottle , it had become one of the best beers i 've tasted . i would n't recommend it for any parties , but in small groups of like minded people i would say good call . very drinkable beer . looking forward to trying more from the brewery ( if i can find it )

i absolutely loved the smell of this , chocolatey , with some sweet fruits from the yeast and subtle hop profile .  pours a nice amber with 2 fingers of head . gorgeous lacing also like nothing i 've ever seen . a solid 5 for appearance .  the taste is also fresh but a with bit of watery mouthfeel .

aroma is very fruit dominated , and not by any single one . peach , lemon , starfruit , lime , mango ... it 's an intoxicating tropical melange . some contrasting oak and fresh yogurt notes are there too , lending some harmonizing 'wild ' elements without getting too funky . flavor is moderately puckering , tart and verging on lemony sour . hop elements are present though indistinct in the mix , lending some possible leafy orange tea notes , and residual bitterness .  slightly billowy , about 1/2 '' and slowly drops . looks sticky . very natural . not bright orange . i think this is as good looking as an ipa gets .  m : average , nothing of note .

aroma : lush and full of fruit , beautiful and deliriously deep , slightly spicy , with further fruity develops , cherries and berries , but burnt . juicy hops and rich malt jump out through the nose , a perfect barleywine bouquet .  big firm plush head , one of the most impressive i have ever seen . opaque black hue as expected .  the only complaint i have is that the texture left much to be offered . overall i great beer .
s- this beer smells great , typical ipa smells ; pine mandarin , pineapple , grapefruit .  great , great look .  the only detraction i can fin is the below average body .

very nice . the taste is very unique .  the classic appearance is the widget induced/nitro-draft style , which produces a paler , more uniform head with typical nitro bubbles ( tighter ) . it was almost foamy and left a nice lacing on the glass from the four pulls i took . this is what a stout beer should look like , imho . perfect . the dark , almost black , appearance of the guinness is beautiful .  mouthfeel was ok .

smell : wonderful aromas on this beer .  appearance 5/5 clear dark brown with a good dark tan colored head that stayed around , and left good lacing as well .  mouthfeel is on the thin side , but not bad . crisp , clean , pleasant in the end -- not overwhelming , a little tart .

very pleasant aroma . i may have picked up some caramel in the flavor as well as some sharp citrus aspects and some sweetness .  '' the appearance was awesome . huge head all the way down the glass .  under carbonated and somewhat thin bodied , there is a coffee flavored finish that is truly amazing .
