s - mild chocolate aroma .  this is a delicious looking beer ! dark with a creamy , full head .  starts with roasted coffee flavor , mouthfeel is incredible smooth .

a - pours a nice deep inky dark color befitting a proper russian imp stout . s - dry biting hops come through with a dark roasted malt earthiness and just a touch of currant or other earthy dried fruit . not too complex or strong of a smell , though . d - incredibly well-balanced beer whose hops and malt come together in unison .  solid finger of brown , almost black head . incredibly dark body with nice lace . darkest head i 've seen .  taste- wonderfully intense malt , and a big bready character that thankfully outweighs any unpleasant sweetness that the malts could impart . fantastically effervescent , it rides into the mouth and over the tongue with confident grace ... all the while alive and outspoken .

smells deep , malty , nots of caramel , bread and munich . slight metalic note as well .  '01-'02 : starts by pouring a jet black , your unable to see through it , with a nice dark tan head that settles with deep fluffy pockets .  perfect silky creamy carbonation .

smell is subtle and surprisingly fruity . overall an outstanding example of the style .  pours a pitch black dark into snifter glass with a rich , creamy head that lasts a great deal of time and a heavy lace remains . probably the darkest looking beer you will find and a wonderful head .  mouthfeel is very good , a light bodied beer with excellent carbonation ; it dances on the tongue and finishes smooth .

smell has only a touch more cocoa and sweetness to it , still a disappointment as far as aroma . taste is milder and smoother , warmer and more rounded , softer , not quite as sharp with light roasty malts and bit more dryish chocolate and cocoa , some notes of nuttyness appear in there .  the retention was downright insane and it essentially sat there like whipped cream . beautiful looking beer .  good and special beer , cloudy , double fermentation , yeast , hops , malt and wheat are present in smell ; taste fruity , and floral like grassy and herbs ; good for mexican haute cuisine , try with pasta and salads ; mouthfeel exceptional , well balanced and litlle strong for the palate ; 96 % recommended .

nice and leggy . smell : not much there .  a- damn sexy looking in my pilsner glass . it sits atop a slightly hazed , deep red almost apple cider colored body .  m : medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation . exceptional in this category . appearance and mouthfeel are certainly worth noting .

unfortunately , the smell does n't measure up to the appearance . it 's ok , but nothing spectacular . well , the taste certainly is nice . complex , malty sweet , and again , i taste the cherries . for 8 % , this is extremely smooth and drinkable .  classic stout appearance -- black body with a thick creamy dark-tan head .  m- awesome thick mouthfeel on this seasonal .

not much smell what was there was slight maltiness . great kolsch flavor , really nice for the style .  pours a bright hazy copper chestnut color with a medium creamy off white head that retains fairly well and laces the glass .  mouthfeel : perfect mouthfeel . very smooth , lightly carbonated .

the smell is very mild with a bit of toasted bready malt coming through . while the smell was a bit small the flavor is the opposite , very big . huge fruity malts up front with a bit of sweet apricots and a touch of raisins , toasted malt and bread qualities linger as a strong juniper and grapefruit bitterness take over and linger on the tongue .  poured a dark hazy brown , tan head , with good retention .  aroma : not overpowering , but hints of citrus-y hops well balanced with malt mouthfeel : medium-bodied with a nice oily coating of the mouth . very smooth with just the right carbonation .

a little bit of fruit gone bad on the nose , this might be due to the aging , it is n't too strong but still noticeable . rich malts and still some hops in the bg .  in a tulip the beer was near black in color with a light brown head . the head lingered well , and left abundant lace .  perfect carbonation to it .

s : not a lot going on here . some pear , green apple , very minor tangerine . ethereal young wheat adds a gently malt background .  pours a beautiful slightly hazy amber color with a large two inch off white head . excellent retention and some great lacing .  mouthfeel is damn near perfect for an o'fest , i think . impeccable balance .

s : a roasted nose with hop undertones . not a big nose on this beer .  pours a very deep brown from a 550ml bottle with a two finger head that retains . it 's opaque and pushes pitch black .  great mouthfeel .

s - not bad , vinous with a touch of vinegar . some fruitiness there as well . t - fruit vinegar and a touch of funk there .  this beer pours beautifully , glowing , hazed apricot amber in color with 3 fingers of fluffy froth topped by rocky peaks . retention is epic and lace coats my maredsous goblet .  m - full body , viscous and chewy with low , delicate carbonation , very smooth across the palate with some heat from the alcohol/bourbon content .

the aroma is a little understated . there are hints of roasted chocolate and coffee . i was hoping for a bit bigger nose though . flavor is full of roasty chocolate and coffee just like the nose . it is very smooth and very drinkable .  the colour is pitch-black ; the two finger head is pale beige , airy and uneven . massive amounts of lacing .  m : very soft carbonation and easy on the palate as a good session beer should be .

the scent is pretty muted , it smells woody with some spicing and a tiny bit of citrus the flavor profile is interesting , it 's one of those distinctly staged brews .  nice tight eggshell head . nearly brilliantly clear .  f : wonderfully thick .

aroma is quite light some dark malt and hop but too light and not nearly as aromatic as the bottle . all the key flavors are certainly present with same complexity as bottle-brown , scotch ale & ipa .  i love the look of this in the glass , nice pale yellow color , frothy white head . it looks like it was dry hopped to me .  m : super creamy as it should be .

s - aroma is mainly bitter chocolate and a hint of brown sugar along with just a hint of hops .  great looking beer !  the mouthfeel is dry with a long and deep finish which is full of blackened malt and char . very very nice .

s- smells of grain , faint hops . relatively clean .  the pour was very good and this is easily one of the best looking beers i have ever seen with its excelent head , color and champagne like bubbles .  excellent ! incredible smooth and silky mouthfeel .

s - not much to it ; sweet , molasses , and a subtle hop character . t - delicious !  bottled in feb. 2009 , batch # 9 ... appearance : pours a very pretty deep orange , copper ; very clear with tiny bubbles and a huge sticky white head . this is a great looking beer !  m : full-bodied , a very firm and brilliantly sructured beer .
smells kind of like homemade bread .  a - brilliant copper color with a finger of thick solid off white head .  mouthfeel & gt ; exciting ... not too bubbly . full score .

smell : rather light on the nose despite the big head , just a hint of citrus and maybe a bit of fresh cut grass taste : very light malt that reminds me of cereal and almonds ( just a hint ) and a nice solid refreshing lemon zest hop finish . kick ass lawnmower beer . very good stuff , it 's superb drinkability and the genuinely good ( not superb ) flavor .  this beer is absolutely stunning in appearance .  m : perfect carbonation amount .

it has a cloudy light brown body and a malty fruity combination . it 's a very well rounded brew and just a little different .  pours jet black with thick mocha head .  it 's thick , creamy , rich , and robust .

subtle . t/m : great malt flavor .  a : this dark lager poured a beautiful clear amber color that showed off a ton of carbonation . i was extremely impressed by the appearance of this beer .  the mouthfeel , though , was the best part . it fills your mouth with mousse like consistency with very round edges .

the aroma was subtle and i tried to pick up the smokiness but really could n't . mostly it smelled like a pale ale just not as hoppy and citrusy.the beer has a nice velvety mouthfeel but was a lot crisper than i thought it would be .  a : absolutely beautiful looking brew .  the mouth feel is perfect - not watery , not syrupy , well carbonated , and very refreshing .

s : the nose generally lacks aroma . some grainy bread notes emerge but the hops offer nary a scent . t : a sip makes up for the lackluster nose , lots of flavor jumps out from the get-go .  looks the part . `` glugged '' into my tulip glass and created a nice tight brown head that leaves lots of lace as i drink .  mouthfeel is full bodied and super smooth . very enjoyable .

there was a faint earth and citrus aroma but nothing really pronounced .  a : the pour is deep deep burgundy with a really large thick creamy off-white head . the slow dissipation leaves lacings galore .  you can feel how well-crafted this beer is : perfect body ... thin , but not too thin ; carbonated , but not overdone ; hoppy aftertaste , but not a tastebud destroyer .

s : light and hoppy , but i think maybe my glass smells a bit wierd .  gorgeous , classy looking beer .  extreme balance and smoothness in this beer , its quite good . big full body with a champaign like fizzyness . im impressed .

light tan head sits upon this almost purple/amber colored beer . not much in the way of aroma . this concerned me and i was not hopeful .  highly envigorated light brown head of fine bubbles that left behind a nice lacing on the pour .  m- great mouthfeel .

s : toasted bread and grain , not as much caramel as the appearance might suggest , with some faint tangerine citrus occasionally emerging .  from the nitro-can , started as a full glass of thick , creamy foam . slowly the foam turned over from bottom to top revealing a deep yellow beer with a steady half-inch foamy white cap .  the mouthfeel is light , with excellent particulates that roam the mouth . a most excellent brew that i would n't hesitate to try again .

aroma : sweet , grainy wheat accompanied with apple , citrus , and a slight hint of floral hops taste : sharp lemon and apple over a tasty and grainy wheat backbone . drinkability : excellent , as you 'd expect from any wheat beer worth a damn . verdict : saint arnold has created a solid wheat beer , perfect for a summer 's day here in texas .  made a great appearance , poured a classic beer golden with a very large creamy foamy white head with a lot of sticking .  matches perfectly with the thickness of the body .

she loves scotch ales/scottish ales and when i ca n't turn up something new/local for her to enjoy i fall back on the classic imports . the nose is mildly malty .  nice white , foamy head with great retention .  very nice feel in the mouth -- rich , thick , tingling bubbles , kind of evaporates on the tongue . medium-heavy body , quite a bit of honey , i get this apple quality .

lacing got more impressive as the glass emptied . i quite enjoyed this beer and found it more interesting than the leffe blonde ; my only criticism might be that it 's a bit too rich at times , but that 's a minor distraction . my preferred leffe right now .  a - pours a deep mahogany color with an inch of fluffy golden head . so far great .  the texture is just flat-out perfect and this is about as easy to drink as you can want .

smells slightly sweet , grassy and floral notes , some fruit maybe ... pleasant enough , but nothing spectacular . nice . this is probably not what a hardcore hophead expects in an ipa .  the pour reveals very fine de dolle bubbles . the beer is a beautiful copper color .  silky smooth on the tongue and exceptionally creamy .

smell : musty , minerally , grassy . taste : great malt sweetness tempered with spicy citrus hops .  the pour is absolutely beautiful on this one .  m : the mouthfeel is dense and creamy and frothy ... and almost stout-like . excellent .
aroma was well restrained , with dark malt notes and roastiness coming forth . 3.9 look : 4.5 | smell : 3 | taste : 4 | feel : 4 | drink : 4 1267  amazing looking beer .  incredible mouthfeel .

s - smelled like a quality stout.though i really could n't smell any coffee like odors . t - sweet toffee & coffee with some bitterness .  a-dark ruby to light brown with a huge tan head . clear .  m : very thick , borderline creamy . superb .

smell is a very subdued smoky chocolate , a bit earthy and a faint whiff of bbq sauce .  i enjoyed this stout as it warmed up to room temperature . this is as black as you can get which is expected for a stout .  mouthfeel is incredible , one of the smoothest beers i 've had .

on its incredibly smart looking clear bottle it even claims to be a bitter ! best compared to the very similar budweiser and millers from the us .  it poured amber in color with a creamy-brown 3+finger head that lasted quite a while . it left gobs of sticky lacing all over my glass .  mouthfeel : has a great mouthfeel . it has exceptional smoothness .

this hefe comes from a brewery whose name can be easily pronounced by an american speaker and as such , is approached with disdain and apprehension . if this were pfaffleschlutzelbraenhiemer brothers hefeweizen , i suspect this beer would be more favorably received . its all wheat and the faintest essence of fruitiness . some are hoppier , but the existence of superior beers dont make widmer hefeweizen a bad beer .  came out a murky amber-gold with a good inch 's worth of head on it . great retention , and perfect lacing rings after each sip . beautiful .  m : very creamy feeling , small bubbles , not too sticky .

the nose is n't prominent at all . all i can pick up is some muted honey cream and some pale malt sweetness with perhaps some clove . despite the short list of adjectives i used to describe the flavors , it 's actually very , very good for the style . this is a very good belgian strong pale and worth trying .  a dark body that exhibits a reddish tinge when held up to the light , with thick lacing spiraling down the side .  mouthfeel is a heavy but perfect . heavy with lots of lactose , light but fizzi carbonation .

the aroma is coffeeish , bitter . this beer is a pretty masterful beer of the style , but it 's not quite exceptional ( for a stout ) . considering the fact there was as much flavor left as there was , this would probably be a beautiful beer if drawn from a cask with a handpump .  perfect looking beer .  m : the carbonation on this one is perfect . perfect mouthfeel .

definitely a good looking beer , but the last one i tried from hoppy brewing looked good but tasted pretty bad . not a very strong aroma ... what is there is the typical winter warmer spice bouquet . very good , certainly a step up from the weak aroma . i really like the creamy mouthfeel ... just a hint of bitter aftertaste leaves it a mark or so down .  a - pours a dark , cloudy copper with an amazing two finger light brown head . the head on this beer was huge and crated with never ending retention and thick , gooey lacing .  the mouthfeel is incredibly creamy , with the tastes of chocolate and dried fruit coming through .

smell : light malt sweetness is so soft it is almost hard to detect .  a - golden yellow with a huge , chunky white head . excellent retention ang big chunky lace up and down the glass . beautiful beer .  mouthfeel : thick , creamy and full-bodied , smooth with just enough carbonation . spicy warming alcohol remains through the finish and leaves a tingly sensation in the mouth and a nice warmth throughout .

foam looks like insulation foam.. smells okay , not a whole lot going on , mostly dark malts .  pours a dark brown-black with a huge creamy tan head that retains well and laces the glass .  the hop particles make it sticky as hell , the rim of my glass is sticky , my lips are sticky , and the mouthfeel is outstanding ! as far as double ipas go ( which let 's face it this is really comparable to an ipa ) , i still prefer either pliny or any of the alpine ipas , but this is a nice change of pace .

a bit light on the nose . pleasant and fresh , but not ultra complex .  this beer was poured unhurriedly into a flute . lots of swirling carbonation and three solid finger s of thick creamy head .  the aroma speaks strongly of roasted grains , as you would expect from a stout , while on the tongue the beer has tremendous body .

rather subdued smells of hops and citrus and i 'm getting a bigger than expected malt .  convict hill oatmeal stout pours a solid black with ample dark brown head .  i keep tasting chocolate ice cream ... dry chocolate ice cream ... not cloy at all ... very fantastic finish and mouthfeel ... german beer ftw will buy again !

smell- bready with a light banana clove aroma . taste- light malt balanced with wheat/ yeast .  poured into a tulip . this beer is a beautiful gold . stunning and fragrant .  mouthfeel/drinkability- sublime mouthfeel , super-easy in the mouth .

- smell is almost absent . very light sweet brown sugar , very light malt ... all which traps a huge piney hop bitterness ... that just ca n't really be smelled . - fantastic light sweet malts ... .  color was a little hard to see as it was fairly dark in the bar but appeared to be a very deep red , that while really dark was no opaque . slightly off-white head that left excellent lacing on the glass . not sure if it was the branded oversized wine glass or what but this was probably the second best looking beer i 've ever seen .  beautiful .

i detect citrus and fruity aromas , but very faint .  first pour into pint glass from 22oz bottle- brilliantly clear straw color . head was bright and high but fell to an inch for the remainder .  it is full bodied and creamy in the mouth .

smell was unremarkable , not necessarily the biggest fan of 4 roses bourbon .  a beautiful brown with red highlights and a tan head that lasts and sticks .  5.0 on the mouthfeel with a huge creamy full-bodied mouthcoating that covers every bit .
happily , though , if you give it a minute or two , the stench fades away some , to reveal a nice malty aroma underneath .  beautiful ruby red color .  velvety mouthfeel and smoother than sinatra .
fairly non-assuming .  extremely cloudy , almost milky thick pale orange golden color .  this beer feels absolutely perfect in the mouth .

it did n't smell like much , which is dissapointing . i look forward to the roasted and hoppy aroma of russian stouts , but this one did n't come through very well .  much darker than one would expect from a trippel . rays of light are subdued by a swampy haze .  m : this stout has an amazing creamy mouthful like a well done milk stout without being too creamy or way too thin like most crap stouts . medium to full bodied ; a really nice medium carbonation on this one .

the aroma is a bit of wheat and sweetness but not much .  a - poured out a clear , orange color with golden highlights . it had a very small , white head of bubbly foam .  m : perfect . it 's thick without being cloying .
s : typical lambic funky smell .  pours a hazy yellow with very little head .  the mouthfeel is where this shines , exceptional medium body and smoothness .

smell : very , very faint smell of malt and floral hops . taste : very smooth , creamy , slightly sweet , with good balance and a nice hop finish . fairly hopped for this class .  very small tan head with minimal retention and lacing .  perhaps my favorite aspect is the full and very creamy mouthfeel .

an excellent golden yellow body with semi haze . smell is prety light , just a hint of the american hefewizen light crispness , zest . this hefe has tons of flover it just dosent need to blast your palate with them .  pours a somewhat cloudy red mahogany , with minimal head .  m= smooth and crisp . feels resinous as well which is great for an ipa . d= super drinkable .

very malty smell . sugary , raisin and malty flavor that mix very smooth .  a - hazy , pale straw yellow color with less than a one finger white head . leaves little to no lacing . color is right on for a pilsener but the head/lacing is disappointing .  mouthfeel is as silky as they come , the sensation over the tongue is as pleasurable as quaffing god 's nipple lactations . taste is , however , the killer here because it 's just not as explosive as the complex nose and full body could easily have supported .

the smell is more toasty malt than anything else , but if you must know that anything else is somewhat grassy barely grapefruity hops and a decent amount of caramel .  lacing is okay , head is minimal , not much retention..leaves barely anything on top aroma : sweet and fruity , hops ( citrus ) taste : malts come in well and finish off with a citrus hop finish .  the body is just fantastic : full , creamy and smooth .

this was my first experience with an arcadia ale and i most likely will never try their beer again if i have to pay for it . smell : harsh up front , but sweet and hoppy at the end .  pours a caramel with a light tan froth , good retention , & average lacing .  full bodied , heavy on the palate and full of flavor . i love it .

nose is kind of small and basic . mild green apple , sense of sweet malts and candi . not very big or noticeable or even complex .  sampled at the bbf a - pours a nice slightly hazy pale light gold almost orange with a very light head that fades quickly leaving minimal lacing .  mouthfeel is exceptional ! this beer is smooth , silky , creamy .

malt scent with a feint fruitiness to it .  pitch black with a thin mocha head that disappears instantly . no lacing , pretty standard stout appearance .  m : medium body with a fantastic carbonation balance ! amazing here !

s : toasted cereal grains , earthy and a bit nutty . very light sweetness with some light caramel and toffee notes . d : pretty drinkable and tasty . hits the spot if you 're looking for something malty but not toasty or heavy .  when poured with vigour , it ends up a pale and bright golden colour , with minimal head , although what 's there leaves some very dense and intricate lacing .  the texture on this is great . with the silky texture and sweetness , this is a good sipper , but nothing you 'd have more than 2 of in a single sitting .

not a ton of aroma , some carmel notes there though .  pours a bright copper color with a thin white head , a little lacing .  still i thought the aroma was alittle weak , but once it hits your mouth it is amazing .

really quite pale - barely gold . mild grainy aroma with a mild yeast quality . drinking while cold i think kept off any excessive taste from adjuncts .  the serving glass and size might have affected the appearance negatively . appearance 3/5 deep amber , slightly hazy , with a moderate off white head , poor head retention and some lacing .  a great take on belgium ale ; apples , pears , lemons , apricot and orange flavors nustle their way thru a carbonated full bodied swig .

a : transparent light amber colored beer , that has a good head to start off with , but it dissipates fast . s : hoopy but nothing special , not that potent . t : overall good . mild hops taste with hints of citrus , and a bit of a bitter aftertaste , but nothing overwhelming . very much so torn between 3.5 and 4 .  my pour created a finger of tawny head with decent retention . color was a slightly hazy orangish-amber .  m : the mouthfeel is perfect . full and creamy with a little grittiness in the texture .

smells not so much and like ripe guava ( combination of the hoppy cirtus and sweet frutiness ?  poured rather hazy in the glass with minimal head after a vigorous dispense .  the mouthfeel is outstanding . substantial , but not quite so thick as to confuse it with a stout .

nice lacing as well . a seriously good-looking brew . smell : malt right off the bat , with a certain underlying spiciness . the taste is terrific & # 8212 ; for a pale ale . not the best seasonal , per se , but a really tasty ale .  pours cloudy and warm chestnut under a diminutive cap of slightly pink foam that receeds to a film suddenly and quickly .  mouthfeel is exceptional . it feels good in the mouth but leaves no lasting memories on the taste buds .

clearly a well-executed lager . a - i actually expected more maltiness in the nose . not that i expected an aroma that 'll knock me off my seat , a la your favorite ipa .  pours a very clear , pale yellow with almost no head , even trying .  the mouthfeel is fucking perfect : it 's thick and creamy .

s : aroma is of roasted malt , coffee and a hint of bitterness . t : taste of roasted malt , coffee , a bit of sweetness and a nice bitterness through to the finish which is quite dry .  it started a little harsh and sharp in its heat and hoppiness ... it softened up quite a bit with the chance to warm to room temp ... the beer pours dark but thin ... dark roasted brown color with crimson highlights under the lights . opaque at the deep points , but the thin edges reveal themselves , allowing plenty of visible light to shine through . it allows the milky carbonation to open up ... higher levels of carbonation here ... not surprising that rd finishes hot and dry . the thin character allows for increased drinkability ... a very solid beer .  mouthfeel is super creamy and silky smooth .

s-smells of heavily roasted coffee , a bit of chocolate , and that 's about it on this one . t-roasted coffee upfront with those nice characteristic porter notes : chocolate and roasted malt with some vanilla notes .  a : pours a murky orange/ruby color with a thin cap of fluffy tan head that sits on top .  mouthfeel- this is an exceptionally smooth saison , with the mouthfeel rivaling that of the saison dupont , my favorite of the style and one of my favorite beers . the tank 7 is definitely a thicker beer , very complimentary to the flavors .

upon first pour the nose is negligent , revealing only a slight twinge of alcohol . very little hops in the nose .  santa 's little helper pours a flat , inky black into the glass . a thin tan head quickly dissolves to a thin ring around the surface leaving behind only a couple spots of lace on the glass . other than the flat appearance it 's top notch .  mouthfeel is phenomenal , rich and creamy it 's quite thick and chewy without going over the top .

smell is heavy of malt , and a bit spicy .  a : dark orange , very translucent . you can see that it 's quite fizzy . layer of golden foam quickly dissipates .  the mouthfeel is outstanding , substantial and even sticky .

lots of lacing that only adds to the beauty . smell - hoppy with a nice malt backbone taste & mouthfeel - let me just say that this one is highly biscuity , and i love it .  this poured a clear medium golden , white foam head , that left broken lace all the way through , taste was nice , rather bold hops , up front , then mellows , to a bit of a sweet aftertaste , citrusy notes , fruit and hop nose , bit of apple , and lemon . mouthfeel was a little chewy , but fairly rich and full , drinkability is very good , nice summer brew !  mouthfeel ; very tight and lively carbonation , slick and creamy in the finish , pretty complex and admirable .

smell - pretty faint but hints of floral hops and sweet bready malt . a well produced pa but smell lets it down .  12 oz bottle into a tulip . appearance : opaque , deep copper brown color with a disappongtingly small tan head that quickly faded to a thin cap before disappearing completely .  the mouthfeel was very very thick and creamy and not as thin as say a sierra nevada .

nice grapefruit citrus taste . a nice malty front with the citrus and slight sweetness undertones .  appearance : really cloudy , reminds me of a wit . pours yellow with an orange tint .  deliciously smooth . coating the entire mouth with a lasting finish .

smell : i personally do n't smell much with this ... a little bit of chocolate and hazelnut .  a - golden amber with a thin off-white head that dissipates quickly .  excellent mouthfeel and not too heavy .

s - was not very aromatic although i could faintly detect some coffee maltiness . t - while i am not a frequent drinker of porters , i found this one to be good . very tasty . d - the overall effect of the smooth taste and the unexpected light-medium body made this porter very drinkable . i think porter fans will appreciate its coffee/chocolate characteristics and more casual porter drinkers will find it very approachable . very good on its own and would probably pair well with a hearty stew , a roast or possibly a chowder .  a- dark amber with large off-white head that slowly dissipates to nothing .  the mouthfeel is perfect . it is full bodied with low carbonation , and oh so smooth .

based on tasting notes poured golden with 1/2 '' of white head , with good head retention & very good lacing s : some herbal & lemony hops t : lemony hops , & a little breadyness .  i was unaware this was an unfiltered beer , so i got lots of yeasties in the beer which made it cloudy and sort of foreign looking . i dont really mind it , but it doesnt look good and could serve as a detractor for some . nice white head and some decent lacing .  bear republic really , really nailed the mouthfeel on this one .

not too much in the way of the aroma department , kind of dissapointing .  once left to settle after the pour - i felt it was a bit murky looking , like dirty dishwater - not really a ruby colouring - i guess ill settle and say it was pale brown .  m - smooth , silky , full body with the perfect amount of carbonation o - great brew !

orangish in color with white head that sticks around s-not much on the nose as i would expect . more malt than anything t-lots of different hops . more piney than anything .  12oz brown bottle with a bottle code that i ca n't decipher . thin layer of tan head holds its own and leaves some lacing on the glass . opaque brown with amber hues when brought up to the light . coffee flavors comes in slow but becomes a dominant flavor middle to end .  t- the taste is starts out very smooth and creamy from the mouthfeel with some of roasted malts quickly followed by a nice bitter finish . m- the mouthfeel is silky smooth from the oatmeal with a moderate amount of carbonation . d- very good stuff , and not too boozy for a 9 % beer even though you can feel the warmth .

nothing exceptional here .  poured a bomber into a pint glass , producing a decent head , a golden amber color and not much else .  mouthfeel is silky smooth , really nice . body fairly full and the beer leaves an impression all the way over the tongue .

smelled very malty with a little pinch of hops . tasted malty and sweet , with caramel and toffee undertones and a roasty finish .  a : pours red-brown , with slight haze and a light haze that quickly drops to nothing .  mouthfeel is utterly smooth with just a hint of carbonation ... placidly perfect .

smells are light too , and crisp . nothing sweet or piny to note .  appearance - cloudy yellow color , with small head that faded out .  the feeling in your mouth , however is gorgeous ! smooth , silky , incredible.. so incredibly good that i actually said 'incredible ' in a french accent because it deserved such smoothness ... i 'm not going to lie , as for drinkability.. i 'm not as into this as anchor 's or even sierra nevada 's , christmas offerings this year , but it is still very drinkable to this lass .

the aroma is lightly fruity and deeply roasty with some mild bittersweet chocolate , some soft dry tobacco , and stale wet coffee grounds .  pale orange like an unripe loquat . smells just like a pumpkin pie . taste like a pumpkin pie with a lot of spices .  this beer has an excellent mouthfeel .

this irish stout surprised me in all regards . the color is pitch black , with only a thin amount of head on top holding in a slight coffee/nutty scent . the taste is of toasted barley and coffee , and is balanced extremely well .  pours hazy reddish orange with a thin head that soon becomes patchy .  ( not a huge coffee stout fan ) ( blasphemous i know ) the greatest thing about this beer is the smooth creamy texture that is present while drinking .

aroma is mellow . nothing super amazing going on here .  served in a tulip glass at american flatrbread in burlington , vt . pours a cloudy yellow/golden color with a thin white head that dissipates quickly .  really wonderful . the mouthfeel is the most impressive and outstanding attribute of this beer .
surprisingly underwhelming . wow !  orange hue , thin head , dissipating quickly , leaving lace on the glass .  mouthfeel - heavy body with mild carbonation . it 's perfect to me .

the smell was earthy and of tart fruits .  appearance - like a pilsener , golden , small head , medium high carbonation . laces reasonably . mouthfeel - just right for pilsener .  mouthfeel : delightfully creamy and full-bodied . very pleasant .
smell is weak , thankfully the taste is not .  the beer poured black , with a tan head that had low retention and lacing .  mouthfeel was virtually perfect .

pours a hazy straw yellow with a healthy tan head . smell of grass , pilsen malt , sweetness and hay . there seems to be more flavor and it is extremely smooth with very few flaws . very drinkable ; even sessionable at this high abv .  granted i gave it a swift pour as i was n't expecting this much sediment .  mouthfeel : fantastic . great carbonation , no real aftertaste and washes easily over the palate .

what i liked most was that it was well balanced and not a hop bomb in my opinion . i love sierra nevada pale ale and i think fans of that will like this too if not more . very drinkable and probably could go through quite a bit on a warm sunny day .  orange in color and cloudy . a pretty color to be sure but otherwise not outstanding . lots of sediment in the bottle , so pour carefully .  the mouthfeel is full and velvety .

smell : really expected a bit more from this . chocolate and coffee aromas at the fore . also roasted malt .  golden-orange color , almost transparent and practically no head .  m : great carbonation feel with a nice medium body . amazing here . perfect !

and now these famous waters are again being put to good use as the principle ingredient in local ales . spartesian is a soft , summer ale . it is exceptionally pale in a dramatic hue of sun-yellow . fortunately , my tastes stray far from `` timid '' and i was able to settle in to a satisfying appreciation of this very pale beer . it has low co2 , no smell , little forward hop flavor , and a vivid lemon color . but the smooth body makes it an easy drinker on a summer 's day and i was left wondering if that billowy mouthfeel was attributable to olympia 's famous artesian well water .  a- motor oil black with a milk chocolate brown head that seemed inconsistent on tap . on one pour the chocolate-brown head took up 3/4 of the total pour and took several minutes to dissipate into a manageable 1-finger head . on another pour there was no head whatsoever and even when swirling the glass was difficult to generate any frothiness . the body was pitch black with no light getting through .  mouthfeel : exceptionally smooth and silky as can be .

bitterness is very balanced and in the background . very drinkable lager ! clean tasting and pretty smooth .  nice oily sheen to this ; some head retention & above average lacing s : plums & other dark fruit , a bit of leafy hops t : boozey plums , dark cherry , woody hops , dryness & a bit of cakeyness up front .  mouthfeel is what always gets me on these beers , i love the chewy creamy coats your throat feeling here .

s : here 's my one complaint : light citric hops , light caramel malt . good , but way too light . my nose was wet before i picked up anything .  pours a golden yellow with very little head .  mouthfeel : spot on in my opinion . medium to medium-lite body with perfect amount of carbonation .

either is the rye . i sought out rye as i chose it to pair with an herbed chicken . the smoke is light as well so i suppose i could call it a bock . the hops , as expected , were n't pronounced .  somewhat muddy at first pour . very , very dark-ok i will call it black . low caronation head wise but seems lively enough .  extremely smooth tasting beer . bodied is so full its nearly chewable . mouthfeel is full and round . finish is clean and very smooth .
s : mild malt aroma with a slight hop note in the end .  pours an orange-caramel color with a pretty large white head .  m - perfect carbonation .

hay and some sweetness give this beer a fairly simple aroma . grainy flavored beer with some faint pale malt sweetness .  poured into a snifter , an opaque muddy looking deep red/brown color . a small 1/2 finger head forms and dissipates quickly . leaves no lacing . this is an interesting looking beer but not above average .  amazingly smooth going down ; full bodied with light carbonation .

color - light golden hue smell - i give everything a 3 because i have a poor sense of smell taste - great initial taste - nice burst of flavor right at the beginning and pleasant alcohol aftertaste mouthfeel - perfect carbonation drinkability - nice beer but due to having 9.0 a.b.v .  pours a straw yellow from a 12oz bottle to a standard pint glass . dissipating to a half finger head with good lacing .  mouthfeel is heavy and smooth with a nice small bite of carbonation , wonderful .

08-09 winter bottle out of a 6pack . smell has a bit of alcohol in there which i would expect , but i did n't pick up the alcohol in the taste . very powerful and tastey . i may have to get another 6er to age .  a - the low , poorly retained off-white head is disappointing as is the hazy golden yellow color .  t- pretty solid all around . very smooth , robust , and thick .

draft beer in a bottle is as good as it gets with mgd . nothing fancy , this is a great bbq beer . throw some burgers on the grill , crack open an mgd and have a great day out in the sun . not the best beer made by miller , but a great cold filtered brew .  '' -- german proverb mahogany brown with reddish caramel edges and a thin slice of khaki colored foam that should have been bigger given the increasingly aggressive pour . the featureless head shrinks to a barely covering film in minutes and leaves no lace .  incredibly smooth mouthfeel , likely due to the aging .

s - a very light nose , almost imperceptible . the yeast spice does start to come through . some alcohol warmth . t - starts very smooth , grainy and sweet - seems like loads of pilsner malts are present .  pours hazy copper with a creamy 1 finger tan head that faded about average time ; good lacing that clings to the glass and leaves rings .  the mouthfeel was phenomenal . to have a cask conditioned beer is such a treat , and i 'm glad my neighborhood bar always has one beer on cask .

the smell is that of a traditional lager with a little roasted malt to it .  ) poured into a pint glass a : pours golden pale orange with less than a finger of thin white head . not great retention .  perfect creamy mouthfeel .

for such a strong tasting beer the aromas are difficult to pick up . mostly what i get for a smell is a malty sweetness .  hair of the dog adam slightly chilled , served in a wine glass minimal carbonation and no head , just a few large bubbles .  mouthfeel is thick as hell and creamy , perfect for a big ris this is smooth as hell , much smoother than beers with this much ash flavor usually are .

s - an overall dry aroma of pine , juniper , and dried yeast . not too strong , but there . t - pretty yeasty for an ipa , but not bad .  poured with a smallish fine cream colored to very lite tan head and a little lace .  wonderful full mouthfeel .

s : very feint smell , chocolate note , but a bit of roasty malt as well .  a - pours cloudy dark amber with medium head . my glass had some dark particles in it .  very nice full bodied mouthfeel . easily drinkable .

smell is a bit muted , whiff of malt .  good bubbly , head . the variance in size of bubbles making up the head , almost give it a lumpy appearance .  mouthfeel was phenomenal - silky smooth and with a slight hops bite on the tongue , giving 'way on the finish to a great caramel sweetness .

* the smell is feint , but boy does that thick and milky head stick around ! * it 's lke a scottish ale but without the bite ; not harsh . * smooth and milky * major big swath of milky lace * taste is sweet actually ; some chocolate * the scotch ale taste is there , but very mild ; not as pungent as usual * has a alcohol presence , but it is subtle * it 's a balanced scotch ale , not brutal .  a - pours a deep brown with very distinct ruby highlights . thin off-white head and very little lacing .  thick with just a little bit of slickness and just enough carbonation . sly fox oatmeal stout is a solid beer with a fantastic mouthfeel ; probably something i would order again .

the nose is surprisingly mild , with just a hint of mild flowery hops .  appearance : medium carbonation , 1 inch head , dark brown smell : malt , chocolate syrup -- like bosco , and cream taste : chocolate , burnt malt , nut , and cream mouthfeel : sweet , medium bodied , smooth drinkability : this is a surprisingly sessionable stout .  the finish lingers for a while , almost spicy with a slight alcohol burn m - pretty ideal for this style i thought .

smell : there is very little coming through to my nose . a hint of fruity smell , somewhat like apples and oranges . coupled with very nice hops .  poured a hazy orange/dark peach color , providing not much of a head and leaving behind hardly any lacing to speak of .  mouthfeel : very thick and very very smooth , wonderful mouthfeel .

s : a funky , doughy yeast aroma .  appearance is a brown to dark copper color with not much head .  where this brew really stands out is the creamy mouthfeel . that smoothness works to perfection with sweetness , but does n't work quite as well with bitterness .

s - there is n't much of a very strong aroma with this beer , but what is there is hints of caramel , lemon , and pine . d - flirts with being sessionable , but is more of a `` couple pints is good '' deal imho . overall - a very solid pnw ipa . pretty tough to beat for $ 4 a bomber . if you 're in the mood for a decent ipa , this one will deliver .  a - nice dark caramel . not much head , not much lacing .  the mouthfeel was spot on and the taste was close behind .

s : a bit oc chocolate but not much to the nose here t : malty chocolateness , along with a bit of bready malt .  2007 vintage . poured into a snifter . no head after pouring . thick and black . minimal carbonation . the appearance of this one is the only thing that must bring it down in the ranks as the other attributes are top notch .  mouthfeel was awesome . farily prickly carbonation with some slight drying on the finish due to the barrel aging .

smells of caramel and ... pepper ? very faint .  poured from the bomber into my harpoon ipa glass the appearance of this beer is only average , there is a good 2 inch head but its only off white , and the beer is a dark reddish brown when held up to the light , yes thats right light makes it through this imperial stout .  m - huge , thick , syrupy , creamy , perfect carbonation .

looks great , clear burnt orange/ harvest orange color that has hints of brown . smells has some vague fruity esters , lemons , a hint of pepper , almost a hint of tea leaves . upon re-drinking i can gladly up the score a bit but still feel there are better saisons out there .  it tasted kind of dry , rather like champagne with the flavoring of berries and just a hint of carbonation . this was a very good beer from leinenkugel and i will be very happy to buy it again .  feel is pretty rich for the style , although it 's medium body it 's almost full really , with such a rich , smooth feel . excellent . honestly , it 's not very typical of the style at all , but i 'm not letting that change my rating .

possibly the best maltese shandy i 've ever had . a- pale yellow and a big big white head that rises quick . s- nose is very faint.. a bit of lime . like a limeade , some sweet slickness that builds in the finish . ugh , i know it 's a lime shandy , but still , it 's like chewing on tropical antacid tablets . o- still the best maltese shandy i 've ever had .  2009 vintage pours a very effervescent straw color with 3 fingers of fluffy ivory colored head . hazes a bit a the bottom , duh ... average head retention & lacing s : grassy with apple peels , plus lemons t : apple peels , white grape , lemony hops & a wee bit of dirt & tartness up front .  full creamy mouthfeel with a low carbonation . thick , thick mouthfeel .

appearance- it has a nice straw golden yellow body . smell- pretty plain and not much aroma to speak of which i thought was odd for bavarian beer . taste- it has a very nice but even hoppy taste for a beer of this style .  12 oz bottle a : dark brown under a very small off white head . no retention and no lace .  m : nice and light , yet still has some body . very smooth , good carbonation , good residue . exceptional .

sticking my nose into this thing there is a bit of pine , grass , earth tones , but not much else .  appearance : the beer is a slightly cloudy beer . with good head retention . the beer has a thick white head when pourd and reduces to a thin lacy head .  but the mouthfeel is absolutely incredible .

aroma is a bit muted .  this beer had an inviting lightly roasted grain aroma , rich amber color , and a crisp mouth feel . while i am primarily an ale drinker , this lager had enough body to satisfy while being light enough to have a few .  body is medium-full for style , and this is just about perfect on the way down .

there is not much in the way of aroma , slightly sweet with no hop aroma . the beer is full bodied , smooth across the tongue .  a- hazy reddish brown with ____ head that dissipates to a ring .  m= perfect dryness and crispness .

aromas of hops , yeast , and mellons . smooth and mellow with plenty of depth ; i really liked this beer , but it did n't present itself in both appearance and smell as well as it tasted .  a-pours a mostly clear yellow-gold w/just a touch of haze . white head with average retention .  m - creamy and rich . the carbonation is very laidback ... almost feels as if it floats on the tongue . very soft ... puffy , in a way .

i really appreciate the distinct discernability between the ale and the stout . there is not enough presence in the nose to have this same quality in the smell , as there is n't much there in that regard . the offering is very drinkable as well , a bit lighter in the mouth than i would prefer but good nonetheless .  this beer pours a mirky brown with a sizeable light tan head .  mouth is extremely crisp , clean with tremendous carbonation and a nice light body .

very subtle , nothing spectacular . t - light initial wheat flavor that follows with a sweet/citrus aftertaste .  pours a super black with no head and no lacing . another flat looking beer .  however , the mouthfeel of this beer is phenomenal , on the tim of your tongue it tingles , in the middle it is smooth as silk , on on the edges it is a touch syrupy ( amazing ) a good beer , but not worth the price they charge for it .

the nose was lightly malty with a slight fruitiness accompanying the sweetness . the finish was bittersweet and extremely pleasant .  planet porter is a lightweight porter with a sienna brown color .  mouthfeel is outstanding . super thick and syrupy , that flavor coats the palate forever .

smells mild . pine and clean alcohol .  pours muddy brown with a tan head than disappears . almost opaque and ... yeah brown is the only color it can be called .  the carbonation is perfect . i love this .

s - kind of muted actually . maybe some slight dark fruits and touches of rum soaked bread .  normally a bright deep ruby color , the cask version of the beer was a hazy brown with virtually no head on the pour .  bitter black chocolate moves into the woodiness and finishes boozy m- creamy , full-bodied , coats the mouth and boozy heat d- really impressed with this one .

aroma of malted grains , hops , very nutty and sort of citrusy .  looks like typical malt liquor , yellow , no head .  m : medium body with the perfect amount of smooth , yet lively , carbonation . truly excellent .

it 's flavor is very rich w/ a slightly bitter finish . the maltiness is very enjoyable . another fine beer from victory  continuous streams of bubbles , but i would like a better head retention .  the mouthfeel is absolutely perfect for a porter , so smooth and silky .
strong hoppy aroma with a floral hint .  a- slightly hazy light amber with floaties , and a half finger head .  the mouth feel is the richest and thickest i have ever tasted in a beer !

smells of barley malt , with a hint of dark chocolate .  this one pours a dark and murky , dirty gold in color .  m : fairly full body is well-attenuated for its strength , with an off-dry finish . perfect balance imho ... just enough residual sweetness to keep the alcohol from being too drying .

surprisingly the aroma is relatively uneventful with some roasted malt and dark fruit .  i got just a little head in my chalice , and what i got did n't stay long .  mouthfeel- damn , this sh*t is creamy ! smooth , medium carbonation , but goes down super smooth . nice light bitterness in the aftertaste .
smell was subdued and malty . fresh , grainy . highly drinkable .  a - poured a cloudy golden yellow with very little head . lacing was average .  perfect mouthfeel .

nothing particular made it stand out from the crowd , but it was definately good and strong and hoppy .  pours a clear golden , big white head forms , billowy , goes fast , no lace to speak of .  tiny bit of alcohol flavor let 's you know it can do some damage m : super creamy dipa , full bodied , good bubbly carbonation ( do n't know why there was n't much head though !

s - very fresh but light aroma .  poured a 1 finger white head that dissipated to random bubbles . laced in thin broken rings .  the mouthfeel is outstanding , like an expensive champagne and it finishes very dry .

very dark with a light tan head . smell is not too impressive and kind of fruity .  faded whitish lemon yellow with a waffer thin cap of white foam slipping right off to a skinny collar .  m - perfect body .

the aroma was clean , woody , spicey , and fruity .  pours a clear orange with a two fingers worth of fluffy head that subsided quickly . a good bit of lacing down the glass . this is a highly drinkable beer that masks the alcohol well .  all the great flavor of the bottled lhms here , but perfectly creamy and full in texture . this only further reinforces my belief that nearly every big beer should be served nitro .

not a lot of aroma . crisp mouthfeel with a very nice bready , wheat flavor .  pours typical saison ... hazy golden straw , filled with hints of brown highlights .  the mouthfeel was amazing . nearly full-bodied .

s- not getting much smell . brew is a little too cold as it was in my basement . very nice . d- this is a very drinkable beer .  rather short head with no retention or lacing and the faintest of foamy rings on the cap .  the mouthfeel is freakin unbelieveable for me . unique and probably the finest mouthfeel i have felt in any belgian , ever .

s : notes of bubblegum , a bit of pepper , and a hint of orange , very faint smelling beer . t : starts out like it smells with a bit of a sweet bubblegum flavor with a bit of a sharp pepper but then does a 180 and has a bit of a dry/bitter hop taste , it 's not too strong but it 's definitely there .  appearance - decent looking burnt orange/peach color .  mouthfeel is heavy bodied and velvety smooth .

s- not the strongest of aromas , hard to pick up . i get some pine/citrus hops and belgian yeast spice .  pours out a very dark color , black , with a bit of ruby/brown highlights on the edges . a cm thick brown head sits on top , looks fairly dense , but falls away kind of quickly , leaving only a little bit of lacing .  full rich mouthfeel , particularly fun after back-to-backing the hansenns cassis .

looks fantastic in this erdinger weizen glass . smell the nose is of yeasty wheat and malt . drinkability this is a very drinkable beer .  a- poured into a glass with a thick 3/4 '' foamy white head , which quickly dissipated , leaving no lacing behind .  mouthfeel was creamy and exceptional . i was surprised to be able to drink the whole thing since i am not a fan of coffee at all , but this was a pleasant change of pace for me .

this beer is only available on tap in the boston area . its got a great color a deep brick red color ( hence the name ) . its got a nice malty sweetness to it with a mild hop finish . its a great red ale and one of sam adams best beers in recent times .  pours a clear , pale golden color , with minimal head , but fair lacing .  sweet malts are offset by crisp hops together producing a wonderful balance and mouthfeel . sooo smooth !

very clean aroma and taste , classic sammy smith . the complex grain profile makes it so delicious .  i have no idea how fresh this bottle was . the best before date was very faint and hardly ledgible . light amber/gold , airy head disappated quickly but did leave decent lacing . top rating for drinkability comes from the fact that it was pretty darn good despite my doubts about the age .  mouthfeel was absolutely terrific .

the aroma is very weak . actually , i ca n't get any aroma , even with a big swirl .  apperance : rubarb and red apple in color . head was minimal and so was retention . color was light and tan .  m/d : a full body that is creamy and velvety smooth .

t : this beer has a little malty but mostly hops , actually more hops than expected . m : reasonably full d : very good , i had a second pint  pours a light bronze with notable carbonation .  this beer has an amazing mouthfeel , very full and luscious , super smooth .

s : smells like oranges and has a slight malty scent , like sweet smelling syrup . the sent is very light though .  whether pineapple , blood orange , or , especially , mango , smells flatter nostrils , so far as to think of fruity candy without becoming sickening fact . by cons , viagra - the so-called present - seems conspicuously absent except by micro-extracts .  m : incredibly creamy leaving a nice coating around the mouth that tingles slightly .
the beer was thin , watery , with a touch of bitter hops .  pours a beautiful deep brown , very little head quickly recedes- no lacing .  m- feel is exceptionally clean and smooth .

soapy lacing stayed behind . very crisp aroma of burnt sugars , yeasts and nutmeg . very sweet . and drinkable ... to a point .  appearance- pours out a muddy brown color with a small off white head . a good amount of particles floating around .  m : the feel is thick and chewy with a nice creamy texture .

nose is slightly malty . flavor is dark fruit and some alcohol burn .  pours out pale yellow and sits a gloriously bright orange in the glass . a small , a forcefully poured white head sits on top , but is soon gone .  the mouthfeel on this beer is abosolutely amazing , almost like carbonated cream , it is wonderful and invites another sip immediately .

smell : a bit musty , some hints of banana in there , but not as appealing in the glass smell-wise as it was when i cracked the bottle . quite nice .  looking forward to this evem after the disappointing eipa and apa a- very hazy , milky even , brown . white head looks like warm milk froth . lots of stuff floating about .  this is one of the thickest beers i 've had . very heavy and smooth mouthfeel .

smell : yeasty wheat , dry and straightforward , expect for a slight strofoamish hint in the background .  64oz growler poured into tulip glasses : a : pouring into a tulip glass from the growler purchased yesterday at portsmouth brewery , the alt is surprisingly headless . other than that it is a gorgeous ruby red hue .  mouthfeel is perfect , my ideal belgian .

the aroma is a variety of differnet malts with a very slight spicy scent that i could n't identufy .  well ill be once ya get a good pilsner , it does make a difference ! very sturdy brew here , started off by a lemon yellow pour , with a smallish white head ( lil disappointing ) .  silky silky smooth on the mouth , it makes it feel as light bodied but if you take the time to get a feel it 's almost medium . just fantastic . o- this is deffinitely a good saison , the mouthfeel is the highlight .

the aroma is somewhat faint , i pick up some raisins and grains , pretty disappointing for a bsda .  a- medium amber with a quarter inch white head that disappears very quickly , an inviting unfiltered cloud lingers as you continue to sip .  m - creamy and full in the mouth , so good , this is just what i want in a marzen .
aroma was a bit lacking .  it did not have much of a head , so i was a little dissapointed . but hey , what a beer .  m - extremely smooth .

color and smell is nothing to get excited about .  drank from a bottle the taste was that of really good choclete and hints of coffe . no real bitter taste had a light smell of choclete to it over all etremelly drinkable and refreshing . alsohada light carbination not too much or little justenough to givethe right amount of fizz this beer is in my opinon up there as far as import beers farsuppour to a guiness wich is overlly bitter .  this was the first belgian i ever had . it has a very creamy smoothness that i really love . finishes long and dry with more fruityness .

s- only could smell sweet and smoke . the only off area was the smell which is usually the area that lacks in most of my reviews . overall this was a great beer .  pours a hazy mud brown with little to no head .  mouthfeel the best part of this beer , really smooth with just a little bit of carbonation .

smell : aromas of spice , yeast , and a hint of citrus . what it lacks in smell it makes up in appearance and ever moreso , taste .  pours yellow/gold with a small head that goes away immediately . lots of dry hop floaties in this beer , not as much as green flash west coast ipa , but you get the idea .  perfect . d- a remarkably smooth beer , although a bit mild .

smell- very light smell . a bit of grain and that 's about it . taste- very flavorful . very impressed with this one .  bottle poured into a tulip a : pours a translucent amber color with an eggshell hued , fizzy thin head . the fact that it 's considered an american amber is truly an insult . it has the appearance of an amber , but the aroma of a belgian and the flavor of a porter .  round velvety texture , excellent carbonation , and ( as you would expect ) some warming . exceptionally satisfying brew - if not my absolute favorite from unibroue , it is the one i return to most often .

i really enjoyed this beer . it really did not have an aroma .  unclear , amber , with some carbonation seen rising up through it . no real head at all , just a bit of white dusting and some dusting gathered in a ring .  all kinds of malty goodness going on here - silky smooth , slightly pinpoint carbonation .

the nose is doughy soapy water and yeast . spicy hops hit first chased by metallic sweetness with a soft-baked quality .  pours a fairly clear dark straw with just a wisp of white head .  m-grand canyon deep and gordian knot complex . amazingly tantalizing on the palate . while it looks still in the glass it bursts with palate stimulating carbonation with each sip . like an amusement park in your mouth ! this is a highly enjoyable and palate stimulating sipper . a mighty fine drinking brew .

smell is pretty average - sweet maltiness and slight citrusy hop aroma .  ruby red with brown and garnet highlights . not much head , pink to off-white .  a great feel that has a body that replenishes itself .

moderate yeasts and slightly sweet on the nose , with a mix of fresh and dried fruit . rather light for the style yet obviously restrained by a copious surface cap , holding the volatile smells at bay . this beer looks better than it smells . all is good again in the flavor of this beer .  poured a hazy pale gold color with a thin white lacing barely covering the top of the beer . the head all but disappeared after a few minutes and did n't really leave any lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel is of a super smooth , velvetty batch . this may be one of the smoothest , silkiest brews that i have had .

esbs are not stop traffic hot chicks , but they are the type of chick that can give good head ... so this is on par . nose ... surprisingly musty , tones of malt and caramel are lurking around the back of the joint but are n't quite in the door , nothing offensive , nothing aggressive ... not much to quaff here taste etc ... tastes a bit like the smell except the aftertaste really develops nicely , up front it is slightly bitter with that musty flavor that leeches into the fluggel type flavor and rounds out with a mild cascade floral/p [ ne hop character . this is perfect at cellar temp ... nothing too complex here but man this beer just is a pleasure to drink .  poured slightly chilled in flared glass a : no head , decent beads , clear mead color s : honey , persistent smell of honeysuckle t : light ale , very floral , very complex ; lots of honey , lavender ; it 's like drinking a fancy handsoap ( meant to be a compliment ) ; buttery undertone ; ok , let 's call it soapy , but i think this flavor profile calls for that .  ideal texture for an ipa .

rich malt lacing . drawback : only subtle hints of malt in the aroma , but with the quaff came a load of malts and an earthy , spicy finish .  poured into a tulip glass . dark opaque effervescing with a slight reddish hue .  for the style , this is an exceptional mouthfeel .

excellent retention , only slowly fading into a lasting cap that coats the glass with rings , streaks and splotches of soapy lacing . earthy hop aroma with hints of soil and pine needle as well as some faint fruit character and a prominent malt backbone . there 's some faint pineapple and grapefruit in the nose but the hop profile mostly gives off an earthy scent .  pours an effervescent amber with 2 fingers of cream colored head . average head retention & lacing s : caramel , leafy hops & breadyness t : breadyness , some crackery notes , & a bit of toffee up front .  the mouthfeel is full and warming , in fact , this beer is a huge belly warmer .

bit of smoke in the nose , but overall subdued .  shared a 6 pack with some friends ( peacebone116 and his wife and my wife ) , sadly didnt have the option to get an appearance since we drank them from the bottles on a picnic . a n/a since it wasnt poured into a glass , so ill go middle of the road with a 3 .  the beer itself is pretty thick , and mixed with the lingering foamy head , it feels great in the mouth for savoring what taste there actually is .

the nose was lightly fruity , yeasty , and malty , but not pungeant enough for my preferences .  a - poured a cloudy orange-colored body with a slim , bubbly off-white head that reduced to a wispy film and a thin ring of retention , yielding sparse lace that slid down the sides of the glass .  what got me hooked was how smooth and creamy this beer was . fantastic . this beer is by far one of the richest and creamiest beers i have ever had .

appearance-golden bright yellow color , very white head grows to three fingers settles down at two and stays there . smell-malt appears in the form of dried bread , also light grassiness and the lightest bit of hop flavor , clean of any alcohol . overall-a very successful kolsch , easy to drink . a great first try for this beer style .  there is a decent amount of head but it dies down quickly .  great palate , though . even when it gets warm , great warmth and sliky smooth syrups .

smell is pretty mild with just a hint of roast malt and caramel .  i heard such great things about this beer that i figured i should enjoy my first from the can . smooth ; very good for the summer . best canned beer i have ever had ( the rumors were true ) . recommended if you want a stronger pale ale for a backyard cook out , or a few beers doing house work .  altogether pleasing to the tongue and brain , it also had a beautifully full mouthfeel from the oustandingly appropriate delicate carbonation .

s- dull smelling dry hops , wheat malt . well balanced with bitter dry hop nose , complex wheat malt finish . the nose lacks however .  a - pours a muddled brown color , thin collar , that 's about it .  awesome mouthfeel .

s : smells of pumpkin , nutmeg , also something sour i ca n't put my finger on . t : taste is much more impressive than the smell ; tastes like a boozy pumpkin pie but the sweetness is held in check nicely .  a - a pale yellow color with a white head that retracts very quickly , a few carbonation bubbles are running to the top .  easy to drink due to it 's creamy mouthfeel and pleasant flavor .
smell is almost non-existant to me .  this beer is a dark gold color , with a small cream colored head .  silky , creamy , and perfectly textured , this mouthfeel ca n't be beat .

adeep , dark , rich brown ; about a 1 inch thick foamy head that disappeared quickly , light lacing on the glass sspicy with a strong plum scent ; a little banana and clove aroma as well . i liked the taste very much but the smell was a little strong and foul for me .  poured a hazy blonde very similar to a witbier or hefe , with notable carbonation . very small head , but with some lace making it all the way down to the bottom of the glass . very drinkable , especially during the summer .  m : soft , smooth carbonation , big and viscous body , excellent finish . there 's very little more that i want from a big ris d : i drank my bottle in an hour and was craving more notes : i did n't really expect much from this beer because nh have n't really impressed me with much of what they 've done but hot damn , this was impressive !

n : lemon peel , citrus and some kiwi ( ? ) with some sweet malt smells . hops come and go in the aroma , knocked out a bit from the orange and coriander .  there was no lace .  taste again where do i start ... sweet , spicy dark fruits soaked in alcohol ( raisins , currents , dates ) , toasted caramel notes , bready , some brandy / rum traces , biscuity , warming alcohol , spicy hop bitterness forces itself through the sweet maltiness , light madeira wine hints ... feel - so silky smooth ... rich and creamy ... light viscousness.. low drinkablilty for this one - a beer for savouring and sipping slowly ... overall - a phenomenal beer ... highly recommended .

a malty aroma with some notes of coffee and nuts greeted me before my first sip . this is a very good full flavored beer that hides it 's 10 % alcohol very well .  golden , peachy orange with just a touch of haze ; not much of a head , but what 's there is fine and white . klsch-ish aroma but with a touch more fruitiness ; apricots and golden raisins , golden syrup and scones , hints of honey and malted milk with a honeysuckle floral overtone .  mouthfeel is perfect -- light but not watery , highly carbonated ... perfect for the style .

s - mild aroma ( i wish i let it warm up a bit , at 11 % i would n't be surprised if it opens up ) . soft woody hops . touch of melon . d - the hops are strong enough to slow you down , and while not harsh in your mouth , the alcohol lets you know it 's there .  clear golden with a thin off-white head .  m- creamy smooth with just the right amount of carbonation and a nice , dry finish .

smell : roasted , malty scent with a burnt undertone , and hints of coffee .  based on notes , picked this up in las cruces , nm poured an effervescent amber with a very modest white head . average head retention & lacing s : fruitty with some musty notes t : apricots & peach , plus some honey up front .  t/m - well carbonated , providing a prickly yet very smooth feel as it rolls across the tongue .

smell was zesty , definite hints of citrus and wheat .  a : pours just as the name states a golden color with 1 finger width white head and really no lacing down the glass .  the mouthfeel on this beer is great , so creamy with just enough bubbles that make it not to syrupy .

poured deep brownish black , thin head smells of dark roasted barley , not too overly impressed but typical .  appearance : a hazy yellow , head fades fairly quickly , and there 's not much lacing . aside from the color it 's nothing fantastic .  the best part of the rwanda gatsinga coffee stout is in my opinion the mouthfeel which is extremely smooth and leaves a pleasant malty coffee-dominated aftertaste and a smile on your face .

smell was a little light but developed after taste was introduced . if agitated there is a burst of floral smell tasted good .  had to try this while at dragonmead as you do n't see many pumpkins around in april . amber color , clean with minimal off white head that fades quickly .  mouthfeel is superb . great level of spice , perfect carbonation , medium body .

the aroma is peaty smoky malts , leather and tobacco and maybe some vegetables . sweet toffee comes out as it warms . it 's unusual and odd and i 'm not sure if i like it .  a - a cloudy white gold . this actually seems more `` white '' than many belgian whites . not much in the way of head , a tad disappointing .  the mouthfeel is luxurious , thick , and chewy . amazing . i am impressed with this brew . flavors are great and the mouthfeel is unearthly .

there was n't much aroma to speak of , but what there was was sweet and just a bit spicy .  500 ml bootle from germany pours dark brown with large off-white head that soon dissapears , the small rising carbonation bubbles create kind of prickly surface , no lacing .  m - the creamiest beer i 've ever had . wow . thick , smooth , perfect .

aromas of hops , alcohol , and yeast .  appearance : dark orange-copper color ; a little hazy ; very small head on the pour smell : a pleasant hoppy smell taste : excellent : fairly balanced ; mild hoppiness with a nice sweet malt flavor to balance ; very tasty ( not watered down at all ) mouthfeel : medium bodied ( im really surprised this is on 4.87 % alcohol ) ; its a lot thicker than other 4.87 % beers ; this must a have a lot of unfermentables in it drinkability : good flavor ; good body , so its going down pretty quick overall , an excellent beer .  the feel is super dry , tannic and superb on the palate , rough , sticky , and full ... easy to drink as this crushed by the girlfriend and i in about 15 minutes .

the smell is a little off putting , but once you take the first sip it is very easy to get over the smell .  a : pours black with a finger of tan head that recedes into a thin ring with no lacing .  great relaxed flavor , it has a nice sweetness to it , a good malt body ; it would be a great beer to drink while out on the river all day , as it has a wonderful flavor without having too much ( it was made with this in mind , according to one of the brewers ) . goes down extremely smooth with a great crisp , sweet aftertaste . ( had on-tap at the star city vfd brew fest fund raiser .

the beer smells like fresh paint .  fairly dark brown with ruby edges while holding to the light . small tan head that goes away quickly .  mouthfeel is thick and chewy , as it should be fir a beer of this strength .

it 's very drinkable and has a pleasant , subtle mix of grain , hops , and english yeast . the aroma is very muted , even for this style , i just get a little grain dust , but the taste holds lightly caramel barely and gentle , spicy hops that finish the beer out . overall , a great session beer and a rare locally-brewed example of the style .  nice bubbling and ok foam that recedes to nothing .  taste & mouthfeel : smoothness is impeccable within the moderate body , big doughy biscuity malt flavour is the showcase of this brew .

s : not much of a nose on this . ethanol , some roasted malts , hops and citrus . t : what the nose lacks is more than made up for by the taste .  it really reminds me of swamp water with little head to speak of .  mouthfeel : perfect , just like champagne .

nose has some citrus rind , soapy alchol and prickley pine but all relatively soft . would have been close to a 4.5 if the nose was a little more developed .  the beer pours a hazy golden orange with a small amount of head .  m : very viscous and full . smooth carbonation and a nice stickyness make the mouthfeel very complimenting to the taste .

s - nothing too over powering . some nice sweet and hop aromas . but hard to pick out any specific scents .  poured a golden/yellow color , very clear , small amount of carbonation . i 'm not sure i would call this an english style ipa , i would personally classify it more like an american ipa because of the big hop presence .  body is the best part of this brew . flavors are all in check , mouthfeel is full and fat , with a straw-like dryness at the finish . this beer is exceptionally drinkable .
all are very light scents .  appears clear copper with small wispy head .  mouthfeel is lucious : creamy and oily , rich in the mouth , but smooth enough to want more and more .

strong malty smell , along with some dark fruits soaked in alcohol ... cherries or plums .  12oz bottle poured into a chouffe tulip pours a lightly chilled golden yellow with a one finger paper white cap that did n't stick around all that long . a little bit of band aid like funk just to make things interesting .  the carbonation is fantastic -- beer feels creamy and smooth- almost velvety .

this brew poured a very beautiful dark brown color with some nice red flecks . the aroma on this brew has a bit of caramel and some faint malts . not a whole lot of aroma coming from it . as it sits a bit , there is a little bit of a nutty aroma . there is n't much else . though there was a bit of lack in the aroma department , this brew makes up for it in the flavor of the brew . it begins with a wonderful blend pale malts , which is quickly followed with a nice punch of caramel and cocoa . it was exceptionally good . i enjoyed it very much this is a great drink .  appearance : pours a one finger medium but `` light '' looking light brown head with decent retention . film eventually disappears leaving a thin ring and no lacing down the sides . average for the style . the average appearance held it back in the ratings a bit , but the rest of the experience was top notch .  m- big , full body ... oily , almost syrupy with unattenuated sugars . very chewy , and it coats the mouth so well . just wonderful .

on cask at glouster arms in oxon . the aroma was subdued but featured some malt notes , rasin and a bit of esters on warming .  clear gold with a small bubbling white head . very balanced and enjoyable ... perfect for sessioning anytime .  the creamy , delicious texture pairs well with the flavorful personality of the smoked porter . the dancing carbonation paired with the brews creamy-smooth feel and intense flavor essentially block dopamine receptors in your brain .

very bitter citrus smell . sweet to the taste .  hmm organic and spelt so this is a no wheat wit . very pale with a light fluffy head and lots of carbonation going on . a touch of lace but not much . notes of lemon and wheat like twang . excellent thirst quencher and it goes down like your favorite cold soda on a 100 degree day .  m : full-bodied , silky smooth , velvety rich and downright luxurious in the mouth . these guys have this whole mouthfeel down to a t. notes : malty rich , fruity sweet , and explosively spicy , this bspa is quite enjoyable !
smell : very faint nose until it gets warm .  pours a light copper with a soapy light tan head . poor retention and scant lacing .  mouthfeel is full and round .
mild roast with a bit of fruit like character .  a - pours with a thin fizzy white head that dissipates quickly .  smooth , creamy , almost velvet like . really enjoyable .

a- pale golden yellow , has about 1/2 in head laces beautifully with lovely activity s - really nothing there , watery slightly malty with just the faintest buttery sense t - wow super smooth with a lot going on .  its got a very smooth and full taste with a good amount of hops , malts , with a sweat finish . at 7.2 % abv its got a good kick to it , and enough of these will get you drunk dialing real soon . as far as altbiers go , this is a damn good one , especially for an american made one . so grab yourself a six pack and enjoy .  mouthfeel is fantastic ... light , dry , well carbonated , and quite bitter .
s : nose is very subtle for a -bal aged beer . muted chocolate , cocoa powder , and roasted malt .  a very cloudy orange color .  m : rich and creamy . very chewy and thick . little carbonation .

from tap into a pitcher , then into a frosty 16 ounce mug at brick house pizza in west richland , wa . s- dark malts . t- nice rollercoaster in the mouth : started only slightly sweet , built to a robust dark malts , maybe a hint of charring , then dissolved with a touch of hop bitters . finished nice and clean with the alcohol completely concealed .  a - transparent and dark copper almost brown . a thin tan head that neither sticks on the glass nor hangs around too long .  unbelievably smooth in mouthfeel - bittersweet chocolate and bitter roasted notes played effortlessly on your tongue .

smell : not much smell , the small amount i am getting has nice coffee and mocha notes . taste : this really shines in this category , like the smell suggests this has strong coffee flavor with a nice mocha after taste that really becomes apparent several seconds after tasting . the light mouthfeel and the carbonation make this very drinkable ; almost scary drinkable for an oatmeal stout !  it poured a dark brown color with some red .  so creamy and smooth it 's almost not a beer ...

'' ok seriously this beer has a great appearance , orange haze color with a good inch head that is white and frothy and hangs around awhile . the nose is n't very strong , but i 'm picking up slight alcohol and earthy tones , something else on the finish i ca n't quite get a finger on . earthy tastes on this one as well as a citrus type candy with a strong tequila booze finish , slightly hot breath similar to after a shot .  pours a hazy , reddish-brown color with almost no head .  mouthfeel is exceptional . very smooth , great carbonation , but not enough to distract from the flavors going on .

smells neutral at first , then smells a bit sour . starts a bit sweet then gets tart .  cloudy , even dusty , in fact it is opaque . the color is a rusty ochre with no head to speak of .  m : one of the fullest and creamiest dipas i 've ever had .

a = pours a nice copper color with a 1/2 '' white head s = smells slightly hoppy with citrus undertones t = very much a citrus taste with slight clove undertones .  brown color beer with some ruby notes .  the mouthfeel is great ... medium on the palate , but slick and well carbonated ... compliments the black pepper flavor perfectly .
