smell : i 'm really not getting much aroma off this . perhaps a hint of grasses , but barely . taste : nice malt taste with a light bit of citrus ( lemon ) and grasses .  appears a light gold with a dense 1 finger white head that lasts for a minute .  the mouthfeel is velvety and thick .

smells of a typica quad , a bit spicey and harsh .  it looks pretty much just like an ordinary old dark beer . its really really black , the head that rises with a pour is small and off white , there is really no retention at all , no lacing .  m : a great , great medium body , that grazes you at the tail with sharp carbonation .

feeling inside the neck , it is totally smooth so i have no reservation about the safety of the beer , but the carbonation is another thing ... aroma - roasted grain , kind of woody , a touch of coffee beans .  pours black with a few large light brown bubbles that quickly burst leaving a glassy top without even a thin ring around the glass .  very smooth and rich taste though and perfectly balanced . wonderfull to drink though think it should be drank as i do n't think that more age makes this one any better .

the smell is hardly there , but i do get the twist of saaz hops and some nice wheaty bready and certainly grainy malts , a clean overall smell just not very strong .  from notes ... had this on tap in prague at a chinese restaurant off of hastalska street a : dark copper colored beer with a small but lasting head s : not much , but some malt and hops ... t : much more filling and thick than a traditional pils m : smoother and thicker , but still crisp d : very good beer , a nice change of pace from the pils abound in prague .  thin in the mouth but heavy on the tongue . perfect for the style and the season .

smells of some heavy brown malts , some toast , a bit of spiciness underlined with a hint of booze . overall , a fantastic and robust offering from a favorite producer . puts countless other pas to shame and raises the bar in an excellent way .  growler poured into a weizen glass . an aggressive pour at that , but the 3 fingers of foam reduces to a skim in short order . lazy streaks of lacing here and there .  m : an incredibly thick body and big , foamy carbonation . i love the way this feels .

aroma is mainly of brown malts with a slight roastiness and nuts . nothing else to note here . kinda boring really , but right there with the style .  the beer pours a dark amber/brown , forming a thin white head that fades quickly .  fantastic mouthfeel .

smell was very mild . malty and slightly peaty with a bit of fruit .  pours a cloudy orange-ish straw with a small white head that quickly sinks to a very thin ring .  the taste is a rich velvety malt with an amazing mouthfeel and a fully satisfying richness .
s ; has a mild roasted malt aroma with a good bit of sweetness mixed in .  this beer is brilliantly clear and is a very pale , gold color .  m - perfect for a porter .
smell was alcohol and burnt malt .  preface - i always rate brews to style ... a - very average . no head . or lacing .  smooth grit with comfort .

mostly malts , but a little caramel/toffee/sugar . t : sweet malty flavor throughout . very enjoyable , but maybe could have used a bit more hops . the eliot ness holds a special place in my heart .  the pour leaves a beige fizzy head temporarily resting on a base of burnt , amber colored beer . head retention is only fair at first but dies quickly .  nice full bodied and well carbonated mouthfeel .

a little roasted grain and a whisper of coffee . i 'm a little disappointed . t : i think this is the widest gap i 've encountered between smell and taste scores . the smell was a let down , but everything i was hoping for in the taste is here . m : this had the smooth silky body i expected from an oatmeal stout . the smell score was lacking , but this has it were it counts .  `` brewed with 4 gallons of pure maple syrup '' served in a shaker pint , t-town maple brown is a murky , rusty light brown with a thin egg-shell collar .  m- full , smooth mouthfeel .

smell is of molasses , toasted oat , and french roast coffee . for some reason i detect some alcohol in the nose too , and for a 5.5 % abv i 'm not liking it a whole lot . after the initial appearance and smell , i fell in love with this beer .  batch 031-34/240031811 notes taken on june 4th a- no head and no lacing .  the carbonation is very low ( natch ) , the body silky smooth , and dead creamy .

smell - rosey , very subdued , but a little too much so . just would have expected a bit more out of it , in terms of aroma . taste - this reminds me of a barleywine . there were lots of hops in this , but it was very smooth . you can taste the alcohol . not what i would have expected out of the winter warmer style , but enjoyable none the less . feel - extremely smooth with a nice mouthcovering .  pours nicely into beer mug forming a reddish purple body with a thin reddish white head that has some decent retention and a little lacing , and decent carbonation .  mouth is rich and sticky yet wonderfully smooth .

smell is small , hints of fruit .  good retention , no lace .  mouth is very crisp and finishes clean , excellent carbonation . leaves a nice tingling on the tongue . drink is very good i usually would n't want an ipa for a session beer but this one i definetly would have a few more for the evening .

smell : almost nothing to say here , the smell is very weak , it seems . from what i *can* detect , there is a gentle grassiness coupled with moderate sweetness . it 's unoffensive , and get more flavorful as the beer warms .  pours a decent head , disappates quite quickly , not much lacing .  mouthfeel : the mouthfeel is absolutely incredible for a milk stout .
the aroma was a simple citrus hints and some malts .  into a tulip , pours a decent head initially , with little lacing and no legs .  '' love the mouthfeel .

s : sweet malts and yeast on the nose for the most part . slight breadiness as well as a smidgen of hops , but not much .  poured a dark orange . the head was nice at first . then it turned minute and the lace ( everything ) was eliminated .  m - perfect feel to this medium bodied brew .

this was a wonderful helles , with the crisp maltiness one would expect from german lager . sparingly hopped , but enought to balance well . show this to a lover of the macros and they might convernt yet ! i wish however , that they were in brown bottles , because i got that slight skunkyness from uv reaction .  served on a tulip glass . a - hazy straw to pale gold pour , unremarkable head , short retention , fair surface ring and some lacing .  mouthfeel is extremely silky smooth .

a-golden in color , completely translucent in clarity , about a fingers worth of white head n-not really what i was expecting at all , the nose is more grass and citrus than any funk , some hints of oak and white wine but nothing crazy t-the funk is a little more pronounced , flavor actually reminds me of squatter 's fifth element , there is light green apple , grape , and malt m-light and refreshing with an almost champagne about of carbonation d-not as memorable as the first time i had it , but still a notable american sour , as i noted in the taste , this beer reminds me a lot of squatter 's fifth element , would like to see some age and additional sourness on this  goes into my goblet a very dark red with a small tan head that hugs the rim .  mouthfeel is full but not too heavy .

s - fairly dissapointing . for having lots of fuggles and goldings i was expecting a good hop smell . smell improves after drinking and warming also m - a little zippy with the carbonation but still well bodied .  pour was decent with minimal head and very little lacing .  mouthfeel : fantastic . rich without being syrupy . carbonation is just right .

faint roasted malt aroma , perhaps a hint of sweetness .  poured into snifter on 12/9/09 10/6/09 etched the bottle a - dense & hazy copper ; amber highlights . semi-aggressive pour yielded hardly any head . swirling is required to garner any semblance of retention . minimal lacing ; what 's there is sporadic .  but what might be the true feats here are , on the one hand , the quality and sock of the flavors given the abv , and the insanely creamy mouthfeel on the other .
the smell is hops , almost bitter , and faint malt .  ) it poured a nice pale gold with a decent head that left quickly .  perfect carbonation and ridiculously easy to drink .

s : dark roasted malts and coffee . kind of disappointing for the style and look .  on tap @ the brewery 03-26-09 pours a light hazy yellow , my friend ordered hefeweizen and i actually thought it was the dipa based on appearance .  a faint bit of tannins in the middle of the tongue starts the finish , which is incredibly long with trailing , vineous notes of chocolate and spiced orange peel . ya it 's a bit like those warheads candies , but it 's tucked in such an incredible silky richness .

i had mixed feelings about the noble pils before it even came out , as i had always enjoyed the white ale that sam adams had previously marketed as its spring seasonal . basically , i feel like the white ale should have remained the spring beer offering , whilst this beer should have become a full time staple of the sam adams line-up . great taste , and easy as hell to drink !  courtesy of raindog , thanks sir body is dark brown and initially wears a tan head that fast becomes one of the quickest dissipating festival of bubbles i 've ever seen .  mouthfeel was great , it was very rich and smooth with little carbonation but it fit the stout just right .

no faults here ... s : citrus , roasted malt , cocoa , and chocolate malt . all very light aromas . t : acidic darker and roasted malt , the same cocoa as detected in the smell is present here as well .  pours out to a clear dark brown , forming a modest light khaki head with average to poor retention and minimal lacing .  m : perfect carbonation .

to be honest , the aroma is the worst part of this beer , because i love the taste .  somewhat cloudy orange appearance.head that doesnt quit.wonderful aroma-oranges , spice , malt all reign supreme.dough boy-awesome flavor ! huge malt flavor-great spicy flavor.the orange highlights are really nice.coriander , peppery.huge full body-slightly oily.very well rounded overall.a killer beer-could enjoy this on a regular basis.really has to be the best unibroue product i have had .  the head portends the exceptional mouthfeel .

smell : pretty faint compared to what i was expecting . some burnt malt , stout-like aroma . faint hops aroma , crisp ut a littel disapointing . improved as it cooled revealing more burnt malts . wonderfully complex stout .  bought a michelob mixed sampler 12 pack for $ 9.99 wow , big surprise here ! i may be a spring chicken when it comes to beer drinking but this was one of the better hefe 's i 've had and to think it comes from ab .  mouthfeel : it is crisp , light , and perfectly carbonated .

nice lacing developed . the aroma was of some barely noticeable malt .  pours out semi-hazy , though it 's bottle-conditioned and there is a thick layer of yeast in the bottle , requiring a firm pour to achieve a modest creamy light-tan head with poor retention and sparse lacing , leaving a thin layer of sticky clumps .  mouthfeel - great smoothness , i was inclined to take a deep draw at the outset , very quenching . restrained carbonation adds to the smoothness .

the smell was not too intense but definitely of apricots . my first apricot beer , and i was n't disappointed .  it is cold and looks refreshing . the beer is a hazy gold pour with only a small white edge layer of head . hmm . was hoping for a little more froth . besides the lack of substantial head a good example of the style i think .  medium body and a wonderfully sprtizy carbonation keeps it light and makes the tartness manageable .

the nose is very mild , with just a hint of malt .  appearance : very effervescent . poured a absolutely clear golden yellow , very small off white head .  mouthfeel : wonderful balance all over the pallets and each taste-bud . the slightly raised abv can give cause to the minor warmth in mouthfeel .

light aromas of sweet fruit and a hint of chocolate ... but it is very faint !  slightly hazy , deep reddish brown colour with a thin cap of light beige bubbles . a little spotty lace clung to the glass .  it 's exceptionally smooth with little carbonation .

the aroma is slight clove , some bubblegum , but that 's about it . taste is rounded and smooth , with the clovey and bubblegum from the aroma , but also with alcohol warming and candy sugar flavors . medium bodied and drinkable , it 's good but not really a first class beer , and not worth $ 6.29 a bottle ( 22oz , john 's marketplace , portland or ) .  a nice dark appearance . not much head and very little lacing down the glass .  m : very soft , finely carbonated medium body .

smell is less then expected for a german hefe , little bit of wheat , a little cloves and yeast , no bannana like i was hoping for .  remarkably i found myself in a bar in portland which was bereft of ipa , but , realising that one can rarely go wrong with a deschutes beer , i ordered a mirror pond . it was somewhere between amber and bronze with a slightly acidic smell which i would n't like to expand on since my venue was bigger on smoke than beer . this was a well coordinated and very drinkable beer with a reasonable feel ( lots of small bubbles ) . i find deschutes to be the most dependable brewery ( never a bad beer ) . good stuff !  really coats the mouth for an excellent mouthfeel .
the aroma is very weak though .  minimal head and little carbonation movement , smell : sweet molasses , alcohol , roast malt .  the lush velvety texture takes control of your mouth .

s : nothing really distinct in the aroma . the alcohol definitely stands out and the smell reminds me of a good whiskey .  it had a dark bras colored body not as bronze as i would have thought . there was a lot of tan head and lace . this is a very frothy beer .  mouthfeel is velvety and smooth . great length on the taste .

the aroma is more dull , but the flavor has a nice mix of sweet wheat grains ( bready ) with creamy ringwood and spice .  certainly does n't look overly intresting .  m- the mouth feel is excellent for this beer .

nothing outstanding .  a - poured a dark , almost opaque ruby color with extremely little head even on an aggressive pour .  carbonation is just right . mouthfeel is full , lush , but the carbonation keeps it clean .

s : weaker aroma than i expected but i might have hyped the wet hops in my mind . floral hops and citrus `` dominate '' but the nose is still weak .  appearance : murky reddish brown , very little white head , no lacing .  m - rich and thick , very chewy .

perfect for drinking on the patio on a summer evening or with a light lunch ! been looking for a good summer beer since the demise of petes rally cap ! this has hints of citrus in a bright light beer that goes down all too easily !  was a little gun shy given my last wee heavy experience..aka mcewan's certainly not as dark as my last wee ... .more like a cola in color and clarity with a rich tan head , zero lacing .  m/d : full creamy body with light carbonation , pretty drinkable for 9 % .

nose is tangy wheat with a bit of a roasted flavor and a touch of herbal hops . good overall and interesting as this is my first dunkel .  poured from a 12oz brown bottle into a clear pint glass . a : not-quite-black dark brown with a tiny wisp of a tan head that materializes with some delay but does n't stick around long and leaves a few dots of lace . the lack of head made me wonder about packaging issues , although the flavor was excellent .  medium bodied beer combined with very active and tight carbonation combines to create an exceptionally creamy beer .

probably our favorite beer from calgary beer fest 2009 so i may be a little biased . honestly 1 good looking ipa ... hazy copper color , excellent head with good retnetion and huge webs of lacing to boot . ahhh ... the let down ... as in aipa i have come to ecpect a bit more in the nasal dept . this offering certainly score on a nice balance between hop and sweet malt ... but does n't knock my socks off ... if it were an eipa i 'd score it higher . carbonation level is almost perfect ... allows all the flavours to come trhu without any fizzy bite . very drinkable and is now my goto ipa  got a decent head however is was pretty weak and died quickly . coloring is light yellow that i did n't expect at first but now i see this is a pilsner thinking it was a pale ale . i guess corn ? this beer is solid !  m- incredibly smooth with a nice carbonation .

lacking a little bit on the smell but the taste has all the usual fall spices in these seasonals . very drinkable and balanced with a nice body to it . along with the lack of smell , there 's also a lack of carbonation i thought , which would have improved the score .  a ) amber in color , about 1/2 inch of head , which was gone before i could get my nose into the pint . no lacing . the smell is like pumpkin pie . in fact , i said to my wife , this smells like pumpkin pie .  mouthfeel is where this beer really shines , and makes one understand why some folks are such lager fans . the balance in this beer is amazing , with everything seemingly in the right preportion .

i really miss schlitz . schlitz has more of a hops flavor than any other american lager that i 've tried . but i think that schlitz is the best american adjunct lager out there today .  kind of goofy throw back ( 50 's ) look bottle ( works well with the duke ellington i am listening to at the moment ... ) eyeballs ... straw with a brownish tinge , nice head , withstanding well , solid carbonation , nothing fancy nothing rancid nose ... bready , almost belgian esque but a bit breifer.. malt and subdued hops like honeysuckle rather than a full on bouquet.. pleasant enough mouth action ... a nice fullness without being heavy in the least , fills the mouth amply without over carbonation , the feel is excellent across the whole pallette , this reminds me of what a `` mild '' fullers esb would tast like , quite enjoyable , nothing overwhelming , just a nice malt ( not too sweet ) start and bare bones hops that finishes dry enough to not drown out the wonderfull mouthfell verdict : an excellent session beer , not as agressive as say long trail ale in america but similar in its ease of sip and nice full feel across the whole mouth .  mouthfeel : so smooth and creamy . very refreshing .

faint clean scent the malty base swiftly gives way to a spicy resin that lingers so long you can get lost in its subtle piney suggestions of cinnamon and nutmeg .  pours a reddish amber with a quickly fleeting rocky off white head .  very smooth and full bodied mouthfeel , with medium carbonation .

but what i can smell is a lot of malt with some caramel to it . ( please remember on this tasting that i do have a stuffed nose ; thank you ) taste : lighter malty ( spelling ) taste ; great body to the beer ; smooth going down , not noticing the high alcohol content mouthfeel : feels like a well balanced beer .  500ml bottle bought from the vineyard , belfast ... poured a nice rich coppery orange colour . creamy head with some rusty hints poured quite small and then faded to light wispy layer ... no lacing and no carbonation to talk about ... aroma - nice strong , lightly toasted , biscuity malts , toasty bread , juicy fruits ( figs , raisins , oranges ) , strong nutty notes , caramel / toffee sweetness , some sea saltiness , the faintest of dusty / smokey notes , peppery hops , grassy traces ... taste nice strong spicy / peppery hop bitterness , juicy and vinous fruits ( raisins , prunes , bitter oranges , apples ) , strong toasted bread notes , caramel maltiness , burnt sugar sweetness , nutmeg hints , malt loaf notes , woody / earthy hints , some grassiness ... feel - initial sharp bite then mellows out ... light / medium bodied ... very very refreshing and drinkable - excellent session brew at 4.3 % ... overall - an excellent bitter ... i wish i had bought a few more of these.. definitely recommended..  mouthfeel is wonderful . very thick , full , coats the mouth wonderfully .

appearance - was excellent , as dark and opaque as any stout , very little head with no visible carbonation . smell - some mild sweetness from the malt with a hint of that coffee taste associated with dark beers .  a : pours murky brown with little head that recedes into nothing with no lacing .  the taste is initially of a very light porter and with a clean aftertaste that becomes a fruit sensation on the palate . the hop/malt balance is the real achievement here and it really contributes to the supreme drinkability . the smell upon opening the bottle is not an effective contrival of the taste that this beer is hiding as it only gives you an idea of the rooted flavor that is to be unleashed , the supreme balance and sublime flavor . great bier .

) aroma is mostly malt but not very impressive overall .  the beer is n't as hazy or cloudy as i remember , which is too bad .  m : wonderfully smooth . nice creamy texture that does n't stick too long in the mouth .

the smell is malty , very mild . mouthfeel is thick , rich , almost creamy .  appearance : tawny brown , quite hazy , thinnish layer of tan frothy foam , ok head retention aroma : rich malty caramel , tangerine , woodsy hops , raisins flavor : smooth malt sweetness with hints of orange marmalade , stewed prunes , hazelnuts , and herbally hops ; finishes semisweet with a brief fruity aftertaste mouthfeel : medium body , gentle carbonation , smooth and soft texture , slight warmth in the throat other comments : quite a scrumptious bitter .  great mouthfeel .

the nose was the least offensive part of this beer : ripe fruits , some bitter chocolate the taste on this beer was absolutely horrid . rotten fruit mixed with tobacco and cardboard . new holland produces some fantastic beers , this just happens to not be one .  bomber this one poured out light and orangey with a bit of chill haze . left a delicate lace on the glass .  great creamy thick mouthfeel , light carbonation .

where the smell was certainly nothing to write home about , everything else was quite impressive , especially for this style . the smell was a nice mix of malt and hops , but again , typical . not striking or unusual in anyway .  long trail- double bag appearance- orange/ cooper/ red with a small but respectable head that did a slight lacing along my glass .  very rich and full bodied , smooth , chewy , all while the alcohol is hidden .

a-pale cloudy yellow with a thin white head s-smells like tart wheat . medium strength t-comes in with a great and smooth taste of tart wheats . the germans might really be making this style the best . it tastes so much more genuine and pure than the other that i 've had .  from a bottle provided by doublej , thanks jon , a : pours a lightly hazy gold with a spotty light white head , average head retention , some lace .  mouthfeel is quite amazing , therefore the 5 .

s - it has a firm soap scent but a hint of caramel can be picked up .  appearance : a deep brown , with smaller head and lower retention of that head . nothing overly special , though i suppose it 's on the prettier end of things as far as brown ales go .  the mouthfeel was exquisite . tiny bubbles caress , going a little foamy , opening the flavor as it hits the back of your mouth .
s : nothing to out of the ordinary for a hefeweizen . t : slightly thick and creamy .  a : pours a nebulous reddish brown with a fast fading small head .  the carbonation is just right here .

the smell was a bit bitter -- -the only part i did n't like too much . i was very pleasantly surprised .  black in color , but lacks head retention and lacing which brings this down quite a bit .  given the balance and great mouthfeel , drinkability was quite good .

smell : just a simple beer smell hops barley a bit floral . a little floral like th smell .  appearance : light golden brown , slightly cloudy with decent head retention on the white head aroma : definate piney notes , with some sharp citrusy grapefruit in the aroma .  overall a really complex , fantastic stout , one i 'd be happy coming back to over and over .

s : not a lot of aroma . mainly sweet , bready malt . t : quite earthy , probably from the yeast , as well as the hops . d : very drinkable .  a hint of wheat in the flavor and the wheat bitterness that i guess is part of the beer . this beer makes me want to go back and try another sweet water blue ( a beer i didnt like much on the first go ) a beer i could drink some of i think , would pick it up for a pick-me-up .  mild-medium carbonation just enough to excite the palate . to me , this is almost the perfect mouthfeel .

s : faintly nutty , with no alcohol detectable . overall very mild , not really noteworthy .  not much of a head , a ring of bubbles lines the inside of the glass . deep orange/amber in color , and a very clear liquid .  very rich and robust brew almost creamy . again , excellent . thanks be to lou91 for the opportunity .

it smells of mild biscuit grain , light piney hops , a bit woody , and some funky floral hops .  besides the color ( pale yellow with a tinge of orange ) , everything else is amazing .  mouthfeel- the texture of this beer in the mouth is stunning and absolutely *perfect* .

smell is very mild , slightly musty and dry . sure sign of belgian yeast .  pours into glass to present a dirty straw/light copper/amberish color . at first pours with a small but nice looking head which quickly disperses . there is some lacing along the edges of the glass , but it does n't quite make up for the lack of a head .  m : the mouthfeel is delightful . fairly thick for an ipa , almost creamy with mild carbonation .

aromas are faint , a bit of spice and floral smells . but not much on the nose .  poured into a snifter , it pours a moderate brown that is difficult to see the light through . a minimal light tan head is formed and leaves a mild lacing around the edges .  m - very rich and thick , has a nice little burn and pop at the end from a combo of carbonation , abv and hop bitterness .

s : apple skin , musty dried fruit , creamed corn , slightly metallic . t : sweet and fruity up front - apples , a bit of raisons , prunes , figs .  this beer pours a hazy orange-red color . the head is half an inch in height , and recedes quickly into minimal lacing .  m : medium in body with a really smooth and creamy feel on the tongue .

on tap at de molen in bodegraven after the waitress walked the tap list board over to us after asking what was on tap . lovely . s - dark fruit malts obvious . bready with dark rye coming to mind . more mild than exprected . weak aroma but flavour is what counts for me , so this was good .  reviewed 6/16/2006 ( tap @ flying saucer , houston , tx ) : pours a dark black color body , but almost no head , tan colored , and quickly diminishing .  mouthfeel is quite exceptional .
mild hoppy smell , and malt .  minor head retained nicely , decent lacing .  mouth feel is incredible with some good champagne bubbling going on .

s- not so much here , unfortunately . some citrus hops with some sweet malt . slightly floral as well . t- good stuff , not too much bite not too much sweetness . this is a fine ipa .  poured from a capped unlabeled bottle from my buddy adam . no head on pour , some carbonation .  m- wonderfully creamy . the carbonation is spot on . one of the creamiest belgian beers i can think of .

the aroma is pretty unremarkable with the typical malt smell .  pale gold and crystal clear . modest white head ( about one finger ) that becomes a thin film and then a ring . lacing is minor perhaps due to glass washed in the dishwasher . a perfect easy drinking summer pils .  t/m : mouthfeel is perfect on this beer .

aroma is faint , but of roasted malts and some nutty and fruitiness . for such a mild beer , this is very impressive . full of flavour .  a dark orange body with a swiftly descending head that leaves no trace -- semi-opaque ... solid malt aroma with hints of fruitiness to develop a sense of complexity.. slightly effervescent , with a mellow , medium body that is pleasantly fulfilling ... smooth , malty presence in the back of the mouth ; little hops to speak of , but at this refreshing a taste , they 'd only get in the way !  a very smooth , luxurious malt backbone enhances the mouthfeel , but a bitter smack of hops reminds me that i 'm drinking an ipa . quite enjoyable .

s - okay , you can smell the malt and you can tell there are hops although they are not predominent as in many ipas . d - very drinkable .  hazy orange/gold color . big , creamy and very dry with driving , fine bubbles . alcohol sweetness is at the center of a complex of toasted nut , dried apple and dried apricot flavors . extremely drinkable though for such a heady brew .  very thick with just enough carbonation that completely fills the mouth and leaves a bittersweet flavor lingering on the palate , and a bit of a syrupy feel on the back of the throat with just a bit of alcohol heat that is perfect for the style .

smells of burnt toast , nuts and vodka . fortunately the taste is so very much more than the smell .  good initial head , but it dissipates to a single layer . the lace is spotty and light .  mouthfeel is where this beer shines the most , imo . creamy and rich and the carbonation is superfine , perfect . this one grew on me a bit as i got into it and it warmed up some , but still not a mind-blowingly good beer .

as for the odor , maybe my sense of smell was n't at its best , but i did n't detect much of a scent . the taste was very smooth , not nearly as bitter as one would expect from an esb , with a hint of caramel .  pours a blackish color on the pour . no head forms on the pour , only a slight ring develops .  m- really interesting . a dry feeling on the sides of the tongue and a sweet feeling in the back . really well done .

s medium malt , familiar to all ambers/red ales . not much else to the nose though . t nice medium malt and a nice woodsy smokiness that makes the taste smooth , a really welcome quality to a beer of this style .  poured into a weizen style glass that creates very little head atop a golden-straw colored body .  mouthfeel was full , thick , and creamy with a rich sweetness on the tongue .

smell was milder than i expected ( also could be due to the allergies/cold i have ) . malts and alcohol primarily . coffee aroma appeared much later , as it warmed .  the amazing extras from alewatcher just kept coming and coming . a- not much head , but i wasnt expecting that at all . the beer is a semi murky brownish color .  mouthfeel- light palate with great carbonation that tickles the senses nicely .

i remember when i reviewed jw dundee 's pale ale as pretty decent too . very lively . smelled like malt , there was n't much else . it 's more of a craft lager , which makes genesee go up on my scale even more .  this beer poured a dark brown with a minimal head , held up to the light , was n't quite crystal clear but a little hazy .  mouthfeel : fully body , lower carbonation , love it .

not much smell , quite light on the hops , but still has a nice floral character .  a - raspberry/brown color , not head nor lace .  each sip of this full bodied beer is smooth and creamy with light carbonation . this beer is so smooth it goes right down .

the dortmunder style is one of my favorites , easy going , not an everyday ( though it could be ) and thisone is done well . a frothy , pillow-like white head that stuck around and laced oh so well . the aroma was not overpowering , maybe alittle grass-like . this homebrew could be a great macro `` try-this '' offering great job , great beer !  label on the bottle says `` craft brewed brown ale . clear and a dark red-amber colour . even with it 's little head it still manages to leave some spots of lace .  the rich , smooth , roasted chocolate flavor works well with the silky body . this is definitely highly recommended , as the beers tend to be from great lakes brewing company .

nose is mild malt with a hint of floral hops and maybe some citrus .  it looks good , but pretty run of the mill . taste/mouthfeel : jeez , this is the little beer that could . looks like any other pils out there , but the flavor is outstanding .  just a hint of carbonation on the palate - utterly smooth .

mild aroma in a black body with an energetic head of light brown fine bubbles . it is a very nice smooth stout that i found myself liking more and more after each taste .  amber color , a half finger of tan head that dissolved to a fine film . no lacing .  in the mouth , the tiny bubbles announce and incredibly smooth and balanced beer , with a roasted , slightly sweet flavor .

as i lay gently wilting to the plaintive swelter of billie holiday 's voice , i crudely guzzled this ice cold beer of dubious fame . it was absolutely not the time for a westvleteren 12 , or a imperial stout . it was even too hot for hefeweizen !  i thought this was a pretty decent brown . the clear brown elixir is topped by a little head with some lacing left behind .  mouthfeel is as good as you would expect with an aerator . all in all , you can drink it for the mouthfeel but do n't drink it for the taste .

s : the grain and metal come through far too much here . this smell automatically makes me think of watching sec football in a fraternity basement ( and being unable to feel my face ) , and that 's not as fun as it used to be .  a - cloudy . yellow . not much head .  at least it was smooth and the carbonation was just right .

aroma however is the usual sour corn mash cardboard mess !  from the growler the beer pours a murky orangish brown color . the head was n't all that great , but that could be due to a dirty growler , glass or the fact that i 've had it in the growler for four days . because of the aforementioned ( i assume ) lacing is also lacking .  creamy mouthfeel with moderate carbonation .

a- brillianty clear , no head retention , dehydrated piss yellow color s- pilsner like noble hops aroma with a corn sweetness , also skunky smell .  when i saw the beer it wasnt the most impressive beer i have ever seen , but i felt that when you make a cherry beer it would look like this , in that aspect the brewer had gotten exactley what they wanted . when you are making a cherry beer you should smell cherrys and nothing but . the beer seemed to be perfectly carbonated and didnt give me any reason to review it as bad . i feel bad to ever give out a bad review but to me this beer was like a fine painting that would never look good in my house but i can thoroughly appreciate the effort and time put into it .  medium full bodied , somewhat creamy .

by the way , is a beer to drunk fast because the taste when it 's in a high temperature is very bad . the merchandise is greater than the taste but is better than other brazilian pilsen style beers .  pours a dark brown , near black , color with brown highlights around the edges . minimal lacing . apperance is nothing special .  flavor is malty and sweet , and on the finish , bubble gum ! mouthfeel is firm , and drinkability is high .

there was no hint of any aroma what so ever , i had a smaller bottle at a bar the day before this review and although i enjoyed the beer , it also had no smell .  orange amber color was semi clear . head was well formed but disapated fairly quickly , lacing was scarce .  very creamy and full . very dry .

a - clear s - nothing really to report on smell t - for a light beer it has an exceptional full taste m - just the right amount of carbonation d - i could drink this all day i can see myself drinking this at a bbq in the summer heat .  a - pours a slightly hazy straw color with one finger of quickly dissipating white head . very little lacing .  let me first say that the brugse tripel used to be one of my favorite beers . nowdays its called brugge tripel and the taste changed slowly ... but a lot of small steps make a big one and today this beer is nothing what it used to be . smell of spices and a little hops , not fresh at all and a dull taste make it just a drinkable beer but nothing great like it had in the past .

s- smells a little too sweet , maybe it 's just me . t- above average for a beer this cheap . lightly grainy , sweeter than average , corn with trace hops detectable .  small , short-lived white head tops a golden colored brew , slight haze but mostly clear .  mouthfeel is good , slightly thick .

an uninspiring golden hued beer lowers itself into my glassware with a small flurry of fizzy pop-like bubbles that fizzle out just as quickly . when i lean in to enjoy the aroma i find myself confused . did i somehow imagine pouring a beer into my glass , only to find myself sniffing empty space ? nothing that makes me think `` mmm , now this is a hefe-weizen '' .  poured from a bomber into a nonic glass . a : opaque , dark brown color with over one finger of light beige foam head . scant lacing remains on the glass .  was pretty decent mouthfeel : smooth and crisp , went down easy drinkability : good enough on a hot day and goes great w/ bbq .

slightly smokey malt aroma that is quit bland reall with faint hints of oak , toast , bbq , charcoal and bacon .  poured with a nice tan head which quickly subsided and a tiny bit of lace . color is a hazy amber brown .  mouthfeel : good .

standard aroma for a light beer -- but this is a pale ale ( ? ) .  poured into a tulip . pours a hazy golden straw colow with a bit of an orange hue to it . no head here , just a little bit of white bubbles .  hoping it 's one of those better in a bottle beers i 'm returning to give it another try . so far so good . maybe , and i 'm stretching , some neutral hop spice . this beer makes me try too hard . these hops should be hops should be ashamed of themselves . good malt base to support hops , were they present . bottle is equally bland as on tap .

does n't smell like much . i get some malt , maybe some peach fuzz .  a : pours a clear dark yellow with a medium head that dissipates very quickly .  taste : a wink of hops , than the shows over , a surprisingly dry finish mouthfeel : decent - nice restrained carbonation , ever so slightly creamy notes : this is the driest , and least bitter ipa that i have ever experienced .

smell is where it breaks down . took forever to find any smell at all and then only some malt and light hops .  cola-like brown in appearance . carbonation is a bit high on this very fresh bottle , but i 'm sure aging a few of these will mellow that , in addition to allowing the flavors to meld and blend together . quite nice fresh though .  mouthfeel is about the only thing going for this one . medium body and appropriate carbonation .

s : no lie , at first , i said it smelled like `` a cat . kinda turned me off .  it 's like an american dos xx = no slime ! it 's very drinkable and should be consumed with lime . just a great all around , drinkable beer .  mouthfeel : light-bodied but not watery . it had a nice feel to it .

s : initial unpleasant , vaguely sour aroma . that first noseful , though , not great . everything is in balance , not unlike a macro lager , but without any minor offensive flavors .  pours a transparent light orange with a small white head which eventually disappears . little to no lacing .  mouthfeel is actually pretty nice , medium body and carbonation with a creamy quality .

mmmmm . already turned 180 degrees from appearance to smell . let 's take a sip .  mmmm ... the appearance is n't anything abnormal/fantastic/special or anything else to write home about ... it looks like an ipa .  m : crisp and clean , moderate levels of carbonation and warmth . medium body .

the nose is of malted milk balls , cocoa , licorice , a touch of tar , oaky spice , and a hint of what i want to say smells like chlorine .  a - holy crap a lot of foam . point deduction for gushing . pours a very dark brown with a thick tan head .  it has a canned fruit essence to it , but i ca n't pick up what kind of fruit . first couple of sips and i get a strong cherry pie filling flavor . i eat a lot of fresh cherries in the summer so i do n't automatically associate cherries with pie filling . not overly sweet but it does have a tart tang finish . a unique beer that i appreciate as well done , just not to my tastes .

there is noe smell other than grain .  without any lace or head , but certainly had adequate carbonation . highly drinkable beer that grew on my palate .  the mouthfeel is very nice , it 's very carbonated which works with the ginger presence , and the mouthfeel is at about a medium thickness .

smell is barely detectable . some very faint light wheat , a bit of grassy hops , and yeast . but not much there at all , and what is there is n't impressive .  22oz bottle a- pours an orangish amber color with a thin and fizzy off-white head that quickly disappears .  while the mouthfeel is actually pretty good , the drinkability suffers from this same fatal flaw .

the appearance is average ( 3.0 ) , but i guess that 's good for an american adjunct lager with lots of tiny bubbles rising up through the yellow swill . the smell is neither good or bad , there just is n't any .  it was bottled in april 2010 , so i think i 'm good ... duped by the standard brown longneck bottle , i poured this into a standard american pint glass , and it appears a cloudy dark iced-tea colour , with a bit of swirling sediment , and a half finger of soapy pale beige head , which disappears quickly , leaving some sparse spidery lace around the glass .  mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation .
the aroma is sweet roasted grains and cola .  a -- old gold body and a nice medium head .  feel : moderate carbonation , medium body , exceedingly dry finish .

smell is not much , sort of bland with a bit of skunk to it , small hints of malt and grains here and there .  pours a dark hazy amber color with a thin fizzy white head that quickly disappears without leaving much in the way of lacing .  mouthfeel : medium-plus body . medium carbonation . some oily viscosity to the mouthfeel .

ah , moosehead . the smell is typical of lagers packaged in green bottles : a bit grainy and a bit skunked . nothing more to say . it 's nothing that breaks the bank , but it 's better than any us macro , and probably better than all of the canadian ones as well .  paid $ 15 even for the midwest taster ... the appearence was a cola colored base with a nice tannish head , minimal retention and no real lacing .  m - good mouth feel . somewhat unique in feel .

bottle into pint glass a 1 finger white head on top of a very carbonated golden straw colored brew , kept a thin layer on top but likely only because of the amount of carbonation , no lacing 3.5 s nothing more than a bit of grain and very slight florals 2 t pale malts and some quite apparent grassy hops and a bit of fruit fade to a sweet finish .  poured a 2 '' white head which dissipated quickly .  the mouthfeel is full and nicely carbonated yet still somewhat creamy .

in regards to the aroma , not much stands out .  appearance : nice dark brown but again the snow-globe of floaties that this brewery is known for . not much of a head and minimal lacing . ok , same old story , yet another very good beer from abbaye des rocs you just need to get past the floaties ( as usual ) .  medium mouthfeel .

probably more of the latter , but still ... this is my go-to beer when i 'm reaching for an ice-cold 40 ... they 're cheap at the local bodega ( about $ 2.50 for a 40 or a dollar or two for the smaller cans ) and pleasantly skunky enough to please your average `` ale '' lover 's palate , especially if you 're just looking for something tasty , cold , cheap and readily available on a hot summer day .  pours a very dark , clear , brown . starts with small , fizzy , thin head that leaves quickly , but maintains a nice thin , creamy lace . a medium tan color .  i did n't pick up the barrel aged at first but the body was quite full and large . worth drinking but i believe that there is better in the 8-9 dollar bomber range .

sweet and fruity aroma with some odd notes . actually smells kind of like tomato sauce ( ?  cloudy , obviously , but golden amber color with a modest white head that left a ring pretty quickly .  mouth is medium bodied , but with some good tingly action on the back of the tongue , so also good .

the aromas are of aluminum , pale malt , and caramel malt .  the beer looks almost still , and so there is no head retention or lacing to speak of .  mouthfeel is nice , good carbonation , but seriously , ca n't get over that ham finish .

purchased a 4-pack of nitro cans - a treat every stout lover must indulge in every once in a while . the cascading in the glass was also pretty impressive - got ta love that widget . personally i thought the smell was a mix between chalk dust and flat budweiser .  wheat beers are notoriously summer quafs , and the raspberry ufo is no exception .  this beer has a high level of carbonation with a very crisp and clean mouthfeel .

there is not much aroma to comment on ; slightly malty and grassy , but nothing distinct . i had anticipated a richer or mildly smoky aroma . similarly , i anticipated that in its taste as well , however , instead it tasted like a basic lager with a faint roasted malt and mild sweetness . it is a decent lager , but not as interesting as i had hoped .  this beer tastes like bacon if bacon = good and beer = good and this beer = bacon then for you , the beer = good if you do n't like bacon , do not get this beer .  mouthfeel : smooth and medium thick , low carbonation .

not much happening here . clean and dry but not particularly flavoursome . faint traces of lemon both in aroma and palate , and some bitterness / aniseed in the latter . but , ultimately just doesnt offer much at all , like most local examples of the genre .  '' a- one finger head goes away quickly , within seconds . orange in color with lots up bubbles .  mouthfeel - medium and smooth .

the smell is very weak with only a hint of floral wheat .  opaque orangish gold color with a little one finger head which makes its exit quickly .  body is on the full side of medium . moderate carbonation .

nose is not there . hoppy after taste .  almost no lacing in the glass . much darker in color than most weizens/pale wheats that i have sampled .  it was somewhat thick with some carbonation , and had a hot aftertaste .

this beer pours a light slightly clouded amber with a white two finger head the smell is not that awesome all i get is a little oat slight hop maybe some banana taste is almost like a wheat ipa , i have heard this compared to wet and i think wet smashes this beer by far for the hop lover it definitely has a good hop after taste , but the forward hop presence is not available mouthfeel is up there with the best of them so smooth and creamy really surprised for an ipa it a good beer .  pours a deep orange amber with a light tan head that lingers for a while .  it had a smooth mouthfeel with a little carbonation .

s : mild , notes of carbonic acid and husky grain , that 's about it . t : bittersweet grainy malt flavour , with a nice little hop balance .  rich antique golden ale , with a one finger head that gives way pretty quickly .  m- medium viscosity with a well integrated carbonation .

very easy to drink , not a big fan of the smell ... i would definitely drink this beer again if given the opportunity !  a : a golden pour , topped with a white head that lacks much retention but leaves a thin sheet behind .  fairly thick body .

this beer is not terrible for what it is , its really easy drinking and is not offensive in anyone aspect . its definitely a way watered down version of there regular lager but its still not a bad beer for a light beer . its strong point is obviously its drinkability and its low point is you cant definitely at times feel its very watered down .  drank on-tap at the pig 's eye pub , hartford , ct poured a cloudy , straw yellow-amber with no head but rather a bubbly , bright white , disappointingly thin film of lace .  very silky mouthfeeland light body , very drinkable and good .

a - clear red orange body with two finger for frothy tan head and excellent lacing s - a little pine and a little citrus . i would n't call this a ipa smell and is kind of faint t - nice mix of flavor and bitter hops with a little spice and citrus in the back m - medium body with medium carbonation d - easy to drink and kind of enjoyable but nothing really special  i poured this one from a 12oz brown bottle into a shaker pint glass . a= this ale poured a very clear golden color ( filtered i would say ) with a fairly low carbonation release and a 1/2 '' white head . the head dropped to zero very quickly and did not leave any lacing behind .  mouthfeel : medium bodied .

this beer actually does n't smell very good . grainy . it tastes much better than the smell .  a - med-dark gold . t - the first thing you taste is whisky , but it fits nicely . beautiful rogue malt profile . very tasty . d - highly drinkable .  lovely thick aromas of blackstrap molasses , dark bitter chocolate , strong coffee and deep roasted malts ... awesome aromas to this one ... lazy and flat tasting ... strange bitter almost sour taste present ... . not much in common with the aromas ... thick oily mouthfeel is great but i ca n't get by the taste of this one ... drain poured this one ... maybe a bad bottle but as is , a big disappointment ...

it smells like slightly rotten apples and butter ; if only french hookers smelled like bass !  pours a slighlty hazy amber with a pretty average head .  m - oily , medium body with a fantastic amount of carbonation .

very light smell of rice and malt .  a : cloudy bright amber-gold body with a thin , late developing head that leaves as soon as it arrives . definitely a bit on the flat side for a saison .  m- moderate/high carbonation , medium body , lager clean . crisp enough leaving a refreshing feel .

there 's something wrong here , wet cardboard , obviously oxided , overpowered any aroma and flavor nuances . while i 'm not sure we would have enjoyed this re the wheat after being pounded by brown sugar , prunes , raisins etc , we all noticed this was one frigging boozy monster .  a- after a fairly aggressive pour , i get a 1 finger head that quickly recedes into a bubbly lacing . the body is a lovely orange with no sediment .  the mouthfeel was decent , medium with adequate carbonation .

the label on the bottle i 'm drinking has a coat of arms , 2 cherries and says the abv is 6.8 % . the smell was the first thing that weirded me out ; maybe i was expecting more of a lambic-ness , but the smell had a funk that i found hard to place . what the hell was that smell ? dirty underwear ? the taste started okay with a tart , bitter cherry flavor but followed by a metallic nastiness that almost pressed down on the back of my tongue .  pours a nice cloudy yellow as expected but this taste of it is just .  this beer tastes like sheep shit . this may appeal to some people , but it 's definitely a very unusual belgian ale . i enjoyed drinking half of this beer for the experience . it 's so pungent i laughed out loud . it 's always fun to be exposed to a radically different flavor profile than you 're used to .

the smell is like a cheap american beer , the taste is malty , and the entire experience is just thick .  slight film persists , but no real head retention or lacing s : sour & oaky notes t : sweet cherry , then sourness , oaky dryness & small hint of vanilla up front .  medium bodied ; good amount of carbonation .

unimpressed by the aroma , watery coffee is predominate , but luckly the flavor is better . kopi luwak is a huge fad too , it 's a joke in the coffee world , but the mainstream world loves its hype .  pours a bright orange amber body that lends a half finger white head .  crisp and clean in the mouth , body fits the carbonation well . nothing amazing about this brew , but it 's not terrible and comes in a nifty bottle you can use for ... something ... .i guess .
no smell or much of a flavour and is a light caramel colour .  a- pale yellow and cloudy .  most everything else about this beer was great , looked good , good mouthfeel , but the taste .

aroma is very hard to detect ... very faint cola notes is all i pick up . i get the fruit cake notes mentioned in the commercial descrip .  dark brown with light tan head - no real retention , and the head quickly faded away .  mouthfeel : lightly carbonated and creamy .

3.5 s : mild smell of malt sweetness . no hops present in the nose . 2.0 . t : hop bitterness can be found on the back end to balance this brew out , but little-to-nothing in terms of floral/citrus hop flavors ... malt sweetness and hop bitterness do strike a nice balance here though .  33cl bottle poured into my gordons thistle glass a- 1 finger head post pour and reducing to non existancy immediately . held to the light , a hint of light gets through to show a very dark dark dark dark ruby body .  the mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation .
the smell is faint and odd .  pours a hazy straw yellow with a half finger head that fades somewhat quickly . not too impressive .  long , earthy , dry finish . interesting , somewhat unusual brew .

poured from a bottle into tulip glass- a- poured a nice orange/gold with a head on fine white lacing s- there was n't much going on at all in the aroma department . i was a bit disappointed . t- spices definitely stand out here and are backed by some fusel alcohol notes and a slight burn m- had a very bubbly mouthfeel d- average drinkability , but i really was n't too impressed by this one .  has a fluffy off white head . an average looking brew .  on first sip you get hit with a strong citrus hop attack . from the aroma to the taste , there is just something that does n't sit well with me . it leaves an unpleasant bitter aftertaste . i love ipas and hops galore . my only guess is that the bitter citrus flavor is what threw this beer off for me .

aroma is screaming butterscotch candy in my face . taste is not quite as bad as i thought it might be based on the aroma . this stuff is just way too sweet and butterscotchy .  pours a not-quite-clear straw color with a small head that rapidly diminishes .  the mouth is smooth and light .

smells : slightly sulfurous on opening , but not as bad as my last sample of pbr . maybe the pabst plant has a little sulfur in the water ? i 'd really like to compare this side-by-side with pbr since they 're both pabst beers .  this is a great bbq beer i had this beer on tap at a little resturant in cayucus with fish and chips . it was citracey and sweet . and a really nice finish .  smooth in the mouth with nice , crisp carbonation . nice feel , but flavor is not there .

smell the smell of this beer is extremely faint . i can smell a bit of wheat and touches of sweetness .  pours out to a clear pale golden , forming a small white head with no retention and lacing . somewhat flat from the voyage with minimal carbonation , so keep that in mind for this review .  mouthfeel is nice & creamy .

s : airy toast is diluted by the thick carbon dioxide presence . hops are weakly piney , not really able to register . t : begins dry , with moderate pale malt that definitely brings more toast than in the smell , as well as some caramel .  it looks much like a standard macro-brewers lager but the similarity ends there .  light mouthfeel with a good amount of carbonation when you drink it .

s : not much on the nose , which i took to be a good thing as it does not look like i got a spoiled bottle . little malt apparent but really not much there at all .  pours a dark coffee and molasses mix with a decent head at first , but does n't linger very long and the last of my 12 .oz is finished with no foam at all .  m - nice light feel with a crisp finish , accentuated with a alcohol warmth .

s - no aroma to speak of . t - extremely restrained flavor .  appearance = it poured from a twelve ounce bottle with a small head that quickly dissipated without leaving any lacing on the glass .  m : mouthfeel is crisp , slightly sticky in the front and a little dry on the back of the tongue . pretty good .
smells faintly like hard candy , and a little rice .  looks thick . dark , no head , little lacing , little carbonation .  m : medium-high carbonation fits the style nicely .

smell is mainly light corn .  a - poured a dark copper with no visible carbonation , no head as it was poured all the way to the top , no lacing and no retention .  dark brown/amber body . it is a very smooth and a sweet sipper . some hops , caramel , candy sugar and oak . not much bourbon . i was way excited to try this and actually find it to be rather average .

faint soy sauce .  it does not have the complexity or the body of ( say ) sierra nevada or victory products but i 'd be interested in how this would stack up in a blind taste test because its appearance , color , etc. , while not remarkable , are right up there . i give costco a lot of credit for this because their beer offerings ( at least in my area ) are polarized between the ( formerly ) us macros and beck 's on one hand and variety cases on the other .  m - medium bodied with good carbonation .

poured this guy into a frankfurt mug pours clear pale yellow with big display of carbonation and a white head that is a little bubblier than fizzy and sticks in huge chunks to my glass . smell is mostly of sweet watery adjuncts taste is of , again , sweet adjuncts , but not as watery as i expected .  a : pours a chill hazed orange/red with a short head that is reduced to nothing quickly . poor spotty lacing and low carbonation .  the mouthfeel of this beer ( outside of taste ) was great . great carbonation , bitter hop aftertaste , medium bodied .

pours very clean and carbonated golden color.the smell was not to apparent and almost none at all.the taste was like strait carbonation i 'm talking like battery acid , but i loved it.i have never had something with so much carbon that tasted so sweet but strange at the same time.definitely a must for me and i would definitely recommend to anyone .  hazy straw-colored body with a fizzy white head that tails off fairly quickly , leaving little opportunity for much in the way of lacing . a tart burst of citrus- lemon juice and orange zest- greets the nose , backed up with cloves , tangy wheat and tangy yeast .  mouthfeel is pretty good , goes well with the style of light and highly carbonated .

smell is initially the aforementioned skunk ... followed by malt , hop and a bit of anise .  however , deep copper color with golden highlights . no foam .  m - good carbonation and it finishes clean . good light to medium mouthfeel .

a - nice copper color - light head s - not too much . can not pick up much hops or malt t - average for and extra pale ale . like the smell , light in the hops and light in the malt .  little head accompanied a dark clear golden colour . little cardination and some lacing .  mouthfeel is fine and not heavy .

very blond to light gold in color . slightly unpleasant vegetal , crackery aroma with a hint of coriander . medium-medium light body .  1/5 inch head of a tan color . decent retention and good lacing .  a bitter spicy bite from the hops hit first . the light body and good crispness contrast the flavor pretty well .
s - quite weak . caramel and a little coffee .  this beer is a fairly brown shade of orange , with almost no head , just a thin white ring .  it has good texture .

s : malty smell , but not much really . t : a bit fruity with very small hints of fruits .  oh , it looks like a euro pils , and to some extent , smells like a pilsner .  the same color , mouthfeel , and drinkability were there , just the hopiness , aroma , and flavor , as well as most of the bitterness seemed to have blown away .

no apparent lacing s - nothing much , a little sweetness , no hop aroma detected t - very sweet . it tastes kind of like malt extract used in homebrewing .  7.5 % abv bottle into my slender & top heavy rare vos glass . big powdery head , though quite faint & not big on sticking around . body is a glittery caramel amber with lots of floaties .  body is right- light , lively carbonation , not cloying or excessively dry .

ca n't find one , really . t : roasted , hints of smoke and coffee . a bit too dry , too odorless and with too little after taste .  the wee heavy poured into my snifter displays a deep amber/light brown color with a moderate off-white head that very quickly diminished to barely a skim .  the mouthfeel is very full and hearty almost meaty- sort of flat .
smell : diluted malts , anyone ?  very thin white head with little lace .  mouth feel is completely crisp , refreshing , and clean .

appearance : too foggy smell : smelled like rotten flesh when it was in the bottle , but better out of the bottle taste is good .  the body pours quite a pale yellow , with a moderate haze and thinnish bone-white head .  mouthfeel - good feel , not too thick , kind of creamy , decent carbonation .

s - hmm . mildew ?  a pretty dull looking beer , but on the nose , there is a huge oatmeal presence that lays on top of the roasted coffee and bitter cocoa nubs .  mouthfeel was smooth , slightly thick for a pils , and with a nice carbonation bite .

you run the risk of getting a skunky smell . skunky smell until you get way down in there . floral hops with lots of cereal aroma .  a - let 's face it , almost all strong belgian ales appear cloudy , murky or muddy . the head is coffee with milk brown and dissipates in less than three minutes . what a shame ! m - not as heavy as the appearance would suggest , but it is substantial d - at 10.5 % abv you wo n't be having too many in an evening .  taste is thin and adjuncty . mouthfeel is good , thick and creamy .

i ca n't smell much of anything in this . at least it is n't skunky .  appearance- slightly hazy , bright orange color with 1.5 finger eggshell white , foamy head . head settles rather quickly but leaves some residual lacing .  mouthfeel is very light and well carbonated .

for a macro lager made for mass consumption it has more flavor than one should expect . typical appearance for a lager and a distinct pretzel flavor . i 'm not arguing that its a great beer , just good for what it is .  pours a very effervescent amber with 3+ fingers of rocky tan head . average lacing & head retention s : herbal hops , breadyness , a slight nuttyness .  has a medium body which is needed to carry all the hops and alcohol . low carbonation lends a nice texture without letting the flavors being cloying .
the nose is a bit unpleasant .  pours deep brown , with a thin off-white head .  mouthfeel : nice feeling on the tongue and also a good consistencty .

it looks like watered-down , carbonated honey , but tastes nothing like that . it 's nothing to get excited about , unless you 're looking to get out of hand .  ok retention with little fingers of lace .  m : lovely long bitter aftertaste .

there is an obvious orange peel smell coupled with spice and something that resembles dirty socks . the body is somewhat thin and dry , lacking in richness and the taste is pretty much the same as the smell . orange peel , some spice and not much more .  the appearence was ok , looks just like everyother beer i have seen before .  the mouthfeel is good , but obviously does not improve the flavor !

i have tried this beer two ways ... ..with and without lime in it . my advice is to definatly drink this with a lime . a lime improves the taste significantly . thats why i rated the taste and drinkability higher than i would have if i would have reviewed this without adding anything . this beer appears pale with a small head that dissapears in the blink of an eye .  very carbonated , a light and bubbly beer . the head fluffs up and then dies down , a shame . the color is a golden white , a bit of a haze .  - well carbonated , dries the mouth a bit . nice smooth body , probably this beers highlight is the mouthfeel .

the rather insipid smell is mild and sweet with notes of honey , sweet loaf and a minimal touch of bitterness . american aroma hops ? fine .  i was glad to see brew kettle still serving a pumpkin beer during my visit in late december ... seems like a lot of brewers plan to sell out of pumpkin beer by thanksgiving , and to me the flavor is appropriate through the new year . appearance-wise , it looked a great deal like the chief 's rye - not quite colorful enough in the amber body , and with a medium amount of head .  the flavor that by far took the lead was chocolate ! there 's an overpowering ( and for me , disappointing ) chocolate aftertaste in this beer . mouthfeel- smooth , no complaints here . drinkability- well , the bottle looks cool as you drink from it !

the smell is epl , it is almost like it is pre-skunked .  a : pours amberish color with little head s : piney and citrus hops with a touch of sweetness t : there 's a decent amount of bitterness from the hops but a good amount .  m : smooth and round .

smell is distinctly metallic note , malt , subdued hops , vanilla and citrus . hard to detect with the overwhelming metallic smell .  lots of sediment just waiting to get moved around in the bottom of this beer . not enough foam or head , or lacing for an ipa imho .  everything about this beer was pretty light - light , crisp malt scent ; light fruity taste ; light body . feel - 4.0/5.0 - refreshing , which was really nice .

the head was huge and creamy which gave off some strange aromas . something like peanuts and sour yeast .  a - clear , deep honey color . the head is thin and leaves scattered lacing .  m : medium in both body and carbonation .

the smell is n't real prominent , but when i press the issue it reminds me a little of wet dog .  the beer pours a delicious straw-gold with a tight head that quickly fades . nice clean malt presence with just the right amount of noble hops , a touch of dms ( just enough to give it a full lager body ) and a light carbonation that helps the goodness go down .  ) mouthfeel is just nicely carbonated and light and the only reason the drinkability is n't higher on my ratings is because after a few 40 's your out of the game for a while .
hops are subdued , in fact , the entire aroma is . tastes fine .  some sediment and good lacing .  m : good mouthfeel , its crisp , refreshing , light bodied with moderately high carbonation .

slight herbal/maple scent , nothing memorable . m- same as the smell , nothing memorable , typical ale .  what a quality ipa ! clear dark orange pour fresh from my sly fox growler into my sly fox pint ( now al i need are sly fox underoos and i 'm all set ! ) this growler was filled up two days ago . finally , this pour is topped off by a beige head that fades to a scant slick as i progress thru this one .  carbonation done very well .
s : pretty dull .  a coppery orange with minimal head that leaves a thin lacing around the glass .  m : medium body and moderate carbonation .

i get a definitive white wine smell , a lot of yeast , and a hint of wheat ( but maybe because that is what i was looking for ) or grain . it looks and feels good but the beer disappointed on the smell and taste .  appearance : poured with a big white foamy head that dissipated to a thin layer on top leaving no lacing . the beer is slightly cloudy with a yellow golden color .  mouthfeel was the highlight of the beer - it was almost velvety smooth . carbonation was low as per the style but if they 'd added a few more hops to dry out the palate it would have been near perfect .

the aroma was a light , thin malty scent with some very faint fruit esthers . otherwise , there was n't much there and it was a rather bland aroma .  deep gold/pale amber in colour . thin , foamy tan head fades to a respectable layer of foam . chill haze is very evident .  the mouthfeel is very nice.. feels heavy , thick , smooth , and not over-carbonated .
it just smells like beer .  this pours a nice dark brown with an off white head . little retention and virtually no lacing .  mouthfeel - it does have a pleasant rich/buttery mouthfeel .
the smell has nothing . this beer was light and crisp in taste !  lots of yeast sediment floating in a thick yellow-orange haze .  m : nice and thick d : not something ill try again .

smell - sourdough bread in a tin can - i understand this is ridiculous , but this is the best i can do ! taste - slightly sour breadiness , slightly sweet with a very subtle earthyhop profile , refreshing .  '' pours to a slightly hazy dark orange-caramel with a small white head and just ok retention and minimal lacing .  at least its silky smooth and the alcohol is well hidden . this beer , in my opinion , is the weakest of their stout series .

smells like a skunky heineken . then corn ?  appearance : without the sediment , it pours a hazy , dark gold body with lots of foam . the only problem is the short shelf life of the head as well as the lacking of any real lacing .  still for such a big beer it had a great body , just not sure if i would want more , until it got about 5 years on it .
it had a bitter smell like that of fermented raisins .  on-tap at beachwood bbq , a : pours brown with a mild white head , no real lace , average head retention .  smooth creamy medium body .

the smell and taste are enhanced with grain . the hops help somewhat with the taste so that it is not bread water .  pours an amber brownish tint that holds an inch thick white cap .  mouthfeel is round and full , thick and sticky .

head drops to a finger weird smells coming out of this one : crisp lemon & raspberry , but also a strange savory flavor , like overly sweet ketchup , which is a turn-off . it 's a shame : the peripheral aspects ( appearance , mouthfeel ) were impressive , but there was something off about the smell & taste which would make me avoid this one in the future .  lovely little bottle , but i will say it looks much bigger in photographs . the head fades quickly and no head retention to be seen .  the body is full and the carbonation is light . mouthfeel is creamy .

lots of lacing s prominent aroma is a hard to describe variety of hoppiness . there seems to be an almost plastic or soapy smell going on that is unpleasant .  on tap @ the office in cranford 01-16-09 a- bright golden color , a lot of carbonation , when i 'm at a regular bar drinking this i almost feel like i 'm one of the bmc crew but if they only knew ... s : yeast hops and some sweetness from the malt .  light body , good carbonation .

s : quite odd , sugary , mealy , and maize notes . t : sugary sweet , with fresh grains , and maize .  it comes with about a fingers worth of off white head . little to no retention , no lacing left on the glass .  m - the brew is wet at the lips but finishes quite dry . impressive . ~ unfortunately i 'm going to struggle finishing this because of the flavor .

s - smells like a bud light . the smell is disappointing . very hard to pick out anything in the smell . t - in spite of the smell , the taste works out to be pretty good .  pours mahogany with 3+ fingers of mocha head . average lacing & head retention s : roasty malt & chocolate , plus a slight iron scent t : chocolate , roasty malt , & some dryness up front .  body was medium , and the liquid was fairly smooth overall . 3.03 rdev -19.5 % look : 3.5 | smell : 3 | taste : 3 | feel : 4 | overall : 2.5 1366

had this one on tap at a bar just down the street from the brewery , smell of biscuity malts , color a classic amber , tastes of german malts little to no hop presence , abv quite high for the drinkability , and as such it makes a good session beer , if you do n't mind partying a little hard .  it 's what purple haze wants to be when it grows up .  mouthfeel is medium , clean with a bitter hop aftertaste .

balanced malt and hop , but with strong notes of a fresh water stream ? almost a puzzling smell . taste - right away you can taste the complexity .  a - pours a pretty clear color with a fizzy white head that dissipates quickly .  mouthfeel : light , carbonated , crisp .

creamy frothy head at first and last throughout ... aroma - metallic bitter hops .  pours copper with thick tan head that slowly fades to patchy layer , scant patches of lacing .  mouthfeel is very creamy as expected from the nitro can , but i couldnt get past the taste that just did not agree with me .

surprised to see a harvest ale categorized as an amber instead of apa or ipa , but the aroma confirms that style choice . put simply , this smells of nearly nothing . if i really concentrate i can pick out a little spice , ala a pumpkin beer .  this score might be a bit lower than appropriate , as i drank the beer in an opaque vessel , and in a dark room -- did n't get much of a look , so i just gave it a middle of the road score on appearance .  m : fizzy carbonation that smooths out a little into the sip and works well with the body of the beer .

aroma is mildly skunky , stale hops and light malts .  brown color with tons of yeast floaters . very thin tan head . nothing special to look at but not terribly out of character for the style .  this one is crisp and carbonation is at a good level . body is n't as light as i had expected ; this one 's medium-bodied .

the smell issue and alcohol after taste put it off my future list .  acloudy reddish brown with a thin tan sheet of foam on top , no head to speak of , but laced well as i drank it down sspicy , raison , plum , apricot , pear , lots of fruity smells here tnot much like the smell , buttery toffee flavor , maybe some mild fruit tones , flavor is very mild and enjoyable if you like mild ales msmooth and velvetish , medium bodied , not much for carbonation dvery differentthe smell really threw me on this one ; i expected the taste to be more fruity .  goes down smooth , no bite , and finishes with an appropriate amount of stickiness . carbonation is on the lower end of the spectrum . nice feel .

the sulfurous aroma however was absolutely what i would consider the worst aspect of this beer . there was a lot of bread yeast aroma behind the sulfur as well .  darkish amber in colour with a persistent head , albeit it quite thin in texture .  mouthfeel is light to medium and has a soft feel .

bottle is a lighter shade of brown , needs to be a little darker , as mine had a slighty light-struck ( skunky ) aroma . ok , but nothing special .  1 pint 6 oz bottle eyes : pours a straw to yellow , pretty average looking , not much head , nothing too exciting looking at it nose : grapefruit ginger ale with a citrus twinge more towards the tart variety.. lemon ices hops mmmm almost smells like a sparkling soft drink ... drool ... taste : like a light american pale ale with an exceptional tart finish with a gentle hop bite .  mouthfeel : light/medium with a tart , crisp finish drinkability : i really do n't crave another of these ; this certainly would n't be a lawnmower beer for me conclusion : just kind of unsorted ( also kind of an odd bitterness on the finish ) ... i tried this a year or two ago and was n't a huge fan ... now that i 'm reviewing it ... i 'm still not .

a blast of skunked hops and adjuncts assaults the nose when first poured , but it settles down considerably when its resting in the glass .  a : pours a deep brown with dark ruby highlights around the edges . about a half finger of foam fades quickly leaving almost nothing on top and no lacing . kinda looks like a coke or root beer .  m/s carbonation is fine , alcohol is n't really noticeable `` thanks '' to the bitterness overall i really do n't like this beer , but i guess it has more to do with me and this style than the beert itself .

no aroma .  love the bottle , too bad the price is so high . a : pours a dark ruby/brown color with a small off-white head forms , comprised of rather large bubbles , and dissipates rather quickly . very thin lacing forms , but does not last .  m : solid mouthfeel , carbonation is pretty much spot on .

really lacking in the aroma department .  i love marin brewing co. beers and this is a well made ale . i just do n't think it 's my style . looked like a lager which was a bit surprising as i expected something darker .  an intense experience . the flavour is huge bitter hops - oily and rich with a spike on the back palette . the alcoholic warmth starts deep within the pit of the stomach and travels all the way up to the cheeks . next time i try it will be in front of a fire with a huge cheese platter .

smells ... bad ! yuck .  dark-brown and cloudy in appearance , the pint glass i was handed had been pre-poured , so i ca n't say a lot about the head . the sweetness up front balanced nicely with the beer 's hops , and in combination with an enjoyable , full body , the pint drank easily while sitting outside the brewery on a beautiful march day .  mouthfeel is creamy and satisfying .

clear pale amber color . light-medium carbonation and light bodied . no nose .  a - poured a hazy amber color with some cloudiness and sediment visible . head was decent , lacing was minimal .  m : creamy to a crisp finish with a good carbonation throughout .
s- like a macro lager .  good lacing , poor head retention .  the mouthfeel is good - smooth with a right amount of carbonation .

the aroma is not very nice . it 's incredibly boozy . a bit of solvent , nail polish remover aromas are in there as well . the taste is not as boozy as the aroma . the aroma hurts the drinkability and it does n't taste like a well made imperial stout .  ) ..its a pretty average looking ale pale amber , large frothy white head .  m : medium bodied with a medium carbonation .

a : this beer looks clean and refreshing , pale color leads you think its a thirst quenching beer s : not impressed with the smell at all . do n't know if its the saaz but i detect an off skunky smell . do n't really like that smell t : thankfully , it does n't taste like it smells . maybe skunky is the wrong word , im not entirely sure this beer is for me though .  a moderate pour yields a 1/2-finger off-white head that deteriorates to a thin clumpy dusting and thin foam ring in just a couple minutes . the body is a beautifully clear golden amber with just a few small carbonation bubbles . some light lacing can be seen clinging to the glass throughout consumption .  mouthfeel was pleasant . a medium bodied chewiness and good carbonation .

aroma is mainly awful , smells mainly of socks and super citrusy hops , no malt complexity .  from the brewery , thanks neighbors ! a - golden in color , no head , light carbonation .  mouthfeel : nicely carbonated and good level of thickness - probably the best part of this beer .

its by no means a sophistocated beer , nor is there a whole lot to the smell or taste of it ( smell being almost undetectable besides some wheats and the taste being a simple blend of understated malts and yeast ) but despite this i actually enjoy drinking this .  a - hazy orange , thin white cap , no lacing .  m : silky smooth feel . i like the finish . smoothed out my palate .
