it had more of a macro malty aroma and kind of stale at that .  pours a hazy straw color with a one finger head that disappears into a ring around the glass smells of belgian yeast , wheat , and spicy esters .  mouthfeel : the carbonation is well balanced with a nice medium body , leaning a bit on the heavier side . drinkability : the mouthfeel is great and there is no sign of the 7 % abv .

pale , sweetish lager . very light golden color in the pint glass . essentially flavorless but manages to project a pleasant beeriness . certainly nothing to excite even the lager lover , but in a mexican restaurant faced with the full range of lites , this is not a bad option .  served in a hill farmstead tulip glass . a - minimal carbonation . thin-late rising wisp of bubbles that linger on top . not much of a looker here .  full bodied with a smoothy , creamy mouthfeel .
the smell is mild , clean and neutral . or , to be frank , very boring .  this beer poured a brown color with very little head .  m : very fizzy , light on body , about right for the style .

the smell is odd . i could have been picking up any of these , the smell was just odd .  paid $ 9.99 for party source to fill my growler ... the beer pours a very dark brown base , with a medium white head , 20 minutes of head retention and a speck or two of lacing on the glass .  the mouthfeel was full and sweet .

there lacked a adequate smell here . there was a malty smell , but very slight .  brown bottle into a sam adams glass . the body was golden brown/amber with a pocked , off-white head .  had a funny texture in the mouth and could definitely taste dried fruit but could not discern the type .

poured a light amber color , quick disappearing head , first sniff was extremely flowery . taste was fine , malty fruity and sweet , very pleasant sweetish aftertaste .  poured into a 12-oz mug , this beer is a murky orange-tinted brown color with almost no head retention , and in fact barely a hint of foam at all on top .  the mouthfeel is really soft and creamy , as i figured cask would be .
something smelled off but the taste was good .  could n't get a head going on it . no lacing . dark brown in color .  m : crisp , clean , would call it refreshing if it tasted better .

skunk on the nose , unavoidable skunk due to the bottle color . once it dies down it is a very malty smell , i would have like more hops .  if you 've ever had melbourn bros apricot , this kind of reminds me of that in terms of taste . very spritzy -- like carbonated pineapple juice with a zest of lemon . almost no head when i poured it , but you certainly do n't need head on this beer to catch a good aroma ; it 's exceptionally strong .  maybe i could not taste the `` rare '' but this really sucked compared to the 2008 classic gueuze which is a fantastic gueuze .

appearance : light brown/gold , good clarity , not much head formation aroma : lightly skunky , malty caramel , feint strawberries , honey flavor : light initial malt sweetness before a somewhat acidic backwash riding a wave of herbally hops , green olives ( ? ) , finishes dryish with a lingering hop bitterness mouthfeel : light body , crisp texture , low carbonation other comments : an ok beer , but a bit timid and unexciting .  12oz bottle into pint glass pours a deep gold color , one finger off-white head , with a decent amount of chunky particulates .  buttery thick mouthfeel .

smell is somewhat corny/metal ... not too tempting , but i dive in anyway .  appearance : pours a rich honey color with practically no head . this beer hits the spot quite nicely .  m - good mouthfeel . a little heavier thanks to the lack of filtration .

ok malt scent , not an aromatic beer really . starts out mildly sweet with a decent herbal hop assault .  presentation dark brown glass 330 ml bottle with freshness date on rear label . a- midnight , dark opaque brown , very slim off-white head which disappeared quickly .  medium bodied and decent carbonation .

a : usually drink it in the can , so the view never changes s : it smells like many american macros , maybe a bit better , but that 's not saying much t : defnately not much going on , but overall smooth , well carbonated m : carbonation , foam , and a little flavor , nothing special d : you can easily knock a few of these back and not notice it overall : as i 'm apt to tell my more snobby beer friends , it won a blue ribbon in the past ( most recently 2006 ) , so something must be good about it .  gold color capped by a thin head . it does n't look as bright as i expected so i take a closer glance . i see a fine haze of tiny particles in the glass , though i only poured in half the bottle .  mouthfeel : thick and what you would expect from a ris .

corn and cereal . t-tastes like the normal as well but a bit more flavorful .  served in a flute . transparent amber-brown body with visible bubbles streams . no cap , lace , etc .  it is pretty full bodied and creamy .

the smell was that of a standard stout , but with the addition of a rather metallic copper smell .  a- straw with some haze .  mouthfeel is heavier than i 'd anticipate . i wish i liked the flavor of this because its heaviness is spot on .

there seems to be no aromatic hops whatsoever , leaving the smell very dull .  pours a hazy golden color with a one fingered head that quickly fades to a barely noticeable cap .  nice creaminess from the malt . probably the driest amber ale i 've ever had . usually not a bad thing , i like dry beers , but this was too much , there needs to be a little sweetness there to bring it to life . should n't be called an octoberfest and would n't try again .

no noticable odor of any kind . this aromatic absence was confirmed by others at our table.tasted like someone burnt the malt .  pours a golden yellow , just a touch of haze and a rocky , bright white head .  mouthfeel is about right for style , perhaps a touch undercarbed , but all else is acceptable , though it showcases a flavor profile best left behind the curtain .

not much of a scent , a little skunky , some grain .  absolutley no head or film . wonderful color and clarity , but the lack of head/lacing/film dissapoints me .  m : mouthfeel is crisp , light-medium bodied and pretty dry .

s- there is no distinct smell to it , t- when it first hits your mouth you feel the creaminess of the beer .  color is a deep garnet with amber highlights . gave me a thin cap of tan head and very little lacing .  mouthfeel was nice and thick ; you know you 're drinking a dipa .

12 ounce green bottle appearance : clear yellow color with little head and little to no lacing smell : a little hard to describe but would say it has a strong bitter almost skunky smell taste : has a lot better taste then smell which was a little surprising .  the color and clarity are oustanding , but a lack of retention or lacing is concerning .  m- very smooth . medium carbonation fills the mouth a little . d- good .

it 's a darker straw color than the uiltra , as well as more body to it . still , it 's nothing to get excited over , but it 's good for what it is . again , it 's nothing that i would order again , but i was being a good ba and broadening my horizons .  no problem though , taste is fine , colour is nice and although there is no head and very little in the way of lacings , the body is pretty nice .  strong carbonation . m. very bitter and the carbonation is clean and tart .

s - roasted malt and skunky-ness ( ? .. ) are immediately apparent .  a hazy dark yellow color with a head that i missed since i looked in another direction ( for 3 seconds ) while rvdoorn poured the beer .  m : light body , moderate carbonation , nice crisp body .

smell is quite weak but fruity and clean . slightly boozy and yeasty ; some fermented fruit smells ( apple ? subdued , but inoffensive flavours and aroma , light body , all work together for a decently drinkable beer .  orange hazy full head reduces to a thin layer .  the body is pleasant and perfectly appropriate for a light belgian ale . full of carbonation , relatively light in the mouth , easy to drink ; no complaints on this front ; this beer only becomes a problem when you have to smell it or taste it .

it appears average , smells bad , and needs a lime but it would be blasphemy for me to give it anything less than a c. i grew up with this beer , in fact this was the first beer i ever had . s : smells of strong yeast , and potent grain malts . also faint skunk smell .  appearance : light amber color , lighter than paulaner 's version with decent amount of carbonation smell : slightly fruity notes and a little bit of hops come out as i swirled the brew in my glass .  m : thick creamy mouthfeel .

s : no discernible smell comes from this beer .  pours very dark brown , almost black with slightly effervescent light tan head , very small patchy downsliding lacing .  m : well carbonated and thick , fairly heavy . fits the style .

smells a bit of clove and a bit of sweet fruit , and a whole lot of coriander . now , i like coriander , but this is too much -- it has a strongly metallic scent that really overpowers anything good it has going on .  huge bubbles due to strong carbonation and no lacing .  m - pretty good .

the smell is exactly what you get when you open a can of corn kernels . not really true to style and not great at all . overall , you drink the beer for what you taste and smell predominately and this is below par on both .  a - poured very little head , and left very little lacing.. and i know my glass is clean . looks like an ipa ... nice orangey-amber glow .  the mouthfeel is smooth and oily and the carbonation is alright .

a : nice hazy copper color with lots of carbonation activity & little head retention s : difficult to detect anything specific in the aroma t : light sweetness and some roastiness m : good mouthfeel to start but loses it quickly - medium , smooth body , good carbonation to start d : this beer started off pretty well with aforementioned charactetistics , but lost its form too quickly .  pours a thin a off white head that rapidly dissipates into the ethers . body is deep brown-black . the oakiness becomes a bit more pronounced ion the flavor along with some of the accompanying bourbon . new hollands crown jewel indeed . i drank this around cellar temperature which really seemed to bring out its full character .  really nice body all around ... overall - i would really enjoy this beer if it were n't for the bubblegum flavor , it 's really off putting and not very pleasant .

i love the vanilla and banana esters given off by most weissbiers , this did n't have those qualities . the only aroma i found was of cereal and grains , even those were weak . refreshing enough , but it lacked a true bite and any character worth mentioning .  dark brown but not black like i was expecting . decent one finger head that leaves quickly smells of rich chinook hops and a sugary malt sweetness .  m : the body is medium to full with a fairly high carbonation . this is actually one of the best things about this beer .

nothing spectacular on the nose but for the typical belgian `` funk '' which was fine but i could distinguish nothing else . overall , a keeper , i just expected some more hop character to poke through but , then again , perhaps belgian darks are n't where we go for hop nirvana ?  pours a deep amber with very little carbonation . no head in trappist glass , just thin ring of white bubbles clinging to the sides for dear life .  there 's big citrus/grapefruit hops , but then a nasty onion/vegetable taste . mouthfeel is fine .

the aroma is of dust and cardboard , and maybe some adjunct aroma . the smell is extremely bland : besides a little dose of malty sweetness and some hard water , there is very little to make me want to take a sip . thankfully the taste is not as offensive -- but it is fairly plain . plain but drinkable , and mildly refreshing .  pours a deep red/brown with no head at all .  m/d : light and smooth feel on the mouth , drinkable but not something i will ever get again .

however , it has little smell . it just smells like ... .beer ... it has a really good grainy taste with a small following of hops . but overall , it is a very drinkable beer .  on-tap in a flute at the capital ale house in richmond , this beer arrives orangey and crystal-clear , with low carbonation and a thin , vanishing head .  the aroma contained notes of malt , hops and a discernable alcohol content of medium strength . it had a stong alcohol flavor that was very over powering the other flavors . it was smooth yet burned as it went down . truely a devilish brew !
s : clover , grassy . cooked rice .  once you get past the weird label , you find a decent ipa .  m : light-medium bodied , creamy , smooth and crisp .

s : cocoa at first , some coffee , diarrhea ( off putting to say the least ) , chalk dust .  this beer pours a deep rich medium brown/orange color . very hazy and little head , about one finger on the pour .  this has a very creamy mouthfeel to it despite being fairly well carbonated .
smell : only a slight sweet smell reminiscent of corn was detected .  a : golden-yellow , fizzy white head , no retention , very little lace .  mouthfeel is crisp and drying , as it should be .
the smell is that of boston lager , rather skunky with hints of hops and malts .  pours a very dark brown color with a quick head .  the mouthfeel is medium and creamy .

smell is relatively nonexistent -- a bit of sweetness , but thats about it .  12oz bottle poured into an oversized wine glass pours a murky brown colour with just a thin head and a light lacing on the top .  firm mouthfeel , big and solid . very imperial .

smell is subtle at first and different than any beer i 've smelld before .  the head is a moderate-lived cocoa-colored affair that recedes into a floating patch of film on top of the brew . a few rings here and there , but generally no lacing .  appropriately light in body without being too thin .

there was next to no aroma , perhaps a hint of malt , no more .  a- poured a amberish coppery orange color if that makes sense . one finger off white head that shows light retention .  however , the mouthfeel was very nice , which lent a overall smoothness and softness to it .

had this on tap at the aranyhomok in keskemet , hungary a - pours a light golden color that produced a foamy white head that disappears and leaves no lacing around the glass s - no real scents , i guess because i had on tap in europe there was no skunk , but i guess sutle malts was all t - not a complex beer , but then again was n't supposed to be .  pours black with virtually no head , just a light tan froth that leaves minute dots of lacing .  the mouthfeel was quite good , though . well carbonated and it felt good going down .

smell : a slightly sour smell that i seem to associate with wheat brews . fairly clen aroma .  batch 1 bottle 198 of 228 pours a cloudy peach color with a decently sized white head that slowly reduces to a ring of foam .  i believe the bottle i got was 8.75 percent.. looked pretty good for a esl , smell and taste reminded me very much of great western extra gold.. very malty with a nice solventy sweet-like alcohol burn ... carbonated perfectly , making it halfway drinkable , still hangover juice as far as imports go.. cheers !

wheat smell , with a sickly sweet remainder , not exactly pleasant .  12 oz bottle , pours a hazy amber with very little head , even with pouring into the middle of the glass .  this beer feels almost delicate .

smell is pretty boring , a little old bananas and corn - eh , whatever taste is quite clean , warm , cereal grain flavour lingering on the off sweet side , but then finishing with a bit of artificial cherry on the end .  i love this beer . ok , maybe that is overstating it , but this is one of the most drinkable beers i 've ever had . it does n't generate much of a head when poured and that combined with the yeast dominated taste may make it a bit meek for some . if you like yeast , though , this beer is for you .  the mouthfeel is notably well contoured . dark and hearty though at times cloying .

i 've somehow not yet tried this pale from victory . the nose comprises dark greens , egg yolk , caramel , flowers , and light leek . not sure where that egg-y smell 's coming from , but it 's not helping things at all .  on tap at the anvil in houston , tx a : pours a murky , cloudy reddish/brown color . a minimal tan head forms , but recedes to nothing in a second .  we 're okay though , as next time we get a samuel adams winter sampler pack , i 'll give her my cranberry , and i 'll have her boston lager . it 's not a bad beer , it 's just not to my liking . i ca n't even really say why . a bit sweeter than i 'd like , and just nothing that stands out and says `` i 'm great '' .

smelled on the road to skunking however . yes it had some hints of spice and citrus but to be honest with you it was so mild that this could have passed for any meak american beer if in a blind taste test or straight from a can .  a : deep prune-brown , minimal wisp ring , minimal legs , no lacing .  taste/mouthfeel : mostly hops . heavily malted finish . drinkability : a bit heavy and not quite as good as other european lagers . overall : probably the best gateway to this style .

slight metallic smell with hints of grain , a hint of very icky hops . i ca n't smell any honey .  pours a murky orange with a thin , clingy head . nothing special in this regard .  there 's actually a nice amount of body to this one .

definitely pale . the nose on this beer is not very entertaining . it 's lightly fruity , but weak in the malt department . not its finest quality , the aroma . the taste is rather pungent , but otherwise underwhelming .  there were a few big bubbles , but very minimal head . there was lacing but it did n't really stick to the glass .  mouthfeel is light with a good spike of carbonation .

lots of weird grape scents .  pours an opaque orange/brown , thin tan head forms , disappears to a thin ring really fast , some lace spots .  taste is a very light malt sweetness upfront with a moderately bitter finish of good length and crispness . a pretty uncomplicated beer , good for the style , a good lawnmower beer .

the aroma was barely detectable due to the beer being served to cold and in a frozen mug . what nose there was showed some earthy biscuits and sweet malts .  a : muddy brown with limited tan head that quickly fades but leaves lace on he edge .  nice carbonation and creamy mouthful .

s : sweet , almost cloying honey ; a saccharine , slightly off-putting aroma . d : not bad , but smell is a bit too sweet and almost like sweaty skin .  served a crisp yellow with a thin diminishing head .  mouthfeel is good all around- enough carbo to temper the bitterness , moderately thick , finishes dry . a damn shame .

s : at first it had a strong waft of earthiness and coffee , but as it warmed , the smell became very muted . nothing pronounced . t : licorice and chocolate-covered cherries dominate .  cloudy caramel colour with little to no head .  m : fuller side of medium-bodied with moderate carbonation that tickles the tongue and throat . this aspect of the beer is really nice .

a : straw lager coloring , half finger head with nice lacing . s : not much on the nose at all , nothing negative but nothing really positive to say either . d : very drinkable , i wish i had tried this brew before and will definitely be having again to support my local brewery .  it poured a very dark brown , and is black in the glass , with no highlights . the head is disappointing . very thin , tan , and does n't last at all .  mouthfeel is decent medium bodied and goes down smooth .

s : not a ton of aroma . some citrus and maybe grassy notes . there 's a big metallic aroma , too .  it pours an average golden amber with a decent off-white head , but appearance is this beer 's weakest suit .  feel is pretty smooth , nothing weird here .

barnyard smells of raw hay and excrement ... unappealing .  like most traditional gueuze and like most drie fonteinen , this is pretty damn good stuff but compared to drie fonteinens 50th anniversary gueuze , which was consumed earlier in the day , it was clearly obvious that this was the lesser of the two . hazy nectarine . a good gueuze .  crisp , clean mouthfeel with flavors of dry , pale malt . at first , i found myself wanting more flavor , a la boston lager , but the mouthfeel and resulting drinkability really brought things back up for me in the end .

smell is nothing to write home about . a big household mould aroma , like clothes left in a wet , warm pile in a basement somewhere .  i was lured into the purchase by the pretty pink cherry blossoms on the can and my desire for the neverending hokkaido winter to end.. the beer is a thin yellow , with light , fast-fading bubbles . there 's a light , roasted grain taste which appeals ... until ... the incredibly nasty aftertaste hits , which sends shivers through the body .  m - nice . thick .

a : pours a hazy red , minimal head retention s : nose features acetone , paint , flashes of rye here and there , lots of herbal qualities t : taste features rye with hints at spiciness , the rye malt brings out a bitterness that does n't seem to be contributed from hops mf : high carbonation , medium body o : well this brew certainly features plenty of rye , but the supporting cast does not elevate the rye in any way .  taste is of a clean blonde , well done and superior to macros , but without much interest , thin bodied and typical .  feels very creamy but that does n't make the beer more drinkable to me .
smells of yeast and not much else .  appearence ... slight haze ( no big deal ) but the color is way off . looks like an amber .  m. medium-high carbonation , zesty on the tongue .

i did not use a lime , if you need fruit with your beer perhaps you should look for another type of beer . there is no smell of hops , but the taste is crisp , and this beer is super easy to drink .  a- golden yellow little no white lace / head s- a slight skunky smell to it light hop odor t- tasted like your average heineken , nothing to really stand out m- went down smooth , slight aftertaste the beer skunk after taste very thin d- not bad would have been better on a hot day , not one i would run out and get again but might have it if i were out for italian .  smacks-you-in-the-face astringent . zippy on the mouth like you 'd expect .
aroma reminds me of lemongrass or some kind of oriental vegetables like bok choy .  the color is an awful yellow .  feel medium body , pleasant texture , some drying and bitterness in the finish .

s : almost no odor to speak of ( had warm bottle , too ) . t : great flavor , much better than the aroma .  appearance : crystal clear pale yellow with a thin ring of lace that has trouble staying around .  m : medium-bodied with low and sightly creamy carbonation . there is a slight sticky feel and syrupy feel .
smell is of grains and mustard seeds . this is very weird .  appearance - super clear pale and yellow , looks like discolored water .  very refreshing in the mouth , its best quality .

no real smell , white head , weak lacing . decent taste , could drink the shit out of it ! as i read somewhere before ... lawnmower beer !  a : pours out a light yellow amber , with less than fingers width of off what head that dissipates almost immediately . leaves no lacing .  m : the carbonation is pretty much just right , and it 's smooth .
aroma is stale with a hint of berry .  the appearance is pale gold with a small head .  mouthfeel is crisp , the whole drink is refreshing due to the good carbonation .

the aroma is grainy with a bit of hops .  this unusually plain pale ale is a pee yellow , and has an aroma of musty basement inhabited by a cat . it is a little less than ideal for a standard american pale ale , but will certainly do in a pinch when decent beer is needed for mindless television watching .  m : medium body and very good amount of carbonation in my opinion .

the nose is almost non existant .  it was a light , translucent yellow in the glass with a filmy head . a thick lace would form as i sipped , but it would quickly slide back down into the beer . but it was not as wheaty as a hefeweizen .  mouthfeel is medium with good level of carbonation .

really not very pleasant .  seems like this cheap import is on sale every week at winn-dixie . this pours a light , watery yellow with a medium-sized , but thin head .  taste - 3.0/5.0 - light `` summer '' type beer , prob good if really hot , some malt crispness feel - 4.0/5.0 - smooth , light , refreshing drinkability - 2.5/5.0 - would have again , if it was hot , but not enough flavor make this a go-to beer

my wife smelled it and said `` yuck '' and said it reminded her of some makeup she wears . the smell did get a little better the longer i drank it , but initially - not good .  a - pours a very pale golden colour , finger f head with no retention or lacing .  this beer does have a nice smooth , dry mouthfeel .

once again , the clear glass has proved to be detrimental to the smell of the beer . beer was slightly skunky , enough so that i could detect no other smells . one thing i have learned though . big burst of sweet malt right from the beginning . no hops of any substance .  straw yellow appearance with very little head .  medium carbonation .

very clear brassy color s - smells like two skunks fighting in an old oil drum .  odouls premium & extra smooth na brew pours weak yellow from a 12oz green bottle with a twist off cap . head goes to about one finger then poof , its gone ... no wisp no lace ... the top of the brew is smooth as glass .  lighter body and a nice lively carbonation .
smell is extremely poor , not showing any orange .  pours amber without any head .  mouthfeel is sticky and sweet with a nice roundness and full character .

smell- dry , musty cardboard and old hops ... not very pleasant . the aroma is , in a nutshell , stale . otherwise , this is worthless imo .  light , but clean golden straw color . i dont want to hijack my own review with a comparison to other lime beers , namely miller chill , but i feel i must . while miller chill actually does a litle something for me with its somewhat confectionary and artificial salty/limey taste , this beer is just a weak light beer with a hint of lime . id almost rather pull the faux pas of putting a lime wedge in a slightly more flavorable beer .  '' m - actually a nice and robust mouthfeel , i just do n't really want to feel this beer in my mouth because it tastes kind of terrible .
s- sweet cereal grain , a bit of bready malt , clean .  the soapy white head sinks quickly into very poor lacings .  good , solid creamy feel with enough dryness to get you through .

let 's go in close ... soap , wet cardboard , aspirin ... i 'm almost tempted to call it `` skunked '' , it is in a clear green bottle , all the way from england , and had been sitting on a dry shelf , in a well-lit aisle . anyway , it does n't smell like any ipa ... taste : wet , juicy , lightly acidic , softly hoppy ... there 's an oily , buttery , off-putting finish , then nothing ... lacks any of the snap or bite i prefer in a good ipa , but that 's never the british way , is it ? gets better as we go ... but i 'll never forget how unpromising the aroma was when i first cracked it .  ugly dirty brown .  mouthfeel was good and thick , but was n't enough to save this beer from being a disappointment .

there is almost no aroma to this beer , a very light hint of malt but that 's it . inoffensive beer to start a session , but would n't seek this out specifically .  well this stuff sucks . get drunk and visit a frat party .  i did n't want to buy this because i do n't trust twisted pine to sell me a good beer . since i am a sucker and i love hoppy beers i bought it anyway . the smell was very hoppy citrus , pine and something off i could n't place until i tasted it , butter . this beer was quite disappointing and i poured out the remaining 13 or so ounces after i finished my first glass .

this is a very average , no frills stout . i pick up no smell what-so-ever . acceptable , some chocolate hints in the flavoring but nothing stellar yet nothing really bad either .  *did not mind would not buy* app : haze pale yellow water .  carbonation is very fine , which leads to a good mouthfeel .

s- have some citrus notes , but you could hardly smell anything . hops also in nose . t/m-medium bitterness , some wheat aroma , carbonation is present highly .  a - pale straw color ; clear .  mouthfeel - some creamy smoothnes , well-carbonated .

funky aroma , grainy . effervescent . lagery . cooked vegetables .  appearance : pours amberish brown in color with a surprising amount of sediment in the beer .  m : chewy and viscous . if anything , the aging has tempered some of the trademark trainwreck mouthfeel and flavors of base dark lord , so i 'm impressed .
some sugar , vanilla powder , cheap chocolate .  a - pale gold with a small head that quickly dissipated to only the larger bubbles and no lacing in moments .  nice mouthfeel .

the aroma is alittle funky , i was not pleased .  appearance : pours a light-golden yellow hue , with a half-finger head that quickly dissipates into nothingness . not impressed . while this beer pours out looking horrible , and smelling average , the taste and overall refreshment factor makes it a very nice beer .  glass : new belgium globe aging notes : one year at ~60f in the dark bang for the buck ( oz* % / $ ) : 22*6.2/10 = 13.64 a : orange , white lacey head , slightly cloudy from yeast s : horse-y farmhouse brett with hints of orange t : brett dominates ( horse-stable hay , a little dung almost ) , notes of orange m : silky , coating , lingering , pleasant o : worth drinking , a little one-dimensional with the brett .

the nose , however , brings in a harsh metallic scent which is rather unpleasent , though it 's the sort of thing that 's possibly more indicative of a bad batch . luckily , the metallic scent does n't carry over too much into the flavor , which is actually quite enjoyable . the brew 's a bit more weighty than the light red hue might have you think , and malty to the core .  brown 33cl bottle , best before 02-2010 , poured carefully into a westmalle chalice leaving the sediment in the bottle . pale yellow and slightly hazy/cloudy with a small white wisp on top , a poor collar tried to hang onto the glass but failed after about two minutes .  if there is , then this ska brew is a prime example ... this is the second time i tasted a bottle of this brew . this is an extremely clean tasting brew which is a great quality i enjoy , but where are the hops ? the malt and ( not overwhelming ) bitterness serve as great supporting backbones to what should be a wonderful hoppy aroma and flavor . as it stands , this brew is severely lacking in hop flavor/aroma and comes across as a brew which should be named `` delicate '' rather than `` decadent '' imperial ipa .

aroma is actually kind of foul . metallic , alcoholic , and a little skunked .  pours a clear apple juice gold with a 1 finger quickly dissipating white head that leaves zero lace .  the mouthfeel is medium to full with decent carbonation .

poured from bottle into pint glass a - clear light yellow with 2 fingers of foam that are sticky s - kind of a grassy smell reminds me of budweiser t - not a lot of flavor but crisp and clean again reminds me of budweiser .  a : lots of debris floating around in the beer . i know this is unfiltered beer , but the amount of junk in the beer is imo out of line .  you do n't get much of the sweet malts you get from the aroma so it really confuses the senses and does n't make for an enjoyable experience mouthfeel is heavy and it sticks to your mouth for minutes .

smell is very off putting to me . i get a tingle in my nose from the alcohol and then an overwhelming scent of bananas to cover it up . taste is exactly like the smell just a little more bearable .  pours a dark copper color with no head . good clarity , but the complete lack of visual carbonation was a turn off .  pretty much just a tingly water . very smooth and somewhat refreshing beer .

faint hops .  the appearance is pale gold with a slight white hue and a small head that fades fast .  m- a good body to it . good weight and smooth carbonation . there is a strange foamy texture in the finish though .

smell is weak , slight roasted barley and a little dark malt character but not much else .  this is an awesome , cheap , f**k you up-type beer . yellow , smells like alcohol and corn . sometimes you just want a crappy beer , and this is it .  pleasantly effervescent mouthfeel .

yeasty aroma with the funk of rotten fruit and full kitchen garbage can.. nasal accents of strong commonly-belgian hops work their way in as well .  pours a hazy orange with tons of large sediment , it looks like floating flakes of brown shit ( yuk ) , the head is off-white ( almost yellow ) and small , it does leave some sheets of lace.the nose is lightly toasted and malty , sweet with hints of marshmellow and citrusy hops.the taste is straight forward , sweet hops fruity and citrusy ( grapefruit mostly ) with some pale malts in a subtle balance , a nice bitter edge keeps things interesting but i would have enjoyed more tangyness and depth.the mouthfeel is a little to sticky on the lips for me , the body is medium and the carbonation is low.i have always avoided taking bar flys home , this one is no exception .  crisp , good body overall .

smell is thin and elusive ; a mild graininess is about all i can pick up . a sweet corn aroma dances around in the background , barely making its presence known .  this pours with a fizzy short-lived head , over very very pale yellow liquid .  pretty slick mouthfeel .

the smell is raisins , plums , maybe some dark chocolate and caramel , followed by a sweet syrupy alcohol . there is an unpleasant metallic component to the sweetness , and there is not much complexity .  pale straw colouring , head subsided almost immediately and made the beer appear quite flat once it had .  i like the feel with some prickly carbonation and moderately light feel and some creaminess from the head .

ok , so i bit on the $ 2 can at a local burger bar . i wo n't work through the five-tier rating system here , and will just say , for what you are paying , this is an honest beer . beats the hell out of bud , miller , coors any day .  i drink miller light because it 's lower in carbs and calories then other beers yet still has a good beer taste without a bad `` light beer '' aftertaste . it might not be a premium beer for special occasions but it 's a great everyday-beer for the everyday drinker .  a little sticky and a very bitter aftertaste .

pours a nice clear golden with an average head that dissapated before i took a drink smelled a bit skunky ( surprise surprise ) with some sweetness in there .  pours an insanely pale color , it looks like watered down lemonade , not even sure if i have seen a beer with this little color before , has no head either , pretty boring overall .  surprisingly , the sediment was n't hard and i did n't feel a corporeal presence in my mouth . coopers best extra stout was nice on the palate ; softly carbonated and creamy . to tell you the truth , i was a bit disappointed .
smell - rather light almost indistinct . most prominent odor is light vanilla .  extremely pale straw golden yellow in color and completely clear .  m : medium bodied , good amount of carbonation .

i think this is the first time i 've ever written this , but the aroma seriously reminds me of urine .  if you pour it good you can get absolutely no head on it , looks like apple juice when you do .  the body of this beer suits the style with the usual level of north coast drinkability and feel to it . definitely the best feature .

smell is , well , sauerkraut . it dominates the aroma and any sembelence of oakiness or caramel just get lost in the sauerkraut . needless to say , i do n't like sauerkraut . taste is significantly better than aroma , but still not all that amazing . definte caramel and burnt sugar flavors as well as lactic tartness and there 's that darn sauerkraut again .  poured into a pint glass from the bottle a-has the look of a normal american macro light yellow with no head .  smooth and refreshing , light to medium bodied with a slight tingling on the tongue .

nothing special in the smells department . kind of reminds me of smelling miller high life .  light gold color with a bubbly head that dissolves right away .  m - low carbonation , tiny bubbles , overall feels pretty good .

this is i would say an good hot day beer . a wheat beer would be more preferable but i havent one . either way it has no hop characteristics at all . deffinately sessionable  poured a pale yellow colour with absolutely zero head nor lacing .  light and creamy mouth feel with obviously knocked down carbonation .

it smelled like feet to me , a little bit skunky .  a - poured into a pint glass , this beer is absolutely indistinguishable from ginger ale . o - i bought this beer on a tip that it was identical to other american macros at a substantial discount . pbr 's even cheaper and much better , though - if for some reason you 're looking to buy an american macro , there 's no good reason to pick this up .  m-fairly dry . medium high carbonation .

black pour that left lots of lace as i drank it , but very little aroma . maybe the pub itself was too smoky to smell anything , but i basically caught some malty scents , and that 's it .  the opaque black body is entirely headless , laceless and lackluster with a distressing lack of carbonation .  mouthfeel is nice and thick and well carbonated . the best part of the beer .

smell is faint with light adjunct , malt and hop . fairly light for the style acting and tasting more like a lager , the bottle does say ale , but ba style says dark lager which i would agree more with .  it poured a murky , yellow-white color . very hard to describe . it also was corn .  m : moderate carbonation with a decently viscous mouthfeel .
smells like musty , almost dank lemons .  clear yellow in color with no head at all .  m : medium-light body ; moderate carbonation ; smooth and clean mouthfeel .

almost no aroma in the nose . the appearances of cloudy lemonade .  *did not mind would not buy* app : kinda bland and yucky colored yellow , white head that was here and then suds .  feels slick , not very carbonated , and heavy . alcohol warming is powerfully strong . lacks balance and drinkability .

smells of diacetyl .  a : solid black , no head , inert , no lacing -- wow it looks dead s : roasted barley with waffs of leather t : burned barley taste detracts from what otherwise would be a simple , pleasant stout ; very lightly hopped , so not complex m : the lack of head and carbonation really detracts from the mouthfeel i 'm a big fan of growler 's -- i 'm prouder of no other ; but this batch did n't turn out well .  there 's moderate carbonation to it as well .

nothing truly distinctive or enjoyable about the aroma . has reasonable body for this type of beer .  lacing is sparse to nil . too bad the appearance is hum-drum .  aroma : hops . the crystal hops dominate the aroma . the malt is there , but overpowered by hops . but i do n't taste the balance that an esb should have . the hops weigh far more than the malt in this beer . notes : this tasted like a very good ipa , but did not have the balance i was expecting , for an esb . a great beer , but did n't fit the style as well as i would have liked .

somewhat skunky aroma , but that 's no surprise coming from a green bottle . the taste is above average for a macro lager .  had this with my thai food tonight , worked alright poured golden with 1 finger of white head . zero head retention & lacing s : sweetness , a bit of grassy hops & that is it t : some honey malt , adjunct cereal sweetness & slight lemon hops up front .  good carbonation .

there was a mild earthy aroma that lends nothing to the beer .  zero head . o : the lack of head and almost non-existent carbonation seems off .  mouthfeel is pretty good however , with a nice medium feel .

pretty boring and bland .  my bus driver purchased this for me from a 7-11 outside of cancun ... appears a transparent light gold with a small white head that quickly fades out . tiny remnants of lacing are left .  m = moderately carbonated . good .

aroma is corny adjunct with little to no hops .  this is typical beer of a brazilian macro brewery . a pale industrial lager as many other brazilian competitors , with a little more bitterness .  good mouthfeel for this light body but the hops balance the feel .

there seemed to be a total lack of smell , save a slight hint of fruit .  a - pours pink with half an inch of white foam and soda-like carbonation . looks an awful lot like some kind of fanta .  this is my first review and hope it looks well , even if not my favorite beer . leaves a malt taste on the roof and tongue . this is the first scottish ale i 've tried . for comparison , i love dark ales , like ommegang abbey belgium ale and founders breakfast stout . bottle serving .
aroma : sour dough bread with emphasis on sour , as in old stale rags .  a- very cloudy with pulpish looking stuff floating in it .  m : full body with mild carbonation ; slightly clinging .

smells like dirt and honey . too dirty smelling and tasting to have more than one or two ( ever ) unless it was all that i had .  with the last `` porterish '' day before summer actually kicks in upon me , i rate this from a 12-pack sampler ... chocolate-vanilla notes adorn a mocha-soda tint with flatlining head and zero lacing ... like experiencing a cologne bottle ... malty punch ... obtrusive , almost as `` no shit '' as flying dog provokes on its label ... a too smooth ( oily ?  mouthfeel was really good for a light beer . liked the carbonation , and felt richer than it tasted .

there was almost no smell initially after some warming i started to notice some malty essences , some molasses . pretty light taste wise .  `` traditional pale ale '' turned into a mediocre canadian lager courtesy of sleemans . appearance - bubbly pale yellow appearance .  it 's very creamy and goes down easy . i 'm really disappointed with this .

smell is pretty strange and unpleasant , an odd mix of fruits and spices with what i want to say is tomato coming out strong in front .  my least favorite of their beers ... this pours a super light straw , watery color .  m : tingly carbonation , medium body and refreshing enough .

the smell is about half and half lager flavor does no tliv eup to the malt smell at all .  pours a pale gold colour - almost looked silvery coming out of the bottle . looks like a dull impersonation of beer .  the mouthfeel is the pinnacle of this brew . full-bodied with a dry crisp feel .

a : pale straw , fizzy , some head retention s : stale cereal grains , corn , a hint of sweetness t : starts with a tinge of sweetness , big grainy bread profile , considerable amount of flavor for an adjunct lager , decent balance mf : light body , high carb o : better than most of what bmc offers , but only by a slim margin  pour was boring , even for the style , as the beer had little head that vanished quickly and left not lacing on the glass as it was being consumed . color and body are yellow and looks fairly thin . as for budweiser , i would advise ab to make sure they keep the flavor in bud , and leave it to bud light to cater to the people that do n't like the taste of real beer .  the body is light-medium with good carbonation .

this beer looks great and smells bad . the distinctive packaging and the average taste add up to a drinkable beer if you choices are limited and you want to look ultra cool .  no head . no lace .  mouthfeel is pretty good , it has a nice full body , and a good finish .

poured into a shaker glass ... virtually no aroma ( at least to my smeller ) . lemon is very faint .  i wish i had some shiner frst here to compare it to , but , i do n't . if this is indeed the same beer as shiner frst , i must say , i do n't like it as much . it also seems sweeter than i remember shiner frst being , but perhaps my palate has changed , or this particular pint is not up to snuff . that being said everyone is different and if your a shiner man you sholuld try it .  mouthfeel was good , with plenty of carbonation and a nice smoothness to it .

so with that in mind ... the taste was small and the aroma was microscopic . this one smelled of beer , and i am talking tat white beer can with black letters that was so wonderfully used in the film repo man .  a : ugh . thin , sickly yellow with minimal head . d : i could definitely see this beer serving as fodder for beer pong or similar games .  the mouthfeel is thick and oily with a mild burn going down . have a bottle of this is all i can handle , which is good because the full bottle would have me a little too buzzed .

( s ) not very aromatic . faint pilsner-like scent with a slight fruit essence .  a - pours just the lightest clear gold with a thin white head that dissipates quickly , leaving nothing but a steady stream of carbonation bubbles . a bit better then your average adjunct , but an adjunct nonetheless .  ) the body is a hefty medium , bordering on the truly heavy , with a light moderate carbonation and a fairly chewy feel . harsh .
nose was somewhat skunky - that 's it .  very light yellow with no head to speak of- apple juice .  big body , low carbonation .

not a lot of aroma though , more of a faint `` beer-stink '' smell ... certainly not that impressive .  the pour is flat and the head is dismal . due to their being no head , there 's subsequently no retention or lacing .  nice mouthfeel for a pale ale .

aroma - weak , slightly stale smelling malt .  kind of a cloudy greyish color . not very appealing to the eyes .  mouthfeel : well-carbonated , as expected from the heady pour drinkability : low- i could n't get over the tire flavor , which is a shame because every other aspect of the beer was delightful

there 's virtually no aroma besides the hops and that leaves in a hurry .  this beer is pretty drinkable , but that is all it has going for it . '' it is completely underwhelming , with no nice finish and a boring appearance . i was excited when i bought this because of all i have heard about it , but i was just disappointed upon drinking it .  mouthfeel : medium to light with lively carbonation .

strange very dry grain smell not sweet . cant ' quite pinpoint the smell , [ spice of some sort ] not unpleasant , but not like any pale ale i 've had before . that smell is present at the back flavors but still unidentifiable .  three of some of the great brewers together to produce a lovely , artistic bottle with minute text on the back outlining the mikkeller history from loving the pale yellow american macro-beers of the past . the first thing noticed was that it poured much like the `` fizzy yellow '' macro-beers mentioned ; but this soon darkened a bit with a 1-2 finger white head that soon disappeared without a lace !  good mouthfeel and texture for a tap beer .

the smell is musty grains and stale beer .  it looked like coke .  hints of chocolate up front , but quickly overrun by the massive spices . reminds me of chewing on a mixture of green baking herbs , and about as pleasing on my palate . an interesting brew to say the least , but not one i 'd purchase again .

like most macros , its easy going down , and unappealing in scent or appearence .  from the perfume river in vietnam ( no really , that 's what the label says ) , on to the beer : poured into a mug , it 's a clear yellow color with a soda-like head .  mouthfeel is quite nice and full .

not much smell to it . an average candian lager , i take this over labatt any day , plus the twin labels can give you a good laugh sometimes .  pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head that quickly dissipates .  yeast , stale hops , a little grass , so boring with a duvel quality ... the taste is equally as bad , bitter toffee , light stale hops , way too much yeast , sour finish . pass .

aroma is the green bottle skunked hops aroma that you get from some of these types of `` imports '' not necessarily bad , but very strong and overpowers the grain bill completely .  pale gold with no head .  a zesty tingle on the tongue at first , nice medium body , but the cinnamon is too much .

nose is of cardboard , caramel , a stack of paper , plums , herbs and is pretty yeasty .  the color of this beer is murky , hazy dark yellow , but there is a tinge of orange too . the foam was much less than expected with only a few wisps of foam which settles to virtually nothing .  the mouthfeel is about right for a stout , a bit thick with low carbonation .

the aroma set the tone for me . maybe a little hop aroma would have pushed it higher for me .  a hard pour produced nothing ! very interesting color .  it is bubbly on the tongue and does leave you dry . it 's smooth , but just kind of basic . it 's a very approachable stout .

very unimpressive indeed .  this is an easy to drink ale , but there 's nothing really to write home about . be careful not to drink this right out of the refrigerator , as it is really surprisingly bad when cold with a terrible mouthfeel . still , i 'm impressed that goose island has so many beers to i find very drinkable , and they are able to do it in large quantities .  '' the mouthfeel is good . its quite smooth and slightly creamy .

faint smell , nothing offensive there .  a : pours a mahogany color , very very flat . absolutely no head , no lacing .  mouthfeel is light and refreshing making the beer overall a decent session beer .

great head retention & super lacing s : an almost dirt like smell , maybe mushroom ? then vegtal notes , t : nutty malt & dryness up front with a hint of brown sugar . finishes with a hint of choclate , brown sugar & more breadyness mf : chewy for the abv with low carbonation drinks fine if you can past the funky smell , maybe the perfect session when you have a cold or sinus infection ? been a long time since i had abeer that smelled this bad & still tasted good .  a - pours a pale straw colour , finger of head with little retention or lacing .  has a nice medium to full body with light carbonation .

smell is not impressive with watery dark malt and stale coffee .  much like urine but with a less of a head ( no pun intended ) .  the mouthfeel is fine . it is a low/medium bodied beer with good carbonation .

smell : a faint fruity aroma , but not much more .  lots of bubbles . no head what-so-ever , no lacing either . looks like sparkling lemon koolaid .  this is my first , of hopefully many reviews , so bare with me . once they were chilled i poured them into a pint glass and sat back with my favorite tv shows a- pours a dark red almost brownish color s- smells like your average porter , did n't really pick up on too much vanilla t- taste more of chocolate or toffee but with hints of vanilla m- pretty smooth , goes down easy without any bite o- not sure if i would buy a case of it , but its good when thrown in a variety pack

not a lot of nose to this one . a little bit of caramel with a hint of earthy hops . hops come out a bit more in the taste with a very piney presence . mediocre offering from a brewery that is never really bad , but not good either .  real ale 's website says this is 5.1 % abv as hard as i tried i could n't pour more than 1/2 '' head , lacing almost nonexistent , clear straw yellow , looks like a macro lager .  m-creamy and good mouthfeel d-did n't finish my 1/5 share of the bomber .

some malt , corn maybe . nothing offensive - nothing different - nothing outragious . have moosehead pale ale .  not much to say about appearance- straw yellow , highly carbonated , foamy head .  nice creamy mouthfeel .

nose is grainy - pretty faint .  weak soft yellow color , head does n't last at all ... smells a bit skunky as well .  mouthfeel- medium mouthfeel ( for the style ) . carbonation level was perfect for bringing out the bittering hops .

aroma of neutral grains with a restraining vegetal character . slightly better in flavor with sweet grain notes and a touch of citrus . likely better from the can where the weak aroma is not a factor and the carbonation would stick around a bit longer .  pale , cloudy , straw-yellow with a very small , thin head . an almost complete lack of lacing . looks like faygo pineapple-orange soda .  the mouth feel was thick and creamy ( a high gravity ) overall not a `` session beer '' but one to enjoy and move on .

weak aroma , not much of anything except for a tiny bit of earth and oxidation . plae malt with no depth at all . floral hop flavor with a hint of bitterness . overall , not enough malt flavor to make this one worth it .  pours a very pale , straw-like color . yeah , it 's drinkable as most macros are , but there are many macros that can suit this purpose at a lower price .  i liked the mouthfeel , smooth and gentle .

the smell was rather disapointing for an octoberfest and seemed somewhat bland with slight hops and malt evident with a spicy tinge .  light yellow and some greyishness to its appearance . booze in aroma . pino 's bottle.not up to the style of even a light lager .  mouthfeel is medium/light with good carbonation .

s- the aroma is pretty typical for a red ale . not a lot going on in the aroma . t- the taste like the aroma starts out with some malt and caramel flavors with a mild hop bitterness in the finish . decent , but nothing special .  pours a very pale crystal clear straw color with a champagne like head that quickly dissipates into nothingness .  moderate hops with lots of body , almost chewy .

a good hot weather outdoors session beer , can only get in a bottle , not available in a keg for my kegerator , a shame , need to add a lime and lots of salt , that way i can not taste the actual beer . this is a light beer but not as watery tasting as american light beers and the lime and salt make it something a little special .  very clear and light straw colored .  carbonation was crisp for a medium body .

it smells pretty bad too .  cloudy golden color body topped by a thin white head that quickly fades . a hefe with a quick-fading head ?  smooth with a creamy but dry finish . i walked away thinking that the `` smoked vanilla , coffee , and birch '' was meant to be flavor descriptors rather than actual ingrediants . all of these elemtns were way too weak to be appreciated for what other beers can do with them . call it a single , nix the mention of the adjuncts , and this beer would be alright .

the aroma is not good at all . it smells like corn with some chlorine mixed in for good measure .  i poured my first bottle and poured it out because there were lots of floaties . poured a second glass and still lots of floaties . the color was a sick orange , with a thin head that receded to the edges .  mouthfeel is medium bodied and crisp . good carbonation , but the overall trainwreck of flavor in the brew makes this one hard to take down .

smell : very weak smell overall- some sweet pale malts and grain hints .  ) a : clear pale yellow body . white foamy head dissipated over a few minutes .  it has a very soft mouthfeel , a little like soda to be honest and you can barely notice the alcohol .

strange aroma that i can not quite place , not very interesting , maybe malt , maybe hops hmm not sure . light and malty with a hint of roast in the finish but then disappears.not much happening here , it 's finish is ever so slightly bitter and somewhat soapy .  appearance - poured thin and yellow/gold with about 1 inch of head . after settling , this beer exactly resembles drawn butter ... lobster anyone ? ?  m- good carbonation and substantial body , not bad here .

smell is light with a hint of corny sweetness .  appearance : this brew is classified and a standard american adjunct beer , and thas is exactly how is should be classified .  not really much going on that i can discern m : this is one category where this beer does well with a nice light feel and pleasant carbonation d : why would i want another ?

in the world of light ales , this one wins the color award : yellow , even bright yellow hue under decent head . ah , that somewhat skunky hop aroma that is much more pronounced in a rolling rock . lack of malt or sweet in aroma had me prepared for the worst .  pours a pale golden yellow colour with almost no head . no lacing on the glass .  the feel was pleasantly smooth , but was unimpressed with the drinkability as seemed to reform a head with every drink .

behind that , you get a decent blend of malt sweetness , graininess and saaz hops . to bad the fools had to out this in a green bottle .  pours a brown + red beer with minimal viscosity and head to it . carbonation appeared to be lacking at this point .  mouthfeel is medium , carbonation average-high with some pleasant warming feel .

i have not had an american lager in a lonnnggg time so i gave bud a try . the aroma was as i remembered - absent .  soda pop head that dies to nearly no bubbles . very thin and spotty lace that does not last .  mouthfeel is thick and smooth , no watery sensation at all .

the nose was very faint . i could detect some sublte pruney scents with much effort . some roasted nut and toffee flavors hit your tongue and do n't get overpowered by the hops that jump into the fray .  very light pale yellow , almost `` white '' with small fine head .  mouthfeel was real good .

s : sweet malt for sure . moldy wood and cooked veggies .  simply put , i 'm stunned that i got nothing ! zero head on this . the body is a hazy straw color that just looks dull and mucky .  as i drink more my palate adjusts but it does n't ever really get over the off flavors m - pretty thick , not too carbonated , nice mouth coating qualities d - burnt coffee does not go down very well , plust the thickness of the beer limits my ability to quaff this completely i like coffee , i like stouts , and i like a lot of coffee stouts ( new glarus and founders breakfast stout for instance ) .

smells is practically non-existent , but as it warms i pick up a very herbal hop aroma that reminds me of straight hop pellets .  poured the carta blanca from a bottle to a pint glass . very , very thin looking .  smells of raisins , a hint of semi-sweet choc ? mouthfeel is nice , thick , syrupy & smooth ... the way i want a barleywine .

hardly any smell , a little bit of malt maybe .  drank this from a bottle then poured into glass mug . the appearenc is more towards a yellow then orangish bud light.the scent.is of course a strong lime eventhough i still recognize the bud light.the tases pretty much is the same as the smell . other notes=eventhough it is very carbonated the head dissapates very quicklyand is not rettained at all.also.there was absolutely nooo lacing whatsoever .  very rich flavor of dark malts and smoke , with hints of coffee and chocolate as well . the finish is almost all smoke , much too intense for my liking . ive used this many times in making caribou pot roasts in the crockpot . they even have a recipe on their website , which is delicious . i was informed that this beer has won more medals at the great american beer festival than any other beer , quite an accomplishment .

a distinctly grainy malt greets you in the nose along with some skunky hops despite the brown glass bottle .  not very beer like . more like a sparkling apple juice . color is a somewhat dull gold . no head .  mouthfeel is medium , well carbed , nice on all fronts but where it needs to be . big failure , in my opinion .

smells of citrus..and formaldahyde .  ) its appearance is typical of a lager , especially in the style of major domestic lagers such as budweiser , etc . it was yellow and fizzy . the smell reminded me of the corn that was in it , very mediocre . i drank it quickly , wanting nothing more then to get it out of the glass so i could poor a sweetwater ipa .  the mouthfeel was sticky and thick . there was tight and crisp carbonation that was nice .
smell is of grain , corn and a slight skunky smell .  pale yellow with almost no head at all .  the body and carbonation levels are appropriate .

it smells a bit yeasty and a tad skunky .  amber , reddy/orange in colour , clear but no head , not even a collar . looked like a glass of fizzy pop . too sweet and the lack of a head , un-beery look along with its fruity smell does n't do it any favours and the 11 % just masks its shortcomings .  m - nice average mouthfeel .

not bad at all , if you are in to ice beers . i can drink this stuff all day , but choose not to . very strong alcohol taste , and the aftertaste will turn most off after the first few drinks . much better than any other miller product out there . slight tastes of corn also crossed my palate .  very pale straw gold in colour . thin head does n't stick around for very long , and does n't lace .  fine mouthfeel , nothing objectionable , but it 's not a stand-out lager either .
smells just a bit on the rank side . nothing too strong , average ingredients .  looks and smells like any other light lager .  medium mouthfeel .

the nose was a very faint , if any .  this was the bad a : so light it may as well be water ! incredible ! light golden yellow with a ton of carbonation and a fleeting white head .  i have the mom version the head was initially strong , though sudsy and it fell quickly . carbonation is plentiful from the surface of the brew come hop aromas -- minty and herbal -- and coriander . it does n't smell as though an authentic yeast was used , which fits my preconceived notions for rogue 's methods the flavor confirms my american yeast suspicions . light fruity flavors , strong hop contributions , though little spice .

the first thing i smell is an off-putting burnt rubber aroma that continues to decline the more i smell it . beer smell is pretty absent here .  a : very pale , light watered-down yellow .  m - light to medium carbonation with medium carbonation .

s - some malt , but you need to inhale deeply . it also smells somewhat sweet to me , perhaps a bit corny .  a - this is too light . it has a big soapy like head that goes away eventually , but yuck .  palate : very enjoyable . great , smooth , and light on the throat . it would be stellar with cheese .

turns out that the brewery says this is all barley , but i swear i took one whiff and it was all cooked corn . the flavor would be nice without the corn flaw and if they dumped in a bunch of saaz hops .  i wouldnt perfer drinking this stuff everynight , but about once or twice in a month for that cinamon tastes . .. id have to say stick with the punkin ' ale from dogfish-head .  mouthfeel - explodes in the mouth with carbonation , yet maintaining a noteworthy smoothness afterwards . the body is sturdy but not overly big .

unfortunately , the aroma does n't really stand up to the look . there is hardly any malt presence . the taste and texture are ok . it does not hold up to the style well , but if you 're a monty python fan it 's definitely a must .  lightly golden in color with a very thin head that does n't stick around too long . label/artwork looks cheap but has nice pictograms to solve under the caps .  the mouth feel is pretty good and when ice cold very easy to drink .

smell - not a whole lot of aroma , maybe a bit of malt and a little bit of caramel , but not much taste - the taste matches the smell quite well .  this stubby pours a turbid peach tea color with minimal pearl colored head . zero head retention & lacing s : grassyness & citrus , both fade quickly t : grassyness , coriander & tangerine up front .  it is carbonated well . it is crisp and goes down smooth .

there was no bad smell to this , but there was no good smell to it either . there was simply no aroma of any kind . this beer is pretty much odorless .  not an impressive appearance ; it looks pretty weak .  m - thick , syrupy , smooth , a bit refreshing .

smell- light chocolate smell is overshadowed by nasty green apple smell .  this lager poured a weak lackluster yellow-orange in color with a frothy head which quickly reduced to a thin lace covering .  it is very finely carbonated , giving a tickle on the tongue .
funky smell .  uh , it 's lemonade . pale yellow , slightly cloudy . you know , like when it gets up to 79f in seattle .  medium feel in my mouth with good carbonation .

really nothing good ... maybe this is a very old bottle .  poured into a pint glass from the freezer , it had a sizeable head , which quickly calmed down to almost nothing . after looking at the color , noticed that the can said `` caramel coloring added , '' so nothing real to go by there . i pick up the regular if it 's on special , but for a real bitter , this ai n't it .  m : medium body , low to medium carbonation . smooth and creamy . d : something does n't quite work for me .

the beer was poured into a weizen glass and looked the business : murky , dull amber with the usual huge head sat on top , just like all the best hefeweizen . where was the normal aromas of vanilla and banana , no cloves or anything else for that matter .  a : slightly hazy copper body under a thin wisp of off-white head . insipid .  mouthfeel : really thick and chewy . this part would be enjoyable in a good-tasting brew .

not much in the nose , really . some faint pale malts and not much else .  a- pours a very clear and crisp light straw yellow tinted fluid , turns a mild foamy head that falls to near nothing almost instantly .  it had a really good mouthfeel .

aroma theres a strange plastic type aroma coming off here .  with the 5.9 abv , this is equivalent to putting down around 9-10 macro lights , like coors or bud light .  m- medium in body and good carbonation .

the smell is oddly like dirty river water , which kind of turned me off at first .  green bottle into pint glass a : clear gold with a very short-lived head and no lace .  mouthfeel - nice body , pretty crisp .

the nose is grainy and grassy . it tastes sweet and grainy with hints of apples and euro pale lager-esque yeastiness . there is very little of interest here . it 's weak , subdued , but in the end very drinkable .  pours an extremely pale yellow , clear , with large bubbles and a big poofy head .  the carbonation feels pretty crisp .
its about what you would be expecting from a mexican lager .  pours with no head , there are chunky bits on the bottom .  mouthfeel is fine . medium bodied with the right amount of carbonation .

text book nose , nothing special . good mouthfeel with nice malty notes , although offset by some high levels of fizz .  it pours a clear , pale yellow , with a below average white head , fades very quickly and leaves a little ring around the top .  syrupu sweetness , not cloying , with hop dryness in the blend . this is what imperial pilsner is supposed to be ? what happened to the pilsner part ?

the smell was minimal . minor nutty notes detected .  it basically taste and looks like your standard american lagar , but at 6 % it holds it flavor _really_ well as it wars up , unlike most american macrobrews . touch of honey sweetness , maybe 20 ibu and very little on the nose and not very much to look at , carbonation is tight , keeps a decent tingle on the toune 30 minutes past the pour . reminds me of discovering shiner bock back in college when i could buy cases and return the bottles ... why did that have to end ?  mouthfeel is light bodied with good carbonation .

cans . ugh , off-putting smell . extra high abv high gravities , like 9.0 % and above , have the grape tinge to them . this smells like it is going to have the grapey alcohol overpowering taste thing going on . ides . ) barely any sweetness at all .  appearance : very cloudy , much more so than an average wheat beer . the head was almost nonexistent , but had decent lacing for whatever was there .  mouthfeel : medium-bodied . fair carbonation .

smells skunky . not much else to say.. taste is creamy and sweet .  undated bottle , but these just arrived on the shelf at a street wines , so it shouldnt be too old . head is small , rapidly fizzling to a ring of bubbles , beer is copper to very light auburn-amber and though the bottle has no sediment left in it whatsoever , the beer does have a decent chill haze . no lacing on the glass , head is off-white .  saccharine all the way . how can you add fake sweetener to bier ? the beer is best described as diet raspberry 7 up . i already go to the gym 4 times a week so that i can drink all the fabulous beer i desire . flavors were overwhelmingly sweet , and tart . complexion was shirley temple , and body was crisp .
not much of a smell . slightly nutty and slightly sweet .  lots of sediment poured in . no lacing and no head retention at all .  m : very nicely carbonated for this type of beer .

not much on the nose , a little jammy with hints of dried tree fruits . maybe it was possible , i could n't smell anything in this !  appearance : pours a light amber colour with a white head diminishing quickly to a thin ring .  oily mouthfeel with next to no carbonation . quite thick and heavy , coating every area of the mouth .

s- has a slighty sweet smell , but not much there . t- very light with a slight sweetness .  ok so appearance is not good , looks flat and no real head or lacing .  it 's still fairly sturdy though , and carbonation is low but solid .

the aroma is weak . roasty . smells a bit like a rotten tooth . it 's not that pleasant .  there was a lot of particulate and white chunks floating around in the liquid that turned into a layer of sediment in the bottom of the glass that was thicker than the beers initial head .  very tame malt , very little hops , and weak alcohol that 's more like aftershave . definitely not over-carbonated , the texture fits the style . actually the best element of this beer .

it smells metallic and skunky , with some sweet corn graininess and fusel alcohol lurking below .  a : pours a deep brown with a soda-like head that quickly fizzes away to nothing . zero lacing .  mouthfeel : trademark lager crispness and smoothness , light bodied and dry .
s : not much here . some light chocolate maybe . t : sweet malt and fruits .  beer fizzes upon pour but leaves absolutely no head .  m - pretty thin and definitely refreshing .

smell : immediately after i popped off the cap i got a whiff of ... corona . the aroma is slight , but there is a hint of macro lager grains there . it 's a good anytime lager -- the pabst of mexico .  black color turning to a yellow gold around the top . once again it looks very thin and watery . low marks are in order here .  flavor was very strong ginger , and this made the mouthfeel quite crisp and pretty good .

smells moderately skunked and i 'd suppose the green glass bottle despite looking cool contributed to that .  poured a smallish head with no retention . color was a pale yet golden sunshine color . the lacing was defiently subpar with any average wheat beer .  smells sour , big nodes of orange and very tart lemon juice . there 's a bit of a funky hop in there , as well . no real spice of which to speak , nor any hint of wheat . very sour , almost cidery . starts more tart , like lemon juice , moves into a dryer , white wine middle , and ending on a more of a light , semi-sweet orange sour . a unique beer , to say the least . could benefit from a bit of something at the end , but is drinkable enough as it is .

not a whole lot of smell , there 's a little malt , and i do n't really smell pumpkin .  the color is moderate golden . something is wrong with the color on this one . no head and no lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel : medium thickness , almost chewy , minimal froth .
s : nothing . uh oh ! t : pilsner like . m : light and mellow , yet some bitterness .  this one pours a pale gold color with a hint of malt in the smell .  m - great carbonation , finishes well .

poured from a real 16 ounce bottle , perfect pint ! aroma is pretty lacking as for the hops , i pick up faint pine , but its a dissapointment for aroma off a double ipa .  a new beer can in my country , specifically in my city , little better than its other presentation glass bottle , made by miller , a strong american brewer in my country , i think best than a & b in market participation , a 32 oz beer , like `` caguama '' , i drink in a pilsner glass , its taste is like crusehd hops , little of malt liquour reminicense , poor color , pale yellow , poor lacing , good for the mexican food , 70 % recommended .  adequate carbonation .

it pours a straw yellow with a 1 inch white head . the smell is not bad , but when i smell a typical high quality hefeweizen , it is a sensory overload of goodness . after the smell , the taste is surprising .  a : typical adjunct pale and clear yellow body with circumferential white head that disspaeared quickly . no lacing . s : corn grains , some vague hop aromas and some slight cheap german pilsener alcohol smell when just poured and while it 's cold .  char davies , the artist in 1998 , made a fully interactive immersive visual/aural virtual artwork called ephemere , which furthers the work begun in osmose started in 1995 and displayed in the national gallery of canada in ottawa on june 26 , 1998. who cares ? this beer is almost close to a champaign ( and i would think that the yeast probably is champaign ) . also there is bitterness , which is nice to know that at least there are some hops to the so called beer . it is not advisable to use apples with fermenting , as the yeast creates funky flavors from apples , but this is much better than expected . although i would not want to drink this beer on a regular bases , thus low score on drinkability , i think it has a great taste like a grandsmith apples i use to eat as a kid .

it actually looks pretty good , but the soapy smell is a killer , and the beer itself tastes a lot like a light toasty mrzen ... they must be using those malts .  pours out of the bottle with just a thing layer of foam that disappears almost immediately . the body is really a dull amber body with not much going on .  the mouth-feel is thick almost porter-like with the cooling of the alcohol evaporation .

it had almost no aroma at all though , which was a bit disappointing . the flavor had very light malt aroma with no hop aroma with a bit of lemon in the background .  a : pours a one finger head of decent slight cream , okay thickness , and downright bad retention .  mouthfeel was good and very drinkable ; however , it was slightly bitter ... something i was n't expecting this to have considering the malts .

the smell is straggly and a bit sharp . notes of crayons , oil paint and some bitter-earthy flavours .  appearance could easily be confused with a miller lite , very pale yellow with a frothy white head that instantly fizzles away .  the drink is carbonated a little more than average as well . mf- very crisp beer with little or no after taste . one of the smoother beers around .

the aroma is a light bread grain scent with a touch of floral hops .  it came served flat with no head or lace in a shade of yellow-gray .  mouthfeel was smooth , light , though i do n't know i 'd go as far as crisp .

smell of hops and maybe a hint of skunking . if there were such a thing as `` beerness '' i 'd say this sample has a lot of it , because it 's like any of the mainstream bmcs just magnified in the color , taste , and smell . and i understand this was sort of a gateway beer which bridged the old bmc style to the more modern hoppy ipas , so i respect that , but instead of coming across as fresh strong hops it comes off almost more like a skunked bmc .  pours a hazy 24 karat gold color , with considerable amounts of chunkiness floating in it , despite a very slow pour . protein flakes everywhere in the beer , makes this truly disgusting to look at . no head and no lacing to speak of .  m : it has a nice mouthfeel .

it does n't have much scent and i prefer a thicker feeling beer , but it tastes good .  12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass a- cloudy dirty brown color s- faint sweetness , i assume is supposed to be cherry t- very weak ( if any ) cherry flavor , like a severely water down juice m- very little carbonation , feels like a soda that went flat d- fortanetly , i got this with a mix and match .  m - crisp and refreshing o - overall pretty meh .

at first notice the smell is like any other beer just with a sweet hint . also believe it or not it went well with mexican food .  poured into a pounder glass at a rapid pace and produced a light fizzy head that reduces to nothing quicker than tom leykis can diss a beeeeatch . as soon as i poured this a huge apple juice aroma explosion . which i imagine is a byproduct of the cypress wood aging .  mouthfeel is light ( duh ) , but not too thin , and nicely carbonated , giving it a bit of a zip , but not too effervescent . probably the best part of the beer .
pours like strong coffee except it has virtually no aroma . as mentioned earlier , there is no nose with this beer .  well the appearance is rather limp .  good carbonation .

my best description for the smell , and sorry if it seems like i am ripping on the beer , but it smelled like leaves that had been in the gutter after a couple of rains , with a touch of sugar added .  12oz bottle appearance - the beer pours a clear yellow colour with an average size fizzy white coloured head . the head was gone in a flash .  the mouth is thick and malty . as far as drinkability , i have to say that i would be really happy to have one of these if i was alive 4000 years ago but for now i 'm going to have to go for something else .

trying to get some more scents , but the smell really is quite weak .  pours a cloudy dirty honey brown color with a smallish soapy off-white head that almost immediately disipates into nothingness , very flat looking . does not look like a bavarian hefeweizen . it looks terrible , then just gets by as an american wheat .  body is light and crisp and finishes clean .
certainly does n't smell bright and fresh .  appearance low head . looks uninviting .  medium mouthfeel .

pours a straw yellow with a one finger head . no lacing on the glass aroma is light hops , yeast , sweet taste is good dose of hops , citrusy lemon , the bitterness is sour . pretty bland , not enough hop bitterness for me to really wash down some spicey indian food .  there is absolutely no head to be found on this beer when i receive it .  very smooth without being too full bodied .

almost no discernible odor , what i can pick up is grassy or vegetable-like .  appearance- deep french onion soup color , maybe a weak cherry cough syrup color . pours completely flat . really quite lifeless .  mouthfeel is crisp and a little sizzly . refreshingly light bodied and clean .
