aroma-light grainy malts blend with moderately low notes of hops , but are overtaken by notes of butter ( diacetyl ) and corn ( dms ) . light fruity esters present as well.there are some redeeming notes , but on the whole , the buttered corn aroma really is n't doing it for me . up front the buttery diacetyl rears its ugly head again , but its blunted a bit by a sort of mineral quality and some moderately low hop flavor/bitterness .  very pale yellow and not much head . minimal bubbles floating to the top .  full body , syrupy like samichlaus . very similar tastes and mouthfeel .

the drink was described as light and long with a sweet taste that stays in your mouth but no `` haze '' more like the reminder of something like perfume sprayed in the air .  pours a pale straw without much head .  m/d ) very soft mouthfeel .

i tried smelling it with my glass full and got nothing . i tried smelling it with the glass half empty , swirling it around , and the whole nine yards , and still nothing .  pours with virtually no head and no lace .  there 's also just a hint of citrus from the orange peel ( or orange oil extract ) the smooth mouthfeel and moderate body is not unlike that of a german hefeweizen .

after hearing such good reviews about this malt i decided to give it a shot . and after finding a 24-pack of 16 ounce cans for under $ 12 at my favorite local distributor , i couldnt resist . i must say that this is by far the best malt liquor i have ever tried . it is much lighter in the mouth , without the repulsive taste of familiar malts ; it is also smoother in the throat , as well as being lighter in the stomach than any other malt liquor i have tried .  pours a pale golden colour with less than a finger of quickly dissipating soapy white head that leaves zero lace .  m - a fairly heavy mouthfeel with all the sweetness .

i am not a beer connoisseur . this is a cheap beer that is good enough to drink . it is extremely poundable . no need to rinse the glass for refills , the beer does not foam switched to this from miller high life good taste , does n't change when warming up can drink forever or until you fall down if i have money , i like wheat beers  appearance - 2.0 pours a very pale straw with 1 finger of quickly disipating head .  mouthfeel : soft creaminess , light to medium carbonation , with a medium to full body .

nothing of note on the nose , maybe a bit of burnt caramel or it could have been the glass , it was weak either way . unremarkable overall but nothing offensive by any means .  its a very cheap beer usually costing about 14-15 bucks . not good for sipping , only for college parties where you wan na get a cheap buzz .  m - crisp and decent carbonation .

aroma of sweet malt plus a slight off aroma , kinda sour and metallic .  pours an orange/brown colour , with no head to speak of . a bit of bubbles around the rim of the glass , and nothing between . no lace as well . the beer is a pretty colour , that 's about all the positive i can give for appearance .  good body and mouthfeel .

smell is bitter and a bit like citrus sitting on top of the malt .  poured a ornage-copper color . no head .  light-medium caramel malt sweetness up front , continued in the middle with a hint of earthy hop bitterness , finishing with a more of the same . medium mouthfeel .
s- smells very much like adjuncts to me .  a : pours a flat straw-gold ; zero head , zero lacing .  the mouthfeel is very smooth , with fine/sharp bubbles .
smell - chemical , aluminium can , some hop scent but not nice .  actually looks totally flat .  mouthfeel - good smoothness , a medium body on par with the style , crisply carbonated .

a touch of hops and sweet malts in the nose , but there is an odd , vegetal aroma in there that is pretty offensive .  the color is a clear pale yellow or faint gold .  m- really good carbonation , low abv and the nearly great sweet/tart balance make it actually react quite nicely with the mouth .

there was very little scent from the pint , a faint smell of hops and nothing else , very bland .  ( end sarcasm ) clear gold color with a failry sizable head .  light body and nice and creamy . moderate carbonation .

s- very disappointing . no hops , almost feels like i 'm smelling the glass .  pours a golden straw color with no head , even after pouring into the middle of the glass .  mouthfeel is creamy and crisp .

the smell was not very complex , i detected only oak .  a : pours a light purple color with a pink/white head this disolves quickly .  the mouthfeel is moderately thick and full for a pilsner and has a creamy texture . the citrusy hops create a crisp bite towards the end .
smells metallic , not pleasant .  poors out with hardly any head and has an amberbrown color with lots of white haze .  this is a medium bodied , well carbonated beer .

smell was very mild and nothing i noticed about it stands out .  one finger of loose foamy head settles quickly to a wisp after a vigorous pour . no lacing .  the body is nice and thick , with a flavorful malt profile : sweet medium caramel malts with a bit of roast character . hops , by the way , are almost nonexistent , which would n't be bad if not for the oxidation , which makes the faint floral flavor seem dull . overall not bad , but has the same type of oxidized or maybe just oversparged flavor common to other corporate breweries like gordon-biersch .

a - copper color with thin off white head s - light smell.. sweet malt.. little alcohol.. sort of a slight pukey smell too.. lol t - not very good , not all that bad .  pours yellow and very cloudy . one finger head , soapy but dense . poor lacing and a few specs of lace .  the body is somewhere between medium and full , with a creamy mouthfeel .

it has almost no aroma , however .  i firmly believe that everything that comes from pabst is the same beer , but they put it in different cans for nostalgic purposes . that being said , hell , it 's not that bad . there are hops in it !  the body is on the full side , though not quite as much as most stouts ( i suppose increased attenuation should have been expected with the switch in yeast strain ) , and has a solidly low key carbonation .
smell : smells like adjunct-laden shit water , but it says it 's all grain ?  from the bottle it poured a dirty gold color with about a 1 '' head .  m - solid and full , with good carbonation .

s : was more aromatic once it warmed up to drinking temp .  pours as a cloudy orangeish color . resembles frankiszer but has some sediment floating around in it - probably just active yeast culture . definitely wonky - has a smell like that of wheat beer but it is n't a wheat beer . has kind of a coriander-orange peel aroma with a touch of wheat ( appears and smells like a blue moon but with a lot more color ) .  the aftertaste lingers nicely , and the mouthfeel is firm . full bodied and smooth , but lacking an extra punch .

the aroma is quite limited but offers some light malt and spicy hops , as well as some light sulfur ( which seems to be characteristic of the brewery ) . the maltiness has an odd , almost musty , bready note that 's fortunately overshadowed by a spicy , but indistinct , hop flavor .  12oz bottle a- pours a clear golden yellow color with a fizzy white head that quickly disappears .  a - opaque black color with a small head that disappears quickly s - rich chocolate-like aroma , mild yeast esters , some smokiness , no hop perceived t - roasted malt flavor dominates , some yeasty esters and mild hop flavors take a secondary role , very gentle mild hop finish with some lingering smokiness m - smooth creamy medium body with moderately low carbonation d - this is a decent enough oatmeal stout . the head and retention is disappointing , but the smell , taste and mouthfeel are acceptable .

sure its cheap and a macro , but this is still decent stuff . it 's perfect for really warm days , sitting on the beach , or when just looking to relive one of those college nights trying to drink all the beer in the world .  most things were good but this was on of the first offerings of the evening ... that said ... a golden , hazy transparent brew with plenty of sediment . yeah , i know it 's a hefeweizen , but does it have to look like the piss of a liver failure patient ?  mouthfeel was nice - weizenbock like . bananas , black beans , chile peppers and/or pepper jack cheese with some creamyness amidst the carbonation . interesting , no doubt , and worth seeking out if you want something really different .

the smell had a hint of bread and fruit , but just a hint .  a : pours light golden with a white soapy head that dissapears quckliy with a sizziling sound . no lace . d : a rather uneven beer ; looks crappy and smells below average but tastes ok and has a really nice aftertaste .  the mouthfeel is very light bodied and good for the class .

the nose was really light in its sweetness , hardly discernible at all .  it 's a pale clear yellow with little head or carbonation .  mouthfeel good . creamy and subtle carbonation . cant complain about this .

really lacks in the smell department ; not much there .  clear dark brick red pour gives way to quickly settling head with floating clusters of bubbles around the edge if the glass .  the mouthfeel was good , but the drinkability hass to be chopped down due to the smell and the taste of this beer .

appearance - mostly orange with a white head that varied greatly depending on how the beer was poured smell - i smelled almost nothing at all , maybe a faint spice . my roommate said he could smell the pomegranate but i sure couldn't taste - i found nothing distinct about the taste at all .  it struggled to pour up a decent head & zero lacing ... very light strawish gold .  mouth is no complaints , it 's low-medium body with relatively high carbonation .

; ( the aroma was almost non existent - a major flaw in any ipa and what i could smell was mild butterscotch and a spritz of earthy hop . i swirled and stuck my face in - i got nuthin . a very mediocre beer , with bland and generic sort of flavor .  this beer looks flat and unappealing to me .  soft prickly carbonation does cleans the pallet , of this light to medium body beer with moderate astringency and warming alcohol .

the smell was weak , almost aromaless , some hop esters maybe , malt smells too . i liked the taste , sharp , sour yet also a sweetness to it .  this is a very pale beer , very light yellow color .  m : creamy and sticks to the mouth for awhile .
i't smells like a funky straw bale , some wet grassy notes as well .  a : thin , clear , pale yellow -- lots of fizz , but not really a head , nor any lacing .  m - it was very crisp and sharp .

smell : an earthy plant kind of smell , not a whole lot there .  have n't seen the light version of pbr around to often but it showed up at a party i was at . tastes very similar to pbr regular , which is good because i find that better than the usual bud/coors/miller . it 's easy to drink , cheap , and not awful tasting.. what else can you want when its $ 12 a 30 ?  medium mouhfeel with some carbonation . smooth and buttery feel . pretty dry finish .

s - booze , apples , dorm carpet , some mild vomit . pretty dismal .  a-cloudy yellow/golden color body with a thin head.no lacing and this looks like cloudy piss .  the mouth is pretty nice , feels rich but easy to drink .

o : well , this one was all over the place ; the smell reminded of euro pale lager , the taste was more like german pilsener but way to mild .  appearance : this beer looks like flat coca cola .  m - tongue ripping bitterness . medium to full body and tingly carbonation to go with it . good .

pours a strong yellow ; thankfully tastes better than it smells ( was n't too impressed here ... ) .  a : a head that lasts for an average time , that left no lacing nor foam at the edge atop a beer that 's a red-brown ?  taste is mild but the mouthfeel is full pleasantly full and quite nice .

s : i 've had this beer before , and it seems that i received a batch that has sat awhile . i detect almost no hops , with mostly a malty , almost maple syrup like note . very different then the average pale ale . t : a rolling blend of light malt , deep citrus , hops , with a slight sweet-salted balance .  pours and awkward pinkish red with a little bit of fizz that i cant even call a head . no lacing .  mouthfeel : full-bodied with a strong , expressive carbonation .

very subtle hop aroma , flowery , old lady soap smell ( dove ? ) .  a - nothing special . pale straw colour . looks like a typical pale lager : canadian , budweiser , etc .  light body with good carbonation .

s -pretty skunky eurolageryness . besides the skunk it 's not too bad .  the appearance was an opaque golden yellow that left a thin white head that dissipated quickly . obviously , little of the head was left clinging to the glass . on the second pour in the same glass , there was more of a head , and more apparent carbonation , but still was not impressive .  bottled under license by the cheval blanc in montreal . light golden ale witha medium head that did not disapear too quickly . the honey taste is very discreet . i could recognize the usual taste of malt from the cheval blanc . enjoyable but not exceptionnal

at first notice , faint or no smell was detected by my good old olefactory nerves . the good factor of this beer is its smoothness and gentle honey after taste , which would sure out do any of the big name american beers .  bought as a single bottle at the grocery store . poured very pale , white grape juice look . very few bubbles and a fast dying lace . i feel its limited in how much of it you can drink and when .  m - pretty thick , smooth and a bit refreshing .

s - the odd smell of copper and metal mixed with a hint of garbage and rust .  yellow , little head , no lacing , boring . reviewers of beer are like reviewers of art -- for many , it stops being about what tastes or looks good , and starts being about complexity and distinctiveness . if it was lighter , it might be refreshing , but it is n't light .  nice lively mouthfeel .

smell theres almost no smell to this lager except for a hint of lemon and maybe grass .  pours light gold with a bit of a white head that almost immediately descends to nothing .  ) and is a deep rich molasses s : once again , may have been too cold for phenols to waft up t : slightly sweet really tasty m : nice and cold d : pour me another

pours a nice fizzy straw color , very clear , with only a little head the aroma is that typically lightly skunked imported european green bottled lager smell .  this is a soda with a touch of alcohol . the aroma is a little funky and a lot sweet with just lime and a hint of corn . the appearance yellow with a thin fizzy head .  the mouthfeel is good ; slightly thick and very smooth . however , it is a little bubble and will sting the recesses of your mouth .
the smell is bland lacking depth . the taste is much more rewarding showing the depth which the smell was missing .  very clear yellow translucent color , no head .  m : smooth and medium bodied .

smells like sour soy sauce -- like a really strong , old port . this is n't a horrible smell , mind you , just not what i was expecting . not very nice . tastes much better than it smells .  poured into a pint glass ok was a little taken by the appearnce , its a chocolate ale and its dark amber with a fizzy head like a soda , about 1 finger high and disapates much like a soda as well smells of wheat and sweet chocolate notes with some semi-sweet malt , almost candy sweetness .  m : a nice , medium body .
smell isvery light hops , light malt and bugger-all else , zip , nada , zilch .  miserably thin trace of head .  it is medium bodied and smooth in the mouth .

the smell is almost that of a macro lager but slightly less offensive .  appearance - murky witbeer like appearance . not very presentable appearance at all .  served in a pint glass mug a : pours a clear bronze color with about an inch of thick head s : a smell provides a nice rye scent with a very sweet undertone contributed by the honey addition t : very nice smooth tasting beer , has a slight hint of honey and perhaps a slight rye note but other than that there isnt much to comment on , smooth and slightly sweet but thats about it m : very smooth in the mouth with a slight bite on the tongue as it is drank d : high level of drinkability , very subdued taste that is great for a hot summer day but leaves the drinking looking for more otherwise .

if i have drunk enough of oregon 's microbrews in a short span of time beforehand this seems ok . otherwise it tastes pretty foul . fortunately , even with only one potent ale under my belt , this imperial pint ( just one of the perks of the goose hollow ) seemed creamy and fresh . it was a very light straw colour with a big foamy head which left some lacing . vinegar anyone ?  looks like white grape juice . i hate it when no head is erected .  medium mouthfeel .
very , very subtle smell of corn and alcohol .  there is absolutely no head or lacing . it looked flat .  mouthfeel is nice , actually - light bodied , spritzy carbonation .

the aroma is pretty faint and it is hard to really pick up on much . the faint aroma is slightly nutty and fruity .  poured from the bottle into a pint glass , beer is a slightly hazy , straw color with a pure white , fizzy head . other than the small bits of sediment actively swimming around throughout the glass , looks like a macro lager .  velvety . good amount of carbonation .

the aroma is very light but that was expected . there is a hint of hops and adjunct malt but it 's mostly metallic and floral . it 's an average light lager .  pours pale golden yellow with no head .  good carbonation .
smelled malty and grainy , no real hint of nut in this bottle so far .  bottle poured a brownish brew with almost no head .  m- decent carbonation , light and airy .

at first blush , it smells like rotten fruit and maple syrup .  1/2 inch foamy head which quickly evaporates into nothing . absolutely no lacing at all . not a very quality appearance .  could be a bit less carbonated .

i could hardly get any smell from this beer , so not much to be impressed with . the taste starts out with some corn and sweet malts and later get some hops that nicely balance the malts out . a good beer to drink when low on money and in need of one .  appearance : boring , crystal clear yellow-orange . white , fleeting head .  m : felt good going down had a nice thick feel to it .

smells very weakly of yeast and not much else .  for export only fill 12 12 02 the appearance when poured into the glass was of a plain yellow color , nothing fancy , and it boosted some carbonation .  mouthfeel is pretty good .

it has virtually no smell , just the faintest hint of hops , and that did n't really change as it warmed .  the beer pours a pale , almost clear , gold color ; very light .  all right taste , almost neutral , with a bit of skunkiness . goes down very smoothly .

the nose is off . some citrus and a tone of off phenolic aromas . there is just a off yeast note that is not good .  ) a - very pale straw yellow color .  mouthfeel : the mouthfeel was pretty good overall .

s : light and thin , with some malt and alcohol notes . t : tastes pretty much of malt and corn , no hops to speak of . m : medium-bodied for a macro , light overall , a bit medicinal and solventy from the alcohol .  a- poured a clear yellow color ... almost fake looking . no lacing on the glass .  i 'm not sure what a `` baltic '' porter is supposed to taste like ; but this one is quite different from most porters i 've had . sweet molasses aroma that is greater than any chocolate or mocha that might be found . a strong level of metal present also . sweet , almost like brandy . reminds me far more of a double bock than a porter . i can not detect any hops at all . too sweet for me , making it more one-dimensional without any complexity .

first off , i 've never had a beer that smelled this bad while tasting so good . it had a caramel scent , with very heavy undertones of wet dog .  this brew poured up a straight yellow color ... the aroma was sour !  decent carbonation , neither too intrusive nor too laid back .

slightly sweet aroma . light , sweet malt , bit of corn . no hops . immensely drinkable . i 'm still convinced that corn is a much more acceptable adjunct than rice .  appearance would be enhanced with labels staying on bottle , but pale clear color ok.. still high on carbonation .  m- medium bodied with a decent carbonation level .

easily the best adjunct lager i 've ever had . the guys over at miller must have splurged on the rice when formulating this recipe .  `` the circus is the place for me with bears and clowns and noise . '' - phish despite a hearty rousing circus boy pours a mostly clear gold . 1 finger white head that does n't do too much . poor showing for a wheat . light grain , grass and lots of butter .  m/d : a medium body with good carbonation .

however , i detected no aroma at all .  pours into a pint glass a very , very pale yellow with just a little bit of foam .  the mouthfeel is slightly creamy and very enjoyable . this drinks nicely . there is a lot going for this though , the mouthfeel in particular .

s- smells grainy , little bit of corn , little metallic , almost white wine smelling .  appearance : the beer is a super hazy copper color with a head that dissipated insanely fast .  it had a medium bodied with good carbonation .

aroma is fairly sweet with a bit of cotton candy and fruity hops . although the hops a bit masked by sweetness and the aroma put off is minimal at best , especially poor for an impy ipa . a beer thats tastes very good , aroma is mia .  appearance : not the best looking beer out there , 1 finger of head that dissapates rather quickly , yellowish color almost reminds me of a miller lite .  feels right in body , but the taste is just off .

smells sightly yeast , but there 's not much else there .  this beer was watery and did not have much taste to it in my opinion . the hue of this beer was yellow .  m : pretty creamy and lightly carbonated . easy to swallow a mouthful .

smells like very like wheat grain . almost nothing there . tastes the same as it smells . very , very light wheat .  yellow-brown beer with a fizzy head that dissolves right away .  m : good mouthfeel .

4.4 abv , 140 calories per serving a-3.0 nice head intially but it was gone quick , very little if any lacing . s-2 slightly skunky , low point on this rating .  pale golden lager with a wispy head and plenty of carbonation .  being of fan of bocks , i was fully prepared to love this ubiquitous doppelbock . it was kind of sweet and malty , smelled great , felt nice going down -- quite satisfying . there was a slightly funky smell to it , and an even funkier taste . i thought that was more common in highly hopped beers . at $ 10 for the four pack , i hate to try it again for fear of wasting my hard-earned beer money .

aroma is of lightly roasted malts and a bit metallic , along with a bit of chocolate and some subtle dark fruit notes . lightly sweet overall with an odd overall character ; possibly a bad bottle due to the metallic character .  typical coors characteristics : dissappearling head , pale color , low bitterness .  this beer has noticeable viscosity and a big thick feel . minimal carbonation .

s : watery , yeast , soapy . t : esters up front , hints of banana and caramel , checked by herbal hops , all ending with nuttiness . d : yes , it 's drinkable .  pours a very light , very clear yellow colour , with a minimally weak head of white , which dissipates almost immediately to a loose collar around the edges of the glass , despite a pretty vigorous pour . minimal lacing . looks very insipid .  t : slight sweet taste , but does not taste much like anything actually , fairly bland m : smooth , light on carbonation . d : mouthfeel was nice , went down easily enough just did n't care for the smell or taste of the beer .

s - little bit of a corn smell in the nose .  appearance : light amber ... similar to an american lager but with more carbonation smell : like a cross between a budweiser and heineken .  recommended by bert from bert 's better beers . smells like dark chocolate , burn caramel , and vanilla -- sort of like an chocolate chip oatmeal cookie . smooth roast malt , dare i say a tad burnt . there 's a mild pharmaceutical character in back that i 'm not a fan of . i drank half this bottle one night and the second half the following afternoon .

s- i just could n't pull any smell off of this one . a bit of grain ... i guess .  a - pours a clear orange color with decent carbonation . the head fizzled out before i could even look at it long enough to see what color it was . obviously no lacing here .  m - lighter side of heavy , pretty smooth .

mariestad porter looks like a glass of coke and does n't really smell much except a little roasted malts and fish ( ! ) .  a : darker in appearance than a bud light , slightly brighter than a bud heavy . easy drinker and goes well with a margarita mixture floating on the top of it aka : iceberg i would have to say on tap it tasted very similar only there was more head .  medium mouthfeel .

smell : umm , what i used to think all beer smelled like , pungent , not entirely welcoming .  a- no head , little lacing , the beer has a cloudy haze yellow body with a couple carbonation bubbles .  m - full bodied and chewy with a moderately dry finish with some alcohol noticeable .

the smell is malty with distinct notes of alcohol . not very pleasant . the taste is a little better ; it is very malty with lots of bread-like flavours .  for a lighter beer this is good . much better than the big macros with contrillion dollar ad budgets ... sheesh how cheap could their beer be without that overhead ... but i digress good tasty beer .  pleasantly carbonated on the palate , with a dry finish .

smells of nothing . very light floral nose as it warms .  i despise this brew for brainwashing my fellow americans into thinking that this sort of thing is beer . i can only thank this beer for making me truly appreciate brews of substance and character .  the flavor is a bit better as the taste of both a good belgian tripple and a solid ipa can both be percieved ; however , the flavors compete for dominance instead of blending harmoniously . i think the problem here is that tripple is a big , expressinve beer . with exit 4 the subtle flavors are masked behind a second layer of bold expressiveness . i love the brewery for pushing the envelope and i look forward to buying the next release in the series . with innovation like this , flying fish is sure to hit a huge winner sooner than later .

s - it smelled of citrusy hops - mostly orange peel aromas . there was a sweet maltiness to the nose , too .  pours a clear gold color with a thin white head . no real lacing to speak of and the head was short-lived .  m=fairly thin , a little medium . watery .
spicy , sweet , cinnamony nose .  a : super white nose and a bland yellow body s : a weak rice or corn aroma .  body is extremely light and spritzy ; refreshing and very inoffensive in character .

good ! taste is similar to smell but a bit strong for my tastes .  a - poured out a very fizzy , straw yellow color with a fizzy , short-lived , white head .  the mouthfeel is medium-light bodied with a watery texture , and a little too much carbonation .

smells rich and butterscotchy .  corona is probably very overpriced and over-rated . as mentioned it makes an excellent summer time beer as it managed to quench thirst . it has weak color , weak strange smell that when not skunky is mildly fruity and has nice mouthfeel for what i expected ... not great , just decent for its purpose .  a bit bland for the style . body is a bit like soda water , and fades really fast .

color seemed consistent with other ipa 's of the high alcohol content variety , and it had a pleasant , slightly fruity smell . regarding taste , you initially get hit with a flavorful mild fruit taste , but it fades into a musty bite that reminds me of the aftertaste of the awful four horsemen .  appearance is a light yellow with nill head and lace .  lack of carbonation , and this beer 's thin , watery mouthfeel combine to make a less-than-awesome drinking experience .

smell is milk chocolate sweet and it also has traces of black fruit .  can , this is pretty straightforward mexican beer , but thanks to the can , no skunky funk going on . a touch of sweetness from what i taste as adjuncts , though the packaging claims saaz hops-i do n't know about that one . i could definitely drink these while floating down the river ( face up of course ) , but we think it 's peculiar that they have white writing on a silver can , so definitely try to read about it before the third one or later .  the carbonation sort of ruins the mouthfeel from the can and hides the taste .

falls surprisingly fast for a hefe and does not leave a whole lot of lace behind . overripe bananas , cloves and bubblegum galore ! there is some nice wheat tang to offset some of the sweeter , fruity yeast esters .  i knocked back a few of these at a restaurant the other night because all they had on tap was miller and bud products . appearance : poured slightly darker than a budweiser , but i could only tell when i held it right next to a bud . had no head but that 's no doubt the bartender 's fault .  m : thin and watery , very little carbonation , too thin to be cloying , but i 'd rather this beer be full bodied .

smells absolutely inviting . flavor falls woefully short of the aroma .  kuhnhenn 's winter wonder lager ( 2008 ) pours up like a flat soda pop w/o much luster , but it manages to release enough carbonation to create a wisper thin beigeish-white head that barely manages to ring the glass above a rather dull , murky brown-burnt umber body . it 's rather an ugly mess to be brutally honest !  was excited to see this one.. but again newcastle has let me down again ... on the bottle it says `` blood red ale '' .. it pours a reddish-brown color.. smells a little funky ... way too carbonated for my liking .

t- inspite of a nice olfactory experience this beer fails to deliver . the roasted and charred notes are nice until they arrive at the level of burnt coffee . very muted cocoa and underwhelming bourbon notes . the beer smells nice but thin muted flavors are not really agreeing with me .  a : very pale yellow with literally no head or lacing at all .  carbonation a bit high . fails on this point . d- easy going macro lager .

: ) a bock `` ale '' . alcohol & maple syrup are the biggest showoffs upfront , burnt sugar , with toffee & sweet brown bread filling up the end of the whiff . taste is very bready .  not at all terrible , not great , typical mexican macro that actually tasted a bit like fosters if fosters made a lighter version . nice classic beer taste upfront , thins out and fades away with a decent lingering corn and hops aftertaste . the can has a classic look that adds to the appeal .  the most negative parts of this beer include the smell and mouthfeel . the smell is pretty bland , not giving any info on the beer itself and the mouthfeel seems watered down after witnessing the color of the beer .

smell is malty and there are some woody hop essences . all the smells are present on the tongue too but when you compare this against a robert the bruce as an example , there is no comparison .  the pour looks very viscous . it has globs of shit floating around in suspension .  3.0 m thin .

smooth and balanced aroma . t/m- coffee flavor with some medicine mixed about .  a : kinda weak head .  the flavor was both too light and 'way too bitter for a pils . it was watery and lacking in aroma . not much foam - what there was disappeared quickly . the word i 'd use to describe this beer is `` insubstantial . ''

smell : sweet , nutty , roasted malts and some vanilla with a fruity hop aroma .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  m : thin , watery , light-bodied , not something you 'd expect with the smell .

smelled or just about every spice you would associate with fall ; nutmeg , cinnamon , all spice , etc . overall decent but not in my top 5 of pumpkin ales that i 've had so far .  it looks like flat coke .  m : water thin , light side of champagne-like carbonation .

nose is sweet milk chocolate , cookie dough , and roasted malt with hints of vanilla and black cherry in the background . this is a fairly enjoyable brew , but i could n't see drinking more than a couple without wanting to go onto something else with a bit more complexity in flavor . perhaps with a little more carbonation the rich flavors hinted at in the nose could really come through .  a- pale straw yellow with thin white head , lots of carbonation bubbles , watery , no lace .  mouthfeel was light in body and watery in texture with a fizzy carbonation .

the aroma is promising -- it smells like it could be a rich but balanced stout .  it 's appearance is a fizzy , yellow colored average looking beer . thats this beer 's only huge upside .  caramel , coffee and cocoa are there , but overall balance is towards the dry and bitter mouthfeel - 2.0 lightly carbonated , bordering on flat and a little watery .

aroma is cloves , bananas , grainy malt and a bit of bubblegum . mouthfeel/body is light/medium , it 's very spritzy and has way too much carbonation .  on tap , looks unimpressive , same with smell .  m - light bodied , very thin feeling , and very little carbonation o - not too impressed with this beer .

smells surprisingly good . the berry aroma really stands out here and is not what i would call subtle like the label implies . i was really pleased with the aroma , but this is just way too much .  appearance - 2.0 poured a small white head that quickly disappeared leaving no head at all . colour is pale straw , large bubbles rising .  mouthfeel on both is not much , just clear water with a bit of beer bubbles .

a big sniff presents brown sugar , molasses , a touch of butterscotch , and a tad of bittersweet chocolate .  had on tap at the wenlock arms in london a : transparent dull gold , zero carbonation and just a little fuzz for a head .  mouthfeel is similar to that of water , not much to it .

it smells pretty good , too .  2.0 a : pale greenish yellow color . head is not dense at all , fizzy , and has horrible retention .  mouthfeel : thin and watery ( or slim-bodied , which sounds more positive ) , medium-low carbonation ( too low for the style ) .

spicey , flowery boquet in the nose . with a hop background hidden by the sweet yeast strain . nearly smells like flower petals freshly blossomed . odd .  very very pale yellow color with little head or lace .  the body was light and very watery .

a - looked good s - smelled good t - this beer has an aftertaste similar to when you chew on a fir tree limb .  had bottle of this which revealed a light gold-yellow color . disappointing overall for a brewery with so much god damned hype around it . a very forgettable beer unfortunately .  perhaps age will remedy.. m : explosive mouthfeel upon drinking , but the body is very light , with the alcohol evident .

the aroma was semi-sweet , a blend of slightly doughy malt , caramel malt , floral hops and herbal hops .  pours a clear darkish iced tea color with a fizzy 1 inch beige head that fades to nothing . no lacing whatsoever either . i was expecting something disgustingly gross but i actually really enjoy drinking this one .  m : this was the most dissapointing . aside from the lingering dry finish this was a very thin porter .

aromas are surprisingly floral , nectar-like , and a bit perfumy from the boquet of aromatic hops . these compliment the softer pilsner malt aromas and mask the grainy-sharp sensation in the nose that usually accompany pilsner grains .  a : pours a copper body with a very small off-white head with extremely poor retention and no lacing .  mouthfeel : pretty thin , with sharp carbonation and a watery finish .

the smell was also very nice and seemed like it would taste good .  this is yellow , rather bubbly with a medium , bubbly white head that steadily vanishes . the aroma is sweet perfume , grain , corn , a hint pf pine and a little alcohol evident - like a stronger , sweeter , more perfumy us macro lager . the taste is quite sweet with a strong corn tortilla taste , a definite but not unpleasant alcoholic quality , and a warm , alcoholic , corn finish that has a light bite .  m- thin highly carbonated .

pours a deep ruby as relatively low carbonation pushes up a meagre white head with rather horrendous retention - not bsda-appropriate at all ... '' ruby '' carries through as a concept in the aroma with some nice plum & cherry-type scents wafting up . simple , overall , but i like the way this stuff smells .  very little head , but highly carbonated and almost appears to be a pepsi , only a bit darker . it 's okay only if you really do n't like darker beers but want to look `` trendy '' and drink a dark beer with sweet flavor and little else to offend , this may be worth a try .  couple hints of charcoal & burnt toast - but just hints the whole bottle was thin and watery , and the harshness lasted throughout .

sweet marzipan-like smell reminds me of candied cake bread .  mother lager- magic hat `` you 're never alone with a bone '' mother lager poured a light yellow with no head .  the mouthfeel is syrupy and shows none of the carbonation that the pour hinted at .

restrained aroma of toasted coconut and rich cocoa .  pours light golden , but the head is extremely bad , disappears within one minute and there almost is no lacing as well .  the mouth is super thin . the thinnest mouth i 've ever had on an ipa . d= the thin mouth makes me go for sips more often and the flavor does n't linger long ... great flavor on this one no doubt .

s : a nice aroma of fruit , yeast , and malt . t : tasted of apples and yeast up front , with a malty finish .  a : the beer is a light gold color with a short white head that fades very quickly and leaves very little lace on the glass .  3.0 m too thin for my taste and my experience with better scottish ales ( like oskar blues ) .

her copper-colored dress off aromas of honey , strong , powerful and caramels a touch of hazelnut . unfortunately , alcohol is much too noticeable in the mouth and final , this coupled with a bitterness too pronounced in the finish , we get an unbalanced beer .  a= golden yellow little head and that 's about it .  really thin for an imperial stout .

smell figs , sweet molasses alcohol .  magic hat # 9 was left at my house after a party . # 9 pours a very clear yellow with tons of bubbles , but only a very slight head that soon reduces to nothing . the maltiness does come out a bit more in the taste , but unfortunately , it is drowned out by the overbearing fruit .  very complex and interesting m : disappointing ! very thin for a barley wine .

s - pleasant smell - lemon soapiness , and piney hops .  i 'm of the age where it 's a rather popular drink , it seems to be the philly hipster beer of choice , in my short life on living in the city i 've watched in double in price and have remained baffled . pbr does n't taste awful , atleast as long as i 'm not paying 6 dollars for 22oz of it at a bar . the main flavour i 've noticed in pbr is water , thats always the first thing that hits my pallet , water , then some slight grain flavor that mixes with the alchohal . the appeal to pbr is that it is n't the university beer bong beer , so cheers to you pbr for being the beer of an overpaying counter culture .  m - thin , watery , overly carbonated .

very interesting . the flavor was crisp but muted and started slightly sweet then the hops kicked in a little bitterness .  the beer was so black my laser pointer would not shine through it ! the beer poured a poor head that was gone soon as i finished pouring .  mouthfeel/ drinkability : the carbonation isnt stinging and seems appropriate . the body of the beer seems far too thin .

pleasant citrus aroma , but also a pronounced herbal presence , which was a little bit jarring .  pours a light yellow with minimal head and lacing .  feels very watery , not overly carbonated , but bubbles hard in your stomach , not letting you drink too many of these .

s - berry and more berry t - strong raspberry flavor , but very little beer flavor . it reminds me of ab wildblue m - thin and watery , nothing particularly special i 'm conflicted on many of my ratings for this beer because on the one hand , many of the attributes of this beer are on purpose ( like the pink color ) but at the same time , it 's not a beer i would pick up again .  medium dark lager yellow color with a smallish head that disappears rather quickly .  the problem is that the beverage is thin and flat on the palate and leaves a really unpleasant metallic aftertaste .

smell was good , nice and malty with some piney notes thrown into the mix .  still feel this is easily the best us macro-brewed light beer . this is my go to beer if i 'm out tailgating or watching sports and need something cold , refreshing and in a quantity that wo n't have me draining the wallet . i will take this over bud or coors , everytime .  no attempt whatsoever to hide the alcohol and the addition of the heavy acidic espresso taste and a watery mouthfeel make this hard to down .

s = light apple smell with a hint of apple .  pours a slightly hazed pale straw with a fizzy one-finger head . poor retention and minimal lacing .  a - medium to dark amber ; almost no head , but what little bubbling there was at the edge of the glass managed to leave a slight bit of lacing s - there was nearly no aroma , and what was there was nothing distinctive t - good malt/hop balance with pleasantly surprising bitter finish m - far too thin and too little carbonation in this sample ; a bit of a sticky finish d - though it will not be mistaken for a world-class brew , this one is easy to suck down since it is thin and flavorful ; without the sticky finish , it would score a half-tick higher

can into pint glass a - big 2 finger eggshell head , slightly hazy medium orange/brown coloring on the beer , relatively large bubbles s - quite robust hops and citrus control the doughy scent , surprisingly bold smell t - bready start transforms smoothly to a citrus to a bitter and a slightly sour finish .  pours an unexciting see-through straw colour with minimal fizzy head despite my vigorous pouring efforts .  m - light and fizzy , thin bodied .

s - incredibly complex smell . fruity , hoppy , and a smell of a cleaning solution ( from the copious amount of alcohol no doubt ) .  i bought this can at a nepali night shop . when poured only a small white head develops . the colour is golden pale . i emptied it & # 8230 ; not because it was good , but because you don & # 8217 ; t waste beer .  mouthfeel is painfully carbonated . light bodied , way way to much carbonation .

s : malty with some hop on the nose .  sitting at a grass and bamboo bar in honduras , one is told to reach for another brand of drink . this beer blends well with the salty brine that has infiltrated your mouth and sinuses . the rejuvenating characteristics of a cold port royal feel great to a body that has been pickling in the briny deep all day .  the mouthfeel is surprisingly flat .

s- it smells like molasses , raisons , and dates . smells much sweeter than it tastes .  a : a light amber color with no head and lots of soda-like carbonation .  flavor is rather plain , roasty , sweet , a bit of coffee and coco , the hops seem to be hiding somewhere , i detect little to none , little carbonation , short finish , with a bit of dark bread , and rasins , very thin body.drinkable but not very memoriable .

not much pop when opening the bottle , but the aroma just spills out . aroma is of sweet vanilla , wet wood , molasses , orange peel , plum and raisin , caramelized sugar , nutmeg , hazelnut -- there is something in the aroma here that reminds me of holiday fruit bread . not fruit cake , but a fruit bread -- a real heavy , oaty loaf of bread with dense chunks of chewy fruit . i wonder , did the high abv knock some of the flavors around ?  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  ( btw the mouthfeel matches ) .

good rich smell , malts and something unidentifiable .  if you cant drink beer out of a mug its not a beer ! appearance- pale clear yellow smell - not much more than a hint of beer odor taste- clean . very light and clean . drinkability- easy to drink .  mouthfeel feels thin and weak ; this is my only real complaint with this beer .

s : some really great aroma here - coconut , vanilla ... not sure how else describe the slight alcohol aroma but reminds me of spiced rum t : big alcohol burn .  poured into a pint glass it looks about the same as coors light , except slightly cloudy ( and i mean ever so slightly ) . the head is almost non-existant and fades leaving zero lacing in my glass .  flavor is of arange , and body is highly carbonated . prickly mouthfeel , and a bit boring overall

s - smells of citrus and bananas . very strong fruity smell . no hops or malts in the aroma . smells like a very strong soda .  this beer is everything i feel an oktoberfest should n't be ... mild flavor , light color , poor head retention and lacing , not much by way of malty goodness .  sweet crackery finish , m - thin with very low carbonation .

smells of sweet fruit , apple , pear , and a little spice . very sweet from beginnging to end . apple , pear , nutty yeast , and some spice .  a- pours clear orange , no head at all , no lacing on the glass .  m : thin body with almost no carbonation at all .

reviewed from notes : appearance : orange copper with a 1 finger head smell : bourbon , vanilla , fruity taste : sour fruit , something went wrong in this bottle mouthfeel : mild carbonation , medium body , overall : i think i 'm going to need to try it again .  pours a clear straw color with a small diappointing head , also there are some unidentifiable objects floating around .  mouthfeel : medium to light treading dangerously close to watery .

pours and looks like a glass of diet dr. pepper s : caramel , banana , sweet bread dough . t : tastes of wheat and toasted corn .  pours into a pint glass a very light golden yellow with a big foamy , but rapidly receding head . looks like a macro beer looks .  the body is very thin -- like there was a lot of adjuncts added .

s - big caramel malt nose with some fruity hops .  bought this as part of 12 pack variety down ar kure beach , nc , bbd of 1 sep 07 , consumed mid-july poured a hazed amber with 1 ' of offwhite head . zero head retention or lacing s : slight sour notes & some apricots t : apricots & apples with some hop bitterness up front .  mouthfeel is very thin .

smell - interesting . about what i expected .  pours pale straw , with an slightly imperfect clarity . soapy two and a half-finger head , fades quickly to dismal lacing . both tiny flowing and rapid and large chunky bubbles make a high carbonation in a thinnish body .  has a malty aroma , enticing , maybe some wheat too ? fizzy palate , mallty taste , fruity , not very lingering . thirst-quenching .

s : bready malts balanced with piney hops , which are hard to separate from the traditional pumpkin beer aromas and flavors . cardamom is the dominant spice . t & m : lightly sweet . d : overall , i 'd like to say that post road pumpkin ale is an average pumpkin beer but it was my least favorite of 2010 .  thos brew pours out as a clear yellow color with a fizzy whit sheaf that last only a few seconds .  m- spritzy , carbonation fills your mouth swelling your cheeks slightly . rough , bubbly and thin .

s : a nice hop smell with aromas of pine needles and citrus .  pours a noisy amber with a finger of cream colored head . no head retention or lacing s : rich pumpkin & spice aroma t : follows the nose , more pice forward than pumpkin up front .  i picked up a carton of this pretty cheap the only downfall its in cans anyways it pours a golden amber see thru colour with nice carbonation that leaves a bubbly two finger head and sporadic lacing , the aroma is pretty macro with grains and a feint bubblegum aroma , it has a thin mouthfeel with a rather grainy taste and isnt nothing to write home about , its definately better than the macroswill that sells for much more and easier to down but its not a beer that i would drink if i wanted a nice beer with character .

smell : very sweet with caramel and molasses . also , it is very floral with a nice hop aroma .  appearance : brown and translucent . the fizzy head dissipates almost immediately leaving no noticeable lacing .  i will admit that i did not like the mouthfeel very much . too bubbly .

aroma is nice . light caramel .  this looks very strange when poured : it looks like small ice crystals in the liquid floating around for a short while ( the beer is chilled to round 6 c/42 f ) .  the body was very thin and the beer lacked substance .

smells of apples , seriously . yep , apples . if i was drinking this blindfolded i would n't guess that it 's as dark as it is ... then i would probably accidentaly knock it over , spilling it and making myself smell like apples for the rest of the night , but i suppose that 's not important . overall : apples ; perhaps this keg is infected , or something .  one in the sixer looking pretty but surrounded , like bellvue ! not a very full for a beer of this kind , but a good gateway drug ... but , it actually kinda nice , has just this little something to it .. pendulum 's blood sugar drops ! ... . no real foam , strange .. '' who pumped ethyl '' ... needs more to be a great one..  it tastes ok. kind of watered down . cant taste any malt or hops . it was too bubbly , seemed over-carbonated .

s : sugary citrus smell . fruity smell overall . hops give it a slight floral smell .  poured into a pilsener glass it forms little head to speak of and no lacing . chill hazed , golden in color , slightly cloudy .  the mouthfeel , as mentioned , is very watery and razor thin .

s - this beer smells pretty good . resiny , tropical goodness .  coppery color , with a pinky 's head that dissolved in 15 seconds and no lacing . disappointing appearance .  m- this is precisely the opposite mouthfeel that i want . it feels like it wants to be sweet and sticky , but it really just falls watery on the tongue .

s - tart cherries right away with maybe just a tad of artificial cherry candy smell , and some dark chocolate . i like it . i wanted to like this because it looked and smelled very good but just took a bad turn after that .  1995 lambic bottled in 2000 and drank in 2004 . poured a pale hazy yellow beer with almost no carbonation , which was to be expected .  mouthfeel : very carbonated with a thin , almost watery feeling .

nice and clear amber-orange color with plenty of sticky head . smells of maple , bread , grassy hops , and a bit of apple .  to be honest , i only got this beer to try a beer made from denmark . really , really boring beer .  thin , harsh , and astringent- the mouthfeel is where the beer suffers the most .

aroma was very pleasant , with yeast/bread , melon , a light orange , honey and some spice .  this poured a standard macro lager yellow with a boring head that quickly dissipated .  not much to say about natural ice other than that it is cheap . little taste that i could discern , but nothing abhorrent at that . maybe some sweetness , a bit more complex than some of its stablemates . of course , it is highly drinkable , which is the point . pressed for cash and desirous of a little buzz ? you could definitely do worse .
s- lots of herbal and vegetal hop aromas and some dark roasty malt .  chang pours an light gold .  a : it 's still carbonated , that 's something at least . too fizzy .

smell is what you would expect , bannana and clove .  the classic , quintessential american adjunct lager pours an unimpressive , pale golden , with a sweet and malty grain ( corn ) scent . pbr scores points for remaining independent ( of the big beer monopolies ) and fully american-owned . when i 'm on a tight budget , and a good craft brew is n't in the cards , this is my go-to cheap beer .  it actually smells more like a belgian dubbel . it does n't have much complexity and it drinks very watery . this is by far the thinnest quad i 've ever come across .

the beer has a very spicy odor , maybe a hint of cloves or something similar in the nose .  sprecher 's version uses real bananas . orange hazed brew is nearly cloudy . fizzy at pour and fizzy from the head , which drops down to a minimal ring around the glass .  the mouthfeel is watery with medium carbonation .

the aroma is of cocoa nibs , with the piquant woody vanilla nose that nibs have , followed by slightly sour milk and more milk and a whiff of alcohol when swirled . taste is a recap of the aroma . chocolate nibs , kiwi fruit , milk , mild herbal bitterness , medium bodied , with chalky mineral adjuncts and a sour aftertaste .  pours a pale clear yellow . not too far off from natural light in paleness and probably the worst appearance of any wheat i 've had . little head the dissapates quickly and does n't lace at all .  feel : active , assaulting carbonation and a light , watery body .

nice bitter chocolate and roast malt aroma , some earthy hop spiciness taste was black and roasted malt with loads of caramel to smooth a touch of pnw hops for balance but somewhat soapy in the swallow ?  a- clear very pale yellow .  tasting it my first impression was how thin the body was for an english porter , compared to , for instance , the excellent fuller 's london porter or young 's double chocolate .

even before the glass got in front of me the green apple aroma hit me in the face . it dominates right from the start and influences everything else . a medium body is again dominated by the tart green apple with a tang from the carbonation .  pours a super clear straw color with a small head that fades fast ( think pbr ) .  not much at all going on except for some sweetness and a very slight bitterness that gives way to a watery finish . not the worst macro lager by any means .

aroma of chocolaty mocha and alcohol .  poured chilled in ale glass a : no head ; cloudy pale yellow ; ok carb action s : very strong sweet aroma , reminiscent of pears ; suggests a belgian-style beer is ahead t : starts off as a sweet , belgian-inspired farmhouse ale , and segues after a few seconds into a diet-sprite-like wheat ale .  the body is thin and watery ; one hardly notices the beer until it is gone .

rich chocolate aroma with a decent bit of hops in the back ground .  pours golden yellow with one finger white head when poured aggressively that subsides to none almost instantly .  mouthfeel is thin for the style .

nose shows loads of treacle fudge and brown sugar with cloves showing in the background .  review from notes pours copper/auburn with a pinky of cream colored head . zero head retention & lacing s : apricots & leafy hops , persimmons as this warms t : much dark fruittyness ; figs & apricots , plus breadyness & leafy hops & a touch of butterscotch up front .  the body of this is way too light for a porter .

aroma is a nice spicy hops with a good bready , roasted malt to it .  a : pretty bottle , but it 's uh-oh on the pour : uninspiring pale gold color of some unloveable lagers and ( within a few seconds ) no head to speak of .  m : taste was below average for me , but the mouthfeel is even worse . super thin . light carbonation and no body make this almost watery .

looks like honey , smells like honey , very sweet , almost no head in either pour out of a 22 oz .  the pour is cloudy with a quickly disappearing white head . the color is not a pretty orange , with a lot of haze .  md - thin and not much of a body to it .

the best way for me to try and describe this beer is if you would take a blueberry muffin , ferment it , and then bottle it .  white almost non-existent head pale straw , clear body .  mouthfeel is boring and watery .

smell : cocoa , as expected , along with some good roasted malt . smells like a promising porter .  presentation : molson dry cold shot , 250ml can , 6,5 % abv appearance : pale straw color .  thin , watery mouthfeel .

notes of sugar and apple dominate the nose . a touch of pear and a hint of caramel .  very weak yellow color.. bordering on clear/yellow , with a head that adjusts well to pour speed , stays very white and leaves a cute belgian to look at .  body is thin and flat .

s - toasted malt , cinnamon & spices , and a mild fruitiness . very much like a pumpkin pie .  appearance - the muddy water brown stout was cloudy and when put to the light did not have a distinct or appealing color smell - faint smell of whiskey and apricot taste - starts nice and finishes like a train wreck ... sickly sour at the end mouthfeel - not much to speak of drinkability - i would take many other mass produced stouts , i dont think i would pick this up again .  the body is light and really deters the taste .

nose is delicate like a bouquet of spring flowers , freesia and tea rose .  i think on the right day with the right food it 'd be a fair beer - like a hot summer day doing some yard work . the beer seemed lighter than miller or bud light to me .  mouthfeel is thin for a ris , almost watery .
roasted coffee nose .  a : it pours pitch black with no head whatsoever . it looks like a flat coke .  mouthfeel is thin , almost no carbonation .

smell : floral with a strong banana smell . notes of lavender and spice come through as well .  poured out a darker yellow with maybe a half pinky head that dissapeared immediately .  mouthfeel is thin and syrupy .

a pretty pleasant smell , although not a lot of hints of much of anything .  a : crystal clear gold color with no carbonation to be seen . no head , no nothing except liquid to look at . at least it does n't have things floating in it .  the presence of tannin explains how , while quite watery , satan red is also quite drying .

at the beginning i tend to agree with most of the other reviews and it is very hoppy . the next time i want this much hops i will go into my homebrew supplies and get a cup of hops and just chew on it .  the head was very disappointing . the beer looks filtered like most of stone 's beers . it is a dark amber color .  tastes like someone put artificial flavoring in carbonated water .

a : pours a hazy orange color , good sized head with nice lacing down the glass s : smell is of sweet ripe citrus fruits .  the color is plae yellow and not overly exciting .  mouthfeel is almost cloying from the sweetness and really is the only category this beer suffers .

s : sweet maltiness , taffy candy maybe , a touch of citrus hops in smell . best part of the brew . t : has a cheap lactose/sweet stout sweetness to it .  this beer has the typical huber metallic , sulfury , antiseptic taste . a high amount of carbonation that quickly fades and no head develops when poured .  m- not a lot of carbonation , kind of syrupy actually . i feel if it would have been carbonated more it would have helped a lot .

it poured well , looked great , and has a good aroma but , it was not to my liking .  pours out of the green bottle an extremely pale straw , lighter than most pale lagers .  m : flat . way too sweet for the ( non-existant ) level of carbonation .

s : very tart , almost of a peach mixed with lemon . t : just ok . extremely peachy , but in a sour/tart sort of way .  bottle , a : pale yellow , with little head after the first five minutes .  carbonation is way too high .

i poured this beer a bit aggressively and it came up frothing barely over the rim of the cup with a light white head that went away pretty quickly . the smell really jumped out at me with oranges and spice . it 's a really cloudy orange color -- looks like i got some yeast in there too .  a na beer with almost ... almost an actual beer taste . hell , it 's got more taste than many to most true light beers .  mouthfeel : a bit on the fizzy side - really scrubs the tongue .

the smell was oats and a fruitiness to it .  comes out of the tap a clear pale yellow with a typical white head - not inspiring .  skimpy in body , vapidly dextrinous and approaching watery in mouthfeel .

this beer had a lot of head , mainly because i 'd poured it so shittely the smell was quite good but the taste was a bit of a let down .  pours a clear , and very light golden color with barely any head .  it does n't taste bad or good , kind of like water . it tastes like bubble water with a hint of sweetness . it 's for getting your swill on , and nothing else . too bad this is what most americans think of , when they think of australian beer .

super cru appears like it should , starting out with a leather-mahogany color , frothy head . does n't smell too bad either ; nice belgian yeasty notes and the added pear .  2002 this is one ugly beer . its a decent color , dark red brownish hue , but so freakin ' murky and flat . it looks like it could be the dregs from my garbage disposal .  starts with fruit taste , looses interest with a thin mouthfeel and water middle although helped by a supporting co2 texture and some tartness ( carbondated water ) ending with lactic acid and dry pucker on the back of the tongue and esophagus .

the smell is of strong apple juice , sugar , some spice , a bit of yeasty funk , faint straw , and some muddle earthy notes .  well , it gets really hot down here , so i figured a caribbean beer would be good yard beer for the summer . anyway , this was a decent one , definitely a good one for the heat , maybe one to take fishing with me . maybe it 'll show up here this summer .  m : dammit , i hate porters like this . light , watery body , slightly oily , and slick on the palate . this would have been so much better with more body to it .

aroma : a lot of oak . toasted coconut and marshmallow flavors . brown sugar and caramel . very cloying .  decent for a macro . kinda dark for a fizzy yellow american lager . taste is clean with noticable corn adjunct .  2.5 m very light , i am not impressed . it is very close to water in feel .
smells sweet , boozy , a little malt but a lot of sugars . smells like a great dessert drink .  a : pours brown , with no head and no lacing . looks like it might be flat .  too thin .
s : has a sweet smell of caramel .  drank this one straight out of the can so the appearance score does n't hold much weight .  thin mouthfeel .

nose is fairly strong . taste/mouthfeel- medium mouthfeel , a rush of spice and banana wheat that tastes a little muddled and unfocused , alcohol and nut flavors on the way down , finish is surprisingly clean and watery . overall-flawed , but passable .  a : opaque faded-straw colored body with a thin white head with little lacing .  very pale straw yellow color , hazy but filtered look no aroma noted water like very light bodied taste and looks like water ... . however better than most would give credit to seeing how its bud .
lots of sweet citrus & bread in the nose .  no head with no retention and no lace . pretty bland looking .  mouthfeel was pretty watery and went down quickly .

smell : very malty with strong hints of chocolate .  a - straw yellow , clear with no head .  above average taste for an adunct lager , but not great by any measure . this is definately better than budweiser , coors or miller , but not exactly to die for . foster 's price point is right about miller/bud level , but always slightly higher . it 's worth the extra coins if you 're on a budget . much more enjoyable than the run-of-the-mill macros .

does n't look like much , more like a cheap domestic pilsner , but smells pretty inviting .  served in a nonic pint glass , the beer pours a hazy gold color with about a 1/4 inch white head that went away pretty quickly . no lacing whatsoever .  mouthfeel is overly carbonated .

s : lots of sweet dark fruit , candi sugar , and some sweet lighter fruits as well . t : prunes , figs , candi sugar , cinammon , and a little lurking booziness .  i good beer for a good price , and with the exception of a few flaws , a fine example of a dopple bock . poured into a pilsner glass the beer produces no head , no carbonation to speak of , and no lacing .  better than expected , but as someone who despises ab products + light beer i was n't expecting much trouble is , within the same can it tasted like lemonade in some sips , water in others . giving it a 4 on drinkability because it 's light , so one could drink a lot of these if they chose to .
s : caramel sweetness with hints of fruit and tobacco .  small head that is very short lived . light yellow gold in color .  mouthfeel - one of the most water beers i 've had .

aromas are medium bodied , and fill the nose with cherries , roasted malt , and wood elements .  it pours a milky white , slightly straw colored liquid . not much of a head . this is a boat drink , not a beer .  mouthfeel is thin and weak .

roasty , malty aroma with some molasses and bread .  bud light is my favorite beer to start when starting a session . the color is light and relatively generic .  mouthfeel is very thin and overly carbonated .

nose has some nice roasted coffee notes .  almost looks green in its pint glass on my computer desk . fairly aggressive pour that would have 99 % of all other hefes spilling over the sides of the glass , leaves me with only a mediocre head . body is lemon yellow when held to a lamp , and in lieu of the usual cloudiness , this is clear with 1000 's of individually recognisable particulates floating around .  fizzy ... gross . m- watery , thin , minimal carbonation , and nothing lingering .

2010 vintage thanks to j47paco look : pitch black and totally opaque with a 1/4 inch tan head and no real retention smell : hints of dark chocolate molasses and fudge taste : i am not sure why everyone praises the flavor of this beer because the beer is a sweet sugary mess .  pours an amber color with reddish hues , looks more like a red ale than anything else , not much of a head and what there is fades fast , no lacing on the glass .  very light in body with a slick mouthfeel at first that becomes almost slimy .

very sweet and strong . this is definitely this brew 's biggest flaw , a total nose dive halfway through the palate that leaves me less than tempted for another swig .  soft white to off white head begins at two and three quarters inches falling to one quarter of an inch within five minutes leaving no lace on the glass . hazy dirty gold in color . large quantity of sediment entered glass despite careful pouring efforts .  the mouthfeel leans toward the thin and watery side .

pours a bit thin for a stout , and less opaque than a stout should be . great smell though , slightly bitter malty smell with a sweetness that comes from the lactose . bitterness is more alcohol than anything else .  clear gold and looks a bit like a bog standard pale larger .  my big complaint is the mouthfeel . this stuff had some serious astringency to it leaving my mouth prickly and dry .

flat abbey strikes again ! the aroma was good with oak , vanilla , dark fruits and brandy being very dominant . overall , yet another disappointment from flat abbey .  poured crystal clear and light yellow . had a snow white head that didnt last long . not a lot of lacing but a little .  body is very thin , drinkability is ok , but there 's not very much to this beer .

a bit too sweet ( confectionery-like ) but still nice . flavours suggest that unibroue has got a perfectly acceptable wheat beer and then dumped a truckload of apple lollipops into it .  a : pours a half finger head of okay thickness , no cream , and poor retention .  mouthfeel is very thin with low carbonation , almost watery , drinkability is poor , huge bitterness and watery mouthfeel is a disappointment .

strong sweet , vinous malty scent .  live review a- clear straw yellow . very cabonated , foams up big but dissaptes fast to have no head whatsoever s- strong scent , sweet , malty t- clean taste , sweet malts , grassy , surpisingly a yeasty afternote m- watery and very light d- not the tastest of beers , but one that can lead to very adventrous nights  flavor : then , i drank some & everything went downhill . it was watery & disappointing .
s - very goodly smell of malts and some faint raspberry juice in the background , biscut qualities too .  pours a cloudy , maize color . poor retention and poor lacing .  m = thin . thats it .
the smell was pretty good . i was intrigued actually .  pours a dark brown with almost no head .  m : thin body with not much carbonation .

the smell is real nice , smokey coffee that makes me dive right in .  very small head , particularly for a wheat . it dies to literally no bubbles and therefore no lace . the finish is milky and short lived .  the body is a bit thin and feels too bubbly .
s - burt sugar and alcohol with a faint baking chocolate .  semi-cloudy caramel , forming a small white head with no retention or lacing .  mouthfeel - very light and dry .

the smell was firm and earthy ; wet straw , burnt malt and tomato paste fragrances mingled together .  weal yellowy macro-ish pour with white fluff head that disappears in a blink leaving little to no lace . this would be fine at a show with cheap taps or as a cheap can of hipster irony .  tragically the mouthfeel is watery and the carbonation ( which others had noted ) , distracts from the overall experience .

it smells fruity and hoppy , but the flavor seemed to be actually sweet with a tad bit of hops .  a - a dark brown color , it looks like a flat coke . pours with a little tan head , absolutely no lacing .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied and very watery .
smell is fruity with a nice yeast kick at the end .  a : the beer is clear pale yellow in color and has no visible signs of carbonation .  very thin , and watery . lower carbonation .

aroma is quite citrusy with plenty of zesty grapefruit and a hint of pine . it also has a tiny bit of tropical character and some sweet non-descript malt . this beer smells very nice and has a nice hop flavor , but it seems a bit out of whack . much better than the dreadful ipa my friend ordered , but overall a pretty forgettable beer .  a little out of season to have this one now , but better now than before it goes bad . basically no head , only a ring of white . this is a wheat beer , it should have some head to it ... blah ... wheat and yeast aromas .  has a bit of a sweet maltiness and maple flavor does come out more as it warms m : very thin feel for a porter and leaves an odd buttery coating d : nothing really appauling , and nothing overpowering so it is drinkable , but i probably wo n't get another

aromatics are subtle with chamomile and not overly done with honey or citrus . pale biscuit male gives off a subtle sweetness there 's an air of the honey and citrus but the chamomile hits an herbal and marshmallow like tone .  a cloudy light amber with enough suspended particles in it to make it look like there is sand floating in my beer when held up to the light .  the body is too full and filling .

pours dark brown with a large head s. lots of dried fruit , typical to a belgian brown t. something off here , metallic and strangely bitter along with the sweet dried fruit flavor . d. overall i was n't too impressed , it starts out pretty good but not what i expected .  pours to a pale yellow color , with thin white heaed that dissipates quickly , and leaves little lacing .  mouthfeel - pretty astringent . almost watery except for the stickiness of the body .

smells `` fresh '' , and lightly hoppy .  this was always my emergency beer ; the cheapest sixer at the one place that stayed open latest . tastes pretty cheap and watery and best served ice-cold-as-possible .  very thin , and barely any head .

cloudy red beer has a hoppy smell , but not overwhelming . taste ; bitter .  it 's yellow and fizzy . the only real distinction between this and other malt liquors is that it tastes even more like old boiled corn than most and has a slightly higher alcohol content .  m - watery and sticky . its almost a thin beer .

( s ) - a dry oaky profile with caramel and bourbon notes . ( t ) - nice vanilla notes with wet cardboard and sawdust aspects .  pretty bad appearance , pouring an extremely turbid and opaque straw color with a head that fizzles away quickly .  mouthfeel is disappointing , wet , but not substantial .

malty aroma , mostly caramel and crackery , but there 's a light hop and fruit component as well . i really liked the aroma , but once i took a sip things went downhill .  good thing they told me this was a hefeweizen on the label , because otherwise i would n't have been able to tell . golden yellow color with an awful lot of clarity for a hefe . do n't think i 've ever seen a hefeweizen that 'd been filtered this much .  mouthfeel : not much carbonation and the body is kind of watery .

aroma : a great mix of sour and vinegary notes over a sweet malt body . mouthwatering . unfortunately , this is nowhere near as intense as the nose and ends up way too subdued for my tastes .  a- hazey pale orange . if i ignored the small foamy cap i 'd swear it was some sort of orange soda made with juice . i would n't buy a 6-pack , and if i had a choice of this macro and blue moon i 'd choose blue moon .  one thing about this beer is it feels extremely watery .
smells of very sweet caramel malts , black licorice , taffy and pine .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  mouthfeel was much too thin to be of any merit .

this amber ale has a huge sweet caramel aroma with a bit of spice .  it was watery and thin , but no off flavors - just a little adjunct flavor on top of the water , and lo and behold - i actually percieved a mild gummy hop bitterness and aroma ! i 'm used to seeing empty cans of these piled all over my brother 's sleeping body when i peak in on him most saturday mornings .  i am dissapionted in the carbination as it is nearly flat with a medium/light feel .

no pop whatsoever upon pulling the sad cork out . it 's very bourbony with traces of molasses , maple , vanilla extract , and sharp alcohol . there is no way in hell i could drink a bottle of this flat , boozy , utter mess of a beer .  pours a medium off colored copper , with very thin head and lacing . very low carbonation level .  feels watery with a sweet burn on the way down . soapy .

very malted , to hide the spices ? very corriander , hoppy , and yeast with a bananna aroma and taste , and all of this adding to mouthfeel .  if what you 're looking for is a cheap beer to keep your fridge full , this is my first suggestion . it 's not much different from others in this category , ie . macro brew adjunct lager , yet the one thing that sets it apart is hops .  it feels more watery than i 'd like my porter , however .

o : smells nice , but that 's about it .  the head is initially one finger before settling down to a thin cap and a fatter collar . no real lace or anything . sort of bland looking .  mouthfeel : seltzer drinkability : would be good but the mouthfeel sucks .

such a teaser the nose- complex and swirling with sweet notes of cocoa powder , toffee , freshly ground coffee , raisin , prune , brown sugar , peach and apricot . ) with a low carbonation , a mild and poorly integrated sourness , and a bigtime cloying sweetness upfront- the unfortunate result of the beer 's sweet chocolate flavors clashing head on with the brown sugary fruitiness . like i said , the nose is nice , but it really ends there .  pours a hazy brown/black with a very quickly disappearing head .  mouthfeel is very thin , again very soda like .

has a somewhat pleasant bready , vanilla like smell to it . smells better than it looks to be sure !  pours a bright , clear yellow/light gold , with moderate white head about an inch thick . retains for a few minutes , then quickly vanishes , leaving no lacing . typical weak lager appearance .  alcohol is very well masked for a 6.5 % way too much carbonation for my liking .

very good coffee and chocolate smells here .  review based on notes : pours an effervescent auburn with a pinky of tan head . zero head retention & lacing s : slight toasty malt & nothing else t : slight breadyness , herbal & metallic hops , plus dryness up front .  mouthfeel is very flat .

i smell sugar and berries , maybe some banana and a hint of wheat .  bottle , a : pours almost an amber , a shade or 2 darker than an average pils , fizzy head with fair retention , no lacing .  body was light and feel was watery .

has an interesting unique look , very cloudy with a hint of ruby color , alot like cranberry juice ( duh ) smell is good , has a classic belgian wit aroma , spicy yeast dominates taste is ok , easy to drink , but the fruit really ruins the beer in imo just an unnecessary addition  i poured the beer and it gave me about a one inch head . some what less cloudy than what i enjoy in a weiss beir my expectations were low .  overall , feels unbalanced , too much carbonation and a little too dull .

a - clear yellowish orange , very thin head that dissapates almost immediately s - lots of bright apple and spice , by far the best facet of this one . t - not really sweet , but possessing a lot of apple and spice . not very endearing . d - very drinkable , if not the the disappointing taste .  had a bomber of this with my indian dinner tonight pours golden/straw with 1 '' of white head . zero lacing or head retention s : sweet malt & perfumy hops t : sweet malt & hint of herbal hops up front .  it 's watery on the palate , surprisingly so - i 've had beers of 3 to 4 % alcohol that had more body . the finish is lightly astringent and bitter .

sfruit and caramel jumps out right away , faint alcohol , plums , some spices , but not sure what they are , mildly sweet and floral tlike drinking fresh flowers , also spicy , some sweet honey and caramel notes , starts mildy sweet like candy , then sucks all of the spit out of your mouth with its dry , perfume like finish .  a - very pale in color . overall , bud light like many similiar mega-produced american beers , lacks any original flavor .  immediately upon entering the mouth it felt very watery and light for an 80/- .

really big malty aroma . in the back some faint fruits can be noticed such as grape . this is very malty with a decent amount of metalic bitterness at the end .  a : lovely raspberry colour . when held up to light looks a thick cherry colour .  the flavor was spicy and malty and the mouthfeel was tingly along with a burning sensation as it is swallowed .

but since it 's summertime , i 've been drinking more beer and have been quite impressed with the quality of crafty beers out there ( if only i did n't live on the upper east side of nyc , where you do n't get much of a beer selection at the supermarkets and delis ) . i was not a big fan of this beer - i enjoy ipa 's , but this one seemed all hops and nothing else .  dark golden look . head was about an inch and a half that left a quarter-inch ( or more ) film . reminded me of that candy that fizzes in your mouth .  really fizzy ( like coca-cola fizzy ) on the tongue , with a metallic finish , not really what i was hoping for , dissapointing .
